The dragon seems oddly quiet
1121.content:
As he laid against the floor, Felix could still feel the stinging pain on his back. Though it wasn't fatal, the feel of his clothing rubbing against the wounds was more than enough of the reminder of his encounter with the beast the previous day. He could barely manage to walk properly, and though he had a rough time stumbling out, it was all he could do to try to stand the pain for long enough to return the cart and say that he had finished.

The rest of the night was less than pleasant as well. Despite his injuries, he was expected to do his other usual duties. Fortunately for him, they weren't too straining, but it was still difficult to clean his master's clothing or even run from room to room with the constant reminder of his encounter burning his back.

He swallowed as he slowly rubbed his fingers over the wounds. At least they wasn't bleeding at that point, but though the dragon didn't actively try to scratch him, it was quite clear that its scales had managed to do that much. He did his best to try to fall asleep laying on his front side, uncomfortably shifting as he closed his eyes. It was difficult to tell how long it would be before he would be able to rest again with the wounds still fresh on his back.

Even when he was asleep, it did nothing to relieve him. In the dark, every slight light reminded him of the dragon's eyes staring at him, of its scales flashing as they rushed towards him the moment he turned away. As his eyes closed, his ears made the sensations worse, every stray breeze reminding him of the dragon's growl, of its heavy breathing when he was close to it.

His dreams were haunted by those sounds even as he did his best to shut everything out. No matter where he ran, he always seemed to stumble into the beast, its ferocity never giving him a break, pushing and throwing him around so easily even as he tried to escape. Even as he tried to run, a claw always managed to grab onto him, to drag him back.

It was impossible to get away. And despite it all, he didn't know why he could even stand it. The dragon was toying with him, but he still was in one piece. He tried to figure out why he would be, even his mouth opening to ask. "Why are you-"

His sentence never finished. He was thrown too quickly, the dragon's maw opening as he found himself tumbling towards it, teeth bared towards him as it opened...

"Wake up, slave!"

He gasped as he rolled over, a sharp stinging on his back dragging him out of his dream and back into reality as he looked up. One of the men was already glaring at Felix, looking as if he'd be punished if he didn't quickly get up.

"It's morning. You're to continue to feed the dragon right after sunrise."

"What? But... It just injured-"

"Your own mistake got you your injury. It's no excuse to stop doing your job. Or would you prefer we throw your meals to the dragon instead?"

Though he grimaced a bit as he tried to stand, Felix just quietly nodded, his head held down as he quietly walked towards the prison. He did his best to try to keep himself steady, but the pain combined with his worry did little to relieve him.

He wordlessly reached the cart, and as he tried to ask for it, his throat seemed far too dry to ask for it. When he received it, he got a better look at what he was giving, his mind oddly registering the fact that most of its food was meat, and was a lot better than what the slaves would get. It felt a bit odd for him to know that an untamed treatment might be getting better treatment than most people in the castle got.

When he took the cart and reached the cell's door, he swallowed. Although he didn't know if it was safe, there didn't seem to be much of an alternative. However, he kept his eyes open this time around, determined not to end up with another injury.
1121.title: Pain's Reminder

choices: and the roar was deafening!
but, the dragon stopped itself from roaring when it saw it was Felix.
11212.content:
It didn't take too long for Felix to find the elephant sized dragon ruby colored dragon, well it was the height of an elephant, but much longer because of the tail and neck. Felix expected the dragon to be on all fours, pacing furiously and growling and roaring at him, but the dragon was just lying on the ground. It was lying on his stomach in a position that roughly looked like a C with it's head looking away.

Felix hoped that the dragon was sleeping and that he'd be able to sneak up to the dragon and just leave the meat, but when the door slammed, the dragon turned its head around. The hard scales on the ground scratched the floor as it dragged it's neck till it looked straight at Felix. Felix became frightened once more and didn't move a muscle for the longest time. The dragon just stared at Felix with hatred deep in it's angry eyes. However, the hate wasn't as ferocious as before.

Felix began to wonder why the dragon didn't seem to hate him as much as before. Felix looked around the cell, it took much effort tear his eyes away from the dangerous and savage dragon, but when he was able to do so, he saw that all the meat he threw around was still on the ground and the water bowl was still full. "It never ate or drank yesterday. It's weak and exhausted. It probably wasted all it's energy acting so savagely and since it didn't eat or drink anything..." Felix thought to himself, "This is better for me anyway. It might be too weak to attack me. I might not be injured this time. I still better keep an eye on it, though."

Felix slowly pushed the cart closer and the dragon growled as Felix approached. The dragon curled its lips upward and barred its teeth as it growled. The growl was weak, but its teeth still scared Felix. Felix saw the line on the ground which was the farthest the dragon could reach. Felix stayed over his side of the line and set the meat over the line. Felix kept his eyes on the dragon, but the dragon didn't make a move, it just growled a few yards behind the line.

When Felix finished with the pile, he backed away from the dragon with the cart. Felix didn't dare turn his back to the dragon. As Felix backed away. The dragon's eyes focused on the meat and tried to push itself up, but it didn't have the strength and just fell back on its stomach with a grunt. The dragon stretched it's neck as far as it could, but it wasn't close enough to the line to just stretch its head and get the meat. It was still too far away. The dragon stuck out its long snake tongue, but still couldn't reach the meat. The dragon struggled, but still couldn't reach.

Felix stopped in his tracks and watched the dragon struggling. The dragon, though much larger than himself, looked so weak and helpless. Even though the dragon had tried to kill him, Felix still felt a little sorry for it. "It shouldn't have worn itself out. It's its fault, not mine," Felix told himself.

"That's not what Lord William would think. If the dragon dies, he'll blame me and I'll be sent to death," Felix argued with himself. He knew he was right. Lord William wouldn't care if it was the dragon that staved itself. He'd still blame Felix and being a slave, Felix had no rights and could be put to death with the snap of a finger. "Shit!" Felix cursed under his breath before leaving the cart and walking towards the pile of meat.

The tip of the dragon's tongue was still two feet away from the meat and it was too focused on the meat to notice Felix. However, when Felix picked up the first piece of meat, the dragon looked up at Felix with hatred again. Felix took a few steps to the tongue and crouched down holding out the meat for the tongue. The dragon only brought its tongue in its mouth again and growled at Felix. "I know you hate me, just take the meat. I'm handing it to you," Felix said.

The dragon just looked past Felix and tried to reach the pile behind Felix, but still couldn't reach the pile. Felix tried to place the meat on the dragon's tongue, but the tongue retracted once more and the dragon growled. "What the hell it wrong with you?" Felix growled back, "Just take the meat or you're going to starve!" The dragon stared at Felix for a long time and Felix threatened, "You need my help to get fed, if you don't let me help you, you're going to starve."

Another emotion entered the dragon's eyes along with the hatred. The other emotion was a sort of sadness, a defeated and failure kind of look along with the hatred. The dragon stretched out its tongue and Felix was able to put the meat on the dragon's tongue. The tongue wrapped around the meat and pulled it in its mouth. The dragon chewed and growled with hatred as it did so. This process continued until the dragon finished all its food and Felix even picked up the meat from the other day to feed the dragon. The dragon seemed to both hate and love eating the meat Felix gave it. Felix couldn't understand why the beast would feel such a way. Felix was just glad he wasn't injured from the experience.

Later that afternoon, Felix was ordered to feed the dragon once more. Felix got the cart ready and pushed it down into the dungeons. When he reached the right hallway, he could see soldiers run out of the cell from a distance. They shut the down and one man yelled, "Is Lord William insane? We can't tame such a beast for him!"

The second man replied, "Every creature his its breaking point."

"But were dealing with a fire dragon, here! Don't you realize what that it?" The first man questioned.

"I think we'll be able to tame an infant dragon," the second man replied.

"But fire dragons are the most ferocious of the dragons. They are the dragon equivalent to Spartans!" the first man argued, "Fire dragon love war and bloodshed and they are taught to never break. They kill or abandon the weaklings, even it it were their own child. Though this is an infant, it will never give in or break."

Felix didn't here the rest of the conversation, because by then, they had walked past him and were far enough down the hall. One of the guards by the door smiled sadistically and informed Felix, "The dragon's all worked up now, good luck..."

The guard opened the door and Felix walked in. The dragon was pacing around the cell furiously and snarled and growled. When the door slammed behind Felix, the dragon snapped its head in Felix's direction. The dragon opened its mouth, ready to roar at Felix...
11212.title: Unusual Behavior

choices: The dragon lets him close to feed him again
The dragon immediately snaps at the food when it's in reach
112121.content:
He couldn't help the reflex. Even as he stepped in, Felix was forced to push his hands to his ears, to try to block out as much of the sound as he could. Though he couldn't leave or just run away, it was impossible for him to do much of anything with so much noise echoing through the cell. As the minutes passed, the sound at least died down long enough for him to stand it, even though he almost squinted as he tried to force as much of the sound out as possible.

After the last meal, it was a bit surprising to Felix that the beast had recovered so quickly. It hadn't even been a day, and it was already at it once again, thrashing about, the chains on it already somewhat strained and marks strewn everywhere over the ground. There were the signs of a few injuries around as well, and it was easy to guess that so far, the attempts at taming the dragon had not gone smoothly.

"Okay, I get it, you're upset!" Felix found himself shouting at the dragon, though his voice was drowned out by its continued shrieking. The dragon kept struggling down on its chains, trying to push away, the racket from its struggles only adding to the din in the room. "I'm not happy about this either, so let's just make sure we both survive!"

He moved to try to get a better view, but another roar forced him back a little bit as he kept his eyes pointed at the dragon, trying to catch its motion and not get injured again by it. However, though it was still thrashing about, its claws didn't seemed to be aimed in his direction anymore, though its gaze certainly was.

"Look, just calm down! I don't know whatever made you this way, if it's because you're a fire dragon, or because you're chained up, or whatever! But as long as you're here, I have to try to take care of you, and as much as you might not like it, I don't think anybody else is going to be taking the job!" Felix kept shouting, uncertain why he was even trying. He could barely hear his own voice, and he had no idea if the dragon would understand or even hear his shouts. But there wasn't any better way to get the beast to calm down, and it seemed to at least respond to him earlier, so...

The sound suddenly quieted to a growl as Felix just stared at the dragon, realizing that at some point, he had stepped away from the cart and put himself into plain sight of the dragon. He swallowed as he recalled the conversation he had heard earlier, worried that he would be caught in a blast of flame or the like. However, the dragon simply continued growling, and though it didn't seem happy, at least it was quiet enough for him to think and to move without a huge worry.

"Okay... I've got your stuff here... I'll just..."

It felt a bit awkward for him to try to move to the cart and get everything without turning from the dragon. Even though it was uncomfortable, though, he forced himself to not break eye contact for a moment. And though the dragon still made a few stiff motions at its bindings, it at least stopped thrashing as it watched him. Its motions were gentler, though it could hardly be be described that way when its claws still slammed into the ground when they moved.

"Here... Here you go..." Felix stepped forwards slowly, carrying a piece of meat at arm's length. He held his breath as he walked forwards, his gaze starting to wander a little from the dragon to the ground, knowing where he would no longer be safe, wondering if he should even try to do it this way. His instinct told him to just throw the meat at the dragon, and to keep himself safe, but another, nagging part of him said to at least try it, and that he could pull away fast enough.
112121.title: Awkward Truce

choices: Felix tried speaking to the dragon again.
Felix decided he'd try another time.
1121212.content:
The dragon continued to stare down at Felix angrily. Felix gulped as he walked closer. He hoped that the dragon and him had a decent enough understanding. Felix didn't want any trouble with the dragon, and he sure as hell wouldn't try hurting the dragon. It may have been an infant like the soldiers said, but it was still viscous and the size of an elephant. "Hope it understands I'm the one feeding it and keeping it alive. Maybe if it understands it won't try to hurt the hand that feeds it," Felix thought to himself, "Besides, I did save it life by hand feeding it. Surely we should have some sort of mutual understanding."

"Then again, it's just an animal and can't understand anything. By the way it's acted so far, it seems like some savage and wild beast with no signs of intelligence, yet," Felix argued with himself.

The dragon's angry glare looked away from Felix and it stared at the meat in Felix's hands with hunger. "Okay, I'll hand you the food and you can..." Felix tried to tell the dragon to be careful, though he really didn't know if it could understand. However, the dragon either didn't understand or wasn't paying attention to Felix, because when Felix started to explain what the dragon needed to do, the dragon launched its head forward with it mouth open wide and its sharp fangs gleaming from the little light the cell had in it. The mouth was aiming for meat, but the dragon didn't seem to care that it could easily engulf both of Felix's arms as well!

Felix jumped back in a panic and was just in time to dodge the mouth as it snapped shut only catching air. Felix fell backwards on the ground and the slab of meat landed on his torso. The dragon shook its head, not understanding how it missed and Felix crawled backwards till he was out of range. He had no idea if the dragon tried to kill him on purpose or the dragon just didn't understand that Felix's arms were there two. Whether it was on purpose or accident, one thing was for certain, The dragon was angry that Felix backed the meat away from it. The dragon roared once more at Felix and continued to growl angrily.

"What did you expect I'd do? You nearly snapped my arms up with the meat," Felix yelled at the dragon. The dragon bared its fangs in a way that it looked like it was smiling and the eyes didn't seem to concerned that Felix could have died from the attack. This made Felix think that the dragon purposefully tried to kill him. "Did you... did you... try to kill me?" Felix questioned still on the ground with the meat on his chest.

The dragon's 'grin' just widened. "What the hell have I done to you?" Felix abruptly questioned, "I wasn't the one who captured you. I'm not the ones trying to tame you. I'm just supposed to feed you and make sure you stay alive. I saved you for gods sake. I'm even offering to hand feed you so that we could try to have some sort of mutual understanding. Yet you still try to kill me."

At the mention of trying to hand feed the dragon, the dragon growled furiously. Felix found it strange that the dragon decided to growl at that particular moment. "Does it not like being hand feed, or was that growl just a coincidence?" Felix wondered, "It did seem more angry when I had hand feed it and it didn't accept the food right away even when it was spent. It is possible it doesn't want to be hand fed, but why? Many of the nobles that visit Lord William love being hand fed by slaves."

Felix then remembered how the soldier compared fire dragons to Spartans. Felix had heard tales about Spartan. They were a proud race that never gave in, no matter the odds. "Maybe it wants too proud to even want to accept being feed by a human," Felix suggested, but it was a guess more than anything. "Here!" Felix yelled and threw the meat in next to the dragon. The dragon ate the meat while still staring at Felix.

Felix walked back to the cart and threw the rest of the meat to the dragon and while the dragon ate, Felix filled up the bowl with water again. Felix stared at the dragon as it ate. It was such a strange creature to Felix. Felix was about to push the cart away, but then a thought came into his mind. "If I'm not mistaken, the soldiers had captured the fire dragon and it was alone. Yet, I think the soldiers had said something about the fact that the fire dragons live in packs. Why was this infant alone?

Felix remembered hearing the soldiers mentioning that the fire dragons throw away their weak children. Felix turned back to the fire dragon who was still eating. Felix couldn't see the fire possibly being thought of as weak, but it was possible that its parents abandoned it if the fire dragon was found alone. "If it was abandoned when it was a child, because it was thought of as weak, and the dragon survived the wilderness before it was caught. The dragon must feel it needs to act strong in order to prove itself to its clan," Felix thought.

It was purely a guess and Felix didn't know if it would be wise to bring this up to the dragon. For one, the guess could be completely wrong and the dragon continues to hate Felix. Or, the guess could be right and the dragon could be very touchy about the subject and hate Felix even more. However, Felix felt as though he needed to get to know the dragon more in order to make some sort of mutual agreement with the dragon, because Felix was starting to feel as though the dragon was more intelligent that it acted.
1121212.title: Trying to Bite the Hand that Feeds

choices: Felix keeps trying to guess at the dragon's life
The guard yells for him to leave, they're going to "tame" the dragon now
11212121.content:
Felix slowly watched as the dragon continued to swallow all of its food, the amount he threw almost completely gone. He quickly pushed the full bowl of water within range of the dragon while it was still distracted eating, quietly backing away the moment it was safe again. Then, he turned back, looking at the door. He was done. He could leave now.

But that would only mean dealing with the same raging dragon again the next time it was time for a meal.

He sat down, shaking his head a little as he crossed his legs. As things were, he wasn't going anywhere. He would have to just wait and let the dragon finish its meal, and hopefully, he could try to make sense of things from there.

When the dragon finally finished its meal, it took its time taking a drink from its bowl. It buried its face into the bowl the best it could, shaking and spilling water everywhere as it pushed through it. Felix watched, his mind somehow just mildly interested at how it drunk what it was given.

In the middle of its draught, however, its eye turned to Felix. A forceful snort blew the bowl away slightly, as it pulled back, still growling as he moved closer to Felix, both eyes pointed to him now. He jumped a little, but tried his best not to break eye contact. "You're... feeling better now, then. That's... good."

He got a quick, sudden snort in response, the dragon turning away from him, suddenly intent on staring at the wall. Felix continued to look at the dragon, speaking a bit louder as he just tried to get a better view of it now that it was staying still. "Okay, fine. You don't want to deal with me. I don't know why you have to get so defensive about it, though. I mean, like it or not, I'm the one that's going to be taking care of you, and I don't exactly want you to end up miserable around here. There's more than enough of that already, though I suppose your situation isn't exactly comforting."

Another sound came from the dragon, whose gaze was starting to wander up to the ceiling now. Though it didn't exactly look at Felix, at least it wasn't snapping at him. It felt odd to be ignored by a dragon, of all things, but he was quite used to being ignored in many different ways. He put his concerns on hold for the moment and continued to speak, though it felt more and more awkward to do so.

"Okay, let's see... You were alone when they caught you, right? But, they said that you're still young... I guess you learned enough to survive, at least? Better than me, at least." He shook his head a little, turning away, looking down the length of its body. It was difficult to see much of anything, but it still seemed to be in good shape. "Not enough to actually fight, though... I guess that's why they caught you?" The tension was visible as the dragon's body shifted a bit, an expected growl resonating through the room.

Felix shifted back uncomfortably, trying to figure out if there was any way to calm the beast down. "I guess you weren't hurt too much, at least. Caught, but at least not hurt during capture. I mean, your body looks okay. So I guess you know what attitude you're supposed to have, but not... too much else. It's kept you alive alright so far, though. I mean, capture's awkward, but at least you were willing to eat." Another soft grunt came from his head as his eyes closed shut. "Oh, don't act like accepting food's such a bad thing. No matter what kind of creature you are, you had to get some from your parents at some point. Even dragon newborns shouldn't be capable of hunting from birth, right?"

Felix half-expected some soft of response, but there wasn't even any slight movement that time. "Look, point is, you're being taken care of right now, so you might as well make the most of it. You've actually gotten a lot more food than important visitors have already. It's... a bit weird, really, knowing that you're getting better treatment than I am."

The dragon actually gave a bit of a snort, a half-grin appearing on its face. Felix just sighed as he put his hand to his forehead, shaking it a bit. "Okay, that settles it. You might not be nice, but you definitely understand what I'm saying, don't you?" The dragon made a deep, rumbling sound. Felix nearly started to back away, before he heard the odd tone in it. "Is that... Are you laughing?" He paused for a moment, only to notice the noise continuing. "Great. I find out you can understand me, and then I find out that you think that this situation is funny."

Though the sound quieted down, the teeth of the dragon's maw were still showing as he turned to Felix, who swallowed. Even though it might have been in a good mood, its appearance was still more than enough to worry and scare him. He gripped the best he could on the ground, doing his best to continue talking. "Well... I guess that's something, at least... Knowing for sure that you understand..."
11212121.title: One-Sided Conversation

choices: Felix coming to feed the dragon dinner.
Soldiers coming to try and tame the beast.
112121211.content:
The dragon didn't reply to anything Felix had said. It just continued to look at Felix while still grinning with all its teeth showing. It was a very uncomfortable sight for Felix to have large, sharp teeth that could rip in to shreds right in front of him. The dragon had even lowered its head so that the teeth would be level with Felix. Felix looked into the eyes of the dragon, expecting to see anger, but instead, Felix saw something else. The eyes looked confused and weren't fused with anger, but a strange sort of curiosity as it looked Felix over with its eyes.

"Why is this dragon curious all of the sudden?" Felix wondered, "Is it because its in a better mood after seeing this situation as funny, to it, or is it something else. Hell, why does it even think this is funny. Was it because I told it it was being treated better than me, or is it because I finally realized it can understand me. Either one could possibly be considered funny to this dragon."

Felix decided to try and communicate with the dragon again after a long period of silence. "Look, if you can understand what I'm saying, could you also speak in my tongue?" Felix questioned.

The confusion and curiosity left the dragon's eyes and was replaced with some anger again. The dragon's grin ended and the dragon turned his head away from Felix once more with a snort. Felix thought about how he could interpret the reaction. "Either, the dragon is telling me its obvious it can't speak the same tongue, only understand it, or the dragon just doesn't want to speak to me," Felix thought. Judging from how the dragon had acted thus far, Felix was leaning more to the suggestion that the dragon could speak, it just chooses not to speak to Felix.

"If you can understand what I'm saying, you could probably speak it. However, I'm guessing you just don't wish to speak to me. I can understand why you don't want to speak to humans and I understand why you must hate humans, but I'm not the one that captured you. I'm not the one forcing you to stay in this cell and keeping you captive. I'm just the guy sent to take care of you and make sure you're alright," Felix informed the dragon.

The dragon kept it's head turned away from Felix, but the dragon turned it slightly to see Felix with one of its eyes. "I have a feeling that you're not going to listen to what I say or even care, but in a way, I'm kind of like you," Felix said while looking at the ground, "I'm not here of my own will either. Hell, if I had the choice, I wouldn't hesitate in leaving this place behind. However, I can't leave. I'm a slave. The lord of this castle owns me. I'm his property. Funny, humans are probably the only creatures in this planet that are capable of such evils as viewing others as property and not people."

The cell was the quietest Felix had every heard and that silence lasted many long moments. Felix finally looked up at the dragon and saw something very different in the dragon's eyes. For a brief moment, Felix thought he saw sympathy in those eyes, but the dragon's face soon hardened and it looked away from Felix, turning its whole body away from Felix this time. "I think I better leave now," Felix informed the dragon, "I'll be back with your dinner in a few hours."

Felix pushed the cart out of the cell and the dragon was left alone in the cell again.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------

A few hours past and the dragon was still alone, thinking about what had happened at lunch.

"Stop it!" the dragon yelled in its mind, "Don't you dare feel sorry for that miserable creature. It's a human!"

"But, if it's true that he's like me and that he's a slave..." the dragon began to wonder.

"Or the human could be trying to trick me. Face it, a human could never be as strong as a dragon. Humans would have to use other means to defeat me such as lies and trickery," the dragon reasoned.

"But, if he's telling the truth, he might be willing enough to try and help me. He does seem to be a lot nicer than the other humans," the dragon continued to argue the possibilities.

"No, a human can't help me. How could a human help me? The one that feeds me seems older than me, and look how small he is compared to me. Humans are too small and too weak to be of any help. That's my the clan looks down upon humans. They are nothing. Just pitiful insects, and because we're bigger and stronger, we have the right to do whatever we want with them. Dragons should be the supreme rulers of the world," the dragon thought to itself.

"So, I must find a way out of this place myself," the dragon decided, "If I escape by myself, maybe the clan will accept me. They'll see how strong I've become in the past five years. I had to hunt and survive by myself my whole life and I've succeeded. Maybe if I show them how strong I've become, my parents will finally accept me."

The dragon thought back to the day he was abandoned by his parents because the clan believed the dragon child would grow up to be weak. It saddened the dragon when it thought about that day and tears were trying to force their way out. "NOOO!!" the dragon screamed in its brain while shaking its head to try and force the tears back where they belonged. "There is no need for such weak emotions. I need to be strong. I need to be tough. Showing such emotions will only prove that the clan was right about me. I can't give in to those emotions!"

The dragon heard the door open and it turned around to see...
112121211.title: Thinking

choices: The dragon tries to push Felix back
The dragon's too ashamed to do much of anything
1121212112.content:
The moment that soldiers began flooding in, any small doubts in his mind vanishing the moment others started to flood in. He even felt an odd bit of relief in the corner of his mind, glad to know that there was someone he didn't have to worry about at all.

Picking himself up from the ground quickly, the dragon charged forwards, only to be restrained by the same chains. However, this time, he had no problems pulling and jerking at them, not even letting them stop his movement as he swung back and forth, never holding still for an instant, not even caring as he felt his scales scratched at by the soldiers.

"It's acting up again! Get better restraints on it, and find something that'll pierce its scales!"

Still, even as they all gathered, more and more trying to reach the dragon, some even starting to shove spears at it, they were pushed back simply from the force of his motions, some just losing their grip and others who stood too close getting injuries that were much, much worse. The injuries that the dragon received were minor, and despite the slight stinging it felt, it never stopped, even looking excited as he lashed out towards all the guards.

More chains went around the dragon's body, though it took the guards a good deal of time and effort to do so. The sounds filled his head, it just making him grow more and more involved in it, more and more upset but just feeling right, feeling like it was his place to keep fighting the humans this way. In the end, however, he felt himself straining, doing his best to move, eyes closed and a muffled roar coming as he could barely open his mouth with his muzzle nearly tied shut, only just able to push.

"It's chained down firmly, then? Good. The beast is restrained where it belongs. It's time to teach it, and to make sure that it understands what its place is."

The dragon's eyes opened just enough to give a glare at the man who spoke. He carried around a bit of an arrogant air, and it was clear that he was the one commanding everybody around. He was responsible. For his capture, for his prison, for everything.

"And killing him would show everybody that I'm capable of getting revenge on my own..."

Despite being bound, the dragon did his best to lunge forward, to do something, anything, to the man who was keeping him here. However, he only heard a quiet laugh as he just barely pushed his chains apart.

"It seems you don't understand your position, beast. I am your master. And you are to listen, or be punished."

A roar suddenly came out of the dragon's muzzle, though he did his best to keep it down. Though he barely saw the man touch him, he knew someone did something to trigger the heat that seemed to rest under his scales. But the pain shooting through his head and neck made it too difficult for him to do much of anything else. The pain, somehow burning him, just seemed to seep further and further through as he shook about, trying to push the man away, to get him to stop touching him, to do anything but let it keep going.

Somehow, it was a relief when he finally blacked out. But when he woke up again, there was only one thing on his mind: the pain he felt, far beyond that he thought was possible for him to feel. For anything like pain from heat to hurt him should have been impossible. But it still happened.

The issue lingered so much on his mind that he barely noticed the boy standing close by for a few minutes, and it was only when he wandered right in front of his eyes that he realized that Felix was there.

A slight growl came, but as he tried to turn, the dragon realized that the chains were still firm on him. He could barely even move enough to reach the food laid so close to his face, and though his mouth could open, it was difficult for him to push the meat there into his mouth.

"I can't... let him take care of me again... It's not..."

The dragon closed his eyes, not even sure of what he could even try to do after what the humans had just done to him.
1121212112.title: Torment

choices: Choice 1: The dragon spoke.
Choice 2: The dragon didn't say anything.
11212121121.content:
As Felix prepared the meat, he heard the dragon growl at him. Felix turned his head to see that the dragon was awake and already growling at him with anger. "Nice to see you again too," Felix replied sarcastically. The dragon seemed to try and turn it's head away, but the chains on the dragon were too numerous now. It was pinned to the ground quite well. "I know you're don't like me because I'm a human, but can't we have some sort of mutual understanding. I don't really appreciate you growling and roaring at me every time I enter, when I'm the one thats feeding you and taking care of you. We don't have to be friends or anything, but could we agree to be a little nicer to each other."

The dragon moved its eyes to look away from Felix. "You are one very stubborn infant, you know that?" Felix stated. The dragon gazed angrily at Felix again and Felix replied, "Well, you are still only a child, aren't you?" The dragon looked away again and growled. The dragon's growl was much weaker now and it sounded more like an infant growl than the growl of a powerful beast. When the dragon was at full strength, it had a powerful growl despite being an infant, because it was much larger than humans and humans heard a powerful roars and growls from the dragon because of the size difference.

Felix began wondering what happened to the dragon to make it so weak. Sure, it was being chained down and it could have exerted all it's energy by trying to get the chains off, but Felix had a feeling it was something else. Felix had heard that Lord William came down to visit the dragon. Felix soon noticed the mark on the dragon's left arm. Well, the dragon's front left leg, but Felix called it an arm because it looked more like an arm than a leg because the front feet of the dragon acted like hands and looked like hands. "Lord William touched you today, didn't he?" Felix asked.

The dragon looked at Felix again in confusion. "How does the human know I was touched?" the dragon wondered.

Felix noticed the dragon's confused face and explained, "You have the brand on your arm."

The dragon became horrified. Not only did he hate the fact that a weak and puny human touched him, but now he had more reason to hate it now that the human left a mark on him. If his clan knew that he was touched by such a weak creature... The dragon tried to turn his head to see the mark, but his head wouldn't move due to the chains.

Felix noticed the dragon struggling to move in order to see the mark so Felix stated, "I have the mark as well. Lord William brands it into his living property. Its his way of showing his dominance and trying to make people think he truly owns you."

Felix turned his back to the dragon and lifted his shirt. The dragon saw the mark on the boy's shoulder. It was a black and red hand print with a terrible eye in the middle of the palm. The mark was a wicked and terrible thing. Something the dragon wanted to rip off his scales. The dragon also noticed other scares on the human's back from multiple whip lashes. This shocked the dragon. He had thought the human was lying about being treated worse than the dragon, but it was clear now to the dragon that the boy really was being treated unfairly amongst the other humans. "Maybe, we do have things in common," the dragon wondered.

Felix lowered his shirt and turned back to face the dragon. Again, Felix saw some sympathy in the dragon's eyes before it hardened again. "I know how much the touch weakens people and I know your strength must have been diminished. I'm going to feed you again."

Felix picked up a piece of meat and brought it to the dragon. With the last bit of strength, the dragon tried to leap forward with all his might. All this did was move him enough to just give Felix a little push. Felix was pushed back and he hollered, "What is wrong with you? I'm trying to help you. Why don't you want my help?" The dragon moved his eyesight to look away from Felix. "Is it because I'm a human?" Felix wondered aloud.

In truth, that was one of the reasons the dragon didn't want Felix's help. Felix was a human and the dragon thought it was a sign of a major weakness if a large and powerful dragon had to get help from something as small as a human. Plus, the dragon wanted to do things himself. He had been keeping himself alive for five years right after his parents and the clan abandoned him a few days after he was born. To him, he felt it was a disgrace having to be fed by someone else, especially a small human.

"This dragon is either very prideful or very stubborn, maybe even both," Felix thought.

Felix knelt down in front of the dragon's muzzle. Too weak to try and push Felix again, the dragon tried retreating his head. "You're worried you'd be weak in accepting my help right?" Felix guessed. Felix got his answer when the dragon looked at Felix with a 'how did you know' kind of look. "You may think it's a weakness for you to accept my help, but I assure you, it's not," Felix tried his best to convince the dragon to eat, "It may seem like that in the short run, but it isn't in the long run. Think about it, if you don't eat and die of starvation, it would seem like the easy way out. It would also seem like a cowards way out, because you'd give up the fight against Lord William and his torturers. Accepting this one humiliation will give you more strength you can use to try and fight off Lord William and his men. Accepting this food is not a weakness."

The dragon shut his eyes tight and his expression was filled with obvious shame. The dragon then opened its mouth and stuck out its tongue. Felix proceeded to place the meat on the dragon's tongue and the dragon wrapped its snake tongue around the meat and reeled it in. As Felix did this, he noticed that the dragon was doing its best to hide and cover his emotions. "It must think certain emotions like sadness is weak as well," Felix concluded.

"Bottling your emotions up is not a good thing either," Felix informed the dragon, "You may think certain emotions are weak and you'd be strong to hide them and keep them inside, but doing so will only make you weaker. Hiding your emotions in yourself will make you crumble on the inside. I have seen it happen many times. People who do that in this place tend to go insane because of the dark and twisted atmosphere of this castle. What you need is someone to talk to. Someone you can tell your problems to, otherwise the emotions inside of you will destroy you and you will be nothing but Lord William's puppet. I know what it's like to feel alone, as if everyone could care less about you. I could probably understand most of the things you're going through at the moment."

Felix noticed the glare was in the red dragon's eyes once again. "But you don't have take my offer," Felix sighed, "You can just keep roaring and growling at me, and you can keep hating me. You could also ignore the fact that we have more in common than you realize and that we're in the same situation together. And you can keep being alone in this place." Felix had finished feeding the dragon and he placed the bowl near the dragon. The dragon drank by lapping up the water with its tongue. When that was finished, Felix started heading out...


Choice 1: The dragon called out to Felix, telling him to wait. The dragon may have been a very proud and stubborn creature, but it was still a five year old dragon and very desperate and lonely.

Choice 2: The dragon said nothing and Felix left the cell.
11212121121.title: Not Weakness

choices: The dragon starts to talk a bit to Felix
Felix left while the dragon was distracted
112121211212.content:
The walk out the door did nothing to comfort either of them. Though Felix didn't hear the dragon make any noise that sounded upset, the fact that it didn't even grunt did nothing to comfort him. Although it was an improvement over being attacked, it didn't feel like it was much of one to him.

The dragon only started moving again when he was sure that the boy had left. However, instead of trying to break free, it simply collapsed, glad to no longer have to hold itself up. Although the pain was gone, his body still felt stiff and awkward as he tried to shake off the tiring feelings it had left him.

"Loneliness... The human's got that part right, at least. I haven't seen another dragon for... How long has it been now... At least one year? Two?" The dragon growled quietly as he closed his eyes, trying to keep himself from becoming depressed by the thought. "Why is it that the first one to talk to me since then had to be a human... If he weren't such a weak creature, we'd both be free by now!"

The dragon tried to give a growl, but despite it still sounding the same to him, it felt hollow as it left his throat. It was tiring for him to move at all. He only managed to turn his muzzle slightly. "At least he's talking to me... That's better than any of the animals I've so far, at least... Why is it that our languages are so similar? Dragons never should speak with them... We all know that... So how did it ever get like this? Maybe they stole it from us in the past..."

A slight scratch appeared on the ground as the dragon tensed, though he couldn't keep his claws there for very long. "Of course... Humans would steal everything from us... They're all like that... There's never one that would be different... They would never stop..."

He didn't know exactly when he fell asleep. Somewhere along the line, he was simply unable to hold on anymore. He should've been more aware. There was a nagging part of his mind that wanted him to push his eyes open again, to not let himself be caught unaware even while he was chained down this way, but it was shut out, just too tired to force himself awake.

At least, until the middle of the night.

The dragon jerked awake roughly, nearly jumping as found himself waking suddenly, pressing uncomfortably into his bindings. He gave a loud roar automatically as he felt them, forgetting everything for the moment, just struggling and shouting as he tried to break free. However, as the hours passed without even a person peeking in, it soon became clear to him that it was pointless, that now, even his struggles didn't attract attention.

Although he was aware now, it soon turned into borderline paranoia. Even the sound of his own motions forced him to try to turn his head, to try to see everything that was going on, and to ensure that nothing happened within the cell that he was unaware of.

By the time the morning came, he was already more tired than he felt before he slept. His mind was calm only because there was nothing else that he could do. It felt tiring just to turn his head.

"This isn't working... Why can't I get free... I'm not... I'm not that weak..." The dragon growled quietly as it just lay there, trying to figure out what it should do, or even what it could do. "Maybe the humans will slip up sometime... And then, I can get away... just run away... come back when I can just break this place down..." The dragon smiled a little bit to himself at the idea, just distracting himself for a little while thinking about it.

Its respite was broken by the quiet sound of the boy entering again. Though it growled quietly, the kid didn't seem to be quite as nervous as he prepared his foods.

"He's seen me far too often now... He knows how I am... I can't believe this... I can't even scare a human kid the way I am..." The dragon shook his head. "No... If you can't win a battle... Wait for the next one... Recover before striking them down... And this kid... If I talk to him, if he's acting, he could help... Yeah... I can at least talk to him, and then I'll know for sure that he doesn't deserve it..." The dragon smiled a little, a growl finally coming out. It caused Felix to pause for a moment, the sound of it quite different from the fierce snarls that had be coming over the last days. It was still deep and strong, but almost gentle. The dragon just gazed at him quietly, a little distracted by the thought, at having some small plan again, and some part of him relieved to have an excuse to start to speak with the only being around who might actually listen.
112121211212.title: Breaking the Silence

choices: The dragon demands Felix to leave.
something else.
1121212112121.content:
Felix stared at the dragon. He had never heard the dragon make such a growl. "What does that growl mean? he sounded gentle. Has everything I said to the dragon finally broke past its thick skull? Is it trying to befriend me now?" Felix wondered.

Felix waited for the dragon to do something, but the dragon did nothing. It seemed to be in deep thought and distracted by its thoughts. Felix just ignored the dragon since it looked as though it wasn't going to do anything. Felix got the food ready and placed it on the ground near the dragon's mouth. The dragon was a little stronger now that it had gotten some sleep. The dragon would be able to scoop the food up from the ground. Besides, Felix didn't want to hand feed the dragon unless he had to because the dragon hated Felix when he had to feed the dragon that way. Once all the food and the water was near the pile, Felix decided to just try and leave.

The dragon was deep in thought because he didn't know what he should say to the human. Hell, part of him didn't even want to go through with it. Fire dragons weren't supposed to speak to humans, let alone befriend a human, which part of the dragon desperately wanted to do. Humans were weak beings that believed they were the rulers of the world, and fire dragons hated that. Fire dragon knew that dragons should take that rightful place of rulers of the world. Unfortunately, nearly the rest of the dragon species didn't have the same beliefs as fire dragons and just let humans be. Fire dragons believed they should show humans were they rightfully belonged, under dragons. That was why fire dragons were supposed to kill, eat, torture, and humiliate any human that believed they were better. Fire dragons were big and strong, and humans were small and weak. Humans needed to be under fire dragons.

So, the fire dragon part of the dragon didn't want him to go through with it. That part didn't want him to talk to the human, otherwise he'd be viewed as weak along with the human. It would be a strong blow to the dragon's pride to speak to such a weak being. However, there was another part to the dragon, the part that got him abandoned. The "weak" part of him that gave into emotions and compassion. It was a part the fire dragon was trying to get rid of. The part he tried to hide so that he could possibly be accepted into the clan again. This "weak" part wanted to talk with the human, wanted to tell the human everything and finally gain a friend, which the dragon had never had in the five years of his life. The "weak" part of him wanted to let out all his emotions that had been bottled up inside him for far too long.

The fire dragon made a compromise within himself. He decided he'd talk to the human to please his "weak" side and slightly harm his pride in order to gain information. However, he wouldn't speak of his past or emotions and he would not try to befriend the human to make his fire dragon side happy. Suddenly, the dragon realized that the human was leaving and he had to act quick. "Wait. Don't leave yet, human!" the dragon commanded.

However, the way the dragon said the order, it sounded a little more along the lines of a plea. This ashamed the dragon to know it was more of a plea than an order and the dragon avoided the human's gaze, hoping the human didn't notice his command was more like a plea.

Felix heard a voice call out to him. It sounded like a plea, although the voice tried to make it sound like a command. Felix turned around to the only other living creature in the cell to find its eyes avoiding him and looking ashamed. Felix knew that the dragon had spoken to him, because not only was it a voice that was deep and powerful that had the sound of an toddler's voice as well, but the way the plea was said was very much like the dragon's personality. Felix had noticed that every time the dragon showed sadness or sympathy in its eyes, it quickly tried to hide it. What the dragon had said and how it had said it, was very much like all its other actions because it tried to disguise its plea as a command.

"Are you going to talk to me now?" Felix questioned.

The dragon continued to look away from the human as if trying to hide the fact he was speaking to a human from himself. "Is everything you said to me about yourself true?" the dragon demanded.

"Yes, everything I told you about myself is true. I have no reason to lie to you," Felix replied.

The "weak" part of the dragon was glad to hear the human was telling the truth. That part of him was happy to know there was another being in the same situation as himself that he might be able to befriend. However, the fire dragon part of him was hoping the human was lying so that there would be nothing in common and so that there would be a reason to hate the human.

"Do you wish to speak to me now?" Felix questioned. The dragon continued to keep its eyes aimed in a different direction. The dragon seemed to be uncomfortable about speaking to him as if ashamed. "These dragons must really hate humans to be ashamed when they talk to one. It looks as though his pride is hurt by talking to me," Felix thought.

"Alright, I see it's hard for you to speak to me. You're species must hate humans or something along those lines, and it's making you hard to speak to me. However, it's alright to speak to me," Felix tried to encourage the toddler dragon to speak, but the dragon said nothing.

"Well, you know about me, why don't you tell me about yourself? What's your name?" Felix asked.

"I'm not supposed to talk to humans," the dragon replied quietly. So, quiet that Felix couldn't even hear the dragon.

"What was that?" Felix questioned.

"I'm not supposed to speak to humans," the red dragon growled.

"Why not?" Felix questioned.

"I don't have to answer your questions. I'm a fire dragon and you're a human. Fire dragons are strong and humans are weak. Fire dragons are higher than humans," the fire dragon snorted.

"Physical strength isn't the only thing that determines strength," Felix informed the dragon, but the dragon didn't say anything in response. "I see how you act. You try to hide your emotions. You act tough. Why do you do that?"

"Fire dragons are supposed to be strong," the fire dragon replied, "I need to be strong."

Felix could see that the dragon was again hiding its sad emotions within itself. The dragon saw sadness as a weakness and if it saw it as a weakness, then all the other dragons in it's clan... "I was told fire dragon were like Spartans and I know that Spartans tend to throw away the children they think are weak," Felix stated. The dragon turned to look at him and knew where the conversation was going.

"You were abandoned, weren't you?" Felix asked. The dragon did not answer and just tried to hide his sadness. "I never knew my parents, but I was told that they sold me into slavery. I know what it's like to grow up alone," Felix stated.

"Stop making it sound like we are the same, human," the dragon hissed.

"You're not really as tough and mean as you are trying to be. You're disguising the real you to try and be what the other dragons want you to be, but no one is making you have to change yourself. Besides, their the ones who threw you away. You think you honestly need to prove yourself to creatures that didn't want you the way you are?" Felix said.
1121212112121.title: Speaking Up

choices: The dragon forces itself to ask about its situation and surroundings
Felix has to leave, leaving the dragon until the next meal
11212121121212.content:
Though he was trying to sound calm, the dragon's noises still shook Felix a bit. Despite being young, its voice was already deeper and harsher than any human voice that Felix had heard. However, the tone of the dragon's voice was easily recognizable, despite its depth. It was far too similar to his own to scare him. Despite the arguments that the dragon was trying to make, he could just barely make out the other meaning behind them. "You were raised a certain way, but... that doesn't mean that the things you were taught are right. I know that what I'm taught can't be right. Lord William definitely shouldn't be in charge, for one. So, what you're taught as a dragon could be wrong as well, couldn't it?"

Felix swallowed quietly before taking a step forwards, within the dragon's reach again. He tried to look over the dragon, but it felt a bit odd to be looking at its eyes, fully aware that it knew exactly what was happening to it.

"I am dragon. No matter what, that's not going to change." The dragon growled quietly, pushing itself slowly, its claw managing to give Felix a bit of a shove. Though it wasn't forceful enough to give him an injury, it was still enough to knock him off his feet. "And that means that if I run into some stupid human, I'm going to deal with him. That's not something that I'm taught, that's something that's common sense. I'm strong enough, and the way humans act, they all know that it's what's supposed to happen, too. So any human that comes my way is going to get treated that way. I'm more than strong enough to take care of a few bugs." The dragon moved its head close to Felix, almost pressing it against him, his breath forcing Felix to sweat a bit. "And seeing as I'm always going to remain a dragon, I'm better off learning to be a proper dragon! I don't need to learn anybody insect's lessons! Things are way too different for that!"

Felix picked himself back onto his feet, his heart starting to beat faster, hoping that things wouldn't get any worse. "I... know. I know that we're not the same. I don't even remember my parents that well, so I can't say I know if what you had to go through is the same as what I did. It's probably a different feeling. And I know that since I'm a human, I won't understand everything about you." He clenched his hands together tight, doing his best to keep his voice stable at the reminder. "But... that doesn't mean that I don't know what things are like here and now. And right now, things are the same for the both of us."

"You think that this is the same?" The dragon made a heavier swipe with his other arm, letting the chains clatter loudly as he did. "Funny. I doubt you've had to suffer this kind of... indignity." He tried to pull his arm forwards, trying to see his brand, but unable to turn his arm enough. "If a mouse left a scar over your face, I doubt you'd take it as a mark of pride." He growled quietly as he tried to push the mark against the ground, trying to grind it out against the cell's floor, but he didn't even wiggle a few scales around, and the mark never touched the dust.

"No, but I'd still learn to watch out for mice afterwards. And you've had some... experience with humans now, haven't you?"

"Learned not to let them near me." The dragon gave a glare to Felix, his anger starting to act up further. "Next time, they're going down my throat the moment I see one."

Felix signed a bit as he pulled away. "If that's what you think... Then I can't really stay near you safely, can I?"

The dragon gave a sharp noise, it clearly worried this time. "That's not what I... I mean..." His eyes suddenly snapped with worry for a moment, before he forced a bit of a laugh. "Sounds like what a human is supposed to think." He tried to keep what he thought was a proud look on his face, but his eyes held the nagging worry that the human would really leave. He shook his head for a moment before trying to hold himself up. "You're a lucky slave, you know. I doubt many even get to get close to a dragon."

Felix gave a small smile as well. After all the time he had spent in Lord William's service, he was more than used to dealing with all sorts of people, knowing when to come for orders and when to stay out of the way in order to avoid punishment. And though the dragon certainly was different from any human he had met, the infant was hardly experienced enough at hiding his feelings. "If you say so, then. I suppose I'm safe enough while you're in here, so I'll try to stay when I can. "A part of him was nervous in saying that when he was well aware that even the chained dragon could injure him, but the way the dragon was acting, it was a risk that he was more than willing to take. "I'm not going to get to be this close to any other creature of your strength, will I?"

The dragon gave a large nod, a real smile showing even more at the complement. "That's right. Remember I can still do quite a lot chained down, so you'd better listen to me, understand? Answer when I talk to you, and then you'll survive... for now." The dragon was slowly relaxing, both parts of his mind satisfied with what he thought was a good threat that would keep the human obedient and subservient, and what he thought would also ensure the human would stay close.
11212121121212.title: Talk

choices: Follow Felix's POV as he does his chores.
Follow the dragon's POV as his thinks about all the things Felix had said.
112121211212122.content:
Felix could see that the dragon was a very strange and tormented creature, there was no doubt about that. It was clear that the dragon was troubled by two different personalities within himself. One part of the dragon was what he really was like, the part that was still just a child wanting someones love and affection. This part of the dragon was desperate looking for any help it could get, even if it was from a human slave boy. Felix knew that this was the part of the dragon the dragon was trying to hide. It was the part of the dragon that would plead to Felix before fighting with itself and then changing the sentence pretending nothing happened.

The dragon's other half was trying to be strong and prideful. Well, there was no question that, although the dragon was younger than Felix, the was far stronger than Felix in physical strength do to the dragon's large size. The dragon was easily twenty feet tall from the ground up and could break Felix's bones with ease. This half of the dragon probably wouldn't mind killing humans, seeing humans and insignificant pests. This half of the dragon was very different from the other half and Felix believed that this half of the dragon only existed because of the dragon's abandoned by its own family because of its original personality being viewed as weak.This half was trying to destroy the other and act tough and emotionless in order to be accepted back into his own clan

Felix understood the dragon's desires in wanting to be accepted by his family, because Felix knew that he surely wanted to know who his own parents were and what they were like. But he was also told so many times that his parents sold him for money and didn't care that they gave up their own flesh and blood. Felix didn't know the truth due to the fact that he couldn't remember anything that happened before he woke up one day as a five year old slave five years ago. So, his parents not wanting him could be is not out of the realm of reality, and if it was truly true that his parents didn't want him, Felix wouldn't want to try and prove himself to win the acceptation of people who abandoned him. This dragon's parents really did abandon the dragon and Felix truly felt sorry for the dragon wanting to win the acceptation of parents who just threw him away just because they thought he was weak. It was a truly horrifying and terrible thing and Felix wanted to show him why it was wrong to have to change oneself so drastically to win the acceptation of people who didn't like him the way he was.

However, Felix knew that he had to ease into it. The dragon was in a very traumatic setting and if the dragon was having any of the same thoughts and emotions as he had when he became a slave five years ago, Felix knew that the dragon's mind could break easily. The only way Felix could help the dragon there is to be there for the dragon and try to help him get through the experience.

As for the war between the two different personalities in the dragon's mind, Felix knew that it was best not to try and force a personality upon the dragon. The dragon had to make the right decision by himself. The dragon had to figure out who he truly was. The kind side of the dragon seemed to want to befriend Felix, and that might be enough for Felix to be safe with the dragon and cause that side to take control.

There had been a long silence with Felix and the dragon just staring at each other. Felix was beginning to feel a lot more comfortable with the dragon now. The dragon was making threats that sounded more like light hearted jokes and the dragon seemed to be seeing Felix as exception of his hatred towards humans. Felix knew he wasn't completely safe with the dragon. There were still things that Felix could do to accidentally offend the dragon's pride which would be a very dangerous thing. However, Felix realized that Felix was safe around the dragon as long as he kept on its good side.

"Well, I see you've regained your strength and you can eat by yourself so that I don't offend your pride again," Felix informed the dragon, "So, I think I should be heading out now so that I can..."

"No, wait!" the dragon interrupted with an outburst that sounded like a plea. The dragon quickly regained his composer and his second half took over and ordered, "Wait!"

"Believe me, I would love to stay here with such an impressively strong creature that has been gracious enough to let me get so close," Felix replied trying to as apologetic as possible to keep on the unstable creature's good side, "However, I have other duties to attend to. I'm a slave to the evil man and I have to do as he says. If I don't, I can be punished, put to death, or worse."

"Bending to another's will is worse than death," the dragon stated as if it was one of the lessons he was taught by teachers like laws needed to be repeated for remembrance, Felix wouldn't have doubted it.

"You have a strong and powerful will and I envy it. But I learned that there are times when people can't always listen to their pride alone. Unfortunately compromises must be made help survive in the long run. I still wish to escape this place and I still want to defy Lord William, but until I find a way out, I must keep the act going. Also, there are much worse things in this castle than death, if one defies Lord William too long. He knows some dark magic. He has the power to keep controlling his slaves after they've died. He isn't able to do it all the time, but he has done it before trapping their soul in this Gods forsaken place.

"I'm not trying to break such a strong spirit, because one needs a strong spirit to survive and resist the torment. But there are times to hide that spirit in order to survive to fight later," Felix continued, "Now, I must leave and do my other chores to avoid the whippings. I will be back to give you lunch and we can talk more then. I know you might think it's weak to confide in a creature that's like a mouse compared to you and that I'm nothing like you, but I'm the closest thing you have that's similar to you in this castle. I may not know everything that's going through your head, but I should know enough to help you."

With that, Felix left and the guards didn't say anything about him being longer than usual. Either the guards weren't suspicious for Felix or they just didn't care if a slave took a long time feeding the dragon. They thought it would be the slaves fault if he stayed in long and was eaten by the dragon.
112121211212122.title: Getting Better

choices: The dragon immediately gets violent again when someone else comes in
The dragon's lost in thought and barely notices Felix coming in
1121212112121222.content:
The dragon silently laid in place as he saw the door close behind Felix. He held tight for a moment before just falling to the ground, sighing and shaking himself a bit. He felt like he could stand the place a little more, but he didn't know how much more. Part of him wanted to start clawing at himself just for even daring to speak to that kid. It wasn't right to depend on humans for anything, even admiration. Humans were just little pests, to be splattered if they ever appeared.

However, he also smiled to himself a tiny bit as he remembered their conversation. There was a slight nagging in his mind as he wondered how much of the human's talk was serious, but the complements that he had received still him a slight sense of pride as he laid there, his maw curled upwards slightly on his face now. Hearing someone else speaking to him without some threat involved was comforting to him, even if it was just a human kid, and the fact that the kid was willing to complement him, even if only to calm him down...

"Heh... So humans still think that, do they... At least, most humans do... That guy still understands how humans should behave... even if he doesn't always act along those lines..." The dragon silently clawed at the ground, his breathing a bit off as he thought. "Even if he's faking it, he still understand that humans should keep me amused... And he doesn't seem that bad to be around. Sure, his conversation's a little bit forced, but at least he acts nice, unlike the others... I can be a little less careful around him, "

He sighed a bit for a moment before his eyes suddenly closed, shaking his head violently. "No. There's no way I can let my guard down for a moment here. Even around him... I can't let myself get soft. I have to... I have to make sure to protect myself... Protect my treasure... Act like a dragon should..."

The soft part of his mind jumped at the opportunity. "So what if he's one of my belongings? Then, I have a reason to keep him close... To make sure nobody 'damages' him... And it's okay to keep a pet or slave or something, right?" His heart started to beat a little bit faster, hoping he wouldn't be able to seal the loophole that he had tried to make for himself. "Around here, anything I can get is treasure, so... Even bringing back a human would prove that I can... raid human lands, wouldn't it? That I can come into their lands, and take what I want for myself..."

Though the darker part of him tried to find a way around it, it didn't try very hard. If he had a bit of loot from this whole ordeal, things would be even better. And if the human counted, then both parts of him would be glad to keep him close. All he needed to do was figure out how to get close to the human, and then he would have a new bit of property. And after, it didn't matter what he did with his property. He could even talk to him, and he wouldn't be weak for wanting to use...

Weak. He couldn't help but pause as he thought of the word. Dragons rarely even wanted to support one another. Looking for the support of a human was unheard of. Even though dragons were allowed to use tools, he didn't know if they would count a human as something like that. If any of the other dragons saw him talking to a human... If they saw him like this...

"The others... I wouldn't want them to hear... Ugh. I shouldn't care about what they think of me. That... that would also be weakness, to depend on them to get through this." The dragon sighed quietly as he just closed his eyes, laying his head down onto the cold floor. "I'm not getting help from them... And they're not going to hear anything about what's happening to me. That human... That human's right... I'm not going to prove anything to anybody else. Until I can get out of here, at least. I only have to make sure that I make it through this. "

"But you have to prove to yourself that you're not weak. Do you think you can believe that while you're being so kind to a human? While you're depending on him?"

"It's... not a weakness..." The dragon muttered the words to himself, his eyes still closed as he thought. "It... means I'll do whatever it takes to survive... That I'm strong enough to survive..." The dragon just grunted, the mark on his body starting to itch, a reminder he absolutely hated. "And... my pride can survive dealing... with one human..."
1121212112121222.title: Thinking

choices: The dragon doesn't have a name, but doesn't admit that to Felix.
The dragon has a name and contemplates whether he should tell Felix it.
11212121121212222.content:
Felix opened the cell door, expecting to hear the dragon roar, growl, or give some sort of acknowledgment of his arrival. However, Felix heard no such acknowledgment. Felix began hoping that the dragon didn't roar because he was starting to see Felix as a friend or an ally. When he opened the door all the way, Felix soon saw that wasn't the case at all and the dragon wasn't even looking at the cell door. The dragon was lying down on the ground staring off into space as if in deep thought.

"I should have known better. The dragon couldn't possibly see me as a friend yet. It's been abandoned and has had to take care of himself this whole time, making it harder for it to trust people," Felix thought to himself, "As an added effect, he has the beliefs of a fire dragon penetrated deep in his skull, and he wants to still please the dragons that abandoned him. It still doesn't occur to him that he doesn't have to please those who abandoned him and have to change he he was just to do so. He's still very young and it's going to take much more convincing for him to understand."

With a sigh, Felix pushed the cart in the dragon's cell. Felix thought that the sound of the cart bumping along the stone floor would get the dragon's attention, but the dragon still didn't look away from the wall as his head lied flat on the ground. "He must really be deep in thought," Felix realized, "I just hope my words are actually getting though to him. The guards say that he's about five years of age, despite being twenty feet tall, but he's a little more mature than most toddlers. Maybe its do to him having to live on his own. Some say I'm smarter for my age and I to had to live alone, well... live without love or care."

Felix made it all the way across the line that marked the dragon's reach and the dragon was still staring into space. Felix placed the cart close to the dragon and then stepped away from the cart to try and step into the dragon's vision. The large eyes didn't notice the movement. Felix was a little concerned now. It seemed strange for him to be concerned for a large beast that had been violent towards him more than it has been kind, but Felix did find himself concerned. "Dragon, are you alright?"

The fire dragon's eyes moved and locked upon Felix before the eyes widened and the head lifted straight up fast. Suddenly seeing Felix next to him caused the dragon to be startled and he even jumped up onto all for paws and took a step back as the clattering of his chains echoed through the large room. Thinking the dragon was suddenly angry with him, Felix fell backwards onto his butt as well. The dragon just started down at the human before him, trying to calm his breathing. When Felix figured out the dragon wasn't angry and not going to kill him, Felix stood up on his feet and looked up at the dragon while apologizing, "Sorry, for startling you, but you were in a trance and I was only trying to snap you out of it so that you could eat your lunch."

"You... startle me? That's impossible. I can't be scared by such a little creature. I'm a fire dragon," the dragon quickly replied with a puff of smoke bursting from his nostrils, "You were the one who was scared."

Felix knew he couldn't get the fire dragon to admit that he was startled as well, so, Felix didn't bother trying to argue with the creature. The fire dragon may have been a lot more friendlier than it had when he first saw it, but Felix knew that the dragon could just easily end his miserable life with little strength. "You were in a trance, is something wrong?" Felix questioned changing the subject.

Feeling the question was simple enough, the dragon allowed himself to answer the little human, "I was just thinking."

"Thinking about what?" Felix wondered.

This was a question the dragon was uncomfortable to tell the truth so the dragon just said, "I was just thinking about some things. Besides, my thoughts are private, why would I reveal them to a human."

"I was just a little worried is all," Felix explained.

The fire dragon thought about it and did remember that when the human woke him from his thoughts, the human did sound worried. "Great, I'm a so weak that the human is worried for me?" the dragon thought. Though deep inside, he was a little gladdened that someone actually was concerned for his well being, he just wished it didn't have to be a human of all creatures. "Why should you worry about me? I'm much stronger. You should be more concerned about yourself than me," the dragon questioned.

"You didn't even notice me enter the room and I had to go up to you just to get your attention. I was worried that Lord William had done something to you. You remember what I told you about his spell, right?" Felix replied.

"I remember what you said, human. It's only been since this morning, I'm not stupid," the dragon growled, "Besides, no human has entered since you came with my breakfast."

"They didn't come today, but why?" Felix wondered aloud.

"Maybe they finally realized I can't be their tamed dog," the dragon growled, but the growl was towards the soldiers, not Felix.

"That might not be a good thing. That might cause Lord William to take worse measures," Felix informed the dragon.

"So what. Lord William is a human and I can handle any human. Humans can match the strength of a dragon," the fire dragon said with his chest out and head held high.

"You shouldn't underestimate Lord William. Did you forget that he left his mark on you already?" Felix pointed out.

This time the fire dragon looked down at Felix with furry. The dragon crouched down low with his neck lowered till his muzzle was level with Felix. Only then did the dragon curl his lips back showing off his teeth as he growled, "You don't have to remind me of my dishonor, human. I should rip you to shreds for reminding me!"

"Then why don't you?" Felix questioned. He knew if the dragon wanted to kill him, the dragon would have done that instead of speaking, though Felix had you use much effort to not shake in fear or look away from the dragon.

The dragon soon stood back up and looked away from the human. "You're not worth it, human," the dragon stated.

"Can you please stop calling me human? I my name is, Felix," Felix replied.

"Yet, you call me dragon," the dragon remarked.

"Only because I don't know your name. If you tell me your name, I'd gladly call you by it," Felix said.
