112121211212122221212221.content:
Felix quietly turned towards the doorway as he spoke, glancing to make sure that it was still closed. While he was relieved to have the dragon's cooperation, it hardly meant that the most difficult part was over. There were still so many problems that could come up, and even his cooperation wasn't enough to guarantee an escape. Still, it was a relief that he could make plans with the dragon, and the thought that he might get out soon was enough to motivate Felix as he slowly turned back.

The dragon watched as Felix quietly looked around the room, uncertain why he had suddenly gone silent or what he was doing. "Well? What is it? If you've got an idea, then say it, Felix- er... servant." The dragon seemed to pause for a moment upon saying it, his movements stopping as tried to figure out his own reason for hesitation.

"He's already agreed that he's your servant, so treat him like one! There's no need to use his name, it shouldn't be important to you!"

"It doesn't matter if he's a servant or not. You know his name, and you want it to be clear when you're talking to him. If you get more servants, you don't want to get them mixed up, do you? Especially not with your first one, and the one that's here because he actually..."

The dragon quickly shook its head, realizing he had been quiet long enough for Felix to notice. He growled a bit, hoping to keep Felix from making a comment. However, Felix seemed to take it all in stride, simply nodding towards the dragon as he spoke. "Call me whatever is more comfortable for you. And would you prefer I call you 'master', then?" Though his tone was slightly sarcastic, the smirk that suddenly appeared upon the dragon's face made it clear that he didn't take it as such.

Before Felix could say anything else, the dragon gave an amused snort. "It would be appropriate, wouldn't it?" He bent his neck, letting his head move closer, a bit of smoke obscuring the space between the two of them. A quiet coughing filled the room after as Felix tried to wave it out of his face. "It will do until I have a... it will do for now." The dragon fell silent again, and even through the smoke, it was clear to Felix that the dragon was deep in thought again.

"It looks like neither side of him has a problem with the nickname, at least. I hope there's a way to keep him from calling me servant, but it's still better than anything that William's called me." Felix turned away from the dragon, letting him think in silence as he took another look around the room. "Now, let's see... The guards said that the dragon was shipped in through a large door, but even William wouldn't be able to deal with too many people around here knowing about it. The passage they brought him in through is probably hidden, and it's definitely one way out. It shouldn't be very well guarded, there aren't very many other reasons for it to be used. The guards outside his cell don't look in here often enough to be a problem, or I'd never have gotten to talk this much with him. If we can use that, then the biggest problem is probably getting him loose..."

Felix kept trying to find some sign of how they might've moved the dragon in, but besides the doorway that he had entered through, it was difficult to make out anything in the limited. "It doesn't look like there's another way in, but there has to be somewhere. Maybe it's hidden, or blends into the wall or something. I'll have to ask the dragon about it once he's a bit more talkative. As long as he knows the way he came in, I can just focus on getting his bindings off. He might've worn them out somewhat. Even if he hasn't broken them, he's been violent enough to at least damage them. If that hasn't been enough, he might be able to try melting them. Dragon flame is suppose to be one of the hottest things in existence. If he can do that, then even strong chains shouldn't be a problem."

He started to open his mouth, but before any words came out, Felix stopped, his lips slowly sliding closed. "He's never tried breathing fire, has he? If he could, he would've tried using it to escape before. And knowing him, it's probably another thing that a 'proper dragon' needs to be able to do. If I ask him about it, it could be a touchy subject. I wish I knew more about dragons right now. It would sure come in handy when I had to talk with him..."

Felix's gaze went back to the dragon as his eyes followed the chains from the wall back to the dragon's body. "Regardless of what else we do, we have to get you loose first. The chains are still on tight, right?"

"Unfortunately." The dragon gave a grunt as he pulled at his arm, the chains fastened to it loudly rattling as they shook, clanging loudly but holding tight. "It's been rather annoying to always have these things on me."

"Can you hold still for a moment? I want to check something out." Felix moved close to the dragon's arm, his hands gripping onto one of the chains as he approached. The dragon pulled back slightly, Felix stopping as he saw the questioning look that the dragon had. "It's not to comfort you or anything like that. I just want to look at the chains. That's okay, isn't it?"

The dragon stared at Felix for a moment before simply lowing its arm, letting it down in front of him. "Fine. If you can think of a way to get these things off, do it."

It only took a minute for Felix to look over the spot, but he shook his head as his hands let go. "It's no good. It's not going to just slip off, there's not enough room for that. Unless the others are different somehow, it looks like we'd need a key."

There was an odd noise in the air as Felix let go of the chain, following it back to its base. The dragon had let out something between a grunt and a sigh as he had heard the news. "Can't you steal one or something?"

"Maybe if I had any idea where to find the right one. I'll keep my eyes open, but we shouldn't plan on any miracles here. How about you? Have you been able to get any looser or something? "

The dragon growled as he gave a sharp pull, lunging forwards as he did. The heavy chains shook violently, nearly smacking into Felix as they kept the dragon from pulling himself any further. "You've already seen for yourself! If I could just pull these out, I would've been long gone! What do you think I've been doing, jingling these for fun?"

"So you've just been pulling... But even if it didn't do anything to loosen the chains, it might've done something." Felix began following the chain to the wall a bit nervously, uncertain about how hard the chains would hit him if the dragon was still jerking them around and causing them to whip everywhere. "If you've been pulling the entire time, it could be weak where it's attached to the wall. Give me a moment to check." Felix swallowed quietly as the clattering around him dimmed, the chains stilling as he approached the spot where it was anchored. He took his time as he examined the end of the chain, hoping it was damaged enough that he wouldn't have to risk having another conversation that could cause the dragon to hesitate.
112121211212122221212221.title: First Plans

choices: The dragon is impatient and tries to escape immediately
The dragon agrees to wait a little longer
1121212112121222212122211.content:
Despite everything that the dragon had done, the chains were somehow undamaged. They had obviously been reinforced to secure the dragon, and it was clear that they were still doing their job well. However, it was clear that the ends of the chains were not in the same condition.

Felix's pulse started to race as he turned to the dragon. There was definitely a chance to get out now, and the knowledge that freedom was close caused him to quiver in his excitement. "Can you take a look at this? I think it might be weaker here."

The dragon's eyes jumped at the words as it tried to turn around, the chains tangling against his body as he did. Despite the numerous bindings now resting against his side, however, the dragon managed to turn enough, pushing his head towards the wall. It bumped Felix to the side somewhat, but the dragon was able to bend far enough to get a good look.

"Why's the thing look different from the chains? I thought that they were all made together."

"This place has been used as a prison before, so the anchors are probably older. They probably got new chains for you, but they still needed to use the old anchors to keep you in place. I think they're built into the wall, so they can't replace those very easily. It looks like you pulled it a bit, so it's not totally embedded very deeply in the walls anymore. "

The dragon grinned as he lifted his arm towards the anchor. "Good. If these are supposed to be for weaker creatures, then this will be simple."

"No, wait!" Felix barely was able to speak in time, and the dragon's claws jerked suddenly to the side. A loud thunk echoed through the room as his claw took out a chunk of the wall nearby, and the sound of the stone breaking off and onto the ground was clear. Felix nervously turned towards the doorway for a moment, absolutely silent in the worry that the guards had heard something. However, after the few seconds of silence, the dragon quickly turned back to Felix, growling with an irritated tone.

"What? I can finally get these things off, and you don't want me to? You'd better have a good reason for it, slave." The dragon's glare made it clear that he was irritated, and Felix had to pause before he could muster a response.

"Because we need to be sure we can escape before you try. If you break them now and we can't get out, they'll just replace them with something that can hold you. If they figure out that you can break free, we're sunk. We need to make sure that we can-"

"What's the hard part? They brought me in through a huge tunnel, and nobody else was there but the ones who caught me! We'll just get out the same way! Even if there are people this time around, they're not going to be able to catch me again!" The dragon was getting more and more rowdy, its movements more obvious as its head stood close to Felix. "If you're going to wait around while there's a clear way out of here, I'm going to leave you behind!"

"You've finally got a chance to get out! The humans aren't going to catch you off-guard again, so you won't get captured again! Just get out before that chance vanishes!"

"You know how to get into the tunnel, then?" Felix took another look around the room, still nervous that the guards had heard the noise. Although the sound in the room never seemed to leave it, he could never stop worrying that the two of them would be overheard.

"It's right there!" The dragon jerked his head towards the enormous doorway he had been brought in through. His body was clearly lunging harder now, the anchors visibly straining. "It might be blended in, but you should at least be able to tell there's a passageway!" The dragon took a quick sniff before snorting at Felix. "It's pretty obvious, there aren't exactly many other places fresh air gets in!"

Felix turned to the doorway that the dragon was brought through. "So we'd have to get through two stone doors before we could-"

"Stone is nothing! That thin door can't hold me! The tunnel's available, and I can get free, so stop wasting my time!"

"Look, I want to get out of here as much as you do!" Felix's voice was rather strained, his excitement now replaced by his anxiety. He was still shaking somewhat, but it was due to his uncertainty on whether or not he'd be able to convince the dragon of anything. There was clearly no part of the dragon that wanted to stay around his captors for any longer than necessary. "But rushing out right now could end with a lot of trouble. Just give me a day to look around and try to make sure it's safe. The guards will still be outside, and-"

The dragon's growl grew even louder, and Felix was forced to stop as he heard it. "All right. Give me a few hours. I'll... I'll figure out something to distracted the guards, and I'll see if I can get any supplies or anything that would be useful."

The volume in the room slowly rose as the dragon looked at Felix before starting to look past him, glaring at the doorway. "That's enough! You've listened to him for far too long! If you're going to let your one chance slip away again, then you've sunken far too low! Just get out of here, and let him follow like a slave should!"

"But he's been right so far, hasn't he? Listening to him hasn't hurt you before, and it won't hurt this time... Just trust him."

"You've already been enough of a coward, and you're going to drag him with you! Stop letting him decide everything and just act like the creature in charge should!"

His voice was slightly shaky, but it was quite loud "I... I have to get away..." Felix hesitated as he heard the words, and his body felt ready to jump aside the moment that the dragon moved.
1121212112121222212122211.title: Opportunity

choices: The guards notice the moment they break out
They manage to get to the tunnel before guards start chasing
11212121121212222121222111.content:
"I can't... I can't wait any longer!" The dragon's voice was nervous, almost panicked as he turned to the wall. He quickly shifted his arm, the chain tangling around him as he did, but he ignored it as he tried to get it to the wall. Felix tried to open his mouth, but there was only a momentary pause before the dragon's claw tore into the wall, fiercely digging at the anchor. The clang of metal against his sharp claws echoed through the open room, and Felix quickly turned away, his eyes looking at the door in worry. However, the guards didn't seem to notice, dismissing the sound as more of the dragon's usual thrashing. Felix couldn't bring himself to speak or to interrupt, the dragon no longer looking at him. All of his energy seemed focused on the walls and chains instead, not wanting to spend a minute more shackled to the wall.

It only took a couple of minutes before the hook snapped free from the wall, the dragon's chains clattering loudly on the ground. With a grin, the dragon moved on to the next one, tearing at it more enthusiastically. Though his face was fierce, Felix could see some level of satisfaction in the dragon's grin as he quickly continued, the chains each falling to the floor, one by one.

"See? This is nothing! If you had actually made an effort, the humans couldn't even hold you for a day!" The dragon continued, a few clear gashes deep in the wall before the last few chains fell down. The dragon gave a relaxed sigh as he turned around, an obvious grin on his face as he looked towards Felix. Though the boy had retreated to a safe distance, he nervously approached the dragon again as he finished his job.

"I told you I could do it." The dragon gave a small, proud chuckle as he turned to Felix, approaching slowly. For the first time, the dragon stepped over the line that had marked its reach. Felix felt his pulse quickening as the dragon approached, his head dangerously close. Though he had gotten close to the dragon before, it felt even more threatening knowing the dragon could easily chase him down in an instant. "All that's left is a couple of weak doors and a short run, and I'll be away from this place." The dragon turned to try to face the doorway, slowly creeping towards, his limbs a little shaky as he moved. "I'm looking forward to moving again... This place is way too small."

Felix nodded slowly, trying to figure out what he could still do as the dragon moved past him. With the chains off, there was no time to think of a plan. The moment someone entered the room, they'd know the dragon was loose, and they might even figure out he had been speaking to it. "Ye-yeah... But you still have to be careful... You don't want to get caught again when we try to get out... I don't want-"

"You should just be grateful I'm taking you along. A human like you doesn't get this chance often, so be glad that you're on my good side." The dragon almost immediately snapped at Felix, before pausing again. His first instinct was to simply grab the boy, but the worried look on the human's face made him hesitate. "So... are you coming? I mean, you'd better be ready to run!" Though the dragon was doing his best to speak like an eminent tone, he couldn't help but hesitate a bit. Now that he was loose, it seemed odd to still even be talking to the human. Part of him knew that he should've already been breaking through the door in front of him, or grabbing the human on his way out, but instead, he was waiting for the kid.

"Stop worrying! You already know that he's your servant! Just drag him along if you have to! You shouldn't worry about him leaving you!"

"You want him to come on his own, don't you? You're only getting out now because he's trying to help you, and you still want him to help. You don't want to risk driving him off..."

Felix looked to the door before turning to the dragon. It was easy to see the hesitation in the creature's eyes, and it wasn't hard to see that the dragon still couldn't handle the situation very comfortably. "Yeah... I'm coming... We don't have a lot of time now, so..." He paused for a moment before an idea struck, him carefully moving closer. "So would you mind granting me the honor of riding on your back? I don't think I can run as fast as you can..."

"Just this one time..." The dragon bent down a little awkwardly as Felix approached. As he felt Felix's arm reaching to try to climb on, he gave a small jerk. However, Felix expected it, holding tight to the dragon's scales as he moved. Though they were a bit rough, they made a good grip for him as he tries to get onto the dragon's back.

"You just got loose, and the first thing you're doing is letting a human ride you like some kind of mule? This is insane! You can't-"

"You have to. Unless you want to admit that the human can get out faster than you can? He's the one that's asking for permission this time. After what he's done, doing a small favor like that isn't a problem, is it? You want him with you right now, and you can handle helping your slave out. It's just the easiest way for you to do it."

Felix looked at the dragon's expression as he thought, but he carefully crept along, trying to do his best to find a spot. It was rough, and though it was difficult to get comfortable, he managed to climb on, his hands carefully clasping around the dragon's sides. "Will... Will this work?"

The dragon turned quickly, Felix gaping as he was nearly thrown off. However, his foot caught upon a couple of scales, firm in place. He winced slightly as he felt the scales scratching a bit at his body, but he did his best to stand it. "Just hold on, human." Not wanting to take another moment to think, the dragon charged at the doorway.
11212121121212222121222111.title: Start of an Escape

choices: Guards are catching up to the two of them
They're close to the exit of the tunnel.
112121211212122221212221111.content:
The sound of the door breaking clean off of its hinges alerted the guards to the dragon's escape. One immediately gave a shout upon seeing the dragon loose, clearly panicking as the others rushed to try and get to a safe distance. "The beast's loose! Get someone in here, fast!" However, before anything more could be said, the dragon lept onto the guards within his reach, his weight forcing them to the ground and his claws tearing at them for a moment before he continued charging onwards.

A few more guards rushed in, trying to get a couple of chains over the dragon. However, they were unable to get close enough to wrap the dragon within them. With a fierce snarl, the dragon charged into one of them, knocking him aside. Though one of the chain caught against his arm, the dragon simply continued pushing through, pulling the guards along as he crashed through the wall. Felix could barely hang on as he felt bits of rubble falling around, but the dragon's scales held him firmly as he bucked around in his seat. The dragon paused to give an enormous roar, shaking off the chains and giving a slash at one of the guards holding it. The guard gave a shout as he was thrown to the side, none of them equipped or ready to deal with the dragon so suddenly.

"Hurry! There'll be more people coming!" Felix tried to shout at the dragon, but his voice was lost among the shouts of the guards and at the dragon's attacks. Though he could have easily moved on, he seemed to linger just to take the time to strike and bite at the guards. "We can't stay too long, the people coming will have weapons and-"

The dragon paused just long enough to give another roar, clawing and biting at the guards within his reach. The chains fell to the ground soon after, but the dragon continued to remain in place, grinning as he looked over the scene. The guards that were still standing seemed to be hesitant to approach him again, and the many littered around the floor were unable to move. The dragon simply gave a small, deep chuckle, his muzzle moving towards one of them as the man tried to back away. He easily snapped at the man, his mouth biting fiercely. The wounds that he caused were clear, blood starting to flow onto the stone floor before he pulled away.

"Please, dragon... We can't waste more time here..." Felix's voice was barely audible, but it was loud enough to be heard over the growls in the air. The dragon gave a small turn, glaring at Felix for the moment. He paused, almost thoughtful again, but the sound of more guards drove him back to awareness. The clanking armor and shouts of numerous people was enough to even cause the dragon to move again, and while he hesitated for a moment more, he took off into the tunnels afterwards.

The two of them moved wordlessly for a time, Felix too nervous to say more than he had already. Though Felix found it hard to speak after what he had just seen the dragon do, he tried his best to keep his voice calm. With all of the time that he had spent with the dragon, he had never seen the creature do that much damage. While it was chained, it had been possible to speak and reason somewhat. However, now that it was loose, it was quite clear that he could do damage to humans quite easily. Felix had to give a small wince as he was reminded of the wounds that the dragon had inflicted onto his back. The look of satisfaction that the dragon currently held on his face did little to alleviate him of his worries.

However, after a couple of minutes, the dragon had begin to slow down. His expression had changed a bit to something that Felix couldn't recognize. While he remained silent for a while longer, Felix couldn't help but begin to worry. He swallowed before he spoke, his voice a little shaky this time. "Do you remember the way through here?"

"Not that hard to find out... There aren't many paths large enough, and I can follow the fresh air out." Felix could only give a sigh of relief when he heard the dragon speak. Although it was a bit impatient, it didn't seem hostile or upset. It was just a relief to know that the dragon would still speak with him after he had easily charged through a few people, even a little sadistic along the way. However, despite how he had treated the guards, the dragon still seemed comfortable enough with the boy.

"That's good... Do you know where you want to go after we get out?"

Felix gasped a bit as he felt the dragon's footing stumble for a moment. The dragon quickly caught himself and continued moving steadily, but Felix had to struggle a little bit to stay firm against the dragon's back. The dragon spoke again, though his voice was a bit more impatient this time. "Far away from here! I'll try and find my way back to my cave!"

"But isn't that where they found you? It might not be safe to go back there... Maybe we should look for another place..."

The dragon opened his mouth to speak again, but he paused for a moment, standing absolutely still. The dragon's senses perked for a moment, and the look on his face changed as he closed his eyes for a moment. Felix could only watch with confusion as he turned his head backwards, looking back through the tunnels. Neither of them moved for a few seconds before the dragon broke into a run.
112121211212122221212221111.title: Alarm

choices: Weeks pass, and Felix has built a bond of trust. Then dragon speaks to him.
Felix sets a plan out to free the dragon not matter the cost to himself.
The dragon gets bigger, then breaks lose. Felix tries to stop its rampage.
113.content:
The great creature, despite having rendered Felix speechless with fear, was backed up as far against the wall as possible, so that its raven black shape melted in and out of the darkness surrounding it. Felix took a wary step towards the massive form; immediately, he was met by the crippling stare of two violet eyes, which burned with an intense and bestial fear. It was obvious the dragon was desperately afraid, which made it even more dangerous for Felix. If he didn't keep his mind sharp, it could cost him his life, as none of the guards were going to risk their own skins for his meager existence, which, he reminded himself, was all too easily replaceable.

Moving with the dexterity and careful attention to detail of an assassin, Felix lifted a piece of meat into his trembling hands; it was a large cut, not of the finest quality, but nothing more than a morsel to the dragon. Approaching as far as he dared, his gaze once again locked with the huge violet eyes, which, he noticed, had a mix of fiery pink fused into the color; but this was of little consequence if he got killed. Yet he found himself drawn to the hypnotic power of those eyes, and how they were not of a savage monster brought into confusion, but the misled and frightened glance of a lonely child, enslaved in a harsh and alien environment with no hope or comfort.

He snapped back into his own consciousness. Felix was particularly clever for his age, and had consulted books describing the actions and perils of magical beings. The dragon-stare was one such ability, a mesmeric force wielded by the dragon and able to virtually transfix any adversary given the intent; but how could an infant use such a power, and, if it had intended to entrance and consume him, why had it not done so moments earlier? In his daze, Felix dropped the meat, causing a noticeable echo which rebounded in the hollow humidity of the prison's interior. The dragon flinched, but didn't make a move. Felix, rooted to the spot momentarily, retreated from the creature, keeping level eye contact but never directly meeting the dragon's vision for fear of the dragon-stare taking a more potent effect.

The dragon moved a little, and Felix saw for the first time the real brutality of the chain it was attached to, blunt and rusted into the wall with no mileage for free movement, ensuring the dragon was perpetually constrained. First one, then another foreleg moved, the diminutive but nonetheless intimidating muscles flexing as if they had been cramped for days, which was entirely possible given the situation. As it approached the meat, the dragon was always aware of Felix, nervously training one eye upon him whilst the other gazed longingly at the food. Finally satisfied, it voraciously gulped down the meat, giving an opening for Felix to make a move. Or to test if he was a threat.

Taking some more of the altogether stale meat, Felix decided he should familiarize himself as a giver of nourishment, as to help him stay alive, and, abandoning fear, he gently tossed it in the dragon's direction. The dragon startled in alarm, then settled, nosed the food with its snout, then greedily swallowed it up. Felix repeated the process several times, slowly reducing the distance between the food and himself, until the dragon was physically prevented from going any further, the chain biting into its neck. Now pushing the cart, which still carried a sufficient amount of meat, towards the dragon, Felix could see the overwhelming hunger it displayed. Had Lord William been so blind to taking care of a creature with the potential he had envisaged? Evidently so, and that made it even worse thinking about.

The dragon strained on the its malicious leash, but even with all its dwindled yet considerable strength, the chain held resolutely to the wall. Felix stopped just so that the dragon could reach the food and water on the cart, but no more. The dragon snapped up the food, making a strange jerk with its head to consume the larger pieces, until the cart was empty. It then proceeded to drain the water bowl with amazing speed, like it had been deprived of any kind of sustenance for a long while. At least a little eased from its predicament, but by no means trusting Felix, the dragon returned to its shadowy corner, but not so much as to make itself intangible from view. As it did so, Felix, pulling away the cart, was able to get a proper look at the dragon.

It was only now he had a chance to distinguish its gender, as there had been no opportunity before, but as the dragon turned from him, there was no sign of outer genitalia. A female then, as it had no significant horns visible either, with a deep blue underside and malnourished body frame. Hardly the terror Lord William wanted it to be, but still a mighty creature. It was only as he closed the cage door, and proceeded to return to his fateful service as little more than a useless wretch, that Felix first was addled by a feeling, deeply conjured in the deepest catacombs of his mind, that blossomed with swift resolve into his heart.

Sympathy.
113.title: Sympathy

choices: Early in the morning, just waking up..
In Felix's dream..
1132.content:
Later that night, as Felix sat in his bed, (Well, not as much of a bed as it was a wooden bunk) begin to think of ideas to free the dragon. He needed to give it a chance to live its life, to not suffer in the way that he does every day, yet he had no ideas on how to carry out his plan. The chain that the reptile was attached to was fixed into the wall, with no locks or anything to unattach it. He couldn't get too close to the chain either to break it, for fear of his life. Even if he didn't get murdered by the beast he would likely be seen by one of the many guards around the castle and be executed on the spot.

He decided to give up thinking on the matter for now and try to get some sleep, given the fact that he was only allowed five hours of rest time every night. He couldn't sleep at all though, despite the fact that he was exhausted from waking up early and running around doing various jobs throughout the day. His eyes restlessly moved about the room, it was made out of stone, and there was only one entrance to it, which was locked. On each side of the room there were many rows of bunks for the many slaves around the castle. There could easily be as many as one hundred people in the room with him. Most of the room's occupants were asleep, and wouldn't notice if he made his way towards the door...

He reached his hand under his bunk, which was lowest towards the floor, and pulled out a rock. It didn't seem any different than any other rock, but this one was special. He had found it once when he was out in the castle's courtyard. It had one sharp edge that could easily be used for picking a lock. He figured he could escape from this room if he tried.. He quickly dispelled the idea though, knowing that if he did make his way out of the room, he would have nowhere to go after that, and would probably be caught and captured quickly by one of he knights on a night patrol. And once caught, he would likely be punished.

He placed the rock back down under his bunk without making a sound, and turned himself over so he faced the wall, trying to give himself a few hours of sleep.
1132.title: Felix thinks about how to free the dragon.

choices: a gaurd.
another servant.
11322.content:
soon, Felix drifted to sleep, curled up on his bunk.

As he dreamed, he saw himself in the third person, standing in a misty place, with various shapes and forms flickering in and out. And then, footsteps, Felix turned to where the noise was coming from, seeing a man in a brown robe, with a kindly, wrinkled face, grey, wispy hair, and eyes that seemed to penetrate Felix to his core.

"...so little one...what shall you do...?" the monk asked, hands behind his back.

"...i...i don't know what you mean..." replied Felix, looking into the monks brown eyes, which seemed to transfix him almost as much as the dragon's had.

"...you seek to help the young dragon...so what will you do...?" said the monk, repeating his question.

"...i don't know...i can't do anything..." Felix said back to the monk, avoiding his gaze.

"...you say that...but you do not believe it..." the Monk said, in an infuriatingly mellow tone.

" well what should i do!?" Felix yelled at the monk, his anger at his own weakness rising to the surface. "i'm just a weak little servant boy who isn't worth anything to anyone!" he cried, dropping to his knees and pounding his fists upon the white mist of a floor.

"...if you yourself are not strong enough...then seek an ally...strength in numbers young one...where one tree falls in the wind, a forest carries on..." said the monk, before he turned away and walked off into the mist, his last words still echoing in Felix's mind.

at this point, Felix awoke to the sound of the other slaves getting up and leaving. He remembered the monk's words. Today he would find an ally...but who...?
11322.title: Inner guidance...

choices: Of course i will!!
Sorry kid, not me.
113221.content:
As Felix went about his daily chores, he kept an eye out for anyone that looked like they might help him, however, most of the slaves were too scared to even listen to him afer he told them of what he was planning, so, disheartened, he decided it was time to risk asking one of the gaurds, but who?

Felix was cleaning a statue of william when he got his answer, a group of gaurds wandered by, one hanging back a bit, wore a suit of gaurds armour, with four familiar gashes down the front of his chestplate. it was the gaurd who had exited the dragons cage just before he had fed it.

"c'mon Freed, we'll be late for lunch at this rate" one of the other gaurds called back to the straggler.

"yea yea, why don't you guys go on ahead...i'll catch up once i've seen the quartermaster about a new chestplate" he replied, stopping a few feet from Felix, waving his comrades on nochalantly.

The other gaurds nodded, heading for the barracks, leaving Felix and the gaurd Freed alone. Plucking up all his courage, Felix aproached the tall gaurd, taking extreeme note of the sword on the mans hip.

"...excuse me sir..." said Felix, just loud enough for Freed to notice him, the man turned around, his helmet obscuring his face from view.

"yes?" the gaurd asked him, seeming to be quite alright with a lowly servant talking to him.

"...your...Freed? the gaurd who went into the dragon's cage yeasterday...before me?" asked Felix back, intimidated by the gaurds face being hidden, his sentances came out few and far between.

"...thats me..." Freed answered, his voice was neutral, not giving Felix any chance of reading his emotions.

"...ok...you...saw the dragon right...?...do you...agree with how they're treating it...?" asked Felix, putting all his faith in the slim chance that freed shared his views on the mistreatment of the dragon.

"...do i agree with it...?" Freed said, echoing Felix's question with an annoyed tone in his voice, before replying. " its sickening...that creature isn't something for men to claim rights to...loke some sort of pet..." he said, an inner passion rising in his voice, almost like he was relived to get the words out of his mouth.

this at least, gave Felix some confidence. "then you saw her eyes...?" he asked, his own voice hopefull.

"...you mean the pain and suffering in them...? of course i did..." said Freed, looking down, as though disgusted in himself for not helping the creature." i tried to comfort the poor thing...but it was in a state of shock...and then...this" he told Felix, gesturing to his slashed chestplate.

Felix nodded, knowing in his heart that he could trust Freed. "then will you help me free her Mr.Freed?" he asked.

Freed looked taken aback, and seemed to be mulling the idea over in his head for a bit, before answering...
113221.title: an armoured ally

choices: later that day.
a few weeks from then.
1132211.content:
"do you really need to make it a question?" asked Freed, nodding to Felix that he would help him, which amazed Felix as much as it relieved him.

"...thank you..." he breathed, bowing his head low in thanks.

"...theres no need for thanks young one...you have a good heart...and a fierless spirit...it is an honour..." said Freed, inclining his head and offering his hand as a sign of comradire. Smiling up at him, Felix took Freeds hand, and though neither said a word, an unlikely friendship had been formed.

"Felix...you have a job to do...you need to gain your dragon friend's trust...we'll talk about escaping after that" said Freed, putting a trusting hand on Felix' shoulder.

Felix nodded, his confidence bolstered by the gaurd's unbending will. "alright, i'll do it!" he said.
1132211.title: chivalry.

choices: The next day, they can talk longer
It takes a while, and by then, she is very injured by more torture
114.content:
...green scales. It was lying on its side, its back to him. Felix heard it crying softly, and he noticed some of its green scales were missing, like they'd been torn off. Somehow, he thought the crying sounded feminine, but also young, about his age. He pushed the cart into the cell, watching the dragon with confusion, caution, and sadness due to its crying. Felix glanced over his shoulder and noticed the guards were watching him, probably to make sure he didn't try anything like trying to free and escape with the dragon. The boy kept walking until he reached a long scratch in the ground, made by guards to show where the dragon's reach could go to. Felix stopped and shoved the cart over the line.

When he did, the dragon suddenly turned and looked at him. Irven was stunned by the bright gold eyes staring right at him, dripping tears. Even though it was a giant lizard, Felix somehow could tell the dragon was female when he saw her eyes.

"Who are you?" a quiet, scared voice murmured.

Felix looked surprised, but realized the dragoness was talking with her mind to him.

"I'm Felix, a slave here," he replied.

"Hey, what are you doing?" the guards asked. "What are you talking to?"

The dragoness looked at the guards and growled, then turned her eyes back to Felix.

"We can talk more later, if they aren't listening," she said. "I'm Salia."

Felix nodded slightly, and motioned towards the cart. The dragoness slowly rolled over so her belly faced the door and Felix, and reached one talon into the cart. Felix stopped to watch her for a bit, as she took pieces of meat and ate them quickly, and saw the look of disgust when she tasted the food. Felix left the cell, surprised he wasn't dead. As the guards closed the door, he wondered when he could get a chance to talk with Salia longer....
114.title: Salia the green dragon

choices: The dragon decides to approach Felix slowly the next time he comes
The dragon decides to attack Felix once more for his intrusion
The dragon is unsure what to do next
115.content:
The dragon had white and silver scales all over its body. It was on all fours, glaring at Felix. Felix heard a low growl coming from the dragon and saw it was trying to raise its wings, even though it had chains retraining its wings tight to its back.

Felix didn't know it, but this breed of dragon was known as a Cloud Dragon, known for its white and silver scales and its ability to fly higher than any other breed of dragon. This was in part due to their larger wing span, which was about one and a half length of the average dragon breed's wing span. Because of its large wings and sleeker frame, it was also one of the fastest dragon breeds and the best in midair maneuverability.

Cloud dragons were also very fierce protectors of their territory and would not allow any intrusion into it lightly.

Felix felt the dragon's gold eyes glaring at him while he pushed the food off the cart, watching to see if this human would try to hurt him like the others did. With the food off, Felix carefully put the water a bit closer to the dragon when he heard the sound of metal on stone. Without thinking, he fell back, the cloud dragon just missing Felix.

Felix pushed away and stayed low on the ground, terrified of the great beast's sharp teeth.

"It almost. . .It almost . . ." Felix thought then feeling something warm between his legs, he grabbed the cart and took it from the room before running to his room to change into his only other pair of pants.

Meanwhile, the dragon sniffed the mean the human left and didn't touch it further. The dragon moved back to its space, and waited to strike the next human who should enter its territory.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------

A two weeks passed and not many were as lucky as Felix. Despite more chains being added to the dragon, it still found ways to attack the guards torturing it. Some were not so lucky as others and Lord William merely complained about having to find guards to replace the ones who had died.

But the cloud dragon noticed something about that one human who brought food. First, after a week of not eating, the dragon took the food and realized it wasn't poisonous like it had originally thought. Also, that small human only entered its territory to drop the food and run away.

"It keeps entering my territory," the cloud dragon thought angrily at the human's continual intrusions, "but it doesn't harm me like the others. Is it still scared from when I first pushed him out of my territory the first time?"
115.title: Cloud Dragon

choices: The dragon left the human there till it woke up in the morning.
The dragon took the human and held it close a it slept.
reader's choice...
1151.content:
Felix dreaded this moment. He had to go into the dragon's cell and feed it once more and fill up the bowl with water. He hated every time he went in there because the dragon was something he feared more than Lord William. The dragon was a vicious creature and it had tried to kill him the first time he entered the cell. All he was trying to do was feed it and it had to go and try killing him for no apparent reason. Plus, every time he heard stories of guards being killed by the creature, scared Felix even more. he sure didn't want to be entering a cell of a creature that seemed to have no remorse in ripping people to shreds.

Although he was frightened of the dragon, he knew he had to go in there and feed it. Otherwise, it would be certain death for him by Lord William's orders. At least with the dragon there was a possibility that Felix could get in and out of the cell quick enough for the dragon not to harm him, and that was exactly what Felix did. He continued to enter the cell everyday at least two to three times a day. He would quickly push the cart over to the dragon without going all the way to the edge of its reach. (He would just get far enough so that he could push it away from him and it would enter the dragon's reach. He would also have the filled water on the cart too.)

It was evening and it was time for the dragon's last dinner. Felix's entire body shook nervously at the guard unlocked the cell door for him. Every second that passed was more and more nerve raking for Felix and with his pale skin, some would have thought he had died of pure terror. Felix took many deep breaths in order to calm down enough to go into the cell and quickly push in the cart.

Once the door opened, Felix was ready and he hurried as fast as he could to the dragon. Luckily, the dragon was always less aggressive during the night runs. However, the dragon was still at the edge its reach waiting for Felix to approach. The dragon stood tall and proud which made it very large and intimidating to Felix even though he had over heard from the guards that the dragon was only about Felix's own age. The dragon was easily twenty feet tall, maybe more and it was impossible not afraid of something as large as that that was still growing.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------

The dragon was extremely curious of the human that kept feeding it. The human was obviously frightened out of its mind. Yet, it still entered the dragon's territory. The dragon wanted to know the reason behind the human's behavior, even if it meant capturing it and letting it stay in its territory for a little while longer.

The dragon paced as it always did in wait for the humans to come. It had the timing down pat since it happened at the same times every day. Soon, the dragon found the door opening around evening. The dragon knew it would be the last visit of the humans and it knew it would be the human that brought the food and drink. The dragon knew that the human would try to get in and out of its territory as fast as it could and the dragon devised a crafty plan in capturing it.

The dragon usually lied in wait at the edge using the full length of the chains that held it to the ground. This time, however, it didn't use the whole length. It was hoping the human would be going to fast to realize that the dragon had done this and would enter its reach.

As usual, the human rushed to a certain spot, the same as usual, and pushed. The cart usually made it to the dragon, but this time the dragon was farther back and the cart didn't reach it.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------

To Felix's horror, the cart didn't reach it to the dragon's paw like it usually did. This meant that he had to go closer and push it again. He was in too much of a hurry and too frightened to see that the dragon was not at the edge. Felix hurried and as soon as Felix's hands touched the handle of the cart, he noticed the dragon hurry to the same spot he was in. He was within the dragon's reach!

The dragon's hand tried to slash at Felix. Well, Felix thought the dragon was trying to slash when in actuality, it was trying to capture him. Felix suddenly, pushed himself away from the cart which caused the bowl of water to fall and spill on the ground. However, it kept Felix from being hit by the paw. Felix scrambled to his feet and hurried to the exit.

He was soon out of the dragon's reach, but he ran into Lord William. Felix fell backward again and was surprised to see his master in the cell. "Master, what are you...?" Felix began to ask.

"I've come to check on you progress. It's a good thing I did, because you had spilled the water bowl," Lord William replied.

"I'm sorry master, I'll get another one and..." Felix started to apologize.

"You will not get another one. You will fill that one up again," Lord William ordered.

"But mater," Felix argued, "The bowl is in the dragon's reach. It will kill me and..."

"Does it look like I care if you live or die. You are nothing but a slave," Lord William replied.

"Please, just let me get another bowl and..." Felix pleaded, but his pleads fell short when Lord William smacked him across the face once more.

Felix fell to the ground and Lord William said, "You will fill the bowl up with this water." Lord William set a jug of water by Felix before kicking Felix in the stomach twice. "You will not leave this room and you will not be fed until the dragon is fed. The dragon is much more useful to me than your pathetic life."

Lord William stormed out of the room and Felix cried in a curled ball for a long moment.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------

The dragon was shocked at what it saw. The human was beat by the evil man, and it gave the dragon an answer to why the human kept going in its territory. "The human has no other choice. That evil one is making the human feed me and give me water or it beats the human," the dragon realized, "The evil man is doing the same thing to the human as he is doing with me. The evil man keeps trying to make me do things I don't want to do by hurting me. That's what he must be doing to this human too, but the human has given into the evil man, because it can't handle pain like I can."

Eventually, the human got back up with a jug of water which only conformed the dragon's speculation. The human clutched its side, obviously badly injured. It was terrified, yet it continued to approach the dragon. Eventually, the human knelt beside the bowl and poured in the water. The dragon only looked down at the human as it collapsed after the task was done. The dragon lowered its head closer and the human was obviously unconscious.
1151.title: The Evil Man's Control

choices: The dragon acts very submissive during breakfast
The dragon doesn't growl at Felix anymore but decides to just watch him
11512.content:
The dragon saw the small human shiver from the cold floor.

"He has not harmed me," the dragon thought, "And his actions are controlled by that evil man. We have more in common than I thought. I can take him into my territory for the evening." The dragon nodded to its thoughts. Carefully, the dragon lowered its head to the human and picked him up by his shirt. It moved the boy to its side and laid him against part of its body that wasn't held down by chains. It then lowered its head next to Felix, holding him snugly against the warm torso. The dragon saw Felix had a content smile on his face before the dragon fell asleep as well.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

Morning came and Felix slowly woke at his usual time.

"I don't want to wake up," Felix thought, "I feel so warm right now in my bed. I haven't been this comfortable in bed since . . . I can't even recall. Even if it means a kick, this warmth is worth it." Felix pressed slightly into the scaly body and realized this wasn't his bed. Quickly his eyes shot open and he saw the large dragon head at his side.

"Oh Gods, it's going to eat me for a morning snack!" Felix thought, breathing heavily. His panic worsened when he saw the large eyes of the dragon open and look to him. The cloud dragon kept its head low as a sign of welcoming the human into its territory, but soon noticed the human was still scared of him.

"Perhaps his pain has gone on far longer than mine and that's why he's scared of me, even now?" the dragon thought before moving its head away to give Felix some space.

------------------------------

Felix saw the opening and bolted to the door, pounding on it.

"Let me out please!" Felix cried. The guard on the other side opened the door and hit Felix to shut him up. He looked over and saw the bowl full of water.

"All right, get out," the guard said, glaring at Felix. "But I'll see you in about ten minutes, cuz it's almost feeding time for the beast." Felix felt his heart race before he bolted out of the dungeon. The cloud dragon watched the boy flee, wondering if the boy could be a friend in this dark place.
11512.title: Warm nights

choices: Felix pushed the cart as usual and left quickly.
Felix pushed the cart all the way to the dragon and stood in front of it.
115121.content:
Ten minutes later, Felix would come back to the cell to feed the dragon once more, and in those ten minutes, the dragon thought long and hard about the possibility of having the human as a friend. it was clear to the dragon that the boy was in the same sort of situation as it was. The boy had obviously been under the evil man's abuse for a very long time, longer than the dragon had been under his abuse. With the similarities, it is possible for two to become friends even if it was a human and a dragon becoming friends. The dragon had heard of stories from the older dragons about dragons befriending humans in similar circumstances.

"And let's face it," the dragon added to its thoughts, "None of the other humans that come in here and torture me are going to be willing to be a friend. This boy might be the only suitable friend, even though he's still frightened of me."

Soon the dragon began to wonder if it really needed a human friend at all. All the humans it had seen so far were wicked creatures who took pleasure in torturing the dragon, all except the boy of course. Did it really need a find? "I do," the dragon sighed, "This is a terribly dark and depressing place full of pain and anguish. If I were to try and fight these humans alone, I might fall into a state I could not come back from. The torture and loneliness will get to me and I might fall victim to the evil man, no matter how much I wish it not to happen."

The dragon knew that it would try to fight off the torturers with every once of life it had, but deep down inside, it knew that it might not be enough. No matter how proud of a creature it was and no matter how much it wanted to be independent, it knew that it couldn't do it alone. It could face the darkness without someone else. "A friend would be able to help me fight off the evil man's control. The boy might not be able to fight like I can, but he could comfort me and be there for me when times grow darker. I know that some time, I will need a friend and right now, the human is the only option."

Before the dragon could think about regretting its decision on leaving the family to be off on its own, the door opened and the human with the cart entered.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------

While Felix had prepared the cart for the dragon, Felix thought about everything that had happened. "The dragon could have ate me last night, but it didn't. Instead, it ate the meat I brought it and while I was unconscious it..." Felix thought.

Felix shook his head and muttered, "The dragon only brought it close to me so it could eat me as a breakfast snack."

"Yet, it didn't eat me when it had the chance. The dragon had been awake long enough to eat me, but instead, it let me go. It could have chased after me, but it..." Felix though.

However, he interrupted his thoughts once more and whispered, "The dragon was probably just tired. it probably loosened it grip when it feel asleep and was too groggy in the morning to realize I had the opportunity to escape. That's the most logical reason, right?"

However, something inside of Felix wasn't entirely sure about it. The dragon had been being tortured for a few weeks now and it was probably ready to give into Lord William. The dragon did seem different that morning. It was possible that the dragon realized that Felix wasn't doing anything to harm the dragon while other humans kept hurting it. It was a child after all as the guards had said and the dragon might want something else other than the torture it had been receiving.

Felix remembered the first days of being a slave. For the longest time, he had felt alone, and he still did. There was no one to care about him and no one that could give him the love and friendship he needed. He had been in a dark nightmare for as long as he could remember, and it was possible the dragon was starting to fell the same way. It was possible that if Felix showed the dragon it wasn't alone and that he could be there for it then...

"But dragons just beasts, aren't they? They can't possibly feel the same way as humans do, can they?" Felix questioned.

Before Felix could think upon it any farther, the cell door opened and he pushed the cart in. Felix noticed that the dragon was on the edge once more, but it wasn't standing tall and proud like it usually did. Instead, it was on its stomach with its head flat on the ground.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

The dragon positioned itself in a submissive stance to try and show the human it meant the boy no harm. The dragon's pride stung, but it knew that if it was to befriend the human, it would have to show the human it meant no harm, and since the human was so frightened of it, the dragon had to lie on the ground with its head flat on the ground. It could only hope that the human would understand.

1151212.content:
Felix walked slowly towards the dragon, watching for any movement that would signal this to be a trick, but none came.

"What's going on? Was it broken while I was out?" Felix wondered but shook his head. The golden eyes still retained their spirit they had since the first time Felix saw them. "If it's not broken, why is it acting like it is?" He pushed the cart to the mouth of the dragon and waited in front of the head. Felix stared down at the eyes of the dragon.

"What's the meaning of this?" Felix muttered, confused by the dragon's actions.

------------------------------------------------------

Laying down like it was, the dragon's eyes were about as high up as Felix's stomach. The dragon saw the human's mouth move but couldn't understand the words spoken.

"He hasn't fled yet. Could he be fighting his fears? Do I need to be more submissive?" the dragon thought, hoping it wouldn't have to.

The dragon then saw something pleasing. The human was bending at the knees.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

"Why am I doing this? I can't believe I'm doing this," Felix thought bending down so he was eye level with the dragon. Both beings tried not to blink, staring the other in the eyes as though they were searching for something in the other.

Felix was breathing deep and felt a strange feeling. It compelled him to see just what this dragon would allow. Slowly, with no sudden movements, Felix's right arm rose until his hand was in his armpit. And then very carefully, he moved it towards the muzzle of the dragon, praying the dragon knew he meant no harm.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Under any other circumstance, the cloud dragon would have bitten the hand that has fed it, but as it stared into the human's eyes, it knew what the human was doing.

"It's a sign of trust. The human wants to know if it can trust me. If he touches me, I might just have a friend," the dragon thought just as it felt Felix's touch on its forehead, slowly and gently rubbing the face that had been whipped by various guards. As the hand reached the mouth of the dragon, the dragon decided to gently lick the hand of the human. Trying so hard to show it meant him no harm.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----

Felix saw the large red mass come from the mouth of the dragon and wet his hand. In response, Felix...
1151212.title: Looking for Trust

choices: Felix tries to communicate with the dragon.
A guard knocks on the door and yells for Felix to hurry it up.
11512122.content:
It was very hard, but Felix kept his hand on the dragon's muzzle as it had licked his arm a few times with it massive tongue. Felix was screaming in his head that the dragon was going to eat him and that he should run away, but Felix didn't do that. He just continued to kneel there with his hand placed upon the dragon's muzzle and in those long moments, the dragon did nothing else to harm Felix. "It wasn't tasting me. It was probably just being friendly. Kind of like a dog's lick," Felix reasoned, "A very large dog that could probably fit me in its mouth if it wanted to."

Felix shivered slightly at the thought of being devoured by a giant dragon, but he stayed with the dragon and continued to pet its muzzle. Felix had become very fascinated by the creature. Not too long ago, it had been hostile to humans. Yet, ever since last night, the dragon for some reason wasn't as hostile to Felix anymore.

However, thoughts of why the dragon was acting differently towards Felix was starting to fall to the back of his mind. Instead, new thoughts overpowered his brain for the moment. "If this thing become loyal to me, imagine what I could do," Felix thought. He began imagining the dragon becoming a powerful and loyal pet. He imagined both thoughts of finally being able to escape the wicked castle and/or using the dragon to finally kill Lord William. Felix fell under a day dream as many possible futures flooded in his mind now that he might have control over a twenty foot dragon that was still growing.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------

The dragon was glad that the boy didn't take the lick in a negative way, because it knew that the human could have thought it was going to eat the boy, or something. Honestly, lick was just a greeting that dragons could use. Another greeting would be nuzzling, but The dragon felt it was necessary not to do that, because it would involve the dragon having to lift its head and bring it closer to the human. The dragon knew that it was more likely that the human would react more negatively and possibly freak out if the dragon was to lift its head and draw it nearer to the boy. No, the dragon knew it was best to lick the human and hope it would understand it to be a greeting and a wish to make friends.

The human seemed to understand the meaning of the lick, because he stayed where he was and continued to pet the dragon's muzzle. At first, the dragon didn't mind the petting for a while, because it was the first caring thing any one had done for the dragon since it had been captured. However, as the boy continued, the dragon became a little more uncomfortable about the petting.

One thing was that the dragon still wasn't comfortable about letting the human touch it. It was bad enough it was in its territory, because it was in the dragon's nature to fell it should protect its territory from intruders unless the "intruder" was a friend. The dragon still wasn't comfortable about calling the human a friend, because it didn't really know the human all too well and all the other humans it had encountered hurt it and tortured it. The main thing that was keeping the human alive and letting it enter its territory was that the dragon was letting it in the territory and trying its best to befriend the human, even if the human's touch was pushing it a little.

The other reason the dragon felt uncomfortable was that the human continued to pet the dragon as if it were some kind of pet! This was bugging the dragon most, because it was an intelligent life form like the human. It wasn't some mindless beast and being a pet was an insult to the dragon. Again, the dragon's want to be the human's friend was overpowering the possible insult and the dragon's mind continued to reason it was possible that the human didn't understand the dragon was intelligent and not just some dumb animal.

However, the dragon couldn't hide the anger and uncomfortableness from its eyes.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------

Felix awakened from his daydream when he looked into the dragon's eyes. There was anger in the eyes and the eyes were fixed upon Felix's hand. Felix realized quickly the dragon was angry with Felix touching it and Felix quickly pulled his head away so as to not anger the dragon more than it already was. "Sorry, I guess I got carried away," Felix apologized. He could tell that the dragon didn't mind the touch at first, but after a while the dragon became angry and uncomfortable with Felix's stroking.

"Does the dragon still hate humans," Felix wondered, "I would too if I was in its position, and it would explain why the dragon was angered by the long period of contact. However, it doesn't explain why the dragon is being nicer to me than all the other humans."

The question of why was brought up again and it was no longer in the back of Felix's mind. As Felix pondered about the question, the dragon lifted it head slowly, but Felix didn't notice, so it started eating the deer meat on the cart Felix had brought.

"Why is the dragon so different to me?" Felix continued to wonder. That was when Felix noticed the dragon eating the meat and Felix figured, "Maybe, it is because I give it food. I'm not like all the other humans that enter here, because they torture the dragon, but I just feed it. It must not see me as a threat to it which has made it act kinder to me."

"But even if that's true, why would it act as submissive as it did just now?" Felix continued, "I know it's a child dragon and I'm feeding it, but surely it knows I'm not its parent." Felix thought back to the lick the dragon gave him and what he had woken up to that morning. "The lick was like a dog's lick, like a lick of a friendly dog, and the dragon kept me close last night yet did nothing to harm me. It's letting me get closer and... Does it wish to be friends?"

Felix thought about the concept of a dragon wishing to be friends with a human, "It might be possible that dragon could have intelligence. It did play that clever trick on me the other day. This dragon might have the same intelligence as a human and it might be wanting to befriend me. It would explain everything that has happened ever since... Ever since it saw Lord William beat me. If this dragon has the intelligence I think it does, then it might have realized we're similar. We're both being held against our will by and evil man that hurts us when we don't do what he wants."

115121221.content:
"Dragon," Felix said softly as the dragon finished the deer. It didn't seem to hear. With a firmer voice, Felix called at the dragon again. It turned its head this time and looked at him.

"He better not want to pet me again or I will bite him this time," the dragon thought.

Felix pointed at the dragon while speaking, "Can you understand," moving to point to his head, "What I'm" pointing at his chest now, "saying?" moving one hand in a talky way and pointing to his mouth at the same time. The dragon stared at Felix for a moment.

"He points at me, then his head, then his body and finally his mouth," the dragon thought, "I wish I had learned how to speak human or at least understand what he's saying." The dragon blinked and realized that was probably what the human was asking about. "He's trying to see if I'm intelligent or not," the dragon realized. But also knew he didn't know how to express this in the human's body language.

Felix stared into the eyes of the cloud dragon. "What if the dragon doesn't know how to communicate with me?" Felix said, thinking like how a dog can understand commands but can't speak. "If the dragon is intelligent, then maybe I could show it a way to communicate back," Felix reasoned, "But the dragon has only been shown pain since it got here, And it's supposedly a young one as well. Wait pain."

"Yes," Felix said while nodding and gently rubbed his arm. "No," Felix said while shaking his head and struck his arm hard.

"He pets himself and nods. And he hits himself and shook the head," the dragon thought, "Is he trying to say a nod is yes and shake means no? Only one way to find out." Slowly the dragon raised and then shook its head, hoping the human understood it didn't understand his words but it did understand the hand motions.

"It's saying no, but how could it respond if it didn't understand me?" Felix wondered confused.

1151212211.content:
"If it can't understand me, then how can it shake its head saying no to me?" Felix repeated in his head, "Unless it's just imitating my movements. No, this is not a simple animal. Not from the way it acts.

"Wait a minute," Felix realized, "Maybe, it's not answering to the signs but the speech itself. It must not know what I'm saying, but it can understand my signs. That must be it, but I have to test it out anyway."

"You don't understand my speech, do you?" Felix questioned without the moments. The dragon didn't nod or shake its head. Instead, the dragon kept its head up and tilted its head, the universally meaning of confusion.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------

The dragon was lost once again when the human spoke. "Did the human not understand what I meant?" the dragon questioned, "How are we supposed to communicate with each other when we can't tell each other simple things. But, I can't give up. If I don't escape this place in time. I'm going to need a friend eventually to get me out of the darkness. If Mom and Dad could see this, they'd probably scold me for not learning the human language. They told me time and time again that I would have to learn so I could tell humans I mean no harm so they wouldn't harm me."

The dragon thought back to the day he left on his own. "You're only ten years old!" the dragon's mother said, "You still need to stay with your family and..."

"I can do things myself. I'm not a baby anymore," the dragon replied.

"So, you think you can make it by yourself?" the dragon's father questioned, "I'll give you a week before you begin to realize that a dragon cannot survive by itself. Dragon's need mates, clans, and knowledge of humans."

"Those pathetic creatures?" the dragon growled.

The father replied, "Humans may be smaller than us, but they have unique weapons that can kill us. There are humans that male a living by killing what they believe are beasts. Without knowing what humans are capable of, you can never win at a fight with them, and without knowledge of their language you can't speak to them and try and settle a truce or..."

However, the dragon had left his family before his father could finish. The dragon snapped out of its daze when the human called out the same word it had last time when the human interrupted the dragon's meal. "I wonder if the human is calling me dragon like it was my name which would make that word 'dragon'. However, it could be say another attention getter word like 'hey', 'listen', or something along those lines," the dragon wondered. The dragon decided to pay close attention to the words from now on to try and pick up the meaning and translate them to its own language.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------

"The dragon looks confused. It doesn't understand my speech, but now it's time to try it out with the signs," Felix thought to himself. Before Felix could say it with the signs, Felix noticed the dragon went into a daze. The dragon looked as though it was recollecting something. "Dragon!" Felix called out.

Suddenly, the dragon shook its head out of its daze and looked back down at Felix. Even while lying on its stomach and having its head up, the dragon was still far larger than Felix. Felix repeated his question with the motions. "You," Felix pointed to the dragon, "Don't," Felix shook his head, "Understand," Felix pointed to his head, "My words," Felix pointed to himself and then he motioned his hand as if something was coming out of his mouth.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------

"The human points to me first and says a word. Maybe that word means 'you' since he's pointing at me. Then he shakes his head meaning no. However, that word must not mean no. No one but trolls say 'you no'. Maybe it's don't. 'you don't'. That's what those two word might mean. Now he points to his head. This might mean knowledge or intelligence or... know. It might mean know. 'You don't know'. Or the word could mean understand," the dragon thought as it listened while trying to understand the meanings of the words from the signs and try to memorize to speak them, "Now he points at himself like for the word 'me' and he makes motions like words coming out. This could mean either 'my words', 'my language', or 'my speech'. Definitely something along those lines. He must understand that I can't understand his words and he's asking if I can't understand it."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------

Felix saw the dragon nod, knowing it meant that the dragon was saying, "Yes, it's didn't understand his language."

"Alright, we're going to have to rely on motions and signs until I can teach human my language. If I can..." Felix said. Felix stared at the dragon for a while and realized he knew nothing about the dragon's age, name, or even its gender. "It might be best that I know the answers to these three questions first. I might as well start with the gender."

"Are you?" Felix asked while pointing at the dragon, "A boy?" Felix pointed to his crotch area, "Or a girl?" Felix then put his hand up to his chest to make them look like imaginary breasts.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------

The dragon didn't understand that the human was asking its gender, because dragon females didn't have breasts, because dragons weren't mammals. However, the dragon remembered that only female mammals had breasts and the boy was show parts that separated males form females. "It might be asking my gender. He probably can't tell, because humans might not understand the differences in female and male dragons," the dragon thought.

what was the answer to Felix's question?

11512122112.content:

"And why do you say that?" called one of the beast masters.

"I'm sorry my lord, but I do not," Claude said, feeling William's gaze upon him.

"Then we will test it by flagging the boy in front of the dragon. If you are correct, then the slave will die and the dragon hurt. And you will be rewarded.
