1451211.content:
Felix was in the kitchen once more. Before he started taking things, he looked around the room and walked around quietly. The chef was not around and all his cooks weren't either. This was because Felix came to the kitchen after lunch and everyone had already finished their fill. Felix rushed up to the well in the kitchen that led to an underground river underneath the castle. Felix used it to fill five canteens that wouldn't be missed and put them on a cart. Then Felix took the unused meat packets and placed them on the cart as well.

Once he thought he had enough, he turned the cart to the doorway only to find the chef in his way with his arms crossed. "You're back, eh?" the Chef questioned.

"I already told you this food isn't for me. It's for Master's pet. I've been instructed to keep it alive while Lord William tries to tame it," Felix replied.

"I found it odd Lord William would have you feed the new beast. So, I had a chat with him, and it seems as though you speak the truth, slave," the Chef, "And now that I think of it, it is better for a slave to be the creature's keeper. Not only would you have to clean after it, but also if the creature should decide to devour you instead of the meat, Lord William could just get another slave to do your work."

"Can you let me through?" Felix said, begging slightly, "I have other tasks to do after I feed the creature and..."

"That's a lot of canteens you have there," the chef interrupted, "Does the creature really need five canteens of water? Or are you planning to escape and...?"

"No, I'm not escaping. The creature hadn't had water all day yesterday and it will need water," Felix quickly explained, "Besides, when it empties some canteens it would have others as I refill the empty ones. I saw how neglected this canteens were and I didn't think anyone would mind if I use them for the creature."

"So, you aren't planning on leaving?" the chef interrogated.

"No," Felix sighed, "A slave's work my be shitty, but it is the only work and life I know. Even if I were to escape, I wouldn't know what to do."

"This slave life is the only life for a filthy bottom feeder like you," the chef added, "Remember that, slave."

Once the chef stepped out of the way, Felix hurried out of the kitchen and towards the direction in which the dungeons were. Felix could never forget the comments like the last sentence the chef had said to him. Felix had heard so many phrases and words such as, "Slave scum", "Slave", "What could can a slave do?", "You can't expect a slave to understand.", and many more more demeaning things were said to Felix daily. Being exposed to such discrimination for five long years and made Felix numb. For the most part, he couldn't feel the sting of such hurtful words anymore. In actuality, the words burrowed deep inside his soul making his numbness and depression.

Slavery was all he knew, and he couldn't escape. Sadly, he wouldn't be able to make it on his own. he knew nothing of the outside world and nothing about freedom, just was the word meant. If he was going to escape, he would have to do it with a slave like Ted that was once free, otherwise, it was pointless. As harsh as it might seem, Felix believed it was better to live as a slave than die free from an inevitable and pointless death. Ted might think differently, but Felix was used to being a slave, it was his whole life.

Felix arrived at the cell, but the guard stopped him. "You aren't aloud in there yet, Felix. Lord William is trying to tame the beast now and he won't want to be bothered. It's best you stay out here till he's done," Randolph told Felix.

Felix was glad Randolph would be one of the guards guarding the cell and that he was the only guard at the moment. Randolph was unlike most of the guards, because he wasn't a mindless drone. He had started serving as a guard before William came into power thirteen years ago. Randolph was now thirty-four years old and had only served three years under the kind and noble lord before William, a lord Felix never was able to meet. It was said that the first lord, whose name was never aloud to be spoken in the presence of Lord William, died of a sickness and since William was the lord's adviser, William become lord. Many suspected Lord William had a hand in the death, but there was no prof. Some said Lord William had black magic that killed the lord, but that was a rumor. Randolph was a noble guard and pure in heart, but he did Lord William's bidding only because he was one of the view nice guards. Randolph was one of the few that didn't treat the slaves as some subspecies.

Felix waited only for a minute before Lord William burst out of the cell with his personal guards. "Damn creature," Lord William growled to himself, "It deserves the punishment I gave it for using such trickery magic on me. It will learn soon enough not to use magic against me, or it will suffer much greater than I already give to it. It doesn't even have the slightest clue of what true torture, pain, and misery are."

Lord William stopped talking to himself and looked at Felix. "You are not to feed the creature yet," Lord William ordered, "It must think on its sins."

"How long must I wait?" Felix questioned.

"An hour should give it time to sink in," Lord William stated.

"But I have tasks after this," Felix argued.

Lord William took the back of his hand and smacked it against Felix's face before saying, "You will do as you're told. It will just take you longer to finish your chores."

Lord William walked away with his royal guards and Felix looked at to Randolph. "Randolph, could you please let me in," Felix pleaded.

"Lord William told you to wait an hour. What if he finds you doing your other tasks before the hour past?" Randolph questioned.

"I never see Lord William until during the evening tasks," Felix explained, "Even if I do run into him, I'll tell him I decided to do some tasks while I wait for the hour to pass. Then I'd have to pretend to come back down here to feed the fairy and..."

"The creature is a fairy?" Randolph questioned, finding it hard to imagine imprisoning a fairy, making it a "pet", and calling it a beast.

"You didn't know it was a fairy?" Felix asked.

"Never looked in the cell," Randolph informed Felix.

"Well, it's a Felaryan fairy, or Ted thinks so. Those are more monstrous and they eat humans by either shrinking humans or becoming giants. Ted said they have no remorse about eating humans," Felix explained, "Now, can I go in, please."

"Fine," Randolph gave up after a long hesitation, "But you mustn't let Lord William see you before the hour mark and..."

"If I am found out that I went in the cell early, I'll tell him that he didn't order you to keep me out just ordered me to stay out. His anger will all be on me," Felix assured Randolph before pushing the cart in the cell.

When Felix was back in the cell with the fairy, the fairy wasn't skipping around and dancing like the last time. Instead, the fairy was on its knees with her face buried deep in her hands, crying. He crying was like nothing Felix had ever heard before. It was a sob poisoned with sorrow, misery, pain, and loneliness that Felix never thought was possible. "What did Lord William do to her?" Felix wondered, "She looks so scared and helpless."

Felix began forgetting that she was a dangerous creature that couldn't be trusted, because in all honesty, she was a trickster fairy that probably enjoyed eating humans. She was a Felaryan after all and even though humans have the same level of intelligences as the Felaryan top predators, Felaryan top predators knew humans were a different species and that helped them see humans as food. It also helped them see humans as food when humans were usually much smaller than Felaryan top predators, too small to be considered equals or anything more than food.

Felix forgot what Ted had warned and started seeing the fairy as just a normal girl who was emotionally injured. She was crying uncontrollably which made Felix feel extremely sorry for her. "I can't let her just cry like this," Felix told himself, "I remember my first few months when no one was around to out of the depression. It made me feel worthless and alone. I can't let the same thing happen to her. Also, if I help comfort her, she might become my true friend and help Ted and I escape by teaching me magic. That way, I can help her escape to and not worry about her turning on me and eating me."

It sounded like a good plan, but he had no idea that Felaryan creatures had a much different logic than the humans of his world. There were times when Felaryan top predators would make friends with humans, but even when that happened, it didn't necessarily mean the human was safe. Even if the Felaryan was friends with the human, it still might have the urge to eat the human because the Felaryan might either be addicted to human flesh or the Felaryan top predator mindset that humans weren't good for anything but food could be drilled deep in the Felaryan's mind. Still, becoming friends with a Felaryan was a start.

Felix slowly approached the fairy with the cart so that it didn't make too much noise. The fairy's cries drowned out what little noise the cart made while going slowly. Once the cart was near her, Felix approached closer to the fairy till he was within inches. Felix then knelt down beside her and touched her shoulder in order to try and comfort her, but before Felix could say any words of comfort, the fairy quickly turned her head and faced him with glowing eyes. The next thing Felix knew was he was shrinking!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------

Once the evil man who called himself master of her left, the fairy began crying uncontrollably. "Humans are dangerous to you right now, Fakira," the fairy, Fakira, could hear her mother saying, "You mustn't confront humans till your magic is much stronger and not until you're an adult. It's true that humans are just food we can eat, but they are still dangerous in numbers against a fairy who hasn't developed all her magical powers yet."

Unfortunately, Fakira hadn't listened to her mother and was captured by humans before she could defend herself. Now, she was stuck in a dark cell without wings and being tortured by a man who wanted her to be his slave. "Evil, nasty, terrible humans. If I escape and my wings grow back, I'll show those humans whose the better predator. I'll show them what their meant to be. They're nothing more than snack that deserve to go in my stomach. All humans are just evil, nasty creatures," Fakira thought to herself.

She hadn't encountered humans before that day when she was captured. From what her mother had taught her, humans seemed as though they were just mindless animals that could be snacks for her. Her mother never told her that humans matched the same type of intelligence as her. When Fakira encountered many humans, she learned they were intelligent creatures that could actually speak. This shocked Fakira long enough for the humans to capture her. Since the only humans she saw were nasty and evil creatures that tortured and discriminated her, she thought all humans were like that making her understand why humans should know their place and be food to her.

Suddenly, Fakira felt a hand on her shoulder and she quickly thought it was the evil man wanting to harm her again. She knew she could still shrink a human to about three inches, the size of a normal fairy, for two minutes. It was long enough to capture the human next to her and eat it, because once its in her stomach, it didn't grow back to normal size. Thinking it was the evil man that deserved to die, Fakira turned and used the spell to shrink the human. The human shrunk, with his clothes, to about three inches. However, Fakira realized it was the human who brought the food the other night.

"That's not the evil man," Fakira thought to herself.

"But it's still an evil human," Fakira could almost hear her mother saying, "You can't let a human go to waste, my child."

Fakira smiled and reached down to pick up and devour the human.
1451211.title: Live a Slave or Die Free?

choices: The two minutes are up and Felix's back to normal size.
Randolph looks in and sees the tiny Felix.
14512112.content:
"Please wait!" Felix called as the large hand four times his new size came downwards aiming at him, "I don't want to hurt you!" Fakira heard him but ignored his plea. The fairy kept reaching downwards at the same pace. Felix could do nothing to prevent it. He just raised his arms outward to the oncoming hand, but what good would it have done now that he was much smaller and weaker than the fairy.

Fakira wrapped her fingers around the Felix's body and lifted him in the air. Felix panicked when his feet left the ground. He knew he had to think fast or he'd be eaten by the fairy, because the fairy wasn't going to hesitate. It was going to eat him without any remorse.

"Evil humans are liars, deceivers, and most of all food," Fakira said, pulling Felix to her face quickly and smiling with all her teeth showing. Felix might have said her teeth were very pretty, though sharp and her smile beautiful, but there was a evil almost wickedness to the smile as it knew of his doom. The fairy licked her lips and opened her mouth wide and as Felix saw himself approaching the dark abyss before him, panic flew.

"No! Please!" Felix screamed. The fairy noted his panic and fear. So, Fakira slowed her hand's approach to her mouth so she could torment the human longer. Felix suddenly recalled the fairy's spell when he was slowly getting closer to the gaping mouth. "Efno Helpu Calcium!" he stumbled, "Ethan Heaplu Culam! Wait! Ethna Hepalu Calum!"

-------------------------

The fairy was laughing inwardly as the tiny human tried using her magic against her.

"Stupid human," she thought as Felix shouted the actual spell inches away from being eaten. Having not expected magic, Fakira didn't have a chance to protect herself from the magic. And given Felix's proximity to her and how much emotion he put into it, Fakira quickly let go of Felix and grabbed her stomach in pain.

----------------------------------------------

The fairy's fingers let go of Felix and her hand fell down to her stomach almost before Felix even started falling. Felix fell the length of Fakira's torso until landing on her lap. Felix then began sliding against the fabric of her dress that only went down to her knees and down the slanted incline of the lap. Felix eventually was able to grab hold of the fabric and stopped himself. Looking up, he saw the fairy already leaning forward with her hands clutching her stomach.

Felix rolled off her lap and onto the rocky ground. The fall should have hurt him more, but it didn't seem to harm his shrunken body and he ran away from the legs, hoping he was far enough away from the fairy and hoping the fairy's spell would wear off soon. The pain was brief as he saw the fairy straighten up and look at him with an angry glare.

"So the evil man now sent you to use magic against me?" Fakira growled. One hand continued massaging her stomach, while the other reached for the tiny human. She glared at Felix viewing him now more than an evil human but a traitor to fairies, helping the evil man hurt her. "Traitor," she added.

"No please, I'm not evil! I didn't know I could use magic until I met you!" Felix shouted, moving away. The hand stopped as the fairy glared at him.

"How can you not know you can use magic?" Fakira asked,

"I have been a slave to Lord William since before I can remember!" Felix replied, "And I never knew I had magic blood within me."

"What is a slave?" Fakira asked. She had never heard this word before.

"I'm his property," Felix replied, "I must serve him or he will punish me."

"Does he want you to convince me to serve him as well?" Fakira growled at Felix, her hand moving once more.

"No! I'm not even supposed to be in here! He told me to wait to feed you but I defied his orders to come in here!" Felix said. Fakira looked over the tiny human and recalled how the ones who hurt her earlier were much larger and stronger looking.

As she debated what to do next . . .
14512112.title: Second Casting

choices: Felix handed her the food and water without any questions.
Felix asks some questions but Fakira doesn't wish to talk to a human.
145121121.content:
Fakira knew that if she wanted to eat the human, she would have to do it at that time. The human would only be able to be shrunk for a certain amount of time and she wouldn't be able to shrink another human for a few hours. So, she had to grab the human right then and eat him so he wouldn't grow, but the fairy hesitated.

Fakira thought about the human's claim and studied the now tiny human just within reach if she were to reach for it. "This human is much younger than the others. He's been in her before, but he didn't hurt me," Fakira thought, "Besides, this human can use magic. What does that mean?"

"If you're not here to torture me, then what are you here for? And be quick or I shall eat you anyway," Fakira demanded, "I don't have troubles eating humans, and I really do want to try it. You humans are supposed to be very delicious."

"I meant no harm to you," Felix replied quickly knowing the fairy might not hesitate for too long, "My master just wants me to feed you, give you water, keep you alive."

"Why didn't you just set the food and water down? Why did you touch my shoulder?" Fakira questioned.

"I saw you crying," Felix explained, "You looked so sad. I couldn't just let you cry."

"Why's that?" Fakira asked. She couldn't understand why a human would be concerned with her feelings. Not only did she see humans as evil, now, but also, humans were a different species. She was a Felaryan and Felaryans saw the meaning of a person differently. For them, just because someone has intelligence, it didn't mean it was a person. For something to be a person to a Felaryan, it had to either be the same species or a race that is the size of a top predator and/or a species their species is friends with. Humans, however, saw a person as something with the same or greater intelligence which made Felix see the fairy as a human instead of a monster. Fakira didn't understand this.

"Because you were crying and you remind me of myself and others that are my friends," Felix replied. He didn't understand why it would be a hard concept to the fairy.

"How do I know you're not lying to me right now?" Fakira questioned.

"If you truly don't believe me and you have no doubts that I'm lying, then go a head and eat me," Felix told the fairy, "I approached you because you were sad and I wanted to comfort you. I knew you could shrink me and eat me, but I thought you would understand that I only meant to help you."

Felix closed his eyes tightly and tensed up as he waited for the fairy to respond. He thought he would feel her fingers wrapping around him again. Yet, nothing happened. Felix opened his eyes and saw the fairy just continuing to stare at him with suspicion. Fakira still didn't trust the human and she still didn't see it as a person, but Fakira knew it could use magic. "If it can use magic when I can't, it might be a way out. I might be able to convince it to help me escape. It might mean having to pretend to be its friend, but it could be an escape plan," Fakira concocted.

"Yes," Fakira could imagine her mother agreeing, "Then you can eat the human once your wings grow back. Or maybe if you should accidentally get a little attached to it, it could always be a pet or a 'slave' which he says he is."

Suddenly, Felix and all his clothes with him grew back to his normal size. "How much magic can you use?" Fakira questioned once Felix was back to normal.

"I don't know any spells other than the one I used on you. I only did it to save my life not to purposely give you harm," Felix tried explain.

"So, you really know nothing about magic," Fakira said.

"Why are you so interested all of the sudden?" Felix questioned.

"Listen human," Fakira said, "I'm going to teach you some magic. Just enough for you to free me from these chains and some other spells needed to defend yourself. Then, you are going to help me out of here and we're going to escape together."

"Is there a second option?" Felix questioned.

"I eat you," Fakira replied with another evil smile.

"However, if you do that, you don't have magic," Felix replied.

"Do you want me to eat you now, human?" Fakira questioned evilly.

"Alright, alright. I agree to your terms," Felix quickly replied. it was just what he wanted and just what he planned with Ted. "She's going to teach me magic and then Ted and I will be able to escape. I have to be careful how I go about this though. She'll have suspicions that I might not help her escape," Felix thought.

"So, you feeding me or what?" Fakira asked.
145121121.title: Plans Begin

choices: Randolph lets him out and Felix does his other tasks for the hour
As Felix leave, Lord William comes to see Fakira . . . .
1451211212.content:
Felix nodded and turned to the cart and took the meat packet first.

"Um, do you have a name?" Felix asked as he approached her with the food. Fakira glared at him.

"Does he expect me to talk to get fed, like I'm some kind of pet? If I was my giant self, I'd show this human whose inferior. It can't boss me around just because I have no wings and I'm in chains. Mother said humans are food," she thought.

Felix was startled by the glare, and he quickly tried to explain himself, "I just wanted to know what to call you. My name is Felix." He saw Fakira smile an evil smile as he handed over the meat.

"Felix," she replied, "Don't ask me stupid questions worm." She flashed her sharp teeth before tearing into the meat. Felix, shaking a little, returned to the cart and put down the canteens of water near her.

"All right," Felix said, "But would you do something for me?" Felix tried to sound as little imposing with his question, otherwise it could land him in her stomach.

Fakira scowled at Felix. "What did I just say?" she asked darkly. Felix rose his hands quickly, shaking them.

"Wait please. Remember I said I wasn't meant to feed you just yet? If they find out I did, we'll both be punished," Felix explained quickly. Fakira said nothing except take another bite of food.

"So?" she asked arrogantly, while inwardly listening to the human. She didn't want to get beaten like that again.

"Continue crying for a bit and hide the canteens of water," Felix said, "That way if Lord William comes by. He won't realize you ate." Fakira thought on Felix's request.

"It's to my benefit as much as his. If I want to get out of here, focusing my energy to heal wounds takes away from healing my wings," she thought.

"Fine," she said, before draining at least to of the canteens of their water and focused her eyes on all the canteens. Felix was amazed to see all five shrink before him. "Inanimate objects stay small longer, even without wings," Fakira explained. However, the last bit was more of a growl as if she blamed Felix for the loss of her wings.

In a way Felix was right to fell Fakira was blaming him, because she blamed all humans. Because of everything her mother taught her about humans, Fakira felt as though all humans were the same. Humans were evil and insignificant beings that are too small to be much of anything except food.

"Okay, I'll be back later," Felix said heading to the cart. As he turned, he heard Fakira start crying again. Felix went to the door and knocked.
1451211212.title: Fearing the Fairy

choices: Fakira teaches limited magic.
Fakira pretends to be his friend.
14512112121.content:
Randolph opened the door and Felix pushed the cart through the entrance. Randolph actually gave a sigh of relief when he saw Felix walk through unharmed. "You're alive. I thought the fairy harmed you, because you were in there for so long," Randolph said as he closed and locked the cell door.

Felix explained, "It just took a long time for her to let me near her."

"It didn't cast any spells?" Randolph questioned.

"No, she was too busy crying from whatever Lord William did to her," Felix lied, "I wonder what Lord William did to cause her such pain."

"I don't know. He has many methods of torturing," Randolph replied, "But maybe he used dark magic against the fairy. Some say he has such powers."

"Do you believe those people?" Felix asked.

"Lord William is a very evil man. It's possible that someone as evil as him could have such dark powers," Randolph said.

Felix pushed the cart against the dungeon wall and cursed, "Shit!"

"What's wrong?" Randolph asked.

"I have to leave the cart here so no one suspects that I fed her sooner than I was supposed to," Felix explained, "But, the meant and canteens aren't on the cart and if someone comes down and see the empty cart, they'll know I fed the fairy. I'll also have to come back down here in an hour to bring the cart back up to the kitchen to make it look like I waited to feed her and brought the cart back up after the supposed feeding."

"Luckily, I will be guarding the cell for a few more hours," Randolph added, "Lord William was very angry. He probably won't try to train the fairy for the rest of the day. He might not come down here and no one else might see the empty cart."

"I hope you're right," Felix replied.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------

Felix did the tasks he needed to do within the hour he gained by feeding the fairy earlier than he should have. Luckily, Lord William never came out of his room and Felix didn't run into anyone who knew he was supposed to be in the dungeon. When Felix was done with the tasks, he walked back down to the dungeons and Randolph was still guarding the entrance to the fairy's cell.

"Lord William didn't come down," Randolph informed Felix.

"I know, he's been in his room the entire time," Felix replied.

"Maybe the fairy made him sick somehow," Randolph suggested.

"Sounds possible," Felix said as he walked to the cart and began to push it to the cell.

"What are you doing?" Randolph questioned.

"I'm going in the cell," Felix answered.

"Why?" Randolph questioned.

"It make it convincing if anyone comes down here," Felix explained, "Do you remember about how long I was in there?"

"Yes," Randolph answered.

"Try counting to that time again and then knock on the door three times. I'll come out then," Felix told Randolph.

"Alright, but stay as far away from that beast as possible," Randolph warned before letting Felix in the cell with the fairy.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------

Fakira had stopped pretending to cry long ago. All she could find herself thinking about was how different the human feeder, Felix, had acted towards her. "That human was very strange," Fakira thought to herself, "Not only could he use magic, but he seemed to be kind to me. He had approached me when I cried not to harm me more, but to comfort me. Even after I shrunk him, he still seemed to be genuinely kind, as if he's trying to be friends and..."

"Stop thinking about this, Fakira," Fakira ordered to herself, "It doesn't matter that this human seems kind. It's still a human. It's a different species and a prey species to predators like me. It can't possibly be my friend. It's too small to be anything other than food."

"He's not that small when I'm trapped in here," Fakira thought.

"But it will be small when I grow to my normal size," Farkira argued with herself, "I'll be eighty feet tall once my wings grow back. At that point, the human will be nothing but food. I shouldn't have troubles eating it when it's time, but just in case, I mustn't let myself get to close to him."

"Wait!" Fakira realized, "There might be a different reason it's acting kindly to me. Either it's stupid and thinks it can win me over so that I don't eat him, or it's pretending to be kind to me to show him how to use magic. If the second is the truth, it might just escape with the magic I teach it and leave me behind. I have to do something to make sure it doesn't leave me behind, but what?"

Choice 1: Fakira decided to only teach Felix a certain amount of magic so that he would still need her for the escape.

Choice 2: Fakira pretends to be friends with Felix so that he thinks she wouldn't harm him if he helped her escape.
14512112121.title: Using Each Other

choices: Felix suggests the shrinking as punishment
Felix decides to show he was sorry another way
145121121212.content:
Felix looked into the cell and saw Fakira sitting on the floor waiting.

"Hello," Fakira said, "You weren't caught were you?"

"No, no one but the guard and you know I disobeyed Lord William," Felix said, walking in. "Where are the canteens?" Fakira sighed and the canteens appeared before Fakira.

"Are you coming to get them?" Fakira asked. Felix nodded and walked towards Fakira, entering her range.

"Thank you for everything," Felix said earnestly as he checked the canteens. Three were empty out of the five and he'd have to fill those three with water when he came back down with dinner for the fairy.

"What are you talking about?" Fakira asked, knowing she couldn't act friendly so quickly if she wanted to earn his trust. It had to appear natural.

"Well, not eating me, hiding the canteens, teaching me magic," Felix replied, "Lord William is a monster I just want to get away from."

"Many humans are monsters," Fakira said darkly. "You, I'm not so sure about."

"Well thank you for that as well," Felix said, taking it as a compliment. "Do you mind if I ask you what your home was like?"

"Why? You'd be an insect there," Fakira said.

"Because all I've known is this castle. I've never been permitted past the outer wall and I'm rarely let outside, unless I had to clean stables," Felix replied, "Even if that place is a dangerous deadly place for someone like me, I would like to hear about it."

"Well, the trees there are very large, taller than my mother and she's 100 feet tall," Fakira said, "The trees are always green and lush where we live. Lots of fruits and small animals to eat." She gained a dreamy look on her face that Felix had never seen before. Then that expression turned sad as tears came to her eyes. She hadn't planned on crying but remembering her mother, her home and her friends were deeply saddening for her. And so, she cried real tears. Felix realized this.

"Oh, I'm sorry," Felix said, looking at Fakira, "I didn't mean to make you cry." Fakira growled at Felix.

"Well you wouldn't have to be sorry if stupid humans didn't capture me and cut my wings off," Fakira replied.

"I know," Felix replied, wondering what he could do to both gain her trust and show her he was sorry.

"I could always tell her to shrink me as punishment for my stupidity. She obviously is angry at me. Maybe if I let her play with me, she'll become nicer and teach me sooner?" Felix thought
145121121212.title: Truth and Deception

choices: Fakira pretends she's going to eat him.
Fakira does something else.
1451211212121.content:
"I'm sorry for being so stupid. I should have known the memory would make you sad," Felix apologized, "To show you how sorry I am, I'll let you punish me for my stupidity."

Fakira was shocked by what the human would 'let' her do. It was one thing for a human to be sorry to another species (Fakira still couldn't grasp the concept on what humans view as a person), but it was another thing for a human to suggest a punishment for himself as an apology to another species. Fakira couldn't hold in her shock as she asked, "What?"

"Well, Lord William punishes me for my stupidity and failures and it makes him feel better doing so. Maybe it will make you feel better punishing me," Felix explained.

"Seems logical, but what is his angle? What could he possibly gain by letting me punish him? There has to be an angle. No one could be that apologetic to another species," Fakira wondered, "Maybe he's willing to let me punish him because he knows I can't risk killing him. Maybe it's his way of showing me he's in control. he might realize I need him to escape!"

Fakira didn't realize it, but there were actually two reasons Felix was willing to be punished. One was that Felix was just too used to being punished after his failures and stupidity. Felix had been punished by Lord William for every failure and Felix felt he should be punished after every failure. It wasn't that he liked being punished, but he just saw it as a fact of life since it happened every time. He thought it was normal.

The second reason was that he felt that the fairy might actually feel better. Felix wanted the fairy to feel better so that she might actually become nicer and possibly become a friend. By putting his life in her hands, quite literally, maybe she would see how sincere he was at trying to be her friend.

But, Felix had no idea what he was up against. He was up against everything the fairy was brought up to be. The way the fairy saw humans was considered a way of life and a fact to all the Felaryan fairies. All Felaryan top predators defined a person as something of their species or something their size. It didn't matter to a Felaryan top predator if something had intelligence and had feelings and emotions. They had to be the same size or the same species, preferably both since Felaryan Elves, which are close to 100 feet as well, have no problem eating regular elves. In fact, elves are even tastier that humans and humans were slightly tastier than nekos. Since Felix wasn't the same species and wasn't the same size as Fakira, (Fakira believed herself to be eighty feet tall. In actuality, she was three inches, but she and her clan were giant all the time and she was usually eighty feet tall. So, Fakira, even if she's human sized now, still saw Felix as a small creature.) Fakira didn't see Felix as a person and only saw him as a weak little prey that deserved to be in her stomach once she had her wings back. Unfortunately, Felix might not have a chance of breaking through to Fakira.

"What kind of punishment do you have in mind?" Fakira questioned while showing off her sharp teeth in a wicked grin. "This human will know his place once I punish him. After that I can gradually pretending to be kinder to him. But for now, I will show him that I'm not afraid of getting rid of him, and show him I'm only using him because I feel like it, not because he;s my only hope," Fakira thought to herself.

"Well, maybe you can shrink me again," Felix suggested meekly.

"Shrink you?" Fakira replied, her tone in a very disturbing tease, "You want me to shrink you and do what?"

"Whatever you want," Felix informed her.

"You do realize you humans are supposed to be the second tastiest creatures that can be eaten. It might be hard to resist myself from eating you upon having a second chance," Fakira said.

"I don't care too much," Felix replied, "If you deem death as a fair punishment, then I will respect your decision and I won't resist."

"So," Felix continued once he tensed up and closed his eyes, "Go a head and shrink me now and do what you wish."

"As much as I'd like to start right away with your punishment," Fakira told Felix, "I still don't have the energy to shrink you. However, I'll be able to shrink you in a few hours when you come back down to feed me dinner. When you come to feed me, I'll shrink you then and do whatever I want with your shrunken body."

"What are you planning to do with me?" Felix questioned.

"That's for me to know and you to find out," Fakira teased, "But I can tell you that it will be fun."

Felix gulped when he heard her say it would be fun. He knew all too well her fun would most likely be his misery. Felix suddenly heard three knocks on the cell door and he told the fairy, "I have to go now, but I'll be back for your dinner."

"And I'll be waiting here to punish you," Fakira added with a smile.

Felix left the cell with the cart and Randolph shut the door behind Felix immediately after Felix was out of the cell. "you'll have to be careful when feeding the fairy tonight," Randolph warned, "I'll be replaced soon and the one replacing me will be one of the mindless guards that can't think for themselves. They only follow the orders of Lord William and will only help you if they're ordered to do so by Lord William."

"I understand, I'll be careful," Felix replied. Inwardly, Felix was slightly happy. he could spend more time in the cell with the fairy without the guard suspecting something. Felix might even be able to start learning magic after the punishment. He might even be able to spend the night in the cell without the guard suspecting something!

Felix met Ted again during tasks and during dinner, but they decided it wasn't the best time to talk about the plan or the fairy. They decided it was too dangerous to talk during those times and that it would be better to talk that night when all the other slaves were asleep.

After dinner and after his remaining tasks, Felix went back to the kitchen. he filled the three canteens and obtained a meat package and placed them on the cart before pushing it to the dungeons. Randolph had been right. The guard by the sell was one of the "loyals". The loyals didn't have free will of their own and did only what Lord William told them to do. Lord William had only told the guard to keep everyone out except of his Lordship and the slave feeding the creature. Lord William didn't tell the guard how long Felix should be and Felix could be in there as long as he wanted without the guard suspecting. This also meant that if Felix were to be in trouble, the guard wouldn't help him.

The guard opened the door for Felix and Felix pushed the cart through the doorway. The fairy was waiting in the same spot as usual, and Felix pushed the cart in arms length of the fairy. Once he did this, Felix felt a familiar shrinking feeling and he was once again three inches tall. Felix looked up at the fairy that appeared to be massive to him when she was still only sitting on her ankles! The fairy smiled once more as she reached down to him. Felix didn't resist and "let" the fingers wrap around his punny body and lift him up to her enormous face. The fairy's face was cute, beautiful, and terrifying at the same time.

"Soooo, what should I do with you, little human?" Fakira questioned while elongating her words.

14512112121211.content:
Fakira's stomach growled and she stared down at Felix while licking her lips slowly. Felix looked deep in her eyes and knew what she was planning. She was hungry and he was now snack sized to her. She was going to eat him as his punishment. Human flesh was now on the menu!

"You're not going to eat me, are you?" Felix questioned, even though there was no doubt in his mind she would.

"Well, I am hungry and human flesh is a delicacy," Fakira informed Felix, "Fairies should never pass up eating a human when they have the chance."

"We had a deal though," Felix argued.

"You gave me the choice to do whatever punishment I see fit," Fakira replied.

Felix sighed, "If you deem death is the best punishment, then so be it. I won't resist you."

"You're smart, for a little snack," Fakira said as she tilted her clutched hand so that Felix would be facing her mouth head first. She then proceeded to open her mouth.

Felix looked forward and saw the wet prison that awaited him. The entrance had rows of sharp white teeth above and blow and her lips were parted so well that Felix could even see the gums holding the teeth in her jaws. The walls of the the moist prison were the pink insides of her cheeks and the thick, moist, pink tongue awaiting to taste his delicious flesh. Beyond that was the back of her throat where the uvula dangled over a dark abyss Felix felt he would soon go down.

As Felix watched in horror, Fakira pulled him in closer. Once Felix's shoulders were in the mouth and between her lips, the fairy closed her mouth and engulfed him with her lips. The fairy then slurped him till his whole body was lying on top of her tongue and he was encased in complete darkness!

Felix's mind panicked and he quickly rose to his hands and knees which helped him back up from the throat. Felix turned his body and faced the only safe way out of the mouth. He could see the outlining of the white teeth, but that was it! He thought about running to the teeth to pound on them and plead. However, Felix was used to getting punished for his mistakes and this was no different. It was just a punishment that he would have to accept. he still didn't want to die and didn't like it one bit, but he let the fairy choose the punishment and he respected her decision. Felix sighed deeply and sat on his ankles like the fairy had done. He lifted his slobber covered hands from the soft moist tongue that acted as the floor beneath him and he placed them on his laps. Felix closed his eyes and waited for the end to come.

Suddenly, Felix felt the tongue rise beneath him and he lost his balance. Felix fell face first on the tongue and was forced upwards. Soon, Felix as sandwiched between the soft and saliva filled tongue and the hard roof of the fairy's mouth. The thick tongue pressed Felix against the roof firmly as it rubbed against his front. The soft surface of the tongue was slightly rough due to the taste buds rubbing against him. (Now that he was three inches tall, her taste buds were larger too him and he could feel their roughness.) The rough scraping didn't last long didn't last too long, because the saliva from the fairy's glands continued to squirt in her mouth. Soon the saliva acted like a lubricant between Felix and the tongue.

"She likes my taste," Felix realized when the constant saliva began to hit him, "She likes my taste and she's not going to let me out. She's going to eat me and there's nothing I can do about it."

Felix began to cry as he waited for his doom.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------

Fakira waited a while before she started tasting him. She had been told by her mother that it was just as fun tormenting the humans as their taste. She had been told that humans would panic, plead, and try to fight her once in her mouth. Fakira's mother would find it funny and pathetic that her prey would do anything and everything to escape an inevitable doom. "The humans will try anything to escape because they know what awaits them," Fakira remembered her mother saying to her one day, "Once they realize they aren't even a match for your tongue, they'll try to plead for you to show them mercy. However, you won't give it. It is just the way life is. Predator and prey. A predator needs to eat and a prey is to be eaten."

Fakira felt the human get on his hands and knees and she thought he would soon start fighting her and trying to open her mouth. However, the human didn't nothing of the sort. Instead, it just sat there on her tongue and waited. "What's wrong with it?" Fakira wondered, "Why doesn't it fight like mother said it would? Maybe I have to give him a reason to fight."

Fakira moved her tongue and forced him to the roof of her mouth while finally tasting human flesh for the first time. The taste overtook her and she couldn't think of anything other than the taste. "Mother is right!" Fakira thought, "Human flesh is like ecstasy! I can only imagine what an elf taste like. Ooooh, this human is sooooo good! It's so hard to resist eating him."

However, Fakira knew she needed the human alive, at least long enough to free her. She had to stop her instincts and began thinking about something else other than the human's taste, even though it was extremely hard to do so. "How come he's not resisting? I can taste tears and he mustn't want to be eaten. Yet, he doesn't fight me like the humans mother talks about. Does he know I'm bluffing? What could he gain from not fighting me?" Fakira just couldn't figure it out.

Fakira opened her mouth and stuck out her tongue with Felix lying flat against it. She then tilted her tongue to her open hand and Felix rolled onto her palm. Felix rose to his hands and knees, drenched in saliva. "Now you know whose in control human," Fakira's voice boomed over Felix's small body, "I have total power over you and I could have easily swallowed you. I would have loved having a little human trapped in my stomach. Mother says that a little human pounding at the lining of your stomach feels just as good as all the other experiences of eating a human. Lucky of you, stupidity isn't a high enough crime to die for and I didn't eat you."

Felix feel back on his butt and looked up at the fairy, still shaking with fear. "My saliva has a substance in it that keeps you whatever size you are now. So, you will be three inches until you are completely dried off," Fakira informed the human in her palm, "Which means we might be able to do something else that's fun."

Choice 1: Fakira decides to play with Felix some more while he's still little. She begins playing with him as if he was a little doll.

Choice 2: Fakira can't think of anything at the moment and just puts Felix on her lap while she eats dinner.

"What did you have in mind?" Felix asked, looking up at her. Fakira bit her lip, unsure how to respond. His tone was filled with acceptance of the facts.

"Why does this human not fight back?" she wondered, "How can he accept such punishments with no open complaint? I guess if I don't get out of here, this might be my fate." Fakira growled at that thought and it was followed by another growl from her body. Fakira looked to her stomach and rose with Felix in her hand. She walked over to the cart happy she shrunk him after it was in her range.

A look of disappointment etched on her face.

Felix, for his part, was in awe at watching how Fakira was very cute. While he knew she could kill him with little remorse right now, he had never seen a girl who was even close to his age before. Mostly he saw the tramps who lived in the castle pleasuring the loyal guards and sometimes Lord William.

It took Fakira a small amount of time to finish her meat before she looked down at Felix. As she looked at the door, she recalled a strange event earlier.

"Human, why did that one guard let you out?" Fakira asked, as she licked her hands clean.

"Randolph isn't like many of the guards here. He doesn't follow Lord William's orders absolutely," Felix said, "That's how I was able to feed you before Lord William said for me to." Fakira nodded.

Fakira glared down at the tiny human.

1451211212121121.content:
"I don't know anymore," Felix muttered as he looked downwards in a saddened state.

"How can you not know if you hate such a man?" Fakira questioned.

"I used to know the answer to that question. When I was first put into slavery, I knew I hated him," Felix told the fairy without looking at her and continuing to look down at her green dress, "I was five years old when I was put into slavery. I don't remember my parents or how I got here. I just remember being here and being forced to do things I didn't want to do. If I resisted, I was punished and Lord William or the guards would whip me and cause much pain. I remember crying myself to sleep many nights."

"I had no friends then, no one to care about me. I've been a slave for five years now," Felix continued, "And now I don't know what I should feel like anymore. Most of my emotions had been torn out of me, and I don't even mind the tasks and the constant beatings anymore. I've just learned to accept being a slave, as bad as that may seem. He's got me trained so well, I even fear escaping without someone who knows what it's like outside the walls.. I've said before to myself that it's better living as a slave than dying out there for no other reason than being free."

Felix sighed, "That's why I don't know if I hate Lord William since he's gotten me used to slavery and I've learned to accept it."

Fakira hesitated for the longest time as she stared down at the sad looking human on her lap. In that long hesitation, Fakira forgot about him being another species and a small speck. She now heard a brief story of his past and it saddened her, because it could be her if she lived as Lord William's pet for as long as the human. Fakira shivered at the thought of growing to her normal size and still obeying Lord William without hesitation. She imagined herself graveling at his feet so that he wouldn't punish her.

"My fate could be the same as this humans," Fakira thought sadly. because of this thought, she felt a slight connection with the human that she never thought possible. It was this connection that made her forget he was a small prey creature only meant for a snack. During that long hesitation, she forgot her mother's teachings. She actually felt sorry for the human on her lap.

"The poor thing," Fakira thought as she actually stroked his back with a finger, "He's had such a terrible life and its turned him into a shell of a person."

"That's why I tried to comfort you when you were tortured by Lord William," Felix said while finally looked up at the fairy's face, "You reminded me of myself during my first months and I didn't want you to end up like me. I wanted to help you. To be your friend if you wanted one." As Felix looked up at the fairy's face, he knew that he was getting to her somehow. He knew that if he could genuinely make her a friend, he wouldn't have to leave her when he and Ted escaped.

Suddenly, Fakira snapped back out of her trance and glared at the human before saying, "I'm not like you. I'm not a little worthless prey. I'm a predator and I don't need your help. What could you possibly help me with besides being my meal?" Fakira questioned before looking away from the human.

"I can't let him get to me. He's prey and can do nothing for me other than being prey. A small creature like him can't be a friend. it just can't. I can't allow myself to gain feeling for this pathetic creature, because it might be harder for me to eat him after my wings grow back and I've escaped," Fakira thought to herself.

"But I am helping you escape this place, am I not?" Felix questioned, "Isn't that something other than feeding you?"

Fakira sighed, "I suppose we do have a deal that I will teach you magic and you'll help me escape. However, this is not because I need you. I could find a way to escape without you. I just choose to have you help."

While the fairy was still looking away, Felix looked at himself and he was still very much drenched in the saliva. He was going to stay three inches for a long time. "At least I started getting to her," Felix thought, "She had looked at me with pity in her eyes for a long moment and actually rubbed my back while I told my story. It's a good start to developing friendship."

"So," Felix broke the silence, "What do you want to do with me now?"

She would become powerful, and Felix knew he couldn't trust her yet. So here that fairies here were about three inches tall, (the normal size for a Felaryan fairy that didn't use growing magic, but Fakira didn't know that because her and her clan make themselves giant. She thinks her normal size is a giant.) "These fairies must be inferior fairies or a different species of fairy to be so small. I can see a Felaryan fairy coming here. However, a Felaryan fairy getting to together with a human and feeling for it is just absurd. Humans aren't people. They're just prey because they're so small."

Felix knew it wasn't impossible for a fairy to feel for a human. The fairy had felt pity for him and even tried to comfort him not to long ago. However, Felix knew it wasn't best to remind the fairy of this and he just pretended to agree."So, you believe it is impossible for me to have fairy blood," Felix stated.

"Yes, and you might not have even gained your magic from ancestors getting together with magical creatures. There are many different ways for humans to gain magic," Fakira replied, "The only way to tell if you have a magical creature's blood in you is that if you're able to do a spell only they can do."

"So, healing isn't a specific spell only a specific species can do?" Felix asked.

"Healing powers can be used by many and almost every magical creature," Fakira informed Felix, "So, even you could do it human. As long as you practice enough."

"Is it better for me to do magic in my normal size?" Felix asked.

Fakira could feel the magic Felix was emitting and she thought it was going to work. She thought that she would finally have her wings healed and the she would be able to be rid of the terrible place and lord. However, almost as soon as she felt the magic, it abruptly ended and Fakira could feel nothing. "What's wrong now?" Fakira growled as she turned around to see what the human slave was doing.

Fakira soon saw that the human was on his knees with he his looking to the ground. The human looked exasperated and he was breathing heavily. Fakira didn't understand what the problem was, at first, but then she soon realized what was wrong. "The spell is too much for him. He may be old enough to do the spell, but he hasn't used magic till now. There is years of magic built in him and he should be able to do simi-powerful magic, but since he hasn't used that magic his whole life, he needs to learn to control and tame that magic first. This means, I'll have to teach him from scratch and teach him more minor spells first," Fakira came to the conclusion, "I hope he's a fast learner like I was, but then again, it's not natural for humans to do magic. He'll probably be a slow learner."

Fakira growled in anger upon letting that last thought slip into her mind. She was going to be stuck in the cell much longer than she had planed. It took about two weeks in Felarya to grow wings back to normal, but since she was in a less magical place, there is still magic but not as much as Felarya, it will take about four weeks for her wings to reform!

"W...What... was that?" Felix gasped as he tried to recover from such a weakened state.

"That was the magic channeling into your life force. Some beings aren't as luck to have magical wings," Fakira explained, "Fairies' wings extract and store magic in the air. Grant it, we can only store a certain amount of magic at a time. Humans don't have wings and have to channel into their physical strength and life force. If you use too much magic, you could end up killing yourself. I should have realized healing my wings would be too much for you, human slave."

"Why is... it so hard?" Felix asked. He wanted to know how to figure out his limits and what kind of spells he could use.

"Growing living things out of thin air takes much magic power and that include growing a part of a living creature. You are creating a living material by doing so, something organic. Trying to grow my wings is the same thing, but it is even harder, because it is my source of magic," Fakira informed the human, "Such a healing power is too complicated for you. But, there are other healing spells you could possibly do, such as healing cuts, bruises, and some sicknesses."

Fakira sighed, "It looks like healing my wings, if possible for you human, will take many weeks to accomplish maybe many months. We'll have to think of another way out of here. And don't think about shrinking, that is an even more complicated spell to master, and that will only work if you have Felaryan fairy blood in your veins."

"So, what are we going to do?" Felix asked.

"I will have to start from scratch to teach you magic," Fakira informed him, "I will have to start you with simple spells like levitation and simple healing spells. I will have to see if you have enough concentration to use magic without saying the words."

"You can use spells without using the words?" Felix asked.

"I can shrink you without saying anything, can't I?" Fakira replied, "The words are only for those who don't have the concentration to direct a spell in a certain direction. The saying of spells just makes sure the intended outcome occurs. Otherwise, something completely different could happen if one doesn't have the right concentration."

"Can we start now?" Felix asked.

"The healing spell has weakened you. You have to sleep and rest before your strength and life force replenishes," Fakira stated. There was an indifference in her voice that sounded like she didn't care whether Felix died or not. However, she didn't want him to die, because he was her way of escaping despite being a small snack.

"Then I will leave and you can teach me more in the afternoon," Felix replied. Felix handed her the three full canteens. Fakira set two empty ones near Felix and Felix took them and placed them on the cart to leave, but then he stopped and looked at the chains. "Is there a way to break the chains?" Felix questioned.

"There is a cutting spell," Fakira stated, "It's one of the simple spells, but it takes more energy depending on what is cut."

"Will I be able to cut the chains?" Felix questioned.

"It might take some time for you to train with that spell enough to be able to do that," Fakira answered, "But the chains are rusty and the spell is easy to master. You might be able to break the chains in a matter of a week or two."

"You can't do it?" Felix asked.

"I can't do certain spells with my wings gone," Fakira stated before looking away as if embarrassed by that fact.

Felix didn't say anything more and pushed the cart to the door. The guard let him out and Felix pushed the cart back to the kitchen before heading to bed.
14512112121211212211.title: Nothing happened at all

choices: To give just some water and go on teaching the cutting spell
To teach him a flame spell and let him have some meat and water
145121121212112122112.content:
Felix walked into the slave sleeping quarters and saw the guards posted around the room. He sighed when he saw the guards near where he and Ted sleep were two loyalists who were extremely strict on enforcing Lord William's commands. He recalled watching them stab another slaves tongue for whispering during this time. Not wanting to risk either of them getting into trouble, Felix said nothing to his friend and laid down and slept.

------------------------------------------------

The next morning Felix was awoken by a sharp kick from one of the guards.

"Come on slave. You just got drafted for stable duty," the guard grumbled. Felix shook his head and saw the sun wasn't even up yet. But Felix knew going back to sleep would mean certain death, so with heavy eyes, he rose and went to the foul smelling stable.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Hours passed as he and only a handful of others had to clean the large stables. Breakfast and lunch came and went and Felix was denied both.

So now, weary from the hard work and no food, Felix walked to the kitchen to collect the food for the fairy. The chef glared at him and his foul stench but said noting as he filled the canteens and collected the meat. He pushed the cart out of the kitchen and down to the prison where another loyalist was guarding the door. Felix walked past him and entered.

----------------------------------------------------------

Fakira had had a bad morning. The men with whips came back and struck her, aiming mainly for her back where her wings were trying to regrow. The pain was great from them hitting such sensitive areas and she knew it would be even longer to heal her wings now. When she heard the door open, she glared and saw her human feeder. Once the door was closed, she spoke up.

"You stink," she said coldly.

"I had to clean out the stables," Felix replied.

"Stables?" Fakira asked.

"They are a place humans keep animals we ride on since we can't fly," Felix replied. Fakira nodded, recalling when she was captured Lord William's men were on strange animals. She guessed it was for them.

"Well you still stink," Fakira said as Felix handed her the food. She heard a strange noice come from the slave's gut.

"Sorry. I haven't eaten yet today. They didn't give me a chance to eat," Felix said.

"I also go the morning without food," Fakira replied coldly, but then saw how tired Felix was. She knew from experience trying to do magic when one is tired could cause problems, especially when one is inexperienced. Being hungry at the same time was just asking for trouble.

"What should I do? I could show him how to cook some meat so he can eat that. Or I could show him the cutting spell regardless of his state," Fakira thought. She looked closely at the weary eyed slave Compassion wasn't something she wanted to show him but she knew she'd need to if she wanted out of there. In the end, she opted to . . .
145121121212112122112.title: Felix's Morning

choices: Later on, Felix proves to be a fast learner when it came to magic.
Training for magic proves difficult for Felix
1451211212121121221122.content:
As much as Fakira hated to admit it, she needed the human slave in order to escape. She couldn't use any powerful magic, other than her shrinking powers, because he wings had been torn off. Even if she could use the cutting spell, it wasn't powerful enough to break the chains thanks to her wingless back. She needed the little snack and if that meant sharing her food with him at that moment, then so be it.

"It's not a sign of compassion for the little prey," Fakira told herself, "This action is only to save myself and escape faster. Without energy or concentration for his magic, he could end up killing himself. Then I wouldn't be able to escape. I'm not sharing my food because I want to and have feeling for the pathetic creature, it's so I can get out of this hellhole faster."

Fakira sighed, "You're too tired to do magic, human. You don't have the right energy at the moment and could kill yourself if we train hard enough."

"I can't train too much now. It's still the afternoon and I still have more work to do," Felix informed the fairy.

"Even so, it still takes a lot of energy for those who aren't as experienced with magic," Fakira stated.

"So, do we have to wait till the evening to..." Felix began to question.

"We will still start this afternoon," Fakira interrupted, "I can probably escape this place myself, given enough time, but I don't wish to wait that long. With you training magic, I can escape sooner and the sooner you start training the sooner we escape."

"Then what do we do if I'm too tired?" Felix questioned.

"I will have to share my food with you," Fakira sighed with slight disgust, "But realize this, human. It is not because I want to or feel pity for you. It is because I wish to escape this place as soon as possible and if that means sharing my food with you this afternoon then I will have to. Understand?"

"Yes," Felix answered not wanting to anger the fairy any more than she was already.

Fakira placed the meat in the floor and then looked up at Felix. "I thought of something. There is a way that both of us will have our fill," Fakira informed him.

"How?" Felix questioned. He knew the fairy could eat the enter slice of meat.

"I can shrink you and the us my saliva to keep you shrunken so that you can finish off a small piece that would seem big enough for a meal to you," Fakira explained.

Felix could tell that the fairy was about to shrink him right then and there, but Felix yelled, "Wait!"

"What is it? Don't you like my solution?" Fakira asked.

"It's not that, because it seems logical, but what about cooking the meat. Humans can't eat raw meat," Felix quickly explained.

"Hmmmm..." Fakira wondered out loud, "Then I shall teach you how to control fire and you can cook the whole slab of meat. I haven't had cooked meat in a long time."

"Will that be too difficult for me?" Felix asked.

"Not if you use already existing fire," Fakira replied while looking at a lit torch, "We shouldn't test how well you concentration is. yet. So, you will use the words for now. I will teach a spell that gives you the will to move fire."

"Like levitation?" Felix asked.

"Precisely. Now, you must concentrate on your powers again, and force it to your hands again. Then aim your hands at the fire on the nearest torch and say Letavzoo Blazlium" Fekira informed Felix.

Felix did as the fairy told him and once more searched inside himself to bring the magic to his hands. He lifted his hands and aimed them at the nearest torch and he said, "Letavzoo Blazium."

He felt magic leave his hand but nothing seemed to happen. Felix was about to question why it wasn't working, but when he moved his hand, the fire rose off of the torch and was in the air. "Now, move your hand and bring it to the meat to cook it," Fakira ordered.

Felix moved his hands slowly, and the fire copied the movements till it was on the meat. Felix kept the meat on there until it was cooked enough. Felix lifted the fire off the meat and asked Fakira what he had to do. This was a spell that had no specific end and wouldn't stop unless Felix told it to stop. "Let go of the magic and the flame will disappear," Fakira told him.

It took a while to figure out how to do it at first, but Felix eventually let go, and the flame disappeared. Felix could smell the delicious cooked meat. It was better than anything he had ever gotten as a slave and his mouth watered for the aroma. Felix closed his eyes to smell the meat better and soon the smell became much stronger. When Felix opened his eyes, he was three inches tall and the large meat was right before him.

The fairy grabbed him before he even got a chance to look up at her and she opened her hand so Felix was siting on her palm. Everything was going fast and the fairy wasn't doing it as slowly as she did when she tormented him the other two times. Instead, the fairy was more along the lines of, let's get this over and done with. As soon as Felix had time to look up at the face, his vision was blocked by a massive pink tongue that licked him and pushed him to the soft skin of the fairy's palm. The fairy licked him front and back till she thought it was enough and then lowered her hand to the floor. She slanted her hand so that he rolled off it onto the rocky ground.

"You smell bad, but you still taste good, human. I want might to do this everyday," the fairy teased.

Fakira pointed at the slab of meat and then moved the finger every so slightly. She had used her concentration to preform the cutting spell and a very small piece slid off. Felix grabbed it and it seemed as big as the slab of meat was when he was normal sized. Yet the piece he had was probably not as big as the fairy's pupil.

"Eat and regain your energy," Fakira ordered, "Then I shall dry you off and well do a few spell before you have to leave."

choices: Randolph, who saw Felix cutting the bone.
The cook who yells at Felix for touching the food
14512112121211212211221.content:
Felix ate his meat and watched in awe as Fakira's teeth ripped through the meat so easily.

"Cooked food isn't bad," Fakira muttered, "Some flavors are lost. Others are more noticeable. I wonder how roasted human is?" However, Fakira really did want to try roasted human. it was supposedly to fun to swallow humans whole and let them squirm in ones stomach.

Felix noted what the fairy said, but he ignored it and just laid back against Fakira's lap. The softness of her dress and skin beneath it were amazingly comfortable, and, while it was only for a short few minutes, the rest was just what Felix needed.

------------------------------------------------

Felix was woken by some rubbing over him he quickly realized it was the fairy's cloth. Soon she was done and placed him off her and onto the floor.

"Feeling better human?" Fakira asked. Felix smiled.

"Yes, thank you," Felix said, "That rest was really nice."

"I'm not a bed," she growled. Felix put his hands up defensively.

"I didn't mean it like that. I just meant being able to rest at all was nice," Felix said. Fakira's glare didn't end but she didn't say any more as Felix shot upright. He now looked down at Fakira, as she was still sitting on the floor.

"Fine. Now the cutting spell. Since you have rest and food, let's try without words," Fakira said, "This requires one hand. You move your whole hand for a large cut and a finger for one like a knife." Her eyes looked at the chains. "It would be best to use your whole hand in this case. When you focus the energy into your hand, think of the air as your knife and make it cut the metal as you move your hand."

Felix nodded and grabbed part of the rusty chain. He focused his magic into his right hand and moved his hand He saw the metal break before him. One side of the link had a clean, barely noticable cut in it. He was about to cut the next link, when he paused..

"What's the matter? Tired? Why haven't you cut it yet?" Fakira said coldly.

"If I cut it, it would be easy to see. Meaning they might put better chains on you and make it harder to cut later. Also, they might beat you even harder for trying to escape," Felix said

"So you don't plan on doing anything?" Fakira asked.

"No, I was thinking tonight we should plan a bit more on the escape, because just getting you out of the cell doesn't mean we're free," Felix said. Fakira glared at Felix.

"So you expect me to deal with at least another day's torture?" Fakira asked darkly.

"Would you rather suffer one more day or be recaptured and tortured for who knows how long?" Felix replied.

"Fine," Fakira said, not looking at Felix now, "Just make sure we escape in a few days or I will eat you." Felix nodded and went to the door. The guard let Felix out and Felix walked back to the kitchen. The cook was gone and Felix picked up one of the scrap bones. He put his hand to it and practiced his cutting magic. As the bone split and part of it fell to the ground, Felix heard the door open behind him. When he looked he saw...

choices: "Tonight. We'll escape tonight."
"The next time you have to guard the fairy." (A week from now.)
145121121212112122112211.content:
Felix quickly turned ans saw that he hadn't heard the door opening. He had heard the door close and the person who walked into the kitchen had seen the entire thing. He had seen Felix cut the bone with nothing but air. The man was a guard, but luckily, it was Randolph and not of the loyals. Randolph was standing in front of the shut door with has eyes wide and his mouth agape in pure shock and disbelief.

Randolph had come in the kitchen because he just wanted some water from the well. Since Felix was at the other end of the room in view of the doorway, Randolph had seen Felix right away and he was going to say hello. However, he eyes witnessed Felix cutting a bone in half without any knives. Felix had nothing but air and he had to have used magic. Randolph stayed silent for the longest time while Felix stared back at him.

After close to a minute past, Felix broke the silence by saying, "Randolph... I..."

However, Randolph began speaking at the same time and interrupted what Felix was about to say by saying, "Felix... Y-you..." However, Randolph was too shocked to be able to form his sentence properly. He had never seen magic, let alone a slave of Lord William do magic.

"Yes, I can use magic," Felix sighed. He knew it was best to not lie to Randolph now. Randolph had seen the whole thing and Felix couldn't pretend that Randolph had seen things. Besides, Randolph wasn't like most guards. Randolph was someone that looked out for Felix and Ted and Randolph was a kind person who hated Lord William and only followed his orders because he was lord at the moment. Felix felt he could trust Randolph.

"So, it's true. He can use magic ans I wasn't seeing things. But if he can use magic, doesn't that mean he could always use magic? I thought you had to be born with magic in your blood to be able to use it, but then again, I'm not an expert on the matter. Still, if that's true, Felix would have been able to use magic this whole time. Yet, he's still here and still a slave to Lord William. What's stopped him from escaping all this time?" Randolph wondered.

While Randolph thought to himself, Felix had become nervous about Randolph's intentions. Felix wanted to trust Randolph, but it was scaring Felix that Randolph was staying silent for so long. "Is he planning on turning me in?" Felix questioned, "No, he can't be. He's my friend. He's a good guard, but... what if it was all an act. What if it was a cover to try and get close to slaves and find ones trying to escape? I can't be turned in. Not when I'm so close to escaping." Felix called upon his magic and brought it to his hands. He was ready, in case Randolph turned out to be an evil man in disguise.

"Please Randolph, don't rat me out," Felix pleaded so that he could get Randolph's answer.

"I'm not going to turn you in, Felix," Randolph finally stated. Felix was relieved to know that Randolph was still a good guy and Felix released the magic from his hands and let it go back inside him. "Felix, how do you know how to preform magic?" Randolph asked.

"Apparently, I've had it my entire life," Felix answered, "But I'm not sure how I gained magic in my blood. Ted has told me there are many ways to gain magic and one doesn't have to be born with magic to obtain it. I didn't even know I could use magic until I muttered of the fairy's curses and it worked."

"So, you didn't know you could use magic until the fairy arrived. That would explain why you're still here and why you still haven't escaped," Randolph said.

"Randolph, can I trust you?" Felix questioned.

"Let me guess, you're planning to escape soon," Randolph figured out.

"Can I trust you?" Felix repeated.

"You can trust me, Felix. You know how much I hate Lord William and distaste his slavery views," Randolph replied.

"Then I will tell you that Ted and I are planning to escape this place with the fairy but..." Felix started.

"With that monster!?" Randolph exclaimed, "Are you out of your mind?"

"I made a deal with her. She's teaching me magic so that Ted and I can escape with her. I must truly be her only hope at escaping and she won't harm me if I help her. It will be alright," Felix told Randolph.

"You sure you can trust that beast?" Randolph questioned, "It's a creature that enjoys eating humans. She'll probably grow herself back to her original height when she regrows her wings. Then you and Ted would be unable to stop her from eating you."

"It will be alright," Felix tried to assure Randolph, "She's not a mindless monster. She has human intelligence and reasoning. If I help her, she will be grateful and she wouldn't hurt us. Besides, She's shrunk me three times and she didn't eat me either of those times. I think we can trust her."

"I still don't think you should..." Randolph started to argue.

However, Felix soon interrupted, "I promised her I'd help her escape and that's what I'm going to do."

"Fine, but do you even know how you're going to escape?" Randolph questioned.

"I can use the cutting spell to free the fairy's chains, but beyond that, I have no plan," Felix admitted.

"So, you have no means of escaping the castle," Randolph said.

"No, do you?" Felix asked.

"I might have a way out, but it's risky and I'd have to escape with you. If Lord William were to find out I helped you escape, he'd kill me," Randolph informed Felix.

"Then you will escape with us, but how do we escape?" Felix asked once more.

Randolph looked at the well in the kitchen and began telling Felix a story, "One day, Lord William punished a slave by using the well. He put the slave in the basket and kept dunking the slave. Eventually, the slave was caught by the current of the waters below and he was taken away."

Randolph stared at the well for a long time as if in a trance. Felix was about to tell Randolph to go on, but Randolph soon continued, "Months later, one of Lord William's soldiers was sent to a village to collect taxes. In that village, he found the slave that had got carried by the current. The soldier brought the escaped slave back to the castle and the slave was forced to explain what had happened. Apparently, there is a maze of waterways beneath the castle and when he followed the current, he eventually came upon a river that surfaced to the land level. That is how we must escape, because it is still unknown to William where that river is and where it leads to. The only question now is when we should leave."

Felix answered...
