1451211212121121221122111.content:
"We need to escape tonight, there's no point waiting," Felix answered.

"I'm supposed to have the night off," Randolph informed Felix, "This could be the perfect time to take action. I won't be expected to be guarding anything tonight so I can help you and Ted escape."

"Then what is the plan?" Felix questioned, "Somehow, you're going to have to meet me and the fairy at the cell with Ted, but how will you do that?"

"I will just go to the slave quarters and tell one of the guards that Lord William needs a slave to do a night task," Randolph explained.

"Even though it's your night off and you don't have a paper to prove Lord William wants it done?" Felix asked.

"I'm sure the guards will believe Lord William would make me do things on my night off. He is the kind of person that would do that," Randolph replied, "Besides, a loyal guard only needs the word of Lord William to believe what is said."

"What about the guard that will be guarding the cell?" Felix asked.

"I'll figure something out. You just worry about freeing the fairy from the chains after you feed her and telling Ted about the plan if you can," Randolph replied.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------

"Tonight?" Ted asked as Felix and Ted scrubbed the hallways.

"Don't you want to get out of this place or not?" Felix whispered.

"Of course I do, more than anything in the world," Ted replied, "But isn't tonight too sudden. Do you even have a plan?"

"Randolph will help us by getting use to the well in the kitchen. But, Randolph will have to come with as well because if Lord William were to find out..." Felix started.

However, Ted was quick and understood what Felix was going to say. "He'd kill Randolph," Ted finished, "I understand, but how will he get us there?"

"Randolph will talk to the guards and tell them Lord William needs you to do some night chores. Then, you and Randolph will meet me at the fairy's cell and..." Felix began to explain.

"Why at the cell?" Ted questioned.

"We're escaping with her," Felix told him.

"Are you serious?!" Ted hissed, "Felaryans are monsters."

"It will be alright. i think I can befriend her," Felix tried to assure Ted.

"Befriend a Felaryan predator? That will be the day," Ted commented.

"Why can't I befriend her?" Felix questioned.

"Felaryan predators have different views than humans," Ted explained, "Humans see anything and anyone that has the same intelligence as a person. That's why dragons, griffins, and other intelligent creatures have rights in other humans cities, because humans see them as people. However, Felaryans are different. They only view creatures of the same species and the same size as people. Felaryan fairies don't even view regular fairies as people. What makes you think she'll view you as a person? You're only a snack to her or at the very most a pet. She sees humans and other 'small' creatures the same way humans view mindless animals."

"But I think I can get her to see us as people," Felix argued, "I've already made progress."

"What progress could you have possibly made in three days?" Ted asked.

"When she shrunk me one time, I told her a little about my past. She felt sorry for me and in that brief moment, she actually stroked my back with her finger to try and comfort me. It will be four weeks till she can grow her wings and grow back to her normal size and I think we can get her to see us as people," Felix assured his friend.

"You do realize she might have just seen you as a pet, right?" Ted pointed out, "or she was just pretending."

"There was no lies in her eyes," Felix informed Ted.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------

Felix did their tasks as usual and ate dinner without any complaints. It may not have looked like it, but they were excited and joyous to know their freedom would soon come. Felix couldn't stop thinking about what the outside would look like. Ted had told Felix about the outside world, but it was too hard of Felix to understand and grasp the beauty of the outside world and freedom. Felix truly had to fight himself to hold all the excitement in.

Felix pushed the cart past a loyal guard and into the fairy's cell. When he was in the cell, he could hold his joy no longer and gave a big smile. The first smile that had ever come across his face ever since he was a slave. "Why so happy, human?" Fakira questioned in slight jealousy. "How dare he be happy when my life is miserable." Fakira thought.

Felix handed the fairy the meat and canteens and she set the meat on her lap. "We're going to escape tonight," Felix answered.

Fakira's heart was overwhelmed with joy when she heard the human's words. She asked in disbelief, "Really?"

"Yes, it's all planed out," Felix told her.

Fakira's overwhelmed joy suddenly overcome Fakira's actions and thoughts. For another brief moment, she forgot that Felix was prey and she stood up, letting the meat slide down her lap. Fakira suddenly embraced Felix. Felix was shocked by the tight embrace of joy, and didn't return the hug, because he didn't want to harm her back.

The hug lasted for five seconds, but it proved to Felix that she was starting to either forget the Felaryan definition of a person, or she was just simply seeing Felix as a person or pet because he's different from the other humans she's met. Either way, Felix felt it was good for him, because there was a bigger chance that she wouldn't eat him when she grew her wings back.

Fakira snapped out of her enchantment and she pushed out of her hug. Fakira backed up and sat on her knees again and looked up at the human in confusion. "Did I... did I just... hug this human?" Fakira questioned herself, "But how? He's prey. Why did I do that? How can this be happening? I'm supposed to eat humans, not hug them. This is wrong."

Felix knelt down in front of the fairy and asked, "Is something wrong? You look as though you're..."

"Nothing... Nothing's wrong," Fakira quickly interrupted, "It's just that you've proved you can take orders well and it's quite possible that I can make you my pet. I can be very kind to my pets as long as they stay loyal to me."

Felix sighed, "Well, I guess being a pet isn't as bad as being swallowed whole."

"But you'll only be my pet if I decide it to be so. I haven't decided just yet," Fakira informed him, "So, when are we leaving?"

"When the others come to get us," Felix answered, "But they're not coming till most of the castle is asleep and I'll stay with you till they arrive. You have time to eat your meat."

Fakira soon remembered about the meat and picked it up once more to rip into it. "This had better be my last meal in this dreadful place, or you can kiss being my pet goodbye," Fakira growled upon taking a bite out of the meat, "Now, who are these others you speak of?"

"There will be two others. Another slave named Ted who is my friend and a guard named Randolph who wishes to help us escape," Felix informed her.

"Do you trust this guard?" Fakira questioned. She had never had any good experiences with the guards.

"With my life," Felix replied, "Is it alright they come along?"

"Sure, maybe they can prove to be loyal pets too," Fakira replied. However, Fakira was thinking something else in her mind, "The more humans, the bigger the meal is once my wings grow back."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------

Ted walked into the slave quarters when he was done with all his chores and he laid down on his "bed". As he pretended to fall asleep, Ted thought, "This is the last day I'll have to suffer this horrible place. Soon, I will be free again."

In about an hour when most slaves were asleep, Randolph entered the slave quarters and walked up to one of the guards. "Randolph, I thought you had the night off tonight?" the guard questioned.

"Yet, Lord William still puts me on duty," Randolph replied acting angry and annoyed.

"What's your business here?" the guard asked.

"I'm to bring a slave to do night duty. Lord William needs one of slave for night chores," Randolph lied.

"Why wasn't I informed?" the guard asked.

"Because Lord William just decided to use another slave," Randolph explained.

"To you have papers of proof of this?" the guard continued to interrogate.

"Lord William is very tired at the moment," Randolph told the guard, "But if you want me to go back up there and tell him you need proof..."

"No, just take a slave," the guard quickly interrupted, not wanting to anger Lord William.

Randolph looked around the room as if trying to decide which slave he would choose. Eventually, he walked up to Ted who was still pretending to be asleep. "Wake up, slave!" Randolph growled.

Ted opened his eyes and acted like he was tired and groggy. Randolph also kicked Ted to make it believable and forced Ted on his feet and nearly dragged him out of the room and to the dungeons.

When Ted and Randolph entered the dungeon hall where the fairy's cell was, the guard noticed them right away and growled, "State your business here!"

"I'm been ordered by Lord William to bring this slave to the cell," Randolph informed the guard, "He is supposed to help the other slave with whatever he needs."

"I wasn't informed about this. Do you have any proof?" the guard asked.

"Right here," Randolph said as he reached the back of his belt and wrapped his fingers around the hilt of a knife. Randolph pulled the knife out swiftly and sliced the guards neck. The guard coked up blood and fell to the ground. Randolph soon knelt down and continued to stab the guard until he moved no more.

When Ted and Randolph entered the cell, the fairy had finished her food and Felix had cut the rusted chains. Felix had started cutting when he heard the commotion outside the cell and he had to chop with his hand like a sword so that the blows of the spell were more powerful. When the two entered, Felix told the fairy who was who, but Fakira stated, "There's no need and no time for introductions. Let's just get out of here!"

Randolph led the way to the kitchen and helped the group avoid the guards since Randolph knew the rounds the guards made. The came to the kitchen and shut the door behind them. "Where is the way out?" Fakira asked.

"Down the well," Felix informed her as they all walked to the well.

"The well?" Fakira questioned with obvious fear in her voice as she looked down at the water. Fakira forced herself to look away from the well and yelled at Felix, "I thought you were going to get me out of here. This isn't a way out!"

"It is a way out," Felix argued, "All we have to do is..."

"I can't swim," Fakira replied, "I... This isn't a way out for me."

"It will be alright," Felix tried to assure her while placing a hand on her shoulder, "Ted and I will help you swim."

"Better start climbing down," Randolph suggested.

Ted was the first to start climbing down the rope followed by Fakira and then Felix. Before Felix could get his head below the well, the door slammed open and a shadow like ball, darker than the blackness around them, shot out and hit Randolph in the chest. Randolph twirled to the well and caught himself so that he was leaning on the edge. Felix saw that it was Lord William at the doorway who had preformed dark magic and was no aiming at Felix. Randolph still had a few seconds of life and with those seconds, Randolph cut the rope of the well which caused Ted, Fakira, and Felix down into the water.

14512112121211212211221111.content:
Felix and the others fell downward into the darkness, their screams echoing before they struck the cold waters. First to surface was Ted, followed by Fakira , who was partially wrapped up in the rope, flailing for her life. Felix came up afterwords as the three were swept down the rushing waters. They were lucky to be holding the rope as it made sure they would come out at the same place.

Fakira suddenly stopped flailing, Felix and Ted noticed. Then there was a sudden pull downward from something between them. Realizing it was Fakira sinking, Ted, reluctantly, and Felix, passionately, pulled the rope, bringing Fakira up and them closer to her. As they grew closer, the fairy reached out and grabbed the two humans, keeping them under her arms so she stayed afloat.

After some time, the darkness vanished and the three were in the middle of a huge forest, though not as huge as Fakira's home. They were still on the same plane Lord William was on. With Fakira still flailing slightly, the two humans pushed to shore and when her feet could touch earth, Fakira bolted from the river, shaking.

Her speed would had been greater had she not been slowed by Ted and Felix, still tangled in the rope with her.

All three were breathing heavily from their escape. Finally, Ted looked at Felix and saw Randolph was not there.

"What happened? Why did we drop? Where's Randolph?" Ted asked. Ted watched as sadness formed in Felix's eyes. He had seen it once before, when another one of their friends who was a slave was murdered by Lord William for accidentally breaking a vase. All slaves watched it as a warning of what came from stupid mistakes.

"Yes, why did we suddenly drop?" Fakira asked acidly.

"Lord William . . . he broke the kitchen door and attacked Randolph, then aimed to kill me. Randolph . . . he cut the rope with the last of his strength, saving us from capture," Felix said as he began to cry for his friend. Ted bowed his head in sorrow, while Fakira was mostly indifferent.

"So one less snack," she thought. Ted saw her indifference and glared at her.

"You could at least pretend to be sorry," Ted growled at Fakira. Fakira glared back.

"Why? I didn't know him. So he died. I don't care," Fakira replied.

"He died giving us a chance to let you go, you stupid monster!" Ted yelled, "If it wasn't for you, he might be alive right now and we'd be free."

"If it wasn't for me teaching this one magic, you wouldn't have had the courage to escape," Fakira replied, "Otherwise you would have attempted to before this."

"Hey, calm down you two," Felix said, moving between them, "We can't fight right now." Ted looked from Felix to Fakirra.

"Felix is right," Ted said, "Lord William will probably send men in the river after us. We need to get moving."

"Hopefully this forest will connect to my home so I can get healed quickly," Fakira mumbled as she used the weak cutting spell to cut the rope binding her to the others. Felix and Ted simply pulled the rope off. After a few seconds of silence, Ted smiled, looking at Fakira.

"Really? You want to go home right now?" Ted sneered.

"What do you mean?" Fakira asked, "Of course I want to go home." Ted laughed darkly at her desire. "What are you laughing at human?"

145121121212112122112211111.content:
Ted thought it would be obvious to the fairy if she saw through the eyes of other Felaryan fairies if they found her the way she was. However, the fairy still didn't see what Ted saw and she kept demanding an explanation, which only caused Ted to laugh more. "Tell me what is so funny, human, or I'll shrink you and eat you now!" Fakira warned.

"Will you two stop it! We have to get as far away as possible, now!" Felix interrupted, "Ted, do you know what forest we are in?"

"My father made a map of many lands and I memorized them all," Ted informed Felix, "I know what forest we are in, what kind of creatures live in the forest, and the nearest villages, towns, and cities."

"Where do we need to go then?" Felix questioned.

"We need to get of of the country and out of Lord William's reach and rule before we can do anything else," Ted answered.

"How long would that take?" Fakira questioned.

"At least two weeks depending one which way we go and which country we go to," Ted answered, "The closest country is the realm of the elves. They are kind to humans, especially if we're run away slaves. They can't stand slavery and see it as a terrible evil. That's at least two weeks walk. There will be many dangers on the way though and we won't be able to use the roads too often and we'd only be able to visit villages that are absolutely safe and big cities where it would be hard to find us. Once we're somewhere where Lord William can't get us, we can do whatever we think is best."

"Elves? Help humans?" Fakira smirked.

"Their not giants like Felaryan Elves," Ted explained, "And even if they were, they wouldn't be as cruel as you Felaryans. They'd realize humans are people and wouldn't devour us senselessly like you monsters."

"We're not monsters?" Fakira hissed.

"You Felaryans are..." Ted started.

"Stop it!" Felix yelled, "This is not the time!"

"You won't take me to the elves. You will take me to Felarya," Fakira told them, "Where is Felarya?"

"It is in another dimension. You have to go through a dimensional portal to get there," Ted explained, "And you'd have to have someone who knows how to use dimensional magic like a wizard or a Silver Dragon to work it. However, there are few wizards that know how to use that magic and there is only one Silver Dragon per dimension. There hasn't been a Silver dragon on Earth for the past few hundred years and when they arrive, they'd be a new born and bond with the first creature that sees them hatch. You'll have better luck with a wizard."

"Where is the nearest dimensional gate?" Fakira asked.

"On the way, but it's still in Lord William's realm about a week and a half away, near the fairy forest," Ted informed her, "But you're not going to want to go there and..."

"You are going to take me to the nearest gate and find me a way home!" Fakira demanded.

Felix could see Ted was about to argue, but then he thought better and just muttered, "Fine, have it your way, but you'll regret it."

Fakira didn't hear the last part and Ted led the way in the right direction. They group trudged through the forest for a a few hours. Ted felt that Lord William wouldn't send people out till morning and might not send them through the well. They might try to search every river, stream, and lake around the castle and might not even find the right river.

The group was about to stop when they came across small cabin in the woods. "You two stay here," Ted ordered, "I'm going to take a look."

Ted bent low and approached the cabin. Ted looked through the window and then after a long moment, motioned for Felix and the fairy to come over. Fakira and Felix approached as Ted opened the door. They all walked in and found the place abandoned. Well, not quite, because there was a dead body and the place was a mess. "Bandits raided this place," Ted explained, "But, it looks like it was months ago. There could still be clothes here. Bandits usually go for riches and not clothes."

"Why would clothes matter?" Fakira asked.

"If we continue to wear our rags, people will notice easily. You have to change to, fairy." Ted explained.

"I'm not going to where human clothing!" Fakira hissed, "It's degrading to wear the clothes of prey."

"The dress you're wearing is very different from human clothes and it will be spotted easily," Ted informed her, "Besides it shows your wounds and wings when they start growing."

"What about my wings?" Fakira questioned, "Human clothes don't have a place for wings to grow."

"We can cut slits," Ted explained, "And you can where a jacket if we go into a village or city."

"But, my mother made me this dress," Fakira replied, "I'm not taking it off to wear human clothes."

"You can shrink your dress," Felix suggested, "Can't you shrink non living things with an unlimited time? Just shrink it and keep it in the human pocket."

Fakira was reluctant, but she sighed and nodded her head. "Fine, but only till we get to the gate," Fakira told them.

Ted and Felix dressed in a different room from Fakira, but they all met each other in the same room when they were done and they set up beds to sleep on for the night. Ted looked at Fakira who would look human if it weren't for her slightly pointed ears and sharp teeth. "I hope there's a wizard there at the gate so we can send you home as soon as we get there," Ted stated.

"I'm glad you are starting to see things my way, human. Maybe you can prove to be a loyal pet, like the other human is becoming," Fakira replied.

"It's not that. It's because it will be a sure death for you if you go there when we get to the gate," Ted stated.

"Explan yourself, human," Fakira ordered.

"First of all, it's Ted. Our names are Felix and Ted, not human. The only reason we're calling you fairy is because we don't know your name. Why don't you tell me your name and you can start calling us by ours," Ted suggested.

"You're not worthy to know my name," Fakira replied.

"You know what, I'm going to tell you the reason anyway. You're going to die, because you look like a human. Without your wings, you'll be stuck human sized and Felaryans will eat you. Even ones of your own clan might eat you," Ted explained.

"They wouldn't," Fakira argued.

"What is a person, too you?" Ted asked.

"Creatures of the same size and species," Fakira answered, "Humans aren't people. They're too little to be much of anything other than a pet or food."

"You won't be the same size when you arrive home without wings," Ted stated, "You won't be a person in people's eyes."

"That's not true. I can explain me situation, and..." Fakira started.

Ted interrupted, "Even if you do get the chance to explain, would they believe you? You don't think anything human sized is a person. If someone my sized told you they were a fairy, would you believe them?"

Fakira didn't answer. She wouldn't have even given them a chance to speak unless she was in the mood for teasing and playing with her victim. "You own mother might even eat you," Ted added, "Do you still believe you're not a monster?"

Fakira turned away and didn't reply.

"People are creatures that have intelligence and emotions. Humans, fairies, elves, dragons, and nagas are all people! It doesn't matter what size or species a person is, just as long as they have the same intelligence. You don't see humans eating regular fairies just because they're small. I hope you go home as your human size, just so that you can truly know what its like being a human in your world," Ted stated before turning away from Fakira and falling asleep.

That night...

1451211212121121221122111111.content:
Fakira dreamed of her home.

-----------------------------------------------------

She was back in her homeland, the lush trees, the beautiful magic earth. Though she was prey size, she wore her green dress, calling for her mother.

"Mother! I'm back mother!" Fakira called as she walked into the Fairy domain. Her eyes darted around, searching for any movement. A soft laugh came to her ears as something grabbed her from behind. Darkness enveloped her as she rose into the air.

"Oh no, what grabbed me? Is it my mother?" Fakira wondered in worry as the huge hand opened. Before Fakira was one of the most beautiful females she had ever known, her mother. A smile came upon Fakira's face when she saw her mother.

"Hmm, yes prey, I am beautiful," the giantess fairy said, smiling. A look of horror came to Fakira's face.

"But mother, I'm not prey!" Fakira shouted.

"But you're smaller than me, so you are prey," she replied.

"But it's me! Fakira!" Fakira shouted. Her mother shook her head.

"Well you do look like you have some fairy in you prey. Your ears and teeth, yes. But you can't be my daughter. You're not a person," her mother.

"But mother this dress! You made it for me for my last birthday!" Fakira shouted. The giant Fairy looked close at the dress.

"You are my daughter," Fakira's mother realized, pulling her hand away from her face, smiling. "It's good to see you one last time." A joyous smile that was on Fakira's face turned to fear and panic.

"What do you mean 'one last time'?" Fakira yelled, scared she knew what was meant by those words.

"Daughter or not, if you can't become my size, you are prey," her mother said, "And prey is meant to be eaten. Not loved. Didn't I teach you anything you silly girl?" A soft chuckle came from her mother's lips as Fakira was raised to meet them. Fakira was too scared, too shocked, too destroyed to even scream as the darkness of the huge mouth came closer and closer.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Felix woke to a noise besides him. He looked to see Fakira rolling on her side in obvious distress.

"She looks like she did right before the first time she shrunk me," Felix thought, his gaze turned to Ted, who was sound asleep. "I wonder if Ted's words are causing her nightmares?" Unable to stand there and do nothing, Felix moved closer to Fakira and put his hand on her arm gently. In Fakira's dream

-----------------------------------

Fakira's eyes were set on the dark abyss that was getting closer. Her mother was focused on enjoying this prey.

"I always wondered what Felaryan fairies tasted like," her mother said, before screaming in pain. This scream caused Fakira to wake from her stupor and joined her mother in looking for the cause. A deep gash was on the side of her arm. Her mother looked to see a small human glaring at her.

"Let Fakira go," Felix yelled at her.

"No," Fakira's mother said. Felix sighed and held his arm curved.

"Then I'll make you," Felix said before chopping his arm, creating a powerful blade. Fakira's mother was unfazed, knowing she could live if it hit her, but then she saw the magic curve and aim for her back . . her wings! She pushed forward to try and dodge but to no avail. The magic cut much of her wings, making the 100 foot tall fairy shrink to a ten foot one.

In the shock of it, Fakira was dropped and Felix, using other magic, caught her in midair and ran out with her as she held him close, crying at what might have been.

14512112121211212211221111111.content:
Fakira woke up from her dream. She shot upwards into a sitting position and looked around frantically as if another Felaryan top predator was going to reach in the room, grab her, and swallow her whole. It was a terrible feeling that she had never experienced before and she didn't like it. She didn't like feeling that she was prey.

Her dream really depressed her as she realized it was her mother who was about to eat her. Her own mother didn't even see her as a person even when she realized it was Fakira in her hand. Her mother was willing to eat her own flesh and blood. Fakira began to cry uncontrollably. She calmed down slightly when she felt a hand stroking her shoulder.

Fakira turned her head to see it was human one, the one that had feed her while she was in that horrid cell. Normally, Fakira would have suddenly sucked up her fear and tears and then push the human away and tell the prey nothing was wrong. However, Fakira was overwhelmed with a different feeling, a feeling of depression, vulnerability, and thinking herself as a prey. Fakira didn't know how she should act and instead of what she would normally do, Fakira hugged the human again and cried on his shoulder as they where kneeling beside her makeshift bed.

Felix embraced her back and tried to calm her down while rubbing her back, careful not to touch the wounds. he noticed that the fairy is in much worse of a condition she was when she was in the cell and being tortured by Lord William. "What's wrong? What happened?" Felix questioned. Felix didn't expect the fairy to answer him. She never seemed to tell him her feelings because he was "prey". However, he knew that it was better to tell at least someone about what's wrong. In one told people of their feelings, it normally made that person feel better about him/herself.

To Felix's surprise, the fairy actually answered him, because she was still being controlled by the strange new feelings inside of her. "It was my mother," the fairy cried, "She... she tried to eat me." Fakira cried harder once she said this and she had to talk between her sobs. "I... I told her.... that I was.... her daughter... but... she didn't... listen," Fakira sobbed in Felix's arms, "She... recognized... me, but... she still saw me.... as a prey! She was... going to eat... her own... daughter. She was going... to eat me!"

"It's alright. I won't let that happen," Felix whispered.

"I know," Fakira said, calming down, "You're the one that saved me."

Felix still didn't know how to reply and she just continued to do what he was doing. Soon, the fairy fell asleep again and Felix lowered her to her bed. Felix looked over to his bed and noticed Ted was awake in his bed. When Ted saw Felix notice him, he turned around to not face him and pretended to fall asleep.

As Felix fell asleep, many things began to run through Ted head. "Why is Felix willingly comforting that wicked fairy?" was the first question that came to Ted's mind, "She's been treating us like insignificant creatures the entire time and... Maybe, Felix misses being a slave. He's gotten used to slavery and he did tell me once that he felt it was better living as a slave then die trying to be free. What if he wants to be the fairies slave, no, her pet? He's loyal to her and becoming her goddamn pet. He might not realize it, but those are probably one of the reasons, deep inside himself, he's sucking up to the fairy."

"The other reason that he knows about is that he wants to make her see people as a human. If he doesn't accomplish this, being her pet would be the next best thing for Felix. However, it might be possible that he can get her to see humans as people," Ted continued, "I thought it was impossible to change the mind of a Felaryan top predator, but I have heard rumors that it has been done before, especially when some people found and infant one and raised it as a human child. Now, it seems possible because she's realizing that she'll be prey if she enters her world. She is beginning to realized what it's like being a human in her world and how awful her and her clan's way of thinking is. Plus, she is subconsciously thinking Felix as a person, a savior, in her dreams. Maybe, we can change her mind by the time she grows her wings back."

After that last hopeful thought, Ted fell asleep like everyone else.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------

Morning came and everyone woke up. Fakira was very silent that morning after she realized everything that had happened last night. Eventually she sighed and said, "We shall still head for the dimensional gate."

"Are you serious? I though you would realize it's useless after you had your dream," Ted replied.

"That was only a nightmare," Fakira explained, "it wouldn't really happen like that. My mother wouldn't truly try to eat me, even if I'm human sized. It couldn't possibly happen."

"And if it does?" Ted asked.

"Don't talk about my mother, human!" Fakira growled, "You don't know her. Besides, my wings will heal by the time we get there."

"How do you figure that?" Felix questioned.

"It takes a week and a half to make it to the gate and it will take about four weeks to heal my wings. However, you said there was a fairy forest near the gate," Fakira started.

"That's correct, but what..." Ted stopped himself, because he realized what she was planing, "Fairy wings heal better when they're surrounded by magic. You plan on staying at the fairy forest till they're healed."

"Presisely," Fakira replied, "How long does it take to walk to the forest?"

"A week to get to that forest," Ted informed her, "And then four days to get out of the forest and to the dimensional gate. Four days if the fairy's help us escape the forest."

"So, in that week of travel to the forest, my wings will heal as much is it takes three and a half days time in Felarya," Fakira figured out. If the fairy forest is as full of magic as my world, I'd have to stay in the forest a week and a half before leaving the forest to the gate."

"That's right," Ted agreed. He began to worry now they had less time to get the fairy to see them as human.

"Then it's a plan," Felix stated, "Shall head out?"

Choice 1: Felix, Ted, and Fakira have a normal travel through the first woods. They don't run into any danger and it takes two days to get out of the woods. They don't have troubles hunting food either.

Choice 2: A problem occurs. On the second day in the forest, they run into bandits!

145121121212112122112211111112.content:
The three freed slaves walked without speaking much to the other. Ted led the group and Fakira walked a little ways behind him, looking at the trees of the world. Felix was near her, wanting to ask to learn some more magic.

"These are poor trees," Fakira finally said. Felix looked at her with a confused expression.

"What do you mean?" Felix asked.

"They aren't very large or strong compared to home's trees. They also don't have many branches to lay on and relax," Fakira said.

"Well these trees are cleared out so we have paths through the woods," Ted called back, "There are probably others who are stronger in the woods."

"You know a lot of this world, how so human?" Fakira asked, looking at Ted. Ted stopped and looked back at Fakira.

"My name is Ted. His name is Felix. It'd be nice for you to at least call us by our names," Ted replied with anger.

"Why?" Fakira replied, "You're prey." Ted gritted his teeth.

"And so are you, that's what your mother would think anyway," Ted replied coldly. Fakira growled, showing her teeth off to Ted. Thankfully for both, Felix spoke up.

"Hey, why don't we stop for some food?" Felix asked. Both looked at him.

"We don't have any," Ted noted, making Fakira the one to laugh at him this time.

"We're in the woods. There's plenty of food if you can hunt," she said.

"Yeah, and how do you expect to hunt without weapons?" Ted asked.

"Magic," Fakira said. She looked at Felix. "You, follow me," she ordered. Felix glanced at Ted before he followed Fakira and Ted followed him.

Slowly they came on an open field where a large buck stood tall.

"That will be a good meal," Fakira said, her mouth watering, "Though not as good as humans." She looked at Felix. "When I shrink it, you stop it by levitating it. Remember what it felt like when you levitated the fire. It's like that," she said before looking at the buck. She focused her magic and Ted watched the large buck shrink down to the ground. Felix pointed his hand at where the buck was and focused his thoughts, willing his magic.

The proud buck was watching for any hunters when it started to shrink. Fear overcame it and it tried to run but then it started flying into the air and towards some bushes. The buck found itself in Felix's hand when something reached down and broke its neck. Felix watched the buck dye in his hands and bowed his head. Fakira said something but he didn't hear her.

"Put it down now," she said once more. Felix gently put the buck down and watched it grow large once more. Fakira took a leg and bit into the raw meat.

"Hey, is there a way Felix could conjure fire so we can cook some?" Ted asked.

"Yes and I could shrink you so there's more to eat," Fakira said.

"No, the spell would be fine. If you shrink me, I'll start heading in the wrong direction," Ted replied.

"You wouldn't," Fakira said.

"Try me," Ted replied, "Besides, with injured wings, you can only shrink living creatures once every few hours." Fakira growled, and showed her bloody teeth. She eventually looked at Felix.

"Hey," she said, "Knock it out. You get to learn more magic."

"What?" Felix asked, looking up.

"I will teach you some magic to make fire," Fakira replied, before explaining this would be calling on the heat inside him to make an external flame. It took some tries for Felix to get this mid level magic, but eventually he and Ted had a cooking fire and ate some of the buck as well.

Fakira shrunk the buck's carcass once they were done and finished it off.

"That could have been dinner later," Ted said.

"It wouldn't have lasted long enough," Fakira said, "Besides, the more I eat the faster I heal." She had a smug look on her face as she walked back to the trail.

Time passed slowly as they walked deeper into the woods. Dinner passed in a similar fashion for them and sleep came easily from a long day of walking.

There were no dreams or nightmares for Fakira, which she was happy about.

And so as the morning sun rose on their small campsite, the three departed down the road once more until a large net fell on them.

"What the?!" Fakira yelled, being pushed to the ground by a net that could capture a horse.

"The bandits," Ted realized.

"You, cut the rope," Fakira said, looking at Felix. He nodded and raised a hand when Ted grabbed his hand.

"Wait, let's see if we can get out of this without magic. If they know you can do magic, they may not let us go," Ted said. Felix looked between Ted and Fakira, deciding to follow

1451211212121121221122111111121.content:
Felix had already begun to use the cutting spell before Ted could grab his hand however and this caused part of the net to break apart.

“Damn it.” Ted said as he noticed that the 15 or so bandits had also noticed the cut in the net.

Just then a voice came from behind the bandits, “Well, what do we have here...a mage…” The bandits broke ranks and the three saw a young man with a mage’s staff and robes. The man looked at Fakira and his eyes began to glow, he then added, “And a Felarya fairy as well…” The man pulled off his hood, and showed of his handsome features, he had short silver hair and blue eyes, before the three could see any more the man, he smiled and said, “A nice find if I don’t say so myself.”

“Great” Ted said in disappear, “They have a mage too.”

“A mage?” The man said, his smile only getting wider, “My dear young human, I’m not just a mage…I’m a SAGE!” The man raised his hand, and instantly the three were captured by the vary air itself. The man closed his hands and soon the three started to fall. There was blackness in every direction, and then with a flash of white light the three kids found themselves on chairs in what could only be called a mage’s lair.

“Transportation magic!” Ted said in awe, but at the same time he knew that if the sage became there enemy they would more then likely be killed, even if Fakira had her wings, the amount of power the mage had just used was a lot even he could tell, that and the way Felix’s and Fakira’s eyes went dim for a few seconds was enough to tell him the mage’s power was enough to put them into a short but potent magical shock.

Just then the man appeared on the other side of a table in his own chair. His robe was now gone and he was wearing The man was holding a type of blue stone in his hand and was smiling at Fakira, while at the same time casting questioning glances at Felix. After a few short moments the man said, “Now allow me to introduce my self, I am the great sage of the Wingly race, Lloyd Springfield.”

Ted stared in shock of what he had just heard, “Wi…Wingly!” ‘No way!’

Felix looked at his friend and asked, “What’s a Wingly?” Fakira just looked confused.

The man, Lloyd, answered, “We are a type of fairy, we just happen to be human sized.” Lloyd’s attention now fully placed on Felix, “Now young sir if I may ask, what type of creature are you? I can tell by the amount of magic you have inside you, that you are not human…then again…with all of those seals on your body you might not have even realized that?”

“Are…Are you saying that Felix is not human?” Ted asked, as he looked from Lloyd to his best friend and back again. Lloyd’s blue eyes looked at Ted for a moment before turning back to Felix and his eyes began to glow as he replied, “With the amount of magic I see in him, he is either from a very powerful monster race, such as a Winglies or High elves…” Lloyd’s head turned towards, Fakira, “Or some Top-level creature of Felarya.” Lloyd turns his head back to Ted, “For all I know he could even be a cross-breed of many different types of creatures.”

Felix was looking down at the ground, his mind was going a 100 miles a second, ‘I’m not human…but there was never anything special about me.’

Ted was about to say something but Lloyd began to continue, “More over you seem to be under many different spells, I can see that one is a glamour, or a disguise spell if you will, that is tapping into your magic, which could explain why it lasted so long, and why you have so much magic power…and why it was never discovered, by that damnable Lord William.”

The three jumped up in shock at the Lord’s name.

“HOW DO YOU KNOW ABOUT THAT!?” Ted screamed, getting ready to either fight or run…and considering that this Lloyd could kill them all in seconds running sounded like a better plan.

Lloyd just smiled and replied, “I’ve seen the wanted posters.”

The three of them, “…Ooo”

“What’s a wanted poster?” Fakira asked with a child like cuteness. Fakira understood that this man was powerful, and a type of fairy, so he should be able to help her out with her wings. She was about to ask, when Felix began to talk.

“Could…Would you be able to tell me what I am?” Felix asked, his body shaking at the news of this revelation. Looking at Lloyd with both worry and hope in his eyes.

Lloyd raised his right hand and snapped his fingers; the three once again found themselves falling.

This time they found themselves in front of a great machine. The machine was easily three meters tall and made out of a greenish metal. The machine had three “horns” on the top in a triangle pattern, and had a large flouting, gold ring slowly spinning around the horns. On the ground level there seemed to be a large screen of some kind.

Looking at Felix, Lloyd says, “Come boy.” And begins to walk up a set of hidden steps on the right of the machine. Just then Lloyd stops and says, “O…and only the boy.” With that he continued his climb. As he walked Lloyd began to think, ‘Who is that boy, he seems familiar…his aura is like that woman’s’ At that Lloyd’s eyes go wide, ‘Can it be…no the child was kidnapped over six years ago, and he looks nothing like her or myself…then again there is a glamour spell on him…high level too, it’s locking away nearly everything from his race as a creature, the amount of magic he can use and even…’ Lloyd gained a smile as he thought, ‘His very gender…The kid better pray that he really is a guy or I have a feeling he will be locking him/herself in a room for many, many months…I wonder what she would think?’ With his last thought, Lloyd began thinking of the fairy he had a one-night stand with when he was visiting Felarya. ‘Nemyra’

(Nemyra= the queen of all Felaryan fairies, the only fairy that could become 1000 feet tall. She is considered one of the strongest beings in Felarya, and is one of the guardians)

Back with Felix and Ted

Felix and Ted were looking at it each other, while Fakira just continued to stare in shock of the Wingly, ‘So fast!’. She had heard of them from her mom, after all there weren’t many human sized creatures that could be considered a Top-Level threat in Felarya, but still… she met a Wingly! Her friends were going to be jealous.

“Wish me luck guys.” Felix said suddenly, as he began to follow the wingly.

“YOUR GOING!?” Ted asked in surprise.

“Ted, you can remember your parents, even if you dislike your mother you still have memories of her…I…I don’t even know if I am human…I…I can’t let this chance just slip bye.” With that Felix starts to run after the man named Lloyd.

choices: Fakira eats him.
Fakira decides to keep him as a little slave.
1451211212121121221122111111122.content:
Felix didn't know what to do. He wanted to stay on Fakira's good side, because of two major reasons. One was that if he stayed on her good side, he realized she might start seeing him as a friend. If not, at least she will she him as an obedient pet, and to Felix, being a pet was better than being swallowed whole after being subjected to a long and tormenting mouth play and then slowly digesting in a fairy's stomach. Yeah, being a pet is a much better option. Besides, even if being a fairy's would be degrading, nothing could compare to being Lord William's slave.

The second reason that he didn't entirely realize was that he subconsciously missed slave. He had been a slave as far back as he could remember. Slavery was normal for him. He was used to having a master to order him around. That's why being a possible pet to a fairy did seem degrading to him. He was starting to see the fairy as his new master.

With those two reasons in mind, Felix was having troubles resisting Fakira's order. "But what if Ted is right?" Felix wondered, "He knows this place better than Fakira. Plus, she's not used to being human sized and she might be listening to her instincts as if she is still a giant fairy and that the bandits have no threat to us, when in fact they pose more threat than she thinks. What should I do?"

Felix was taking too long to decide and Fakira believed the human had taken the other human's side. "That terrible and miserable human," Fakira thought to herself, "If I didn't need the two of them, I'd eat them now for disobeying my orders. How dare those ungrateful little pets."

Ted took the moments of silence to look around. The bandits were starting to surround the net, but there weren't as many bandits as he originally thought. He only saw about six men. He noticed they didn't have the best of gear and the way most of them were yelling and "dancing" around the net either meant they were extremely crazy or they weren't the brightest bandits.

"Felarya isn't common knowledge," Ted realized, "They've never seen a Felaryan fairy and wouldn't know what it could do. What if the fairy shrinks the leader? They might not know that she can't do it again for another few hours. They might think she'd do it to all of them and they might run away. Magic might be a way out of this, and it will keep the fairy from shrinking us for a while."

"I have an idea," Ted whispered, "But it involves shrinking."

"I thought you said we should try without magic," Felix said.

"I do believe we shouldn't use too much magic, but one spell might be good enough," Ted replied, "These guys probably never heard of Felarya and shrinking spells can only be used by creatures from that place. They won't understand the rules of shrinking magic when it comes to an injured fairy. If we can shrink the leader, the other's might run away."

"There's one problem," Fakira whispered with a hiss, "He'll only stay shrunk for two minutes."

"Unless you coat him with saliva, right?" Ted replied.

"What about the others?" Fakira questioned.

"You'll shrink the leader, but not his equipment. Felix and I can take whatever weapons he has than try to defend you if they attack. Meanwhile do what it is you do with shrunken people. The others should be frightened and run. These don't look like the type of people that will sacrifice themselves for their leader," Ted explained.

"And what is it that Felaryans do to shrunken people?" Fakira questioned.

The torture them, play with them in their mouth, and savior the taste before they swallow them whole and let them squirm around in their stomach while their victim slowly digests and..." Ted started.

"For you're information, we don't do that to people, only prey," Fakira growled.

"What if you were to shrink someone who was a person to you? What that automatically make them prey to you even if that person used to be you're friend and..." Ted started up once again.

"Both of you, stop!" Felix interrupted trying to keep the group together, "There's no time for this! I'll be ready to cut the nets. Just shrink the leader once Ted gives you the signal."

"And what will be the signal?" Fakira asked.

"I'll tap your lap. No one will be able to see me to it," Ted informed her.

Before Fakira could say that she didn't want his hands on her, a large and buff man walked to the net and looked down at the three captured humans, or so he thought, who we forced to their hands and knees because of the nets. "So what do we have here? A little too young to be wanders, are yah?" the leader questioned.

"We mean you no trouble. We don't have anything to give you, honest?" Ted pleaded. He still wanted to try and get out of the situation without using magic, but he knew Fakira would have to use her magic if all else failed.

"I beg to differ," the leader replied, "You're all strapping young lads that can still work hard. We can sell you has slaves. You mustn't have family ties if you're all alone out here in the woods."

Ted realized these were bandits that would risk everything. "Let see what happens when they meet a Felaryan monster," Ted thought as he tapped the fairy's lap.

Fakira shrunk the leader without a moments notice and Felix quickly cut the net. With fast reflexes, Ted picked up the bandit's bow and arrows and Felix took the sword. The remaining five were confused when they saw their leader disappear and the children take the weapons. "What sort of tricky is this?" "He's gone!" the bandits exclaimed.

The leader couldn't believe it. One moment he was standing above three children, and the next moment, he was three inches tall and the ten year old girl bent down and picked him up by the back of his shirt. The man became dizzy and the suddenly attitude change forced him to shut his eyes. When he opened them once more, all he could see was a massive wet tongue cover his entire front. "Are these cannibals?" the man wondered worriedly. He wanted to curl up right then and there, but he was dangling from the girl's two fingers.

"Not so big and tough now, are you human?" Fakira laughed.

"She shrunk our captain!" a bandit cried out.

"Do any of you want to join him?" Fakira asked the bandits, "I need the food."

The bandits didn't even have to watch the torture and teasing Fakira was about to preform. They all ran away, not wanting to join their "leader".

"Looks like you're loyal friends left you," Fakira smiled, "All the better for me."

Choice 1: Fakira tastes and tortures the man in her mouth for a while before finally swallowing her first human. It felt good and overcame the little guilt she felt. (She didn't feel as much guilt because the man was going to enslave her and was evil.)

Choice 2: Fakira starts playing with the tiny human, but then she remembered how she felt when she dreamed about her mother trying to eat her. She couldn't bring herself to eat him. However, she doesn't show her weakness and says that she'll just keep him as a slave. Of course, she'll have to keep him coated in saliva till she grows her wings.This could mean scheduled licking and him sleeping in her mouth when they slept.

14512112121211212211221111111222.content:
Ted and Felix watched Fakira as she laughed darkly and played with the bandit leader.

"No! No! Please no!" cried the once strong man as she dangled by an arm over Fakira's mouth. The giantess's dark laugh resonating from her mouth made him realize there was no coming back if he went in.

But in Fakira's mind, the man's words struck an uneasy chord.

"He sounds like me in my dream," Fakira thought.

"But he's not a person. I should eat him," another part replied.

"But he... he sounds like me..."

"Eat him and I'll be healed faster!"

"But..." Fakira thought, her hand shaking.

Thankfully the bandit and others watching thought the shaking hand was more torment. Suddenly Fakira pushed the man in her mouth. He had a slightly different flavor than Felix, more potent and meaty. Once she savored his taste for a while and swished him around her mouth, her mouth then opened.

"Oh man she's going to swallow him with her mouth open," Ted mumbled to Felix. Felix watched intently as Fakira's hand went in to her mouth and she pulled the bandit out. Not that the bandit really noticed, he was flailing around in terror.

"You sparred him?" Ted yelled in shock. Fakira turn her eyes to Ted.

"Not for the stupid reason you think human," Fakira said, "As I was about to swallow, I realized how you were partially right about the buck. It would be good to have a food source with us. So I'll use him as a living one."

"What?" Ted asked, confused, the bandit had calmed down enough to understand Fakira and start freaking out once more.

"It's simple, I will keep him shrunk. When I'm hungry, I will knock him out, dry him off and let him grow. Then I'll eat part of his legs or arms and shrink him and that one will use some healing magic to least stop the bleeding," Fakira explained.

"You can't be serious?!" Ted yelled.

"Of course I am," Fakira said.

"Yes... he's prey... If I can eat part of him... I can eventually eat all of him..." Fakira thought as she held her little slave, who was dripping with saliva.

"Um, I have an idea then," Felix said, walking back to the net and cutting a rope from it. He handed it to Fakira, "Now you can tie him up and keep him around your neck, so you don't lose him and can coat him in saliva easier."

"Good idea human," Fakira said, accepting the rope. Her eyes flashed with the memory of how Felix helped her in her dream but she dismissed it.

A few days later...
145121121212112122112211111112221.content:
The man struggled against Fakira, but he was no match for the fairy when he was just far too small to stop her approaching fingers. She easily tied the rope around him and then tied the rope around her neck. the man dangled from her neck like he was some fancy jeweled necklace. Fakira giggled as the man dangled from the makeshift necklace. "You're probably the most irresistible piece of jewelry I own now," Fakira commented.

The man stared up at her with a confused look and Fakira explained, "By irresistible, I mean that it's hard not just untying you and eating you right now." Fakira gave him a wicked smile and added, "Don't worry, I'll eat you over and over again until I get bored of you, and during that time, you shall be my slave. Serves you right for trying to enslave me."

Fakira gave the dangling figure a little tap with her finger which caused him to swing around without any control. "You should be happy this human has suggested to make you a piece of jewelry," Fakira said, "If I ever decide to wear my mother's dress one day, you'll have a nice view of the valley below."

Ted looked away from the fairy. He knew that Felaryans teased their victims till they were bored and he heard rumors of some of the terrible things they did to humans before they swallowed them whole, and he knew that fairies were the worst. Like normal fairies, they had a playful and curious characteristic. They liked to tease and play jokes on people. However, since Felaryan fairies didn't see small people as people, they were capable of some of the worse forms of torture just by their teasing alone. Ted knew that it would only be worse for the bandit and although he didn't like the guy, Ted believed that no one but Lord William deserved such torture.

"We better keep going," Ted informed them, "There's no telling how close Lord William's troops are. If you want to get to the Fairy forest, then we should go now."

Fakira and Felix agreed and they continued through the forest. It took another day or two to make it through the forest. Luckily, they didn't run into anymore trouble. One evening at dinner time, the group set up camp for the night, and Felix and Ted were eating a deer that Fakira had captured easily. Fakira on the other hand was waiting for them to be done so she could have another meal out of her little captive, still hanging around her neck. The bandits of the forest didn't want to go near the three travelers, not even to save their miniscule former leader. "Hopefully, the bandits won't tell others of the event," Felix prayed.

"I think we won't have to worry about that. Those bandits are fugitives. The only way they would tell is if they are captured and know that giving information about a Felaryan fairy can save their lives," Ted explained, "It would be the only reason they'd need to tell people and quite frankly, they don't know what a Felaryan fairy is, otherwise, they might have attacked use that day."

"Glad you humans don't know too much about Felarya," Fakilra stated, "It will make it that much easier if I should decide to come back her and hunt with my clan. We'll have an abundant source of food."

Ted and Felix had learned to ignore such comments as they continued to eat the cooked deer. Fakira sliced a small piece from the deer meat and placed it between her thumb and pointer finger. She then was able to untie the rope with one hand and the man down on the top of her breasts and slid down the front. Fakira was wearing her human peasant clothes, so the shirt didn't so cleavage. The man rolled down the breasts and fell towards the lap. The man fell on Fakira's lap and rolled off to try and make a run for it through the grass. However, Fakira simply set her hand in front of the bandit and teased, "I don't think so little prey."

Fakira slowly pushed her hand to him and the man tried to hit the hand as it grasped around him. Fakira lifted the man to her face and whimpered with a fake expression, "I was only trying to feed you little guy."

"I don't need you're damn food, witch!" the bandit shouted.

"Then you will die if you don't," Fakira showed fake concern.

"I'd rather die than be your slave and food source," the bandit screamed.

"Then I'll just have to stuff you. You should have thought about your actions before you tried to enslave me," Fakira growled as she shoved much of the food in his mouth. The bandit chewed and swallowed, it was hard for him to commit suicide and choke on the meat, even if he wanted to. Ted and Felix continued to look away from the torture Fakira was doing with the man they knew little about. Fakira had done many things to the man and she played with him in her mouth frequently to keep him shrunk. She did it to show her dominance over the little human to show that he couldn't even fight against a "little girl's" tongue. it was terrible for the little man and Felix and Ted couldn't answer his pleas. It was a surprise the man didn't break yet.

Fakira noticed the man would grow soon and she smiled as she stated, "I won't let you have the pleasure of being knocked out this time. This time, you'll see the whole thing." Fakira lifted the man up high and let him fall to the ground on his legs. The legs snapped as he hit the ground and he tried crawling away while screaming in agony. Every time the man screamed and pleaded, Fakira was reminded of her dream, but she continued to try her best to dismiss it and hide her doubts. The man soon grow to full height, but he couldn't fight back with his legs broken.

"I shall teach you a new level of healing," Fakira informed Felix. Felix had had to heal the man's wounds before and was getting very good at it.

"What will I be taught?" Felix asked sheepishly.

"You will learn how to grow limbs. You're still too weak to do it at full scale, but you will be able to heal him when he's shrunken," Fakira stated.

Fakira used her magic to cut the man's arms off and the man screamed in pure agony as blood squirted out onto the dirt. Fakira automatically shrunk the man as she took both arms to eat. Felix knew what to do and was about to heal the man's broken legs and missing arms, but Fakira hissed, "Wait! Wait till he has learned his leason." Fakira licked him while he was on the ground to make sure he'd stay small. Long minutes passed till Fakira let Felix heal him. Felix was able to heal the man, only because the man was small and the man curled in a ball for a long time, crying in fear and sadness.

"You need to think next time before you defy me, slave," Fakira growled as she ate the arms. The man watched in horror when he saw what used to be his arms being eaten by the fairy. When, the fairy was done, the man crawled on his hands and knees to the fairy's leg and bowed. There was nothing left of the man. He was broken. Fakira only smiled, picked up the man and tied him back to the neckless. With that, she placed him in her mouth with the rope still tied and fell asleep for the night.

1451211212121121221122111111122212.content:
A few days later, Ted and the group had long departed from the forest. Fakira a little surprised when a few days had past since the forest and they had found no other forest since then.

"There are no trees!" she shouted. Ted and Felix looked back to the once bandit, now slave, and Fakira.

"Of course not. We don't have massive forests all over this world," Ted said, "We need to cross this plain to get to the fairy forest." Ted's eyes glanced down at the bandit slave, who Fakira renamed Mini-slave. He was back to repeating the same words he always did now, after Fakira ate part of him.

"I am nothing but the food for Master. I have no other purpose," Mini-slave repeated over and over again.

"All right. Let's get going," Fakira said, smiling. Ted glared for a second, thinking no progress had been made before starting off.

Felix sighed as he moved on with the others. Because of Fakira's slave, he had become very good at the healing spell as well as other magics that were needed for him and Ted to survive. as he looked at Fakira, he believed there was a change in her, it was just slight. When she talked to Ted and him, her tone wasn't as harsh as it was to begin with.

A few hours passed and their stomachs growled. Ted had been keen to watch for any animal tracks so Felix could kill it.

"Capture it. Felix hasn't directly killed any of our meals," Ted thought. Fakira saw the dilemma on Ted's face, smirking.

"You could always take a bite of Mimi-slave if you're hungry," Fakira said darkly.

"If prey eats like-prey, then I am not prey, just small a person," Fakira thought, hoping to see Ted and Felix become her pets as well.

"No than-" Ted replied when he stopped as Fakira let out a scream. Both Felix and Ted looked down to see a snake slither away as Fakira grabbed her lower leg.

"Mistress must have disturbed snake's lair," Mini-slave noted, "That snake was poisonous."

"It's nothing," Fakira said, letting go of the wound. There was not blood but the wound was very red. "Let's keep moving until we find something for Mini-slave to eat," Fakira said.

"But we should get that checked out," Felix said.

"No Human, we keep going. Fairies have strong defenses against poisons," Fakira said. Of course what she didn't know was those defenses are very limited when her wings are cut.

A few hours later . . .
1451211212121121221122111111122212.title: Open Field

choices: Choice 1: Ted get things quickly
Choice 2: Ted takes a little longer than expected.
14512112121211212211221111111222122.content:
The three travelers and the mini slave around Fakira's neck walked for a few hours and as they walked, Felix and Ted noticed Fakira's odd behavior. She was walking a little slower than usual and she was walking very oddly. Fakira's skin was warm and she was sweating. Sure the sun was high and since the field had no shade, the grasslands was like a desert itself. Felix questioned what might be wrong with the fairy, because he had herd her say that fairies had a strong immunity to the poisons. Ted glanced at the fairy and stared at her wings. Her wing had been healing for six days. It was supposed to take a week to get to the fairy forest. The wings on her back were nearly one fourth of the way heal, but it made her weak enough to be affected by the poison. "Once we reach the fairy forest tomorrow night, she will only need to stay there for a week and a half to heal fully her wings instead of three weeks. It also takes four days to get out of the Fairy forest if the fairies help us and guide us through, but that Felaryan will want to stay those eleven day in the forest so she can heal and eat us. I hope Felix is right about her changing." Ted thought to himself.

"Ted, what's wrong with her?" Felix whispered again.

Ted snapped out of his thought and once again looked at the fairy and thought about her predicament instead of how long she had left to grow. "The poison is affecting her," Ted answered.

"Why? She has immunity, doesn't she?" Felix question in a worried tone.

The worried tone truly scared Ted. He realized for the longest time that Felix might be attached to the fairy because Felix was used to slavery and saw the Felaryan as his new master. it was true that Felix still didn't understand the concept of freedom, but he didn't even realize how loyal he was becoming to the fairy. He thought that it was just because he felt sorry for her and he wanted to be her friend and help her. However, the truth deep inside himself was that he saw her as a new master and didn't even know it himself. Ted looked at the bandit around the fairy's neck. "At least that outlaw sort of deserves what he got, though I don't know if anyone truly deserves to be a slave and constant meal for a Felaryan, but Felix doesn't deserve such a fate at all. Felix is a nice boy and my best friend. The Felaryan is a monster and..." Ted started getting off track once again.

"Ted, why is this happening?" Felix reminded Ted of the question. Ted had been distracted for a couple of days now because he was looking forward to try and figure out what should be the right thing to do.

"There are two possible reasons," Ted whispered, "Either he weak wings are making her easier to get poisoned, or her kind don't have an immunity built up for the snakes of our world."

"Then what will happen to the fairy if we don't...?" Felix began to question.

Suddenly, Fakira stopped in her tracks and began to titter. Felix and Ted turned around just in time to see Fakira tip over to the side and collapse completely. Both Felix and "Mini-Slave" became overwhelmed with fear. (Mini-Slave was more fearful since he had fallen with Fakira. If Fakira wouldn't have turned to her back on the last second, Mini-Slave would have swung with the necklace and would have felt the full impact of the fall onto the ground instead of falling on Fakira's chest.) Felix rushed over to Fakira's side and knelt beside her. Fakira's eyes were rolling into her head and she was shaking terribly. Felix felt her forehead and she was burning up with sweat drenching her skin. Felix turned to Ted who was still standing where he had been.

"Ted, what do we do?" Felix questioned.

"We should keep going," Ted replied.

"But, the fairy... we can't leave her," Felix argued.

"And why not, Felix?" Ted questioned, "So she'll heal and grow to her giant size. Then she could eat us or make us her pets. You want to be her pet?"

"She won't do that, she's just saying that to keep an act," Felix tried to argue.

"The fairy is stubborn and still fighting to make sure we're just prey to her. She's looking for any reason to prove we're not people to her," Ted explained.

"But if she has to fight to see this, then she's starting to crack. She might see us as people soon," Felix argued.

"You may have a point, but should we risk it. This fairy is part of one of the extreme Felaryan clan, the extremes only see people as something of their own species and/or their own size," Ted informed Felix.

Felix thought carefully about what Ted had said and realized something. "There are others than extremes aren't there?" Felix questioned.

Though it was strange put, Ted understood what Felix meant to say. "There are Felaryan clans that have the same views as humans on what a person is, and it is true that those clans have been befriended by humans, but even those clans still eat humans from time to time just because their bigger. No one has befriended an extreme case," Ted informed Felix.

"There's a first for everything. Think about it, she became a slave like us. You and I have much in common with the fairy because of this slavery. You and her want nothing more than to be free and her and I have shared the same sort of sadness in being a slave. Then, we freed her and we've been traveling. You informed her about how she'd be a prey in her world. She dreamed about being a prey and she know how much it feels to be in our predicament. She won't eat us. Even when she tortures the bandit, I see conflict in her eyes," Felix told Ted.

"But should we risk it?" Ted questioned.

"Help the master!" Mini-Slave demanded.

"You see what you can become, Felix?" Ted pointed out.

"What are you talking about?" Felix questioned.

"You may think you're just trying to befriend this fairy, but it might be because you wish to her her slave now," Ted accused.

"What the hell are you talking about?" Felix asked.

"You've been a slave your whole life. You told me you'd rather live your life as a slave than die free, because you've been a slave all your memorable life and you're too used to it. This fairy is showing dominance over and because you're so used to being a slave, you're starting to see her as a master," Ted explained.

"That's not true!" Felix replied.

"Such deep inside yourself before you deny it," Ted ordered, "Why else would you be so loyal to her? Why else are you always sucking up to her?"

Felix searched inside himself foe a long time and Ted added, "That slave could be you in a few weeks!"

"I still can't leave her for dead," Felix informed Ted, "I can still change her in the twelve more days we have. Can you heal her?"

"I know what bite her, I know the antidote, and the ingredients are all around us," Ted told his friend.

"Then give me a chance to change her. She's not lost cause. You know this to be true," Felix pleaded.

Ted sighed, "Fine, but this is very risky. Hopefully, she'll understand we had a choice on whether to save her or not. We had the free will to leave her, but we chose to save her. Hopefully this will help our cause an she'll be at least a little but grateful."

"She may not show it, but she will be very grateful," Felix told Ted as he left for the ingredients.

Choice 1: Ted finds the ingredients quickly and makes the cure. Thanks to Fakira's partial immunity, she recovers quickly after the cure is administered and she is in time to lick Mini-Slave again to keep him small. They eat lunch soon after.

Choice 2: Ted takes a while, but gets the ingredients. Fakira is unable to recover in time and Mini-Slave grows once again. The bandit sees the opportunity and tries to kill Fakira. Ted and Felix, still having the weapons, are able to kill the bandit. Fakira becomes even more grateful!
14512112121211212211221111111222122.title: Near Death

choices: Fakira realizes small beings are people and accepts it
Fakira realizes the truth but tries not to show her revalation
145121121212112122112211111112221222.content:
Ted ran off to find the ingredients while Felix cut some grass on the field and made a bed for Fakira to lay on.

"It's not because I'm serving her. It's for her health," Felix thought as he pulled her weak body onto the softer surface. He also tried covering her in the shade of some tall grass to buy her some more time.

*************

A short time passed and Ted had all but one ingredient left.

"Come on. Where is it?" Ted murmured, looking under every rock for a bit off moss that could draw out poison, either by applying to the wound or ingestion. He knew this was the key ingredient to saving Fakira. He paused to breath when a thought came to him. "Mini-Slave," he whispered as his eyes went wide, realizing the small bandit might still have a spark of rebellion in him. If he grew before Fakira could lick him it would be big trouble for them. With this fear driving him more than Felix's pleas to help Fakira to change her, Ted looked on much quicker.

**************************

Felix was fanning the feverish Fakira. Mini-slave was standing next to Fakira, still attached to the necklace. The small bandit stood in the direct sunlight watching Felix attend to his mistress.

"No! She isn't my mistress. If things go well I can escape from my torment with her, the bandit thought playing with the knot around him. He could never have tried this if the other boys were still around as they would keep him small for their own safety. The bandit smiled as he undid the knot, even at two inches, he was great at knots. Unknown to Felix, the bandit slipped off into some taller-than-him grass and hid, waiting to grow.

"Felix!" came a voice from a far, "Get the bandit wet with saliva!" Felix recognized the voice as Ted's and looked and saw no slave present.

"He's gone!" Felix cried as Ted arrived. He bit his lip.

"Felix, we should go," Ted said.

"No, we can't leave Fakira to die," Felix said.

"She's a monster!" Ted replied.

"You keep saying she's a monster but why haven't you left or tried killing her yourself?" Felix replied coldly. Ted looked away. "You're just as uncomfortable about leaving her alone as I am. Part of you can't let her die because she is a person who has suffered like we did."

Fine, here is the antidote," Ted said, kneeling down and putting some in her mouth. He pushed some moss on her leg. The affect was almost instant. Her fever went down and her eyes opened slowly.

"Wha . . .? What happened . . ." Fakira breathed out, still worn from the poison.

"You weren't as immune as expected," Ted said coldly.

"Ted found the antidote to heal the snake bite," Felix said as he, Fakira and Ted felt a large shadow cast over their kneeling bodies. Ted and Felix looked behind to see the large, nude, furious bandit glaring sadistically at the three.

"I will make you pay for what you did to me," the bandit growled, holding a large rock and was about to throw it down upon them when Felix reacted without thinking.

With a quickly wave of his hand, though missing because of the panic he felt, Felix missed the rock but did sever the man's hand, still protecting them from his assault. As the man gripped the stump that was his hand, Ted pulled some arrows and jabbed one into the man's throat. The bandit struck Ted back with his stump but the damage was already done and he collapsed on the ground, dying.

"You . . .saved me . . ." Fakira said, looking at her former slave and meal plan, then to Ted, who had blood on his shirt. Ted looked back.

"Because, while you're a monster to torment him like you did, you were a defenseless person just the same," Ted said. Fakira looked away.

"What is this I'm feeling? Thanks? Gratefulness? Respect? But why? How? They're slaves! They're prey! Not people! But . . . they could have left me . . . even at the castle . . . that one guard died letting us go . . .WHAT DOES THIS MEAN!!!!" Fakira grabbed her head tightly from her inner turmoil.
