1451211212121121221122111111122212222.content:
Fakira was very conflicted in her head. She had never been more conflicted with such a subject. On one hand, she had been taught that humans were prey and could never be people. Her mother and the rest of her clan told her that only creatures of her size could be considered a a person, but now she had been introduced to another form of thinking which suggested that a person was defined as creatures as similar intelligence. The humans of this new world even saw miniature fairies as people.

At first Fakira saw this way of thinking as extremely odd. To find out that humans would eat something smaller than them was just too strange for Fakira to comprehend. She thought she could never pass up such an opportunity. However, the more she spent time with the humans, the more she understood their way of thinking. She began realizing that creatures of the same intelligence have the same feelings, fears, and emotions. Though the humans were little, their minds were very similar to the mind of a fairy. not only did she realize that, but she found out first hand what a small human would feel like if they were about to be eaten. Though it was only a dream, the emotions and fears were real. She thought she was really going to be swallowed whole by her own mother which not only made her understand what goes in the mind of a Felaryan prey, but also see how flawed her way of thinking was. She could be a person one day and a prey the next if she decided to shrink and get her wings cut off. No, she was realizing the humans beliefs were the only logical truths. A person is defined by their mind and the ability to feel, not just because of their physical structure.

Fakira had slowly learned this fact and she tried hard to tell herself that the humans' way of thinking was a weakness. It should be the right of large creatures to do what they wanted to do with little beings. Though bigger creatures had the power, Fakira began to comprehend that even if large creatures had the power to eat small people, it didn't make it any less wrong. They had the power, but it was wicked to use it in such a way. It's not right, it's not fair. This was what caused Fakira to have trouble torturing the miniature bandit so much. She thought it would bring her her normal beliefs, but it only caused her to think worse of herself.

Not only were those beliefs being realized, but Fakira grown to like the two humans she was with. She was starting to see Felix as a loyal companion and Ted as an ethical teacher showing her the right direction. They had both helped her, despite her being wicked to them and seeing them as prey. They had saved her from slavery, helped her against the bandits, lead her a way home, saved her from being poisoned, and protected her from an evil bandit she thought she had under control. They did all this even when she threatened to eat them or make them her pets. They know of the risks and possible consequences of helping her, but they still helped her. Fakira didn't know of anyone that would do such a thing.

"Fairy?" Felix questioned as he placed a hand on Fakira's shoulder. She was sitting up now and just thinking deeply within herself.

"I'll go get some food," Ted informed them. Ted left and Fakira and Felix were alone.

"Why did you save me human?" Fakira questioned, "Why would prey sacrifice so much to save a predator?"

"It's different in our world. There are only people and animals. All sentient beings are people. Sentient beings don't harm other sentient beings unless they are either cruel or have no choice. Sometimes, even the most vicious looking of sentient beings will help another sentient being despite the species. Our world still isn't immune to prejudice and racism, but no world is immune to such. There are still humans that are too ignorant and stubborn to dragons, or other animal looking creatures as people just because they're animals," Felix explained.

"In our world, Nagas and Dridders hate each other. They hate each other even more than succubi and angels of our world," Fakira replied, "Just because their different species. Fairies and Chilotaurs are the only predators that can truly be friends with any other top predator. Chilotaurs even find friends in humans, disgusting." Fakira didn't want the humans to know she was broken. She didn't even want to believe it.

"Do you understand why Ted and I saved you?" Felix asked.

"You two don't see me as a predator, but as a person," Fakira answered, "Even the other human saw this and couldn't let me die."

"Do you understand that what you originally thought was wrong?" Felix questioned.

Fakira know what the human meant by his words, but Fakira didn't want to give him a hint of her broken state. She shoved his hand off her shoulder and growled, "Just keep your hands of my, prey."

Ted came back shortly with two rabbits. "They rabbits were about getting close to mating. It was the only way I could get two with one arrow," Ted stated, "Luckily arrows can be used more than once. I only have ten."

Fakira looked at the rabbits and questioned, "No deer? nothing bigger than this?"

"There is only small animals in the grasslands. We'll only have another day of this. We should arrive at the town next to the Fairy Forest by nightfall tomorrow. Unless, you're still weak to keep going after lunch," Ted stated.

"We won't stop till nightfall," Fakira barked back.

"To back there isn't much to eat," Felix replied, as he began a fire.

Suddenly, the rabbit grew to the size of a dogs. Felix and Ted looked at the fairy. "I can't grow myself yet, but I can grow this rabbits larger. They'll stay large enough to eat," Fakira informed the humans before they began to cook.

Tomorrow's nightfall...

14512112121211212211221111111222122221.content:
Ted smiled as they came to a tavern and inn.

"I haven't slept on a real bed in so many years," Ted said in a happy tone.

"Real bed?" Fakira asked, "You slept on grass for many nights. Isn't that a real bed?" Ted shook his head.

"No, this is a bed that has a mattress stuffed with feathers, or straw and is above the ground," Ted said as they made it to the door. "Just let me do the talking, all right?" Fakira looked away.

"Fine," she said, looking at the village life.

***********

Inside the tavern, Ted walked up to the bar and got on the stool.

"You're a bit young to get a drink," the bartender said, eying Ted carefully.

"I'm traveling with my friend and his sister. We need a room for the night," Ted said, putting money on the counter.

"One room?" he asked. Ted nodded and the man took the coins. "That will get you a small meal and one night stay," the bartender said, "Get to a table. I'll get your food."

"Thank you," Ted said, heading back to Felix and Fakira.

"Samuel, Mary, I got a room and we have a meal coming," Ted said.

"Mary?" Fakira growled at him.

"We're still in Lord William's domain and he's probably still looking for us," Ted whispered, "If we use our names, especially just calling you Fairy, it will be troublesome." Fakira sighed, realizing Ted was right. She and Felix followed him to a table and sat as the bartender left a platter of bread and cheese, along with some water in a pitcher. Once he left, Fakira looked at Ted.

"No meat?" Fakira asked.

"I didn't ask what I would get. Besides," Ted said grabbing the warm bread, "I've had enough meat for a while." Felix watched Ted break into the bread and was so excited at having fresh baked bread and good cheese. When they were slaves, they had bread but it was usually stale by the time slaves were allowed to eat it. But after a bite of the warm bread and cheese, Felix realized why Ted was smiling.

Fakira ate in silence, finding the bread and cheese filling, if lacking the raw meat she enjoyed.

With their bellies filled, the three were taken by a maid to room 5, where they would be sleeping. Ted smiled at the three separate beds, each raised off the floor and promptly laid down on it.

"What's with him?" Fakira finally asked after the maid left, "Why was he so weird when we got to this place?"

"Jack remembered what life was like outside being a slave before he was sold," Felix replied, taking a bed for himself, "Being free and being able to eat food he could only remember on distant dreams was probably something he had been wanting to do since we got out of the castle." Felix looked at Fakira. "I'm guessing there are some fruits you're interested in eating once your home."

"I see your point," Fakira said as another pang of guilt came for demeaning these two who had saved and protected her. She sat on the third bed and laid on the soft surface. It felt nice on her recovering wings.

"Um, Mary," Felix called to her, "What is your real name?" Fakira looked at Felix for a moment, wondering should she tell or not.

145121121212112122112211111112221222211.content:
Fakira hesitated for a few moments and listened to the two sides within her. One side know that she had been broken from her original state. She was a knew fairy inside and it knew she was a better person because of it. She wasn't the monster that ate small people just because they were small anymore. She was fever changed. That part of her saw Ted and Felix as dear friends and it wished to tell them her name and start calling them by their name.

However, her other side, her prideful side, thought differently. He prideful side was still hoping to she could revert back to her normal self, despite it being wrong and a terrible thing to do so. It didn't want the humans to realize how she had changed because of their actions and it felt that if she told them, they would become aware of her she had changed. Her pride wished to cover everything up and act like everything was alright and the humans were still insignificant creatures beneath her.

Since both her sides were in the opposite extremes, Fakira made a compromise. She decided she would tell them her name, but her prideful side would makeup a reason that would seem like she hadn't changed.

"I guess I can tell you my name," Fakira replied, "You two have become very loyal and I have no doubts both of you will make fine pets I can care for and act kindly towards. You might as well know my name. My name is Fakira."

"It's nice to meet you, Fakira," Felix greeted with a friendly smile.

Ted smiled as well before he fell asleep. He knew that they were getting to Fakira and that she would someday be their friend he knew the Felaryan will finally be going down the right path and away from the path her mother started her on. Ted fell asleep first and was followed by Felix soon after. Fakira stayed awake a few minutes. She was thinking about her two sides and she couldn't stop thinking about them. "We will be staying in the fairy forest for a week and a half. When my wings grow and I grow myself to my normal height, what will I do with the humans?" For the first time in the entire trip, Fakira didn't know what she would do. She had no idea and no predictions of what her actions might be in the future. Deep down inside, she hoped she would make the right discussion and befriend the humans and not harm them. However, there was doubt and she feared that she still might eat them or make them her pets.

Fakira sighed and she fell asleep and waited for tomorrow to start.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

The next morning, the three of them woke up and Fakira was very quiet. She didn't say a word while they prepared to set of. She just put her jacket on, to cover her partially healed wings, and waited on the bed.

Once they were all ready, they headed outside and the bartender greeted them farewell before they left the place. They walked down the fairly empty street to the gate near the fairy forest. Not many people were around that gate and many other travelers stayed clear of it. So, when the guard saw what appeared to be two ten year olds and a thirteen year old who wished to exit the gate and go through the fairy forest, the guard thought he was seeing things. However, the kids still approached the gate. "Do the three of you wish to go into the fairy's domain?" the guard questioned.

"We do," Ted answered, "On the other side of the forest is were we need to go. What's the problem?"

"Most travelers go around the forest, not through it. If grown men don't normally go through, what makes three kids so special?" the guard asked.

"We don't have enough supplies to go around the forest. We can only go through it. Is the forest dangerous?" Ted questioned, pretending to be just a dumb kid that didn't know about the forest.

"Fairies live in the forest and they like to play tricks on the travelers. They can use their magic to manipulate the environment or cast spells and hexes on you," the guard explained.

"Are the fairies dangerous?" Ted asked.

"They don't usually kill travelers, if that's what you mean, but... well..." the guard started to explain, but he couldn't think of a very good reason to stay out other than what he had already said.

"Can we just go?" Ted asked.

The guard opened the gate and the three travelers walked into the forest.

Fakira shivered as they entered and smiled.

"There is a lot of magic in these woods. I will heal nicely here," Fakira thought as she followed Ted and Felix on the worn path. Suddenly she stopped, watching the humans in front of her.

"Hey you two!" Fakira said, "You're going wrong way and off the path." Ted looked around.

"No, we're on the path," Ted said slowly, stomping his foot on the path below his foot. Fakira shook her head.

"You F-Mage human, focus magic on your eyes and look around," Fakira said firmly to Felix. Felix was confused but did as Fakira instructed. She sounded serious about this. "Now what do you see?"

"I see trees and glowing spots in them and," Felix said, looking at Ted, "Ted is glowing a lot!"

"What?" Ted asked, looking at himself. But he didn't see any glow.

"And what about the ground?" Fakira asked, not moving.

"It's glowing as well," Felix said.

"That's a sign you in a magical illusion," Fakira said, "Move back to me now." Ted, unsure to fully trust Fakira, trusted Felix's words on what he saw and they moved back to Fakira. Suddenly giggling was heard from all around them.

"These ones are smart. They didn't walk back to the village," one voice said.

"One is human, another is a mage and the girl is part fairy," a different voice responded.

"Fairies of these woods, please, we are just trying to get through the woods. We mean you no harm," Ted said firmly.

"You want to get through the woods?" a voice said, laughing, "We can help you out easily."

"I'm not agreeing with you unless you show yourself to my comrades and me," Ted said More laughing came but it had a dark undertone to it.

"No human orders us around," a voice said, the mirth that once was in it, replaced with a dark sadistic tone.

"Do as he says runts," Fakira said, while believing small fairies were people, Fakira still believed they were just runts compared to her clan's "natural size".

"And you'll make us?" one voice called back at Fakira, "Half-blood?"

"Try me," Fakira growled back.

1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Ted, Felix, and Fakira walked into the forest to find that there was no path whatsoever. "There's no path!" Felix pointed out, "Is that because the fairies made it invisible or something."

"It's not fairy magic," Ted informed Felix, "There's no path because humans don't go through the forest. Once they discovered fairies living in the forest, they realized the fairies would just make them lost in the forest from illusions. Humans didn't bother making the paths. They only made the path that goes around the forest."

Ted and Felix started moving, but they found that Fakira wasn't following. Felix and Ted stopped and looked back. Fakira was looking around the forest in awe. "Something wrong Fakira?" Felix questioned.

Fakira didn't hear his questioning. She was too mesmerized by the forest. Everything was old and overgrown. Everything about the forest reminded Fakira of home. The forests of her home world were old and tall because humans didn't dare try to make settlements in a Felaryan forest, and the forest she was in had no human development because of the trickster fairies. So, this forest was exactly like Fakira's. Even the magic was coming from everything.

"Fakira," Felix called. Fakira finally snapped out of her trance and looked at Felix. "Is something the matter?" Felix questioned.

"No," Fakira shook her head, "Everything here is just like my home forest."

"It makes sense for it to look alike," Ted replied, "This is an old growth forest. It takes many decades for a forest to become this. Forests that aren't tampered by humans become like this. Humans in your world don't go into forests unless they have to because of all the things that will eat them, let alone go in to chop wood."

Fakira understood Ted's logic and agreed. The group continued and Felix brought up an important matter. "If there is no path, how are we to get out?" Felix asked.

"We're not leaving till my wings heal fully," Fakira stated, "That will possibly take another week and a half."

"Well, when Fakira's wings heal, we'll have to find fairies and convince them to help us. Or, Fakira will grow and fly us out of the forest," Ted stated.

Fakira didn't know how to react to that statement. At first she was angry to think that she'd be a form of transportation to them. However, the other side of her, the part that didn't mind her new change of mind, reasoned that it would just be helping her friends out. It wasn't like they would think of her as a beast of burden. It would be her decision to helping them and carrying them out. So, Fakira didn't say anything and kept walking for a while.

Fakira soon noticed the silence and she questioned, "Why is it so silent?"

"What do you mean?" Felix asked.

"Back in my world when humans enter the forest, my clan likes to go in the trees and tease them. They'd whisper and giggle aloud so the travelers can hear their inevitable doom. They also make illusions and do many things to torture them as they walk through the forest till they finally decide to eat the traveler. I know your fairies can't eat human travelers, but I'd think they'd still like to tease them," Fakira explained.

"You're right," Ted replied, "Yet, they aren't doing so now. It's almost like their staying away from us."

"Why would they do that?" Felix questioned.

"Their forest is close to the dimensional gate. if Lord William used that gate to obtain Fakira, then the fairies must know there's a Felaryan fairy in our country. They probably know about Felaryan fairies and realize Fakira is the Felaryan. They must want to stay away from Fakira because... She'd..." Ted started.

"Eat them?" Fakira finished Ted's words.

"That's what you Felaryans do, isn't it?" Ted questioned.

"Yes," Fakira sighed.

Fakira's mind was divided. She knew that part of her knew that eating little people was wrong. She realized that judging people by their intelligence instead of their size made more since and was fair to though who just weren't as large as Felaryan predators. The part didn't even think she'd be able to eat a human, especially the two accompanying her who were becoming her friend.

"Who cares if you eat things littler than you," the other part of her thought, "You're bigger than them and have the right."

"But they're people," Fakira's new part argued, "They have the same intelligence, feelings, emotions, and..."

"They're still littler," her old self commented.

"That shouldn't matter," Fakira's new self stated.

Before the argument could continue, Felix and Ted looked behind themselves to see Fakira. "Fakira!" Felix yelled.

Fakira had been so engrossed in her mind that she wasn't watching were she was going. She stepped on uneven ground and when she snapped out of her trance, it was too late to undo her mistake. Her balance was lost and her weight tipped over. Fakira fell and rolled down the hill towards a grove of strange flowers.

Ted realized what the flowers were. They were the most powerful healing flowers and they were concentrated with so much healing magic that just touching one could heal an individual. Fakira was heading right for the grove and Ted knew that her wings would heal and she'd be able to grow. She was at a critical point between her old self and her new self which understood Ted and Felix's way of thinking. The problem was that Ted didn't know which one she was leaning more towards.

Ted watched in horror as Felix ran down the hill after Fakira. "Felix, wait!" Ted ordered, but Felix wouldn't listen. Ted readied his bow and arrow in case things turned for the worst.

Fakira finally stopped rolling when she reached the middle of the grove of flowers she had never seen before. She could feel more magic than usual and her partial wings became numb. Fakira just lied on her back and Felix was the first to reach her. Felix knelt beside Fakira and questioned worriedly, "Are you alright?"

Fakira slowly sat up as she answered, "I think so." Fakira faced Felix only to see him staring at her back with wide eyes. "Is something wrong?" Fakira questioned.

"You're wings," Felix pointed.

Her wings weren't numb anymore and she felt them. She could feel them whole again. Fakira turned her head to the side and could see her wings were normal again. She could grow once again. Fakira wasted no time and she willed herself to grew to eighty feet tall. Fakira stood on her feet and twirled around a few times in joy. She was her normal height once more.

"Fakira," Fakira heard a familiar voice below her. Fakira looked down and saw a small Felix looking up at her. Fakira's old self took over and she smiled evilly at the human below her. Fakira bent down and clutched the small boy in her hand and lifted him to her face. The human was petrified with fear.

"Now I can finally eat you," Fakira stated showing all her teeth.

"Fakira, you don't want to do that," Felix informed her.

"Why not? I'm bigger than you. I can do whatever I want with you. You're not even a person," Fakira stated.

"Fakira! Put Felix down!" Ted demanded from the hill. He had an arrow aimed at Fakira. Fakira just smiled and made a flicking motion with her free hand. Ted was pushed to a tree and he was hit hard. He dropped his bow and arrow and stayed on his hands and knees to recover.

Fakira turned her attention back to Felix and said, "Now, back to you and your voyage to my stomach."

"Please, Fakira. You don't want to do this," Felix told her.

"You have no idea what I want to do, human!" Fakira hissed and she used her other hand to pinch the back of Felix's shirt. She dangled him and opened her mouth as wide as she could. Felix grabbed the top teeth and straddled her thick tongue when he was placed on top of it. Fakira could easily push Felix in, but she teased by using as little force as she could with her fingers first.

"Fakira, please," Felix pleaded, "I thought you changed."

"I only pretended," Fakira informed Felix.

"No, you didn't!" Felix argued, "We saved your life!"

"I only used you," Fakira replied.

"That's not true," Felix continued to argue, "I'm a person Fakira."

"Your prey," Fakira argued as she bent her tongue and pushed his back with the tip.

"People are judged by their intelligence, Fakira, remember?" Felix cried out.

Fakira's new self began to take hold as she listened to Felix's words. "Don't you remember everything we went through. All three of us were slaves to Lord William. We all suffered the same punishments, we all shared the same feelings. We escaped together and Ted and I saved you from the poison and the bandit. Don't you remember the nightmare you had Fakira?" Felix questioned.

Fakira remembered the nightmare very well and started to understand Felix was in her position when she was in the nightmare. Felix was going through the same emotions she had had. "You mother in that dream was going to eat you because she believed you were prey. She was going to eat her own daughter just because you were little. You don't believe you were a prey, right. You were just a little person, just like Ted and I."

Tears fell down Fakira's eyes as she realized what she was doing. She was eating a person. She was become the monster from her dreams. "Fakira, I'm your friend. I could have left you and Ted and I could have escaped alone, but I couldn't let that happen. I like you Fakira and I couldn't leave you alone in that cell. Are you going to eat a friend Fakira?"

1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
The leader of the small group of fairies looked at his comrades. They were still a bunch of mischievous little pranksters. Dalil, the leader of the group, sighed. "I can't complain," Dalil thought, "All fairies start that way. Some don't even grow out of it. Then again, the mischievous ones are the better at driving out the humans. They always have better ideas."

"Alright youngsters," Dalil started.

"Will you stop calling us young? We're all about the same age," a female fairy pointed out. The other three fairies agreed with the female.

"That maybe true, but I'm the leader of this squad and you're still a bunch of children in my mind," Dalil stated.

"Just because you're 'mature'?" another fairy questioned, "I remember when we were in school and learning how to drive out humans, you were a wild and crazy..."

"Don't remind me, and let's focus on the task at hand," Dalil interrupted, "We need to get these humans to the giant fairy. If the giant fairy still doesn't harm the humans and still sees them as a friend, then the giant my be trusted. If her species is like ours, she might be obligated to help us."

"What about the humans?" a normal quiet female fairy in the back questioned. Her name was Solita and she was the only fairy in the squad close to Dalil maturity. However, she was always very quiet. This could be understandable since her parents were both killed by humans. Solita had seen the whole thing. Somehow, some bratty human kids came into the woods and... Solita couldn't even make herself think about what had happened.

"I understand your distrust for humans Solita, but not all are like the boys who..." Dalil started.

"Then why has every human we met either tried to bring harm to the forest or our village?" Solita.

"Because usually, only the evil ones are the ones brave enough to enter," Dalil stated.

"If these humans are brave enough to enter then..." Solita started.

Dalil quickly interrupted, "These humans seemed to befriend a fairy, a giant fairy I might add. You've heard the tales of Felaryan fairies from the elders. If the humans can befriends such a monster who just eats anything smaller than her, then either this fairy is more like us or the humans are just that kind."

Solita still didn't like the idea and the others were uncomfortable with the serious conversation. "Are we going to lead them to the fairy or not?" a fairy questioned.

Suddenly, a fairy scout returned and announced, "The giant fairy went to the meadow. She's stilling down and crying to herself."

"I think there might be a way we can lead these humans to the giant fairy," Dalil informed them, "We still should stay hidden and study them for a while longer to see what their intentions are. We can lead them to her without showing ourselves."

"How?" a fairy questioned.

"We'll make a chain and increase the sound of the giant's crying. It will lead the humans to her," Dalil explained. The fairies understood the concept and making a sound louder than it should be was easy magic. The six fairies spread out in a long chain and used their magic to increase the noise of the giant fairy. The fairies had used a similar method when they tried to make humans lost by making the sounds come from an opposite direction. Only this time, they were making it lead in the right direction.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------

"We have to get to her," Felix said, "She needs us more than ever. She's in a major conflict with her old and new self. Her old self wants to eat us because we're small and her new self must realize we're people and friends. She's in the middle between those conflicting views and at a critical point."

"I understand that Felix," Ted replied, "But how are we going to find her? She's her giant height and could easily have traveled too far for us to reach her. She could still be on the move for all we know. We'll never catch up. We don't even know the direction she left to."

"I know but..." Felix began to argue, but he cut himself off when her heard a crying voice. Ted heard it too and looked for the source, but couldn't find it. "That's Fakira!" Felix exclaimed, "We have to follow it and..."

"Wait!" Ted ordered as he grabbed Felix's wrist, "It could be a trap."

"What do you mean?" Felix questioned, "You think that Fakira..."

"I never said it might be Fakira's trap," Ted explained, "But it could be the fairies living in this forest. They could be mimicking Fakira's voice and leading us into a trap. These fairies ever every right to want to drive out humans and distrust us."

"Why?" Felix questioned.

"Old growth forest is the best kind of wood for fuel," Ted informed Felix, "These trees are highly valuable. I won't be surprised if every nearby human village has tried to make a profit out of the wood, especially when it takes hundreds upon hundreds of years to make an old growth forest."

"But we have to try, it's the only lead we have," Felix pleaded.

Ted thought carefully and decided to follow the voice with Felix. He only hoped that the fairies weren't playing a trick on them.

Both Ted and Felix were relieved to find her, Felix for finding his friend and Ted for knowing this isn't a trick by the fairies.

"I'm a monster . . . . I can't go home or I would be a monster," Fakira sobbed, not noticing her visitors as they approached her giant frame.

"Fakira!" Felix called out, "You aren't a monster!" Slowly Fakira's head rose and looked at her companions.

"But I let my other half take over," Fakira sobbed, "I was about to eat the two of you because at that moment I thought you were both prey. My old self is still within me and I'm too dangerous to be around."

"But you didn't eat us, Fakira. You took control and stopped yourself from doing it," Felix informed her.

"But what if I lose control of myself again?" Fakira questioned. Fakira began to remember how Felix tasted. Felix was one of the greatest things she had ever tasted and Fakira was worried she'd try to eat him again because of that. "I don't wish to harm either of you. You're the only true friends I have in this world," Fakira cried.

"That's why you will stay in control and not harm us," Ted pointed out, "You're worried about hurting us. You don't want anything to happen to us because you see us as friends and people. You'll do anything to keep us safe, including keeping control of yourself. You're not dangerous for us to be around."

Fakira was shocked by Ted's confidence in her and she asked, "You don't see me as a monster?"

"You're not the same fairy I first met. I know you know realize that even little beings can be people. I know now that you won't eat 'little' people," Ted told her.

Fakira was overwhelmed with joy. The little humans were really her friends and they had confidence in her control. They risked their lives to be with her. She could have been controlled by her old self and they could have been eaten, but they came to find her anyway and comfort her. "They are really my friends. I can't let anything bad happen to them. I will protect them and keep them safe," Fakira promised to herself.

Fakira reached down and grabbed Felix and Ted in different hands. She was still not completely used to them being people, since they were so small, and she didn't ask if she could pick them up. She just reached down, wrapped a set of fingers around each one, and picked them up without any consent.

This scared Felix and Ted slightly. (It scared Ted a little more since he had never been picked up by a giantess, let alone a Felaryan.) Fakira moved her legs away from her chest, but still kept them bent up. Fakira moved each hand to her stomach and pressed both humans against her stomach. Fakira them moved her legs closer in and bent down to give them a firm, without crushing them, hug. Felix and Ted quickly realized what Fakira was only hugging them and they calmed down and hugged as much of her as they could back.

The hug continued for a very long time and it seemed like it would never end. But eventually, Fakira sat straight up and set her legs down in a crossed position. Fakira them lifted Felix and Ted off her stomach and set one on each lap. Fakira stared down at them much calmer and happier.

"Well, that was a different and very rewarding experience," Ted commented and Felix agreed.

"I'm glad you liked it... Ted and Felix," Fakira replied.

"However, could you warn us before you just pick us up?" Ted questioned, "It's kind of scary."

Fakira quickly realized what Ted meant and she replied, "You're right, I wouldn't have licked being suddenly picked up without any warning or giving consent to do so, no matter how nice the giant might be. I understand your request and I will try to remember to ask you two before I pick you up again. I'm just used to picking up humans without consent because I always thought they weren't... well... you know."

"It's understandable," Ted replied.

"Do you still wish to go to your home world?" Felix questioned.

"I'm not sure if I want to anymore," Fakira answered, "You two are great friends. I don't want to leave either of you and I'd have to bring you if I went home, but it's too dangerous for both of you. My clan wouldn't see you as people. Plus, I don't want my old self to come back. It might be better is I stay here."

There was a few moments of silence and Felix and Ted just sat on the giantess's comfortable lap. Ted suddenly said, "I'm sorry for calling you a monster so many times."

"It's alright," Fakira assured him, "I was a monster. Everything you told me helped me realize how much of a monster I really was. I should be thanking you for that and I'm the one who should be sorry. I treated you and Felix as if you weren't people. Even when I treated you two so terribly, you both were kind enough to me and you both saved my life many times. I'm sorry for not realizing this sooner and I'm sorry for treating you so terribly."

"Apology accepted," Ted replied.

"We forgive you," Felix added.

Fakira smiled happily down at the two kind humans on her lap. She knew she had picked two great humans that would be her friends till the day they died. She couldn't have picked two better humans. Fakira reached down to pick both of them up again and hug them. She noticed both cringed when her hands were about a foot away from them. Fakira stopped her hands and asked, "May I pick the two of you up? I want to hug both of you again."

Felix and Ted nodded. Fakira happily picked them up and brought them into another warm embrace. After the hug, Fakira placed the two humans on the ground and stood up. "I think I should get dressed into my mother's dress," Fakira informed them, "It's more comfortable than these human clothes." Fakira took the human sized dress out of her pocket and grew it to it's natural size. The dress was pretty clean since Fakira always washed it when they got the chance. "I can trust that the two of you won't peek, right?" Fakira questioned teasingly.

Felix and Ted turned their backs to Fakira and Fakira turned around as well, just in case. Fakira quickly undressed out of her human clothes and...

"I have to think about it," Fakira replied, "I understand what you're saying and I know my mother cares about me, but her and the rest of the clan think humans are snacks. They would never understand the true meaning of a person. They might disown me or try to change me back to my old self if they find out I see you as friends."

"Wouldn't your mother or your friends respect your decision?" Felix asked.

"I'm not sure anymore," Fakira answered, "My friends are usually respected of my other friends. Some of my friends don't get along, but they all understand I have other friends too, and they respect my decision, but I don't know what they'd do if they see that two of my friends are humans. No fairy has ever come back to the clan with a human as a friend. None have even brought a human back as a pet. I don't know what the clans reactions will be."

"I have heard stories of humans befriending Felaryan top predators. There have been stories of nagas and giant neckos that had been abandoned by their parents and raised by humans. Those Felaryans become friends with other top predators as well as humans," Ted informed Fakira, "Though the top predator friends still eat humans, they respect the top predator who had been raised by humans and don't harm their human friends. They've even been known to see the humans as friends as well."

"I hope my clan would be like that, but I'm still unsure," Fakira replied.

"What about you mother?" Felix asked.

"She's usually stubborn with her beliefs. I fear she might eat you or shove you down my throat to prove her point," Fakira cried at the thought of her mother doing so to her friends, "I want you be with you two, but going to my world will be extremely dangerous to you. What if we can't go back through the portal to get back here? I might not be able to protect both of you all the time and the thought of one of you or both of you being eaten by a Felaryan would make me feel guilty for taking you there. I can't bear losing either of you."

Ted and Felix heard the sincerity in Fakira's voice when she said the last sentence. Fakira looked down at her lap while trying to erase the images of Ted and Felix being eaten by fairies of her clan or neighboring nagas that Fakira had befriended. "I would die if Felix and Ted were eaten by one of my Felaryan friends," Fakira thought.

From the sincerity of Fakira's voice and the sadness in her eyes when she imagined Ted and Felix being eaten, any remaining doubt in Felix or Ted's minds about Fakira's friendship was shattered right then and there. It was clear that Fakira saw them as her friends and people. Once one as a friend to a Felaryan fairy, they were always a friend of that fairy. Felaryan fairies were extremely loyal like Nagas and once you were just a slight friend of a fairy, you are automatically deemed a close friend, kind of like a best friend in human culture. It was obvious that Fakira would never harm them now, and she would do everything in her power to protect them from harm. She had come a very long way since they had first met her in her cell at Lord William's castle. Fakira was a changed person, no longer the monster that only viewed people her size as people. Now, she knew that creatures with intelligence were people and it didn't matter what their size was.

Felix approached one of Fakira's knees. It was very easy to reach since she was sitting on the back of her ankles with her shins on the ground. Felix touched the bare knee, (her dress only came down just above the knee), and Felix then stroked it. Fakira stopped and looked at Felix. A few weeks ago, Fakira would have swatted the human like a bug, but now was different. Felix was her friend and it was obvious he was only trying to comfort her. Soon, the strokes began calming Fakira down and returned the favor by rubbing Felix's back with her pointer finger.

"You'll at least think about it, right?" Felix asked, "If your mother really loves you, you need to at least say goodbye."

"I know, but what if..." Fakira worried.

"You'd do whatever it takes to protect us though, wouldn't you?" Ted questioned.

Fakira strongly answered, "I would use all my power to protect you two if I have to. You two saved me from so many things, including myself. If I wouldn't have met you, I'd still be in Lord William's cell and I would be a monster, still eating humans and not realizing they're people. I need to keep you safe after everything you've done for me."

"Then you shouldn't have to worry about protecting us, because with that determination, I'm sure you'll keep us plenty safe," Ted assured her.

Fakira paused and thought about the truth in Ted's words. After a long pause, Fakira sighed, "I still have to think long and hard on the matter before making a final decision."

Suddenly, a growl as deep and loud as a dragon's growl permeated the air around them. Felix and Ted knew right away were it had come from and they looked up at Fakira who looked down and away while blushing. "Are either of you hungry too?" Fakira asked.

Both humans nodded and the giantess fairy looked around while still sitting. Her eyes eventually found something trying to bolt away. Fakira caught the creature with her telekinesis and levitated it to her. The creature was a large boar. Fakira grabbed the boar when it was close enough and easily twisted its neck. Once the beast was dead. She laid it on the ground and grew it till it was large enough for her to eat a meal from.

Felix had already started a fire by making it with a spell and the flame was levitating in the air, waiting for the meat to cook. Fakira smiled and commented, "You're fire skills seem to be coming to you naturally."

"So far, it's the only spell that seems natural to me," Felix replied, "You think one of my ancestors was a creature that could control fire?"

"We don't even know if you bloodline gained magic that way," Ted said, "Your ancestors could have gained magic a different way other than mating with a magical creature."

"Yet somehow, that explanation seems right to me. What creatures were natural fire casters?" Felix asked.

"Many creatures can cast fire. It's one of the most common powers between magical creatures." Ted explained, "However, the creatures best at it would be dragons, elementals, kitsunes, phoenix, and a few others that seemed to have slipped my mind. I know way too many creatures to remember them all at the moment."

Fakira cut a piece of meat big enough for both Felix and Ted to eat and levitated it down to Felix. Felix caught it with his telekinesis and cooked it over the levitating flames. Once it was finished cooking, Felix cut it in half and gave one half to Ted. Felix and Ted ate as Fakira ripped into the boar.

Felix watched Fakira eat the boar she had grown and it gave Felix an idea. "Fakira, you can grow things, could you turn us into giants if we go to Felarya? Will that keep us safe?" Felix suggested.

Fakira paused and thought about it for a while. There were such things as giants in Felarya and she could grow both of them large enough for people to believe their giants. However, there was a small problem with the suggestion. "Probably not," Fakira answered, "There are better magic wielders than me and they could detect spells. They would realize you're only giants because of a spell and they would shrink you back down."

"But, if we're their size with the spell wouldn't they see us as people?" Felix questioned.

"My clan judges you as a person by your original size. If you're originally smaller than us, despite having a current giant size, they would see you as prey," Fakira stated, "But that's wrong. You can't help it if you're smaller than us, you can't change your species or original height. Your size shouldn't make you any less of a person than you are."

"So, if your clan judges on your original height, your nightmare would have never come true," Felix pointed out.

"True, but I'm glad I did have that nightmare," Fakira replied as she recalled the nightmare where her mother tried to eat her, "If I wouldn't have had that nightmare, I would have never experienced what it is like to be a person, but large people only see you as a snack, just because you're smaller. I would have never realized what it was like to be a human in my world."

"What?" Ted asked, yawning. He spotted the brightly lit fairy in front of his eyes.

"We should get ready to move," Dalil said. Ted grumbled a little. After a few nights of waking when he wanted to, being forced to wake was momentary reminder of Lord William's castle.

"Fine," Ted said, before nudging Felix, who took a few minutes to wake as well. Once he was awake, they set upon waking Fakira. They freed themselves from the hands and walked towards her giant head.

"Fakira!" Felix called, causing the giantess to stir.

"Felix . . ." Fakira mumbled.

"Fakira, Dalil wants us moving again," Ted chimed in. The giantess fairy did not want to wake. The smell of the ancient wood and sleeping peacefully reminded of her home and let her sleep peacefully.

"Now?" Fakira asked aloud.

"Yes," Felix said. He heard Fakira sigh as she rose upright and looked down at her friends.

"May we get some breakfast first?" she asked, yawning still.

"I already captured a beast for you," Dalil said to Ted, "It's by her foot." Ted pointed the bound boar out to Fakira and she grew it like before and Felix cooked the meat for himself and Ted.

"Has Telim returned?" Ted asked.

"No, but by the time we reach Luto's domain, the barrier should let you in," Dalil said. Ted nodded and finished his meat as Fakira shrunk to a height still taller than her friends. Dahil smiled and they set off.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Meanwhile, in the southern part of the forest dark mages and soldiers continued to try and penetrate the barrier.

"Damn it! Why won't this barrier break?" one soldier asked, breathing deeply from his failed attempt at entry by one of the mages using a magic shield to try and get him in. It failed.

"Because the fairies are tapping into the power of the woods and making a barrier we never thought they'd make," one mage replied.

"Which is why I came to this place a head of schedule," came a voice from behind the two. Both froze with fear and turned to see Lord William behind them. And behind him, in the camp a ways behind them, several dead bodies.

"My-My lord," the mage started, "We tried everything." Lord William looked at him with uncaring dark eyes.

"Not everything. I told you to break the barrier at any cost," Lord William said darkly, before shooting a small orb of darkness at the guard. "Get the bodies arranged over here in the form for the Darkill Ritual," Lord William commanded. His mage servant nodded and rand, fearing he would be added to the ritual as this powerful rite could be used to penetrate even the strongest defense, provided enough bodies were used. But unlike most magic, this rite was best done in darkness and he wondered if Lord William would wait that long.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Dark Clouds Approach

choices: The village is very frightened, but they trust Fakira when she defends it.
The village is a little hesitant, but gets used to Fakira and the humans quickly
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
"Unfortunately, this spell is stronger at night when the moon shines down upon us," Lord William muttered to himself, "This fairy magic is stronger than I thought. I might need the spell's full strength to bring this wall down."

With that, Lord William waited for nightfall, but he prepared all the things needed for the spell so they could preform it the second the sun was gone and the moon shone.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -

Dalil lead the two humans and giant fairy to the village. It was around noontime now and they were close to the barrier. "We're very close the the village," Dalil commented, "You three are faster than I thought. We made excellent time." It was hard to keep up with a fairy. They zipped around much faster than a small bug. In all honesty, fairies were probably the fastest fliers around relative to the speed and size. Because of their small size, larger fliers could easily catch up, but if a fairy were their size, they could never be caught.

"Dalil, why are there other fairies surrounding us?" Fakira questioned. Dalil stopped and flew in midair, his wings beating like a hummingbird, while turning around to look at the three travelers. "Dalil, I can sense other fairies in the trees ever since we started heading for your village," Fakira stated.

"They are my squad and we found the three of you together. They just following as a precaution," Dalil explained.

"You're still worried that I would eat you," Fakira muttered, "I understand, not too long ago I was just like my clan members. Eating people just because of their size difference. However, I am not like that anymore."

Dalil flew over to Fakira and hovered in front of her face. "I know you are not like that anymore, Fakira," Dalil assured her, "I see how friendly you are to Felix and Ted and a can tell you're a good person. I know you wouldn't try eating us, it's only a precaution that something bad might happen."

Dalil then started fly off ahead of them. "At least they can stop hiding. I know they're there," Fakira stated. With that statement, there were a few giggles form the tree and some fairies darted in front of the three new travelers, but then went back to hiding in the trees. They were too fast for Ted and Felix to see, like bugs zipping and buzzing around them. It was as if they had made a game out of it like they were trying to zip past them without being noticed or caught.

"At least they're not putting spells on us," Ted whispered to Felix.

Suddenly, Dalil flew past the barrier, but Ted and Felix ran into it and were met by an invisible wall. They hit it hard enough to step back and fall on their butts. Fakira quickly crouched next to them and asked, "You alright?" They nodded and Fakira yelled, "Why is the barrier still up? Surely she's told your elder about us."

"Maybe Elder Telim is having troubles convincing Elder Luto," Dalil suggested as he flew back to Fakira, Ted, and Felix.

"So what do you do now?" Fakira questioned.

"We can only wait," Dalil told them, "We're close to the village now."

Fakira sat down between Felix and Ted while Dalil landed on a large flower and sat a top of it. "You fairies must be very light," Felix commented.

"We don't have to worry about fat at least," Dalil replied.

Felix noticed the fairies that had followed them still stayed in the trees. "They aren't going to come down, are they?" Felix asked.

"They're still a little worried. Especially Solita," Dalil explained.

"Whose Solita?" Fakira asked, "And why would she be more worried than the others?"

"Let's just say she has good reason to distrust humans," Dalil replied, not wanting to reveal her secret to them.

"So this is the Felaryan," they heard a voice say.

They all looked to the barrier and just behind it, hovering, were Elder Telim and Elder Luto. Luto actually looked like an old man with a full length white beard. Since fairies aged like elves, Luto must have been ancient.

"My name is Fakira," Fakira introduced, "And this is Felix and Ted, my friends."

"Friends, eh? Don't you mean supplies or pets or slaves?" Elder Luto questioned.

"I know you have reason to distrust me because I'm a Felaryan and there was a time I used to see the definition of a person differently," Fakira replied, "But I am like that no longer. I see the error of my definition. The size of a person can't be the only thing determining if the a person is a person or not. It should be what's on the inside."

"They really are her friends," Elder Telim stood up for Fakira, "Even when she's a giant, she treats them as equals."

"Or it could all be an act and they're her slaves," Elder Luto suggested.

"I could never make Felix and Ted my slaves, not when I was one myself," Fakira informed the elders.

"There are very few cultures in Felarya that have slavery. How did you...?" Elder Luto began to question.

"Lord William captured me and tried to make me his slave. It was terrible, but I was only a slave for a few weeks. Felix and Ted were slaves for years," Fakira stated.

"That's why you three are determined to help us and stop Lord William," Dalil interrupted.

"He is a terribly evil man and I would like nothing better than to see him stopped," Fakira growled, "I can't let anyone else suffer like I had."

"You said you used to be like the other Felaryans, what changed you?" Luto questioned.

"Felix and Ted did," Fakira answered, putting an arm on each of their shoulders, "Ted taught me the real definition of a human and explained why size shouldn't be the determining factor. Felix was the kindest to me and never stopped being nice and helping me despite my wickedness towards him before. Both of them saved my life and helped me despite me possibly eating them if I grew. There were more reasons, but they are the main ones. They showed me the truth and I'm glad I met them, otherwise I'd still be the monster I was before."

Luto was examining Fakira closely, trying to find any lies, but there was on truth. Luto began to believe and said, "I believe you, Fakira, and you may enter our village and help us rid us of the evil."

With that, Fakira, Felix, and Ted were granted permission and was suddenly able to pass through the spell wall. They all headed towards the village. How would it react?
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Interigations

choices: The spell we use to fight off Felaryans."
A staff made from a fallen branch of the Twelve Trees."
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
As the friends were escorted towards the village, Ted saw the trees were getting larger and larger. The light that fell through the canopy was lessening by the foot.

"Even if Fakira flew us here, I doubt she could have gotten through it," Ted thought as he looked at the canopy. But for Felix and Fakira, they noticed something Ted could not.

"Fakira, I feel tingly," Felix said, looking at his hands, expecting to see mites on them.

"I do as well," Fakira said, "I'm guessing it's the ancient magic here. It's everywhere."

"Correct," Dalil said, "Even the weakest being who can use some magic would sense the magic in this land. The fairies in this village have fought more enemies than many of the others combined."

Felix was about to speak when they reached the main village. In a small grove where light once stood, twelve trees encircled it. And on each tree were homes placed on them and strange glowing fungi, as there seemed to be no sunlight. The homes went up the trees, being the point Ted and Felix could see them properly.

"Were those the first trees?" Fakira asked.

"Yes," Elder Luto said, "It was from them my grandparents helped grow the forest outward."

"Amazing," Felix said as he felt the magic radiating from them. In some of the closer homes, Ted saw heads pop in and out of windows.

"Your people do not trust us, do they?" Ted asked.

"My dear human, you are the first welcomed human guests to this grove in hundreds of years," Elder Luto said, "They don't trust you as far as they could throw her at her huge size."

"That would make me uneasy," Felix said, when Elder Telim coughed.

"As wondrous as this is, I believe we should help prepare them to fight?" Elder Telim offered.

"Yes, that would be wise," Elder Luto said, "Scouts on the edge report a new man has arrived and he is amassing dead bodies for some ritual."

"What does this man look like?" Ted asked.

"He is a tall human, hair black as coal and his eyes have no soul. They also said he used dark magic to kill one of the soldiers and everyone cowers from him," Elder Luto said, watching the worried looks on the new comers faces. "It's the evil man, isn't?"

"It sounds like Lord William," Ted growled.

"Then we shouldn't wait a moment," Elder Luto said, "Your quiver and bow young warrior." Ted removed them and put them down. The Elders placed their hands on them and the objects glowed. "When you protect nature, it protects you. In these woods, your string will not break and your quiver will never run empty."

"Thank you," Ted said, as the elders looked at Felix.

"What magics do you know, young mage?" Elder Telim asked

"I know a cutting spell and and how to conjure fire and levitate it from already existing source," Ted said, "I seem to have an affinity with fire and cutting."

"Wind and fire based," Elder Luto said, "Impressive. Not many have those anymore."

"I will teach you some more spells that should suit you," Elder Telim said, "This way." Felix was hesitant for a second, then followed the Elder away from his friends.

"And as for you Fakira," Elder Luto said, "For your helping us, we give you . . ."
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Preparations

choices: Yes, he battled with his troups.
No, he sensed something was wrong and stayed back, just in case.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
"...a staff made from a fallen branch of the Twelve Trees," Elder Luto finished. As Elder Luto hovered in mid air, he offered his own staff to Fakira.

Fakira shook her head and said, "I can't possibly accept that. It's that yours?"

"Don't worry, child," Elder Luto, "I have more of these at home. Take it."

Fakira put her hand out with her palm facing upward right beneath Elder Luto. Elder Luto dropped the staff in Fakira's palm which looked littler than a twig to her. Soon, Fakira grew the staff so that it was the right size for a staff for her. Instantly, she felt the magic in the staff increase and inpower her. She had never felt so strong with magic.

"The staff can act as a reserve and hold magic for you. So when you're low on magic, you can draw the magic from the staff to replenish your energy," Elder Luto explained.

"So, if the staff reserves magic, how does the magic get stored in it. There got to be a way to put more magic in it when she uses some from it, right?" Ted asked.

"She can put some of her own magic in the staff or she can just go in an ancient forest. If this staff is in an ancient forest that contain trees like the Twelve Trees, then magic from that forest will go in the staff till the staff is full," Elder Luto answered, "Plus that staff increases Fakira's magical abilities and makes her stronger when she wields it."

"And the reserves and the magical increase in my will grow as well if I grow the staff with me?" Fakira questioned.

"The magic and the magic it can store will increase in proportion to its size," Elder Luto informed Fakira.

"And I can use it to aim my spells by sending the spell through the staff. In case some spells need to be more accurate, I'd be able to aim with my staff," Fakira commented.

"You seem to know a lot about magical weapons," Elder Luto commented.

"My grandfather uses a magical staff, because he's not as powerful as he used to be and needs the reserves of magic in the staff for most spells," Fakira explained.

"How powerful did that staff make you?" Ted asked Fakira.

"I feel as though I'm as strong as my mother now with this staff," Fakira informed Ted, "That's a big difference from what my magical powers used to be. If I become my giant size, I don't think even Lord William can defeat me."

"You must really trust her to give her such power," Ted said.

"I've seen many Felaryan Fairies in my time, and none were like Fakira. She is very different from the others. I know I can trust her," Elder Luto explained. Ted and Fakira were still shocked that Elder Luto would give Fakira such power without even knowing her and Elder Luto continued to explain, "I can look into people's hearts and find out their true intentions. I sense no evil plans coming from Fakira. I can tell that, despite our size difference, she sees everyone here as equals. I know I can trust her."

"Once Elder Telim is done teaching Felix the spells, we we have to start formulating a plan to stop this invasion," Elder Luto informed them.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------

Eventually, night fell and Lord William preformed his dark magic. There was a pile of about fifteen men, no big deal when he had more than enough soldiers to attack some little fairies. Lord William stood in front of the pile and began the incantation. After many minutes, blood squirted out of the bodies and solidified into long red tentacles. The men behind Lord William were scared of the tentacles which only made Lord William laugh.

The tentacles morphed together to make two very large tentacles. Then, Lord William lifted both of his arms, having full control of the two blood tentacles. Lord William stared at the spell wall made by the fairies and slammed both his hands downwards. The tentacles repeated Lord William's actions and shattered the fairy wall.

"Soon, I will be the strongest sorcerer in the land, and there is no one that can stop me," Lord William muttered.

Did Lord William go in the forest with his troops?
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Trust / Breach

choices: Fakira gets to test her words as they run into the Lord soon after
There is still much distance between them and Lord William.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Lord William grinned as he watched his men storm into the forest, heading towards the ancient source of magic in the land. He chuckled as he entered, feeling the power radiating from inside the forest. He knew each platoon of men had a mage to help lead them to the desired location. He moved in with an arrogant stride, embracing the darkness around him.

Behind him, a bright full moon began its rise that evening.

------------------------------------------------

The soldiers and mages moved carefully into the woods. They had not seen any fairies as of yet.

"Think we scared them off?" one soldier asked, grinning. But before the mage could respond, they had come upon a large pack of wolves. On some wolves stood fairies, who were smiling. They spoke in some strange tongue the humans could not understand and the wolves attacked.

--------------------------------------------------

"So other creatures of the forest are aiding you as well?" Ted asked as Dalil led the three friends to fight. Dalil's platoon of fairies were following them from behind.

"Yes," Dalil said, "We normally try and avoid the wolves or bears as they try to kill us but even they understand what would happen if the evil man succeeds."

"And our mission is to take on Lord William himself?" Felix asked, fear evident in his voice.

"You three are the most capable next to the elders to face such a monster," Dalil said, looking at Felix, "The protection spells Talim told you are strong and will help you protect yourself and your friends."

"And with this staff, I will be more than able to fight against him," Fakira said, smiling. Felix looked at Fakira.

"All right. Let's get going," Felix said with more confidence.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------

Lord William walked over the corpses of his fallen men when he heard growling come around him. He saw bears appear with small fairies near them. Before the bears could react, Lord William short a dark energy, killing the lead bear, enraging the others.

"Such pathetic creatures," Lord William muttered as the bears swarmed around him.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------

"Look humans!" one soldier called, seeing Felix, Ted, and Fakira. The three moved to hide behind some trees as arrows flew at them. Dalil seethed.

"Those arrows are hurting the trees," he seethed. He rose to go attack, wen Fakira put her hand up.

"I'll make them small enough to even the fight," Fakira said, coming out from behind the tree. She focused on her shrinking spell and pushed it through her staff.

Felix and Ted watched as the soldiers grew smaller and smaller, and at the same time, sadistic chuckles and giggles came from their fairy guards before they flew off to torment the human soldiers before killing them.

"Do you think you could shrink Lord William?" Ted asked Fakira when she returned.

"He is powerful but I'm sure of it," Fakira said.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Battle of the Full Moon

choices: The group runs into General Ethan.
The group makes it through to Lord William.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Fakira peeked around the tree and could see Lord William, but he was on the other side of the clearing and many soldiers and fairies were in between Lord William and the squad ordered to defeat Lord William. Fakira could also see Lord William mercilessly killing anyone and any creature that tried to attack him. None of the small fairies of the animals could withstand the evil magic coursing through Lord William's body.

The odd thing that Fakira noticed while she stared was that Lord William wasn't getting tired from his magic. In fact, he even had enough strength to fight with his sword as well as his magic. This worried Fakira a little, because it almost seemed as though Lord William's magic was endless, he wasn't loosing as much energy as he should have from the terribly powerful spells he was casting. "Where is he getting his energy from?" Fakira wondered.

Fakira got her magic from her wings which absorb magic from the air, and since the rate of magic that flowed into her wings varied depending on if she was in a magical place or not, made it so that the magic in her wings were not endless. There always had to be a limit to the amount of magic one could do, otherwise, if their wasn't, that magic user would be a god. Focusing back on the task at hand, Fakira examined Lord William and what he was wearing. Fakira couldn't see or sense any magical charm on him which meant Lord William must have been drawing magic like all other magic humans. This meant that he should be drawing magic from his life force. Many magical creatures had to do that, but it was much more dangerous for a human to have to do that. Humans were weaker creatures and had the tendency to not know what spells would be to demanding and end up being drained of life from a spell. Humans weren't meant to use magic, but sometimes, something unnatural does occur granting a human magical blood.

However, Lord William wasn't getting tired from drawing from his life force and strength. "He's just either a strong human or just has a large inner magical storage," Fakira tried to assure herself, "He still won't be a match for me. I'm a Felaryan Fairy and he's only a small human."

"So, what's the plan?" Felix openly asked the group.

Felix's question caused Fakira to snap out of her deep thoughts and replied, "We fight our way to him and kill him."

"That's it? That's your plan?" Ted questioned.

"We can take him," Fakira tried to assure Ted, "We have seven fairies in Dalil's squad, a mage, an archer, and a Felaryan Fairy. We're more than enough to defeat him."

"We don't know what he's capable of. We shouldn't be underestimating him," Ted said, "It's best we sneak up to him and catch him by surprise."

"The longer we take, the more fairies and animals will die," Fakira argued.

Dalil flew between Fakira and Ted and interrupted, "I understand both of your points, but Fakira, are you completely positive you can defeat Lord William?"

"I believe I'm more powerful than, and even if he is more powerful than I think he is, I can always grow myself to my giant height. My magic's intensity increases at the same rate as my body. Things much smaller than me will be far weaker than me, even Lord William," Fakira assured the group.

"It makes sense that you'd be more powerful than him as a giant fairy. if we can't defeat him when you're human sized, we'll surely be able to when you're a giantess," Dalil agreed.

"It still might be better for us to sneak up on Lord William, just in case," Ted suggested.

"I understand your concern, Ted, but I think we can do this. Look, there is a gap in the fighting over there and the soldiers are too engrossed in the battle," Fakira pointed out, "We can get through that quickly and get to Lord William."

Ted only sighed and replied, "Let's go."

Fakira lead the group with Felix and then Ted behind her. The fairies in Dalil's squad flew all around Fakira, Felix, and Ted and stayed close. The only one that didn't stay as close was Solita who still didn't trust the humans, even though she learned that the humans and the Felarian had been slaves to Lord William and had every intention of helping the fairies and killing Lord William once and for all.

The group rushed through the widest gap in the battle. Fakira was right about the soldiers being too engrossed in battle. The fairies they were fighting were tricky beings and flew around the soldiers while annoying them and hexing them. Most soldiers were to busy swinging wildly in the air to try and hit the darting fairies, but very few could achieve that task and most hit one of their own men. Many of the fairies found this amusing, especially Solita who hated the humans for trying to destroy their home. Solita even stopped to watch the human soldiers die, she was too engrossed that she didn't see a human behind her.

"Solita!" one of the fairies from Dalil's squad cried out, causing the other fairies of the squad and the three humans sized beings to stop and turn around. Solita snapped out of her trance and turned to see a sword swinging at her. Solita tried to dodge, but the sword got a head start on her. She dodged it mostly, but part of one of her wings was chipped off, making it much harder to fly.

Ted, being the closest to Solita at that moment, fired an arrow at the man, making direct contact with his neck. Instead of drawing another arrow, Ted rushed forward to Solita. She was barely able to hover in the air and would soon plummet to the ground. Luckily, just as she started falling, Ted made it to her and caught her in the palm of his hand. Solita was truly and utterly surprised by the human's action. She had thought she was going to die, but a human, of all creatures, saved her life. Solita was in too much shock and disbelief that she couldn't think of anything to say. She just sat in the human's hand and stared up at him.

"What's wrong? Is your wing hurt?" Ted questioned.

Solita only nodded as she stared up at the giant. Ted quickly made it back to the group with Solita in his hand. Dalil quickly landed in Ted's hand as well and examined Solita. "Solita, what were you thinking?" Dalil demanded.

Solita didn't answer Dalil's question but only muttered, "The human... saved me."

Dalil could tell that she was shocked by the fact a human had saved her. She had lost her parents to bratty human teens that attacked the fairy village just because the fairies were smaller than them. Solita had never seen human kindness and was young when she saw her parents die such a brutal death. The teenagers had captured Solita and her parents, ripped their wings off and squished her parents before her eyes. Then they forced Solita to lead them to the fairy village. It was a horrible experience and easily traumatized her.

Dalil examined Solita's wing and called up to Felix, "Can you heal her wing?" Felix nodded and healed her wing without much any troubles. Dalil took to the air and Solita was hesitant in doing so, but eventually did and stayed closer to the group, especially the human that saved her life, Ted.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Fight to Lord William

choices: Because they were distracted, neither man realized Fakira was shrinking them.
An enraged Fakira grows to her max to kill the the first humans she met
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
As the group pushed on, the distance between them and the dark lord was decreasing. But suddenly a large wolf fell in their path. Or better to say part of a large wolf, as the lifeless head looked at the humans and fairies. Fakira let out a growl and saw a human with a bloody sword near the wolf's body. The man saw the group and glared.

"You," Fakira breathed out, her body shaking with anger. Ted and Felix easily saw her contained rage. Fakira did not blink as she stared at the man, memories of her capture threatened to over take her.

------------------------------------------------------------

Fakira looked at the strange world around her. She had never seen it before.

"I must have gone through a portal," Fakira muttered, smiling knowing she'd find some fun prey in this world. Fakira decided to look around to new world to find the prey and she shrunk down to human sized. Her mother had told Fakira how fun it was to shrink down and trick humans who didn't know of a Felaryan fairy's ability to shrink things. The humans who didn't know would willingly go up to her mother only to be shrunken or her mother would grow and they would fall victim. Fakira's mother had told Fakira in great detail how fun it was to play with prey before swallowing them whole and letting them die a slow and painful death by the stomach acids while they tickled the inside of her stomach with their useless pounding.

So, Fakira shrank down to a human child size to be able to sneak around and find prey easier since they would just run if they saw a eighty foot tall fairy walking around, but as she began walking, she felt something strike her wings. Turning around, she saw her wings were mostly cut from her. "What the?! Who did this to me!?" Fakira bellowed. Her eyes darted around but failed to see a net fly at her from behind her, forcing her to the ground.

Fakira was starting to get scared and she had reason to do so. her wings were injured, meaning she couldn't use her size changing magic on herself. Whenever a Felaryan fairy's wings were injured, they were stuck that size till it was healed. The creatures that attacked her must have known this and waited for her to shrink so they could keep her at a manageable size. They must have known that just simply harming her wings wouldn't make her shrink. They knew what a Felaryan fairy was.

"This is one impressive beast," came a voice. Fakira turned her head just enough to see the man. It was a human. Humans had captured her. Fakira was furious for letting such weak beings capture her.

"Be careful it still has wings," came another, unseen voice, "You better remove them." General Ethan chuckled darkly and kicked Fakira in the gut several times before reaching into the net and cutting off the rest of her wings.

"Bastard!" Fakira screamed, trying to rise, only to be slammed into the ground by General Ethan's boot, knocking her out.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

"So you did survive," the General Ethan said, stepping over the wolf's carcass. "That's a surprise."

"Who is that man?" Dahil asked Ted as he saw a mage join this man.

"General Ethan," Ted said, recalling it was he who brought Fakira into Lord William's castle and the newcomer was probably the second most powerful mage in the castle as well. "And the other man is Damien."

"You know, I think they mean to kill us," the mage Damien said darkly, raising a staff and pointing at the group.

"The slaves are mine, you handle the fairy," Ethan said walking slowly towards the group. But as he approached, he saw Felix move his hand like trying to cut him. He almost laughed it off when he saw his armor was deeply cut.

"He knows magic?" Damien muttered, just barely defending from an arrow aiming for his head. "Impressive to cut enchanted armor so easily."

"True," Ethan said, backing away slightly, rethinking how to attack. His eyes darted to Fakira, who had not moved, except to continue trembling with rage. "Let's work together." Damien nodded, deflecting another arrow easily. He focused his magic on Ethan's sword. The evil general slashed his sword at the group releasing a torrent of lighting. But before it could strike, Felix used his own protection spell to block it.

"That boy knows some strong magic," Damien murmured, not liking the fact a slave in a short time could block one of his strongest attacks.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: First Humans

choices: Fakira eats General Ethan. She promises only to eat evil people.
Fakira still can't eat a person, no matter how evil. Fakira twists his head off.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
General Ethan and Damien had most of their focus on Felix. They could not believe that a former slave actually learned how to use magic efficiently enough. It was a shock to both of them and because Fakira wasn't attacking at that moment, they forgot about her and focused on the others.

Damien casted a spell on General Ethan's sword. The spell caused a strange glow around the blade. Felix figured that the glow made the blade stronger and more deadly. Everyone backed away making sure Fakira had enough room to grow without squishing them in the process of her growth. "I'm the one larger than you. You are just a bug to compared to me. You should the the slave. I might just make you my slave and you will finally understand the feelings of all those you stepped on and diminished."

Fakira was ninety feet tall and she was pissed out of her mind. Her magic had now increased relative to her growth and there was no way something as small as a human had the power to stop her now. Yet, Lord William still smiled confidently. Fakira growled and slammed her foot on the ground shaking the Earth around the clearing, causing many to fall on their asses. But Lord William still stayed motionless and fearless. Fakira approached Lord William, making sure to slam her foot with each footfall. Soon, She was close enough to Lord William that he was only a few feet from her toes.

Fakira crouched down sitting on her heels while her feet were still planted on the ground. "Not so powerful now, are you little bug?" Fakira smiled wickedly.

Lord William only smiled back and pushed his heads outward. Fakira suddenly felt a strong force push against her chest and she was sent backward against one of the large trees, bending the tree and nearly causing it to snap inwards where it would have hit her head. Fakira was in utter shock and dismay. Lord William still seemed normal as if it didn't take much of his energy at all!

Fakira finally became frightened. "What's the matter?" Lord William asked, "Not so high and mighty now?"

The only beings that can shrink and grew themselves or others are Felaryan and even those are limited to fairies, succubi and incubi, very few humans that keep their size as giants because it's the only way to be safe, and possibly angels and some nekos. Lord William is not a Felaryan. He doesn't look like one," Fakira thought to herself.

Before Fakira could think of an answer, she was human sized again and Lord William used the cutting spell to chop off her wings in order to keep her that size till the wings healed. "That's what's wrong with you Felaryans," Lord William stated, "You judge things by their size and nothing else."
