---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lord William's throne room was empty. The large room was vast and silent and none of the patrols were in the room at that moment. Suddenly, a flame emerged on the throne room floor about the same size as a candle flame. The flame was on a large rug that stretched down the length of the throne room, but it didn't cause the rug to burn. Then more candle sized flames emerged in the room, some on the long rug and some on the stone tiled floor. The flames then increased in size while still retaining the same shape of a candle flame. The first flame that had appeared grew to the size of a human and stopped growing.

A man was thrown head first out of the flame. The man was flipped in the air and landed on his back. The man's face was covered by his long black hair and he stayed on the ground, catching his breath and trying to recover from the shear pain he had experienced. The man slowly sat up, brushing his hair away from his eyes. The man could hear other men falling onto the ground. Some making a clang when their metal armor hit the stone tiled part of the floor. The black haired man stood up and brushed the ash away from his black clothing. None of him was burnt, but ashes were on his clothing. He watched as his flame disappeared and watched soldiers being thrown out of their flames.

One soldier came up to the black haired man. The soldier was clutching his stomach and was breathing heavily. The soldier asked, "My Lord, what happened?"

"We were taken from the battle," Lord William informed his soldier.

"Why did you teleport us out?" the soldier questioned.

"It wasn't me who brought us out of battle," Lord William stated as the soldier fell to his knees, still clutching his stomach. Lord William had brought only a fraction of his army; only about a hundred of his men. Now, there were only about fifty men left. These men haded been teleported before and their body wasn't accustomed to the effects. "These men will probably be sick for few weeks. Luckily, I still have an entire army under my control," Lord William thought, "But before I can do anything else, I must find out why she tore us away from the battlefield."

Lord William left the throne room and walked to his room. Lord William closed the door of his room with a sign on the outside of it to dissuade anyone from barging in. Lord William even latched the door for good measure. Though the men he ruled didn't know what Lord William did in his room when he was alone and they didn't know about her, they knew that disturbing Lord William would be a grave mistake. Lord William approached his bed, the only way to contact her was to fall asleep and let her enter his dreams. It may seem to be a risk letting someone in his dreams since they could make his dream happen in reality as well, meaning if he was killed in the dream, he'd die in real life. However, Lord William knew that he was safe with her and that she wouldn't kill him. She was the only person he really trusted.

Lord William cleared his mind of all his thoughts to fall asleep faster. Before long, he was dreaming. It was clear to him that she wanted to talk to him after she pulled a stunt like pulling him and his men out of battle Lord William thought he was winning. Lord William found himself in the same place she usually took him in when their dreams were connected. Lord William was in the middle of a vast and thick amazon like jungle, but the jungle trees taller than any tree Lord William had ever seen and he knew why they were, he was in a Felaryan jungle. Lord William sat on the fallen log as usual and waited for her to arrive. She usually waited a bit before appearing.

Soon, Lord William heard a familiar voice call out, "William, I'm here."

Lord William turned around and saw her. Her name was Sanya and she was the most beautiful woman Lord William had ever seen. Sanya's body was slim and could be considered perfect through many people's eyes. She had long and amazing legs, a flat stomach, and large but not dramatically large breasts that were just right for her build. Her face was young and sexy with ruby colored eyes, a petite nose, and luscious red lips. Her hair was black and shoulder length with many dark red strand of hair scattered throughout. Sanya, as always, was naked letting Lord William see her extraordinary body.

Sanya also wasn't a human. In fact, she was a Felaryan demoness, a succubus to be exact, and with being a demoness, she had two bat-like wings coming from her shoulder blades that were folded up at the moment, two horns upon her head, and a long black tail with the traditional triangle-like tip at the end. She was also the size of a human. Even with all these things, Sanya was still a very beautiful creature to behold.

"I know you must be angry with me but..." Sanya started to say to try and calm William down.

However, Lord William stood from the log and interrupted, "You teleported me and my men out of a battle for no reason at all. We were winning and you pulled us out. Why wouldn't I be angry?"

"William, I..." Sanya tried to say in a calm voice, but her emotions were starting to get the better of her, a mixture of anger, worry, and sadness.

Still approaching the succubus, Lord William continued, "Why did you do this? You ruined my plan to..."

"I did it because you nearly died!" Sanya cried out.

Lord William fell silent when he heard her words. She had pulled him out because she was worried about him. Lord William willed himself to calm down as he noticed Sanya's eyes were slightly watery. In a more calm and assuring voice, Lord William told Sanya, "I was fine Sanya. That arrow missed my heart. All I had to do was heal myself with the energy around me. With the absorbing power you gave me, I am nearly unstoppable."

"The key word is nearly," Sanya growled in an upset, but not angry voice, "If that arrow would have hit your heart, you wouldn't have enough time to heal yourself. You can still be killed if something pierces a vital organ. You wouldn't have time to use magic then. I was worried about you William. You could have died and I would... I don't know what I would do without you."

"I understand your worry," Lord William admitted, "I shouldn't stay mad at you for looking out for my well being. Come."

Sanya embraced William and William returned the favor. Sanya placed her head upon Lord William's chest while her arms wrapped around his waist. Since she wanted to get closer to Ted, she was worried about her looks, since she was teased long ago, and she thought he gasped because he thought of her as ugly. "Is something wrong?" Solita questioned with worry.

Ted was surprised to hear such worry in Solita's voice. Ted remembered how surprised he was when he first laid eyes on her after being shrunken, and Ted could only imagine what Solita could possibly think of reasons why he would be so surprised when seeing her. Solita blushed slightly at the complement and Ted couldn't believe he was flirting with a fairy, but he was telling the truth to Solita, at least. Ted couldn't help but feel attracted to this particular fairy. Solita also couldn't believe that the first complement given to her in years actually came from a human, the species she used to hate and distrust with a passion.

Solita and Ted were saved from any awkwardness that they might have felt from the conversation when Felix walked over to Ted's side and asked, "So, what's it like being small?"

Ted turned his head to see Felix beside him. Ted saw that Fakira had shrunk Felix enough to seem like he was the same height he was usually compared to Ted. "This shrinking definitely puts the world in a very different perspective," Ted answered as he looked around again in awe. The giant world around looked different and alien to Ted now that he was a different size. "Who would have thought that changing my size would seem to drastically change the world around me," Ted thought.

"I was scared too when Fakira shrunk me for the first time," Felix admitted.

"I didn't say that I'm scared," Ted replied defensively, "I just said this size change brings a much different perspective to this world. I admit that having everything around me gigantic does make me seem helpless and but a extremely small part of this world, but I'm among friends that I am safe."

"I wish that was so when I was first shrunk. When I was first shrunk I had to convince Fakira from eating me," Felix stated.

Felix and Ted turned to see Fakira shrink down. They thought that Fakira would shrink down but keep herself larger than the fairy adult to make sure she could help Ted and Felix if trouble should arise. However, Fakira shrank down till she was about the size of a ten year old fairy which actually made her about an inch or two smaller than Felix. "She actually made herself smaller than us," Felix gasped slightly.

"She must finally be trusting people. She's come a long way," Ted replied.

"We all have," Felix added.

Fakira began approaching the small group on the ground and as she approached she looked around the forest with both amazement and fear in her expression. "So, this is what it feels like to be small. This is what the world looks like for a tiny," Fakira said aloud.

"A tiny? Is that what you call us?" Felix questioned. He didn't really take offense by Fakira's comment, but decided to tease her about it. They had become close friends and Felix had nothing to worry about with Fakira.

Fakira blushed a little realizing that her comment had been said aloud instead of in her head. Before Fakira could explain that tinies were something else entirely, Ted explained, "Tinies are a species in Felarya. They are creatures that are about three inches tall as an adult and consist of miniature humans, elves, and nekos. Because they are the littlest of creatures in Felarya, they are the most vulnerable, because even though humans are treated like food to the top predators, some humans, elves, and nekos also eat tinies."

"So, even Felaryan humans can be monsters," Felix remarked in disgust, "You would think that they would see the wrongness of eating people since they have to worry about being eaten themselves. Instead, they too eat smaller beings just because their smaller."

"Felarya is a much different world than ours where people are judged by size. There are tinies in our world, but they are rare since they are eaten by animals. Fairies of our world are hunted by animals too, but tinies are rarely able to use magic," Ted informed the group.

Dalil, Elder Telim, and Elder Luto all landed on the ground near the group. "Where is this celebration being held?" Felix asked.

"Where all our ceremonies are held in the center tree," Elder Luto informed them. All the fairies lived in the eldest trees of the forest. Those trees circled around the largest and oldest tree in the forest. The fairies homes carved into the trees.

"So, how are we going to..." Ted began to ask.

"There is an entrance at the bottom of the center tree," Elder Telim told them, "Sometimes when there are birds flying around, its safer to use the entrances at the base of the trees rather than flying. Now come with us."

The seven of them walked to the center tree and entered through a hole at the base of the tree. The tree was gigantic by human standards and now that the travelers were shrunken, the tree looked impossibly huge. "It reminds me of the Giant Tree I've heard stories about where that blonde naga tends to hang around," Fakira said.

"You mean Crisis?" Ted replied.

"How do you know of her?" Fakira questioned.

"My father once traveled to Felarya once, never wanted to go back there again," Ted answered.

"I don't know if I ever want to go back there either," Fakira replied.

Soon, the group was in a large room with many tables that could fit in all the fairies of the village. The tree and all the other old trees had been carved out and made into buildings on the inside with floors, stairs, and rooms. Yet, the trees were somehow still alive. Before anyone could ask why the trees could possibly be alive, many fairies swarmed over to the group. All of them wanted to greet Felix, Ted, and Fakira and thank them for their help. Neither of the three ever had so much attention on them and it was strange for them to be greeted and thanked by so many people.

"Please step back," Elder Luto ordered the crowd, "Don't crowd them. He'll have a chance to meet them later. Just sit back down in your seats."

The crowd dispersed and began sitting back down in the large tables. Elder Telim turned to Felix, Ted and Fakira and told them, "The tree of you may sit with Dalil and his squad. Help yourselves to whatever food you wish to have."

Felix, Ted, and Fakira sat with Dalil and his squad and they all ate and talked. Occasionally, other fairies came to introduce themselves to the newcomers. Once dinner was done, Elder Luto stood up and silence came upon the room.

Elder Luto spoke, "For centuries, we have been protecting this forest from those who wish to destroy it and we have dealt with such intruders who wished to cut down the forest and replace it with a town. It is our home and the magic that resides in this forest needs to be kept preserved. It was only recently that a new evil emerged and came to this forest to actually came for these trees and take the magic from it. We have been battling his men for a long time and lost fairies in the struggle. But today, we were given three heroes who have defeated the evil man for good. Tonight, this celebration is dedicated to these three heroes and all those who have fought and died for the downfall of the evil man."

With that small speech, there was many cheers and clapping. The tables disappeared and music began to play, causing the fairies to start dancing and celebrating the downfall of Lord William.

They reached it fairly quickly and Solita opened the door and invited Ted in. Ted walked in and found that her home looked like any other home, except all the furniture was wooden, with cushions on them of course, and looked like they had been carved from the floor. Ted approached the nearest furniture, which was a chair, and examined it. The chair was anchored into the floor and it looked like the entire home was carved out to include the furniture. "It must have taken much craftsmanship to be able to make this home," Ted commented.

"The only negative thing about it is that you can't ever move the furniture if you want it somewhere else," Solita replied.

"I guess you're right about that," Ted chuckled a little, "But it is still a very nice home."

"It was my parents' home," Solita informed Ted, "After they died, I just stayed here." Solita sat down on a bench with cushions like a couch.

"Sorry about your parents," Ted apologized.

"You don't have to apologize. It wasn't you that killed them. It was some nasty, demented, brats that called themselves humans," Solita growled starting with the word nasty. Then taking a sadder tone, Solita recalled, "My parents were in the forest alone. They were celebrating their anniversary together. Some young nasty humans found them and cornered them. My parents tried to make peace with them, but the humans only saw them as bugs they could mess with. They tore my parents apart, piece by piece, like when a person torments a bug they've caught."

"That's awful," Ted gasped at the horror, "No one deserves such a death." He was having troubles picturing a human being able to do that. He knew that he could never do something like that.

"I saw the whole thing," Solita admitted, "I followed them and wanted to surprise them, but the humans caught them. I couldn't help even if I wanted to or else I would have died to. But I watched the whole thing. After that point, I thought all humans were cruel, heartless, sadistic monsters that couldn't be trusted."

At this point, Ted sat down next to Solita on the couch. "That was until I met you and Felix," Solita said with tears in her eyes as she turned to face Ted, "After what you and Felix did for us and after you saved my life, I realized that not all humans are evil. I was just unfortunate to encounter some of the evil ones."

Ted couldn't let himself watch the fairy be so sad. Ted placed his hand on her bare shoulder (Fairies only wore enough clothing to cover up their private areas including the breasts for females, but it's still only a bra that strapped around the neck, due to the wings, and a skirt.) Ted tried to comfort her by rubbing her shoulder. "I'm glad I met you, Ted," Solita said before she turned and warped her arms around Ted. As she embraced him, she cried on his shoulder.

Ted was slow to react at first, he was kind of shocked that such a beautiful person was hugging him. Ted soon placed his hands on her lower back since it was the only way to avoid her wings and he patted and caressed her back till she was clam. Once Solita was calm, Solita stopped the hug and said, "Thanks, Ted, for everything."

"You're welcome," Ted replied. Solita told Ted to follow her and she showed him to her parents room. "Are you sure you're okay with me sleeping here?" Ted questioned.

"I'm fine. Who better to be the first to sleep in this bed than my first human friend who has saved my life?" Solita asked back.

Before Ted got into the bed, he noticed that there was a bow and arrows hung on the wall. Solita followed his gaze and informed him, "That was my father's. He was a great hunter. He even once took down a bear with poisonous arrows. The fairies were able to preserve the meat and we ate for about a month. You could have that if you wish."

"I couldn't possibly..." Ted started.

"The bow you have isn't that good. I was told that you obtained that bow from bandits, right? An archer like you needs a better bow," Solita insisted.

"Thank you very much, Solita. it will be an honor to carry such a bow," Ted replied.

"I'm glad, good night, Ted," Solita said.

"Good night, Solita," Ted replied. Solita closed his door and slept in her own room while Ted slept in her parents' bed.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

"All the other fairies were dancing in the air at that point, I thought it might be fun," Fakira replied.

"It was scary was what it was," Felix said.

"Here is you're room," Elder Telim pointed, "Each room has two beds and we were going to put Ted and Felix in one room and Fakira in the other, but since Ted is with Solita at the moment, you two can sleep in the same room, unless you don't want to."

"Then you two can share a room, and don't worry about Ted too much. Solita's a nice girl. I'm sure he'll be fine," Elder Telim assured them before she left. "If you are talking about going to see my mother to at least say good bye to her and tell her I'll be safe," Fakira said, "Then I will go see her. You and Ted may come along."

"We'll come back to this world if we can since that world will be dangerous for you and Ted, but I'd have to bring you two along because if I weren't able to come back here, I wouldn't be able to live without you two," Fakira informed Felix, "We might as well stay in this forest. "Also," Fakira continued, "I think that after I see my mother and come back here, I will make my self the size I am now for a while and have you and Ted normal sized."

"I think right now we should get some sleep," Fakira said as she got in her bed, "Good night, Felix."

"Good night, Fakira," Felix replied.

"It's just an honor to be invited to the High Table, for a fairy like me I mean," Solita said. Ted blinked for a second.

"So, what are your plans for today?" Elder Telim asked, looking at the group.

"We were planning on continuing our way through the woods," Fakira said, "I want to return to see my mother." Both Elders took this information with mild interest. Solita's eyes widened a little with worry.

"And will you be staying in Felarya?" Elder Luto asked softly.

"No," Fakira said, "I plan on telling my mother I cannot live the Felarian life and tell her I'll be safe in this world." Both Elders nodded slowly.

"And then?" Elder Luto asked.

"We don't have anything concrete after that," Felix spoke up, "We were hoping to be able to stay in or near this forest." Solita breathed a breath of relief.

"Considering your actions, that would be easy to arrange," Elder Telim said, "On the matter of traveling through the forest, though, you should know the other Elders do wish to meet you for your actions and bravery."

"Um, Elder Telim?" Solita said, catching her Elder's eye, "If they are to be journeying through the woods, then I would like to join them as they traveled." This comment was no surprise to either Elder, but appeared to take it in consideration.

"And why do you request such task?" Elder Luto asked.

"So the other fairies on patrol do not harm them first, not knowing who they are," Solita responded quickly.

"That is a wise plan," Elder Luto replied, "However the final say lies with them." Elder Luto looked to the guests of the forest.

"It's no trouble with me," Fakira said.

"Me neither," Felix replied. Solita's eyes then turned to Ted and held her breath as their eyes met over the table.

"I have no problems with it," Ted replied, smiling. Solita smiled as well, while Felix turned to Fakira.

"Fakira, will you be staying small as we walk through the woods?" Felix asked, recalling their talk the night before.

"I'll make us human size while we travel," Fakira reminded Felix, "I said I'd remain tiny only after we meet my mother." Felix nodded as the others took the info in.

"What would it be like to be human size with Ted?" thought Solita as she glanced at her human friend.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Planning Ahead

choices: Some sort of trouble happens halfway through the forest.
The group makes it to the edge of the gate and spend the night there.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Solita thought of how exciting it would be to be a giantess. Well, a giantess to fairies. She thought that it might be fun and an interesting change in perspective like Ted's experience with turning small. Solita thought it would be worth a try becoming human size, but before she could ask Fakira, she thought of something else. "Though I'm going on this journey to be closer to Ted, on the record, I'm going with them to help them meet the other fairy villages and making sure they aren't attacked by fairies on their journey to the dimensional gate on the opposite edge of the forest," Solita thought, "If I have Fakira make me human sized, the fairies might think I'm a Felaryan fairy as well and might not recognize me. At least if I'm fairy sized, the others might recognize me easier."

"I'm going to have to stay fairy sized at least until they get to the edge of the forest," Solita decided, "It might be a more dangerous journey for me due to giant animals, but I'm sure three human sized friends can keep me safe. This also might give me the excuse for sitting on Ted's shoulder again." Solita blushed slightly for even thinking about that.

She again wondered why she was so attracted to Ted. He was a human and a giant compared to her species. And though she only look slightly older than him, she was much older due to the different lifespans of humans and fairies. Those two factors alone would convince a normal fairy from being attracted to a human. Yet, she still had feelings for Ted. Maybe it was because he was so cute and a very kind person. He had saved her life and was the only person who truly cared about her. Sure Dalil was like an older brother to her, but there was something about Ted's care that made things seem different. There was just something about him. It was as if he had all the right qualities she wanted in a man. It's a little unfortunate that all those qualities were put into a human, but that wasn't stopping Solita from falling in love.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------

When breakfast was finished, all the fairies left the safety of the old trees and were out in the clearing. Felix, Fakira, Ted, and Solita all stood next to each other and the fairies were all saying their farewells and goodbyes to them.

The Elders approached the group. Elder Luto looked upon the three heroes and said, "You three are great heroes. You have saved us from the evil Lord William and protected the forest when there was no real reason to do so. You could have minded your own business and not cared what happened to us. But the virtue in your hearts kept you from just leaving us to our fates. Here are two humans and a Felaryan fairy. Proof that not all of your species are cruel and careless creatures. You have proven that there are still trustworthy people beyond this forest and you have given us hope when we had previously thought no outsiders could be trusted. Thank you for everything you have done."

Elder Luto bowed his head and Felix, Fakira, and Ted replied by bowing as well. Elder Telim then added, "The three of you have proven to be trustworthy friends of the fairies and you can come back to this forest when ever you desire. You are forever welcome in this forest and in our hearts."

"Thank you. That is very hospitable of you," Fakira replied, glad to have another place where she could belong.

Many fairies stepped up to the group giving goodbyes and thank yous. After Dalil said his goodbyes to Felix, Fakira, and Ted, he approached Solita and asked, "You sure you want to do this?"

"I'm sure. I feel as if it is the right thing to do. I can't quiet explain it, but I just feel like I have to do this," Solita informed Dalil.

"Destiny doesn't like to explain itself. It only tells people what they should do," Dalil replied, "Well, when you come back, or if you come back..."

"What do you mean if?" Solita questioned.

"I know you never really felt as though you fit in with us," Dalil replied. That was an understatement. Ever since her parents' deaths, she had felt as though she was completely alone. "If you decide you belong with them, then it would be alright to pursue that belonging. You must do what you think is right for yourself. Only you can decide what is best for you, not anyone else. But if you come back, we'll save your spot in the squad for you."

"Thanks, Dalil," Solita thanked. Dalil had been like an older brother to her. A person who looked out for her and kept her on a straight path. He was a good friend and that was as far as both of them wanted the relationship to go. Solita hugged Dalil and said goodbye to him.

Dalil patted her back and added, "Just watch yourself out there. It's a dangerous world out there for a fairy to be alone. Just stay close to Fakira, Felix, or Ted and they will keep you safe. I'm sure you don't need to be reminded all the animals that would love to capture a fairy for a meal."

"I will always stay close to at least one of them," Solita promised, "Don't worry about me."

When the hug finished and Solita turned to the others, Fakira asked, "Solita, would you want to grow human sized with all of us?"

"I think I should stick with my normal size," Solita answered, "The other fairies might think I'm a Felaryan fairy as well and may not recognize me if I'm human sized."

Fakira nodded and then turned to all the surrounding fairies. "You all might want to step back and give us some room. I don't want our growing bodies to accidentally crush you," Fakira suffested to the fairies. The fairies, including Solita, took to the air and waited for Fakira, Felix, and Ted to grow. Eventually, all three of then grew back to their human size and Fakira made herself around the same size as Felix, making Ted the tallest of the three. When they all felt ready to leave, they waved a final goodbye to the fairy village and walked off with Solita flying near them and giving them the directions.

When they were a good distance from the village, Solita flew over to one of Ted's ears and asked, "Could I sit on your shoulder again? We're far from any fairy village and wild animals would like to nab me if I'm too far a head of you guys. It would be safer if I'm very close to one of you."

"Sure, go a head and sit," Ted whispered back. Solita gladly complied and sat on Ted's right shoulder, continuing to give them directions.

"So, you didn't want to become a giant again, Fakira?" Felix asked, "It would be a faster journey to the gate if you were a giantess and carried us."

"There's no real hurry in getting there fast," Fakira informed Felix, "Lord William is a threat no more and we don't really know how we're going to open the gate when we get there. It takes someone who is gifted with a strong dimensional magic to open the gate, and none of us are proficient in that type of magic. Besides, the other villages on the way want to meet us and arriving as a eighty foot fairy will scare many people."

"You're right," Felix agreed, "It probably is best that you're human sized."
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: A New Journey

choices: A few hours at most."
A day or so, give or take an hour."
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Several hours passed as the sun reached its apex. Deep in the woods, the travelers had little issue in their travels. With Solita aiding them, the three larger beings were directed around harder to trek areas. And through out it all, changes were happening in their thoughts towards another in their group. Felix and Fakira were walking very close to each other and Felix would regularly help Fakira over some more uneven ground, even when it was not needed. Solita similarly would point out the best path for Ted to walk, while rarely leaving his shoulder.

And now the four were crossing the shallows of the great river that passed through the old forest, a path once again shown to them by their fairy guide.

"Solita, are you all right?" Ted asked, once they had crossed the waters, "You seem tense now."

"On this side of the river lay some of the animals who regularly hunt fairies for food," Solita said, "We are also in Elder Sheeka's domain."

"What sort of elder is she like?" Felix asked.

"She is wise, like the other elders," Solita said, "She is also the one who guards the great river from ways of attack by evil humans."

"From what Elder Telim said, we ought to expect her to see us or send an envoy to ask us to come with them to meet her," Ted recalled. Solita nodded when she suddenly saw Ted gasp in shock. She felt a light prick in her chest and looked to see small fairy arrows in Ted's chest.

"Ted!" Felix called before he was struck with the arrows as well. Solita felt Ted's large body begin to waiver and started to fly just as the boys collapsed on the ground. Solita looked around with hateful eyes.

"In the names of Elders Telim and Luto, I order you to show yourselves!" Solita bellowed as Fakira knelt over Felix. From two branches above them, two fairies appeared.

"What the? Who are you?!" one patrolman called out. Solita looked up at the guard.

"I am from Solita of Elder Telim's guards. I am escorting the ones who helped save our forest through the woods!" Solita shouted back. Both guards exchanged glances.

"No humans would help us!" the other called down.

"And yet she speaks the truth," came a cold harsh voice, causing Fakira to look around. Something magically strong was coming towards them when she saw a pale blue-haired fairy appear before Solita.

"Elder Sheeka," Solita said, bowing her head. The Elder looked up at her guards.

"You were told to alert me if any humans came across the river," Elder Sheeka said, "You ignored my orders and in your ignorance injured two humans who have Elder Luto's respect. Stay where you are until I'm done with them." She closed her blue eyes and looked to Fakira. "I am sorry for that attack."

"Um, can you tell me why they won't wake up?" Fakira asked, holding Felix in her arms. The Elder hovered over to the arrows and pulled them out. She sniffed the tip.

"Ester berry juice and . . . Opine grass," she saidm "It's a sleeping potion we use on larger beings. Only a small dose is needed to make them sleep."

"For how long?" Fakira asked.

"Given the number each took was only four," Elder Sheeka said, "I would estimate . . .
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: By the river

choices: Ted wishes to talk to Solita alone.
They all get to sleep and head for the gate in the morning.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Traveling to the dimensional gate normally would have taken about a week in a half to reach, provided that fairies weren't making the travelers walk in circles. However, it took closer to two weeks for the four to get to the other end of the forest. This was because of the fairy villages they came across. The fairies weren't purposely diverting their paths with magic like they would do to most strangers. They just wanted to met the supposed saviors of the forest. They all wanted to met Felix and Ted, and they especially wanted to meet Fakira. The fairy rarely met Felaryans and when they did meet Felaryans, no matter if the Felaryan was a human, fairy, or other species, the Felaryans tended to eat the fairies and not care that fairies were sentient beings. So upon hearing news that there was a Felaryan fairy that actually regarded regular fairies as people and not food, they just had to see it for themselves.

News had spread throughout the entire forest rapidly. So, none of the fairies attacked when they saw two humans, a giant fairy, and normal sized fairy traveling together. When ever the four travelers were close to a village, the village invited them to stay the day in this forest. Since there was no real hurry to get to the dimensional gate, the group was happy to accept the hospitality of the fairies and had to shrink down to fairy size to stay in the villages. This is the main reason it took longer to get to the other side of the forest, but none of the travelers complained. Solita was happy since she got to spend more time with Ted, and Fakira wasn't too fond of seeing her mother to soon. Sure, she wanted to see her mother, but she wasn't looking forward to what would have to be said. Felix liked the fairies' hospitality and making more friends and Ted was happy to learn more about their culture. So, each of the four had a good reason for taking their time. Especially since they would be heading for the dangerous world of Felarya.

As their destination was getting closer, the group asked the fairies to see if they knew anyway to use the dimensional gate. However, none of the fairies, not even the elders, knew of a way other than dimensional magic. The only problem was that none of the fairies they had encountered had such magic. Dimensional magic was a very rare gift to have for all species. The only creatures that naturally had such magic were Dimensional dragon, also known as Silver dragons, but each world only had one of those dragons at a time and they bonded to the first sentient creature they see when they're hatched. Such creatures were hard to come by.

So when they finally reached the edge of the forest, they still didn't know how they were going to open the dimensional gate and control where it would take them. Nightfall was coming upon them when they reached the edge of the forest. They set up camp and started the fire at the edge of the forest. They kept the camp in the forest, though their flame come probably be seen from outside the forest. All four sat close to each other, but Felix sat closer to Fakira and Solita sat on Ted's shoulder. Her excuse was the same as the other nights that they weren't in a fairy village. There were dangerous creatures in the forest at night and being three inches tall and wanting to stay three inches tall she needed to be close to one of them. That was a true excuse, but she could have stuck close to any one of them, and choose Ted. All four of them knew Solita was developing a fondness for Ted, even though she hadn't outwardly admitted such feelings for him. Everyone else also knew Felix and Fakira were developing a relationship as well, even though both told everyone that they were just friends constantly. At the back of Fakira's and Felix's minds, they knew that they were developing feelings for each other. Though they kept hiding it from their selves and trying to keep such feelings back.

At first glance, it was a night like any other after dinner. The group just huddled around a fire, thinking about their next moves, thinking about what the next day would drag along with it. "So," Felix spoke up wanting to end the silence as well as putting forth the most pressing matter of all, "We have no idea what we're going to do about opening the dimensional gate, do we?"

"We have found no way of opening it," Ted answered, "Unless we can find a way to do so, we won't be able to do what we've come here to do."

Felix turned to Fakira. She was very quiet. She grew more and more quiet the closer they got to the edge of the forest. "We can back out if you want," Felix informed Fakira, he knew how Fakira didn't want to go back home. He knew how uncomfortable she was getting with the thought of the day she'd confront her mother getting closer. Fakira was worried about the place she grew up in, and how it raised her to be a terrible monster. She now know how cruel that world really was, and she didn't want to get trapped there. She also didn't want her new friends being trapped in the cruel world along with her since it would be the most dangerous place for them to live. Her mind was a whirlwind of worries as the days were drawing closer. "If there is no way of getting back to Felarya, then it's alright to back out," Felix added, "I know how you don't want to go through with it."

"We've gone this far to do it, and even if I don't want to go back, it is something I must do," Fakira replied, "Maybe there is something at the gate that could help us use it."

"It is possible," Solita agreed, "There's probably a reason why the gate is there, and maybe there is someone there watching over it."

"The next thing we have to figure out is what will happen if we do end up reaching Felarya," Felix brought up.

"The three of you will not be safe at your natural sizes. You wouldn't be considered as people in Felarya," Fakira informed them, "Well, at least not to the fairies. I'll have to grow all of you to giants."

"Will that keep us safe?" Felix asked.

"I'm not sure, but if you're normal sized, you wouldn't be safe at all. Are you sure you want to come to Felarya with me?" Fakira questioned.

Felix and Ted nodded, telling her they needed to stick together. Solita spoke up, "I'm coming too."

Everyone was surprised by this and looked at her questionably. "You want to go to Felarya?" Fakira questioned, "You know how dangerous it is, right?"

"I know the dangers. I also know the dangers here if the three of you are gone. Whether I end up staying at the gate to wait for you or if I try to make my way back home, it will not be safe for a lone fairy. The safest place is with all of you," Solita explained, "Besides, it sounds like it could be fun being a giant."

"Then you may come with us, if everything is alright with that," Fakira replied, and both Felix and Ted nodded. "Since that's settled, I think we better get some sleep," Fakira suggested and the others agreed.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: The Night Before

choices: Ted allows Solita to sleep with him.
Ted's does mind and Solita sleeps with Fakira.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Ted sat by the fire as Felix and Fakira were getting ready for bed. Ted turned to look at the fairy on his shoulder. Solita was standing and was about to fly to Fakira. Since Solita wanted to stay fairy sized during the trip, she had to sleep close to one of the human sized companions. Since her choices were Felix, Ted, or Fakira, she ended up sleeping with Fakira at night. She didn't want to sleep with Felix, because it would be to awkward, and she didn't sleep with Ted, because she didn't want to approach things too fast with him, even though she really wanted to sleep with Ted to show him her love for him. However, she slept with Fakira each night, because it just seemed proper that when a single lady not committed in any relationship, as of yet, would need to sleep with a giant person for protection, it should be another lady. Besides, over the travels, Fakira and Solita have become good friends. Even though the back of Fakira's mind sometimes wondered how Solita would taste if she ate her. Luckily, Fakira kept in control and never acted upon those desires.

Before Solita could start flying to the waiting Fakira, Ted asked, "Solita, may I have a word alone with you? There's just something I have to tell you."

Solita looked to Fakira and Fakira nodded, "Go ahead Solita, I'll try to rest and stay awake while you and Ted talk. So that once your done you can sleep with me. If you come back and I'm asleep, just wake me up."

Ted slowly and carefully rose to his feet. He didn't want Solita to fell off his shoulder. Even though she had wings that would help her if she fell, she was still a little living lady and he needed to be careful with her. There was much responsibility in taking care of a little person when nearly everything was dangerous to said little person. Ted then walked outside the camp only far enough so that Fakira and Felix, couldn't listen in. Once Ted felt that they were far enough, Ted brought a hand up to his shoulder and Solita hopped into his waiting palm of the giant she had fallen in love with. Ted brought his hand up to face level and looked at the miniature three inch person in his palm as she sat down and looked up at him. As she stared up at Ted's admittedly cute and attractive face, she was inwardly hoping that Ted was starting to feel the same feelings for her that she was feeling for him.

Ted looked as the beautiful, but small fairy in his hand. He had to admit that when he had first seen Solita when he had been shrunk down to fairy sized, Solita was one of the most beautiful girls he had seen. Though he was much larger than her now, he could still see some of her details well, since she was holding still in the palm of his hand which was near his face. He was able to see her eyes, and in them, he saw love for him. "It's just as I thought. Solita might actually love me," Ted thought, "But how is that possible? We barely know each other and she's a fairy and I'm a human which means there's a large size difference between us. And let's not forget that she's probably decades older than me, even though we physically look about the same age. What is it that she sees in me?"

As Ted thought about what he should say to bring up the conversation, there was silence as they stared at each other. Eventually, Solita asked, "What is it you want to tell me, Ted?"

"Well..." Ted said as he thought of how she should put it, "We've been traveling for about two weeks, and I noticed a few things."

"Like what?" Solita asked innocently.

"Well, do you like me Solita?" Ted asked.

Solita had a feeling he'd bring it up. She had never confessed her love for him in words, but one would have to be blind to not see that she was in love with Ted. She was almost always on his shoulder or by has side. She acted like a small child with a big crush. However, Solita was beginning to fear that Ted didn't like her in the same way she liked him. She began fearing that this talk was for him to tell her that this love wouldn't work out. "Well, I really like you as a friend and..." Solita began.

However, Ted was able to interrupt the small voice of the fairy and he questioned, "Are you sure you like me just as a friend?"

"Why would you ask that?" Solita replied.

"Please, don't avoid the question, Solita. I've noticed the way you act around me, and I've spotted how you've stared at me sometimes. Now, do you like more more than a friend or not?" Ted asked.

"Well, I..." Solita started. She was starting to get uncomfortable in Ted's palm. It wasn't that his hand wasn't comfy, but she was getting uncomfortable because she was getting nervous. She began thinking about how Ted may react if she told the truth. It wasn't normal for a fairy to fall in love with a human. Humans were giants to fairies, and it's a little odd to fall in love with something so large. Plus, the lifespan of fairies and humans were very different. Fairy lived a lot longer and aged slower. Falling in love with a human meant that the human lover would die much sooner than the fairy. There were many other factors as well that made a human and fairy relationship out of the ordinary. Solita looked down and spoke quietly. Too quiet for Ted to be able to hear her.

"I'm sorry, Solita, but I couldn't catch that last part," Ted informed her.

Solita looked up and spoke up, "It's true. I do love you, Ted." After saying those words, Solita blushed and forced her head downwards. She didn't want to see the reaction in Ted's face, fearing it would be a negative reaction to her statement. Silence feel upon them and Solita cried a little, thinking the silence confirmed her fears.

"Solita, what's wrong?" Ted asked, only so that he could try to comfort her from crying.

"You probably think I'm some weirdo fairy," Solita cried.

"And why would I think that?" Ted asked. Ted knew the answers, but he only asked in hopes to calm her down.

"Because, it's not natural for a fairy to fall in love with a human. We are just such different species. You probably think I'm a nut job for falling in love with you. I even think I should be examined, but I just can't help it. I don't know why I've fallen in love with you. Maybe it was because you saved my life and you're the first friend I've gained, other than Dalil who treated me like a younger sister. I've just fallen for you, and I don't care that you're a human," Solita explained, "I wish that you could feel the same way for me, but I'd understand if you only see me as a friend." Solita laid down in her stomach and buried her eyes into crossed arms.

Ted definitely liked Solita as a friend, and he couldn't stand seeing a friend cry in his palm. Ted used his free hand and placed a finger on Solita. He then pat and stroked her back, being careful of her wings as well as her fragile, miniature body. "Solita, I don't think you're a weirdo. You're a good friend and one of the only friends I have," Ted tried to assure her.

"But I've fallen in love with a human. That's enough proof that I'm weird," Solita argued.

"You are different, but that's nothing to be ashamed about. My parents were explorers who documented many different legends for nearly every sentient species out there as well as documenting some interesting tales they witnessed. He had come across true events as well as legends about creatures of other species fall in love with each other. They even found a giant naga falling in love with a human," Ted informed Solita.

"Really? One of those giant snake people fell in love with a human?" Solita questioned, cheering up.

"It just goes to show that you shouldn't worry about what others think of you if you fall in love with someone, you should let anything get in your way if you truly love them," Ted told her.

Solita rose to her knees and hugged Ted's finger. Her three inch body, well less than three inches since her shins and feet were planted on Ted's palm, pressed against the finger with her arms wrapped around. As she continued to hug Ted's finger, she asked, "Ted, do you like me a little more than just a friend?"

Ted thought about it carefully and then replied, "You're very sweet and attractive girl. Whenever I'm shrunk down to your size, I find it hard not to stare at such beauty. I know that you're a fairy and I'm a human, but I think I'm starting to have feelings for you as well. I'll be will to try this relationship if you are."

"You're willing to try?" Solita questioned.

"Sure," Ted answered.

Solita was happy about his decision and hugged the finger tighter. "Really? That's great, Ted."

"Yeah, well, we better get back to the camp," Ted replied.

"Fakira said that I could wake her when we came back, but I could sleep with you. But if that's too fast and a little uncomfortable for you, then I understand and I'll sleep with Fakira," Solita stated.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: We Have to Have a Talk

choices: One of them confesses before Ted and Solita return
Ted and Solita return at that moment.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Ted looked at the little lady in his hands. "Well, I think it might have been quick," Ted said slowly watching disappointment fall onto Solita's face, "If we hadn't known each other for these two weeks. I mean for most of the day, you are with me. So there really shouldn't be much difference now." Solita smiled and flew into the air and touched Ted's chest.

Beneath her hand, Solita felt strong, toned muscles. She looked up at Ted while he craned his neck down to see what she was doing. "Thank you," she said softly, before flying back to her place on his shoulder.

"It's no trouble," Ted said. He saw Solita blush deeper.

"No, I meant for giving us a shot," Solita replied. Ted blushed as well before walking back to the campsite.

----------------------------------------------------

Around the fire, Felix looked at Fakira. She gave a small yawn, tryoing to stay up for Solita. Inside his chest, Felix felt his heart race. His eyes glanced over the vacancy left by Solita and Ted and knew this was the time.

"Fakira," Felix said, causing the girl to look towards him. She saw the strain in his face. Her fatigue seemed to lessen.

"Is something wrong?" Fakira asked, worry was in her tone.

"I just wanted to say thank you," Felix said, looking her in the eyes, Fakira blinked. She thought back to the past few days, trying to think what he could be thankful for, considering each time they had helped each other they gave a quiet thanks. But this seemed to have more weight than those minor times.

"For what?" Fakira asked.

"For accepting my help back in those dungeons and giving us a chance," Felix said, "I realized I never really thanked you for that since we escaped." Fakira felt her cheeks grow warm.

"Felix, you have thanked me in other ways," Fakira said softly, "You continued to show me how eating humans is wrong. And then you saved my life when the thief tried to kill me. So I think we're even." Felix smiled at that comment. He glanced to where Solita and Ted went off to.

"I wonder if they're telling each other how they feel," Felix said, giving an awkward moment.

"Probably," Fakira said, adding another. Only the crackling of the fire made any noise around them.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Thank You

choices: They'll find someone or something that will open the gate for them.
Turns out, one of them has dimensional magic and didn't know it.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Both Felix and Fakira were falling for each other. They both knew that something was growing deep inside them. It was a very odd feeling for the both of them, for neither had felt such strongly towards an emotion. Looking back, both would have thought love was impossible for them. Felix never thought he would find another person he could trust and feel passionate towards. He had lived most of his life alone with very few he could trust or confide in. He had almost lost hope until he had met the most beautiful creature he had ever seen and saw she had been in the same predicament he was in. It was that understanding of each other that opened the door and eventually helped Fakira see that humans were people too.

Also, Fakira never thought in a million years that she would fall for a human. All her life, she was taught that little people were food, no matter what, and that size determined a person's status on whether they were a person or just some snack. She had gone her whole life never thinking twice on such a subject, never once questioning that. In her world, it was permissible to eat a person just because they were smaller. So, falling for a human seemed impossible to her. However, Felix and Ted questioned her definition of a human and started the moral dilemma. They had opened her eyes to the truth and showed her the cruelty of her definition. Because of this, she now saw humans as people and was now falling for the first human she had ever truly met. She had no regrets doing so, even if her family would most likely not approve of her actions.

Both Fakira and Felix looked away from each other and both wanted to tell the other one how they felt, but both were having troubles speaking there mind. Both were worried what the other might think. Here was a former slave, who had proven himself to be brave by finally standing up to an evil monster of a master as well as stand his ground against a Felaryan fairy and help change her life despite the dangers. Now, he was trying to find the courage to talk to Fakira and tell her his feeling. On the other side was a Felaryan fairy who once saw humans as just little insignificant creatures she could do whatever she wanted with them without consequences and deemed her species high above the human race, was now having troubles speaking to one.

Suddenly, both turned to each other after a deep breath and spoke up, "I have something to say."

Both said it at the same time and both blushed afterwards. "What is it you wish to tell me, Felix?" Fakira asked.

"It's alright, you can go first," Felix insisted.

"Alright," Fakira replied before taking another deep breath, "I... I love you." Felix's eyes widened in amazement and shock. Felix continued to stare at Fakira without saying a single word. His questions were answered, Fakira loved him! "Well, aren't you going to say something?" Fakira questioned, not liking the silence after such a revealing statement.

"I was going to tell you that I love you too," Felix informed her, "I was worried you wouldn't love me back, but now I see that you do actually love me."

Fakira smiled with joy and said, "So, you really love me?"

"Of course, you're a wonderful person, Fakira," Felix told her.

Fakira hurried over to Felix and hugged him, happy that they both had feeling towards each other. "I'm glad you feel that way," Fakira whispered in Felix's ear as she hugged him tightly.

"I see you guys finally confessed each other's love as well," said the voice of Ted as he stood at the edge of the camp. Both Fakira and Felix escaped their hugs and looked to Ted as he stood there with Solita on his shoulder. "It's refreshing to know that none of us have to keep secrets any longer about who loves who," Ted added. The rest agreed and they eventually fell asleep. Solita slept on Ted's chest and he covered her body and kept her warm with his hand. Felix and Fakira still had their on beds, but Fakira and Felix now slept closer to each other. None of them knew it, but a magical bond was forming between them: one between Ted and Solita and one between Felix and Fakira. These bonds have been going on for a while and were slowly growing stronger since they had started. It's what pushed them into falling for each other, but now, that bond will get much stronger more quickly.

What will happen when they reach the dimensional gate?

1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
The couples woke the next moring, refreshed and relaxed. Felix found himself laying on his side, looking at Fakira, and Fakira was looking back at him. Solita was pressing herself on Ted's chest, as though she wanted to be within him. With the sun filtering through the trees, the four woke and ate a quiet breakfast.

"So what will the gate look like?" Felix asked.

"I don't know," Ted replied, "They won't need to be the same device everywhere, depending on how often Felarya appears in that land."

"I hope we can find someone to operate it for us," Felix said, "Even though we are still in Lord Willaim's domain."

"Felix!" Fakira shot at the boy, "If you're going to say his name, don't add Lord to it." Felix nodded.

"Sorry, old habits die hard," Felix replied, smiling. Fakira smiled as well. Ted nodded in agreement.

"He is nothing to us anymore," Ted said, "But you are right the local gatekeeper may be sided with him." His gaze looked to the little lady on his shoulder. "You said this guy lives all alone, Solita?"

"Yes, Elder Gailita said the gatekeeper is one man, but she doesn't know much else about him," Solita said, refering to the last elder they encountered and protector for this part of the forest.

"Let's hope he's a nice man," Felix said. No one said much else after that and the group packed up.

****************

As the group departed the forest, they saw the gate. Two ivory spires shooting up into the sky. There was nothing between them, but between the spires and the forest stood a cabin.

"Wow, not what I expected," Felix said, "Do you think the doorway will open between those spires?"

"That makes sense if you wanted to make a way to my old home," Fakira said, "Otherwise you would just need to find an overlapping spot, like what happened with me."

"Come on, let's get closer," Ted said, as they walked towards the cabin.

***************************

From the cabin window, a man was watching the approaching beings.

"Interesting, very interesting," the gatekeeper said. He stayed quiet and moved to the door.

****************************

As the four travelers got close to the cabin, the door opened and a tall, strong looking warrior stood there. "Hello," he said, looking down at the travelers, "Are you the ones who had the fire in the forest last night?"

"We are," Ted said. The man's stoic face flickered a smile.

"Then I'll assume you are friends of the faries within," the man said, his eyes glancing at Solita, who was still on Ted's shoulder, "In fact I'm sure of it. So what business do you have here?"

"We need to use the gate," Felix said. The man nodded. He walked out of his doorway and sat on a chair on the porch.

"Well, that's unusual for young ones like yourself needing to go to Felarya," the man said, "Though when one is a Felaryan fairy, who escaped from Lord William's castle with two other slaves, it's not so unusual." He watched as the group tensed up with their idetities known.

"Do you plan on capturing us for that man? A dead man?" Ted asked.

"He's dead?" the gatekeeper asked, sitting up. Ted nodded. "You felt his heart stop?"

"He exploded," Ted said. The man had a grim look on his face.

"Then there's no garuntee," the gatekeeper said, "But regardless of him, I won't let you into Felarya."

"Why not?" Fakira asked.

"Because opening it up without anyone aiding me, on this side of that side, may let one of your kind in here or an adult naga and they are hard to get back through," the gatekeeper said.

"But Mister . . ." Felix started.

"Eric," the gatekeeper provided.

"Mister Eric, Fakira didn't come through the gate and it's not like we plan on being there for very long," Felix said.

"It doesn't matter. I have a responsibility to many people," Eric answered. Fakira raised her hand at Eric.

"I will make you open the gate for us," Fakira growled. Eric smiled and walked off the porch.

"Planning on shrinking me, then?" Eric asked, in a challenging tone. "It won't work."

"Watch me," Fakira said, casting the spell. But the gatekeeper waved his hand and Fakira and Felix heard a shout from Ted and watched him shrink to Solita's size. "What the?!"

"How did you do that?" Felix asked.

"It's part of my bond with the most beautiful woman I know," Eric said, "Alicia, a diamond naga. We are bonded and so the magic she knows, I can use as well. Casting spells against me is useless." Fakira backed away slightly. While she had never met a diamond naga, she knew they were one creature fairies should always avoid at all costs. They had the ability to redirect magic as easily as one breaths. They could even absorb it. If this human could use such powers, she doubted they could beat him.

As Eric moved closer, to prove his threat, he felt it. On his left ring finger, a silver ring with a ruby in it began heating up.

"Oh this is interesting," Eric said, chuckling, "It seems I'll be able to help you in the end after all."

"What?" Felix asked, confused.

"One of you has the ability to use dimensional magic," Eric said, "And it seems to be coming from . . . "

"... the shrunken boy," Eric finished as he pointed down to the close to three inch tall Ted.

As soon as Ted had been shrunk, Solita had landed next to him to make sure he was alright. Solita was worried about Ted when he shrunk right beneath her and she was worried something might have been wrong since Ted was hit with a shrink spell that had been countered. Solita was worried that there might have been some sort of strange side effect. So, Solita landed next to Ted and examined him, despite the fact he had told her he was alright. She continued her worried examinations as the giants around them conversed. It wasn't until Eric had said something about a "shrunken boy" that Solita and Ted turned their attention upwards.

Everyone was looking down at Ted and Solita as they stared upwards. "Wh-what?" Ted asked.

"It seems as though you have dimensional magic in your blood, boy," Eric stated.

Fakira had a feeling that Ted had a lot to say and she began growing him to normal size so that he wouldn't have to yell up at them. Once Ted was back to normal size, Solita sat upon his shoulder, listening intently. Ted looked at Eric with much confusion on his face as he said, "You must mistaken. I don't have any magic in my blood. I've never been able to use magic. I'm the only one in this group that can't use magic."

"You see the ring on my finger?" Eric questioned rhetorically, "It's a magic ring that is able to sense dimensional magic users, besides myself. This means that one of you can use said magic and it glows brighter upon pointing at you." Eric demonstrated this by pointing it at Ted. He even ordered Solita to leave Ted's shoulder and the ring still glowed in Ted's direction. "There's no denying it, you are the dimensional magic user," Eric concluded.

"But, I haven't been able to use magic my entire life," Ted argued.

"It's possible that dimensional magic is the only magic in you," Eric suggested.

"But that's the rarest type of magic. It usually has to be past down or I'd have to be bonded with one of the few creatures capable of that kind of magic," Ted continued to argue. He couldn't believe he had dimensional magic. He had never been special before, other than his exceptionally gifted knowledge of magical creatures and other worlds.

"Did one of your parents have dimensional magic?" Eric questioned.

"No," Ted quickly answered, but then he thought about it and continued, "At least, I don't think so."

"Why are you not certain?" Eric asked.

"My father traveled a lot. He was almost always gone, but he always came home to check on me regularly and would stay for about a month before heading out again," Ted explained. Ted thought carefully and began to think aloud, "He's been in other dimensions and worlds like Felarya. Maybe he did have that kind of magic. That's probably how he was able to travel around so much and get into other worlds. He was able to use dimensional magic, and I didn't even know about it. It all makes sense."

"Your father traveled a lot? Even to other dimensions? It would make sense that he would have magic to help him go to those places," Eric replied.

"He gone for long periods of time, but he always came regularly for a few months. He saw many places and creatures and told me about them. He's how I now so much about different worlds and many creatures. I learned everything from him," Ted informed.

"He sounds like a dimensional magic user. Usually, they don't like to stay in one place for too long. I unfortunately have a duty here and this gate. Otherwise I would be with my bond mate," Eric stated. Eric paused in silence for a moment. But that silence was ended with a sigh before he continued to speak, "Not only did your father pass down a rare magic, but he past down an even stronger dimensional magic than most users of said magic."

"Wh-what?" Ted gasped.

"Usually those gifted with the power have to use a dimensional gate just for our powers to work. That's the type I am. However, you bloodline has a more powerful magic. With your magic, you can make portals on your own without the use of a dimensional gate," Eric informed Ted.

"Without a gate!" Ted gasped in shock. The others were just as surprised when they heard this.

"Yes, when he has honed his skills, he would be able to make portals appear at will and direct them to where he wants to go by just thinking about where he wants to go," Eric explained, "But since he's just now learning of his heritage, that's too advanced for him at the moment. But with practice, he'll be able to do this."

Ted was speechless. He had dimensional magic all his life, and so had his father and he had never realized it. What made him feel worse was that he was William's slave for three years. If he had known what he was, he could have just teleported himself out of the castle and his problems would have been all over. "I could have escaped William's castle all along!" Ted thought as he clenched a fist.

Fakira was the first to notice this. "Ted what's wrong?" Felix and Solita grew concerned and Solita, who had flown back to Ted's shoulder, placed her hand on his neck.

"If I would have known about my powers, I could have escaped William's slavery much simpler. Hell, I probably wouldn't have become a slave and I would have teleported back to my house and have some unpleasant words with my mother," Ted explained.

"Your mother?" Solita questioned.

"When my father didn't come back on his regular visits, we assumed he was dead. My mother never loved me as much as my father. She was still nurturing and still took care of me, but I never felt the motherly bond most children had with their mother. Maybe that's why she found it easier to sell me when times grew hard," Ted told them.

Felix had heard this story before, but Fakira and Solita were hearing it for the first time. "I'm sorry I brought that up," Solita apologized.

"It's alright," Ted assured her. Ted turned his attention back to Eric and asked, "What do you need from me?"

"Well, I can open the portal for you four, but Felarya is dangerous and I can't keep the portal open till your business is done. I've told you already that you wouldn't want a naga to come through the portal while you're doing whatever you need to do," Eric stated.

"I see what you're getting at. You're going to need me to open the portal back up when we're finished," Ted said.

"That's correct. But I'm going to have to teach you how to open the portal, since you're a beginner. I can't bring myself to send you kids into Felarya without a sure way back home. I know what dangers lay in that place. It's no place for young ones such as yourselves. But then again, it does help to have a Felaryan fairy as a friend," Eric commented as he looked to Fakira, "Stories of humans and Felaryan top predators becoming friends is rare. Fairies are usually kind creatures that are friendly to all the other top predators despite whatever species they are, but even they see humans as snack."

"I used to think that about humans," Fakira admitted, "But Ted and Felix taught me the truth and that I should judge a person by their intelligence and sentient minds, not by their size. I will never eat a human, ever."

"It is good that some Felaryans have enough reason to be brought to the light," Eric replied, "So why are you going back to Felarya though?"

"I want to go there to say goodbye to my mother. Then I will come back here where I will live with my friends. I can't live in a place far away from my friends and Felarya is too dangerous for them," Fakira answered.

"I apologize for the questioning, but it is a highly unusual situation to find four children wanting to go to Felarya," Eric explained.

"Hey, I may look like a child, but I'm not a child," Solita yelled from Ted's shoulder.

"I'm very sorry," Eric apologized while bowing slightly, "I forgot that fairies stop aging regularly at thirteen and start aging like elves at that point, taking decades for their body to age one year."

Ted turned his head to look at Solita and he whispered, "You've never told us how old you are. How old are you really?"

The tiny fairy whom was sitting on Ted's shoulder and that had the body of a fifteen year looked back at Ted and replied in a teasing tone, "I'm not telling you that yet. You're just going to have to guess for now."

"Well, you four want to be off as soon as possible, I suppose. Come and I will show you the basics of dimensional magic. By just learning the basics, you will be able to open the portal by using a gate. Especially since dimensional gates can only go to certain places," Eric said.

Solita had to leave Ted's shoulder and she landed on Fakira's as Eric led Ted to the gate. "Now, you're lucky with this one, because this gate only goes to one other place, and that's Felarya. The gate on the other side could be different. If it is a newer model, it will have more than one possible exit point. If that's true, it will look different from this and have an arch shape with different writings on it. Each of those writings will be a different destination. I will write the words that would mean this gate since dimensional portal destinations have their own language. If the gate on the other side is new, you'll have to touch that magical word as you try to make a portal as well as picture your destination in your mind," Eric explained.

"Okay, so how do I open a portal?" Ted asked.

"It works a lot like most magic. You have search deep within yourself. There will be a funny feeling in the center of your body," Eric informed Ted.

"What sort of feeling am I looking for?" Ted questioned.

"It's hard to explain, but you'll know it's the magic within you when you feel it," Eric answered.

Ted took a deep breath and closed his eyes, concentrating deep within himself. At first, he felt nothing within him. He began to doubt that he had such rare magic within himself. However, he suddenly felt something within him near the center of his body. It was a strange feeling. It was as if it was a living mass deep within him. Ted was startled by the feeling and opened his eyes and stopped concentrating. Ted even jumped back a bit.

"I see you found it, but you mustn't pull back if you want to use the magic within you," Eric informed Ted, "You need to take hold of it." Ted took a deep breath again and closed his eyes, concentrating on what he had felt earlier. This time he didn't pull away from the mass inside him. His mind and thoughts dove into it, taking it all in. As if knowing what point Ted was at, Eric continued, "You're going to have to mold it now and divide it up into two parts of your body, your mind and your hand."

Ted did as Eric instructed and took the magic into his mind and hand. "You're going to need to open your eyes and keep concentrating," Eric instructed. Ted opened his eyes. "Aim your hand at the gate," Eric ordered. Ted did so. "Now, in order to open the portal and use your magic, you have to just the emotion that compels it. Dimensional magic has great ties with longing. You mustn't just want to go somewhere, but you have to long to go there as if your life would be complete if you could just go there."

Ted understood the feeling. He had had that feeling for the last three years he was a slave. Ted imitated that feeling, but directed it towards the gate. Suddenly, a strange silver colored smoke began to emerge from between the two pillars. It continued till the smoke had filled the entire space between the pillars. The smoke began to create an image. Ted could see a dirt path, with enormous trees bordering the path. The sun was shining brightly and in the distance appeared to be a city, but he couldn't see it too clearly. The image was still hazy like the smoke.

"You've done it," Eric congratulated, "Usually it takes a few tries for beginners. There is very powerful magic within you."

"How do I close it?" Ted asked.

"Let go of the magic and way your hand as though you're clearing smoke," Eric answered.

Ted did this and the portal and smoke blew away. Eventually, there was nothing left between the two pillars. "When you're finished with your business in Felarya, you must go to the gate you came in and open the portal. I will be on the other side helping keep it open."

"Won't the portal disappear when I lower my hand?" Ted questioned.

"To keep a portal open once it's started, you only need to keep hold of the magic. The only way to close a portal is letting go. Waving you have makes it go a little quicker. Now, before you're off, I'm going to write down something in case the portal on the other side is a newer model," Eric told Ted.

When Eric left back to his house, Fakira, Felix, and Solita approached Ted. "That was incredible, Ted," Felix congratulated.

"Yes, I can't believe you did it your first try," Solita added from Fakira's shoulder.

Fakira embraced Ted in a firm and tight hug. "Thank you. Because of you, I'm able to see my mother one more time," Fakira told Ted. As Fakira hugged, Solita climbed onto Ted's shoulder since Fakira was slightly shorter than Ted, being ten years old and Ted being thirteen.

Eric soon came back with a piece of paper with strange writing on it. He handed it to Ted and told him, "If the portal is a newer model on the other side, you will have to touch the writing on the arch that resembles these markings. Ted nodded and placed the paper in his pocket. "I will open the portal for you four," Eric announced before actually opening it. Felix, Fakira, Ted, and Solita all went through the portal and Eric closed it quickly behind them. "Good luck to you all. You will most likely need it," Eric muttered. He still couldn't believe he had sent children into Felarya.

1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
The four looked around at the ancient ruins that stood before them.

"Fakira, do you recognize this place?" Felix asked, standing close to her. Fakira shook her head.

"No, I rarely left the kingdom," Fakira said, "I was actually inside it when I hit a portal taking me to your world." Ted looked around and blinked in confusion at a strange stand selling clothing and other odd things.

"What's this place?" Ted asked, walking towards a place with a sign reading Mr. Mhurr's Many Marvels and Souvenirs Shop. It had a sign in front of it with words written in various languages. In the one he could understand, it read "Be back in five minutes." He glanced back at theeing had name. It seemed vaguely familiar.

"I don't know," Fakira said, moving close. Solita flew off Ted's shoulder and looked at some of the bottles on one of the shelves.

"'Chocolate scent: Guaranteed to make you taste like gourmet chocolates. Perfect for the meal you're about to be.'" she read one of them. There were similar bottles for mint, cherry and other fruits. She turned her head to Fakira who raised her hands defensively.

"Don't ask me," Fakira replied quickly.

"Why, it's obvious. Any one who is about to be eaten ought to at least taste well to the one eating them," came a voice from behind the group. Fakira, Ted, and Felix turned quickly and looked up, and up, and up. The being had gray hair covering his muzzle and stood stooped forward, but was still well past the seven foot mark in height. Ted looked at the creature his father has described many times to him and knew this was a neko.

"Excuse me?" Fakira replied.

"Father, don't start with the bottles just yet," came a female voice from behind the tall neko. Appearing in their view was an equally tall female neko. She had a tall beautiful body and amazing red hair. "Hello, my name is Likki." she batted her eyes at the boys, causing Solita and Fakira to move close to their guys.

"I'm Felix," Felix said after a moment of silence. "And this is Fakira, Ted, and Solita." Likki nodded.

"Would you care for a souvenir?" Likki asked, "Is this your first time to Ferlarya?"

"Um," Ted started, unsure whether to tell them what Fakira really was.

"What an interesting fairy. You don't usually see one that small," the elder neko and owner of the shop, Mhurr said, "Unless we have an eclipse, mind you."

"Does that affect a fairy's power?" Felix asked, looking at Fakira with worry.

"No, my father just says some odd things at times," Likki said, "So what may we offer you?"

"Directions please," Solita answered, "we need to reach the Fairy Kingdom." Both nekos pulled back from this comment. Generally they could keep their composure at some of their customer's odd responses, as well as their own. But four young, small beings wanting to go to the Fairy Kingdom was far outside even their norm.

"Why do you want to go there?" Mhurr asked.

"I used to live there," Fakira answered.

"Used to?" Likki asked. Fakira nodded.

"Yes, I was taken by a portal to their world and learned to not judge personhood by size. I can't live here anymore. So I want to say goodbye to my mother before returning with them to their home," Fakira explained.

"That is very strange," Mhurr replied, "Yes, we do have maps."

"You do?" felix said, smiling. The elder neko nodded.

"But nothing is for free," Likki added, as her eyes looked closely at Ted. She knew she had never seen him before, but he looked familiar. He kept glancing at their sign.

"Did you know a man with a scar on his left cheek connecting his mouth to his ear?" Ted asked. Mhurr looked at Likki.

"Do you mean that mage, what's was his name again Likki?" Mhurr asked.

"Arthur, I believe," Likki said when Ted's face brightened up.

"That was my father!" Ted exclaimed, "I knew I recognized your name. My father told me about this place. I get why he said they had some strange items on sale." His eyes glanced at the shirts saying "I'm with Stupid. Eat him instead!"

"He was your father?" Likki asked, giving Ted another look over. The nose and eyes were very similar to the mage she knew. And that smile was the same when Arthur laughed at some of their merchandise. As she thought on it, she always had a hard time selling to that man.

"Well, isn't this a coincidence," Mhurr said, "He was always good to us when he stopped by."

"Does that mean you'll give us the directions for free?" Solita asked.

"We could do that much," Likki said, "As he gave you such a glowing recommendation of our shop." Ted smiled as Mhurr walked behind the counter and looked through some things.

"Thanks," Felix said. Likki smiled.

"It's really no trouble," Likki responded,
