1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
"By the way, are any of you mages?" Likki inquired.

"Actually, we all are," Felix answered, "I can use fire and wind spells with ease as well as a few other spells. Ted can only use dimensional magic, but without it, we wouldn't be here now. Fakira is a Felaryan fairy and Solita is a fairy from our world. So, they can use magic as well."

Likki's eyes lit up with excitement as she turned them upon Solita. "So, you're a fairy from another world? I've never seen a fairy of your size before. I've only seen Felaryan fairies, since my world has no fairies in it, and those Felaryan fairies tend to keep themselves as giants. Tell me, can fairies of your world changes their sizes as well, little fairy?" Likki had crouched down so that she was more level with the humans in front of her. Likki looked as though she was a small child waiting to be told a fascinating story. Female nekos, like fairies, tended to be in touch with a sort of child-like side to them, and Likki didn't seem to be an exception.

Solita was very nervous now that the neko's attention was fully on her. Not only was it because she was small and they were giant strangers, but they were also nekos. There was the reason why Solita had flown to Ted's shoulder as soon as the nekos showed themselves. She was frightened of nekos and now scooted closer to Ted's neck, hoping Ted would protect her, even though these nekos seemed to be kind. Solita had heard horror stories about wild nekos eating fairies, but also playing with them, like a cat would with a mouse, before devouring them. Solita even heard that "civilized" nekos ate smaller beings as well. There seemed to be an instinct to eat small creatures in nekos that is hard to resist when they spot small creatures, even if the creature is sentient! This neko wasn't from her world, and luckily wasn't from Felarya, but it was a neko and she still feared it had that instinctual urge.

Likki and the others noticed Solita shivering and Likki figured out the reason. Likki backed away a little in hopes to make Solita more comfortable. "I'm sorry, I didn't realize you were frightened of me," Likki apologized. "There is no need to worry about me, Solita," Likki added Solita's name in hopes to assure her she saw her as a person and not prey, "I don't eat smaller beings that are sentient. There are smaller sentient beings in my world as well, but I never harm them. I can resist the urges that nekos have that you must have heard of. Trust me, you're safe with me." Likki giggled a bit and added, "Now, if you had a mouse tail and mouse ears, it may be a little tougher to resist."

Solita seemed to cheer up a little, but she still stayed close to Ted's neck. "So, can you size change like Felaryan fairies?" Likki asked again.

"I can not," Solita answered, "Fairies of my world don't have that power."

"It would explain why you are so little than," Likki replied, "It's rare to see a fairy of human size, let alone one of your size, Solita."

There was a bit of silence and they could hear Mhurr muttering to himself, "Maps, maps, so many maps." He picked up a few maps and looked at the titles. "Map of Doom, Map to a Felaryan's Stomach, The Insides of Felaryans. Yet no Felaryan Map," Mhurr continued to mutter.

"You said you've seen my father," Ted broke the silence, "When's the last time you've seen him?"

Ted looked at the map closely and found where the Fairy Kingdom's borders were. It was clear that it would take a week or so to get there. "What's the best way to get to the Fairy Kingdom?" Ted asked Mhurr.

"We would much rather go on the safest and quickest path possible to avoid as many dangerous predators as we can," Ted informed the tall neko.

"Well, getting close to the Giant Tree is suicidal due to Crisis living there," Mhurr said while pointing at the tree in the map, "You'd have to go around it. If you decide to go south of the tree, you can follow the Shard River. The Tolmeshal Forest is about as dangerous as any other Felaryan forest, but nothing to make it over the top danger. There are the usual predators there. It's still highly dangerous."

"However," Mhurr continued, "There is a small town called Safe Harbor in the forest along the river. It is a human and neko settlement started by a giantess named Jade. Jade does not eat sentient beings and protects that town. Maybe you will be lucky to come across her and she can protect you and bring you to the town. Continue along the River and you should make it to the Fairy Kingdom, but it's still a dangerous trek past the Safe Harbor."

"What's the path to the North like?" Ted asked.

"You'd have to go through the Bulvon Forest before you can get to the northern river. This area contains many slug girls and dridders that will eat you. And insects are impervious to most fairy magic. There is a naga that had been raised by humans in there named Fiona, but it's still dangerous with the dridders and slug girls. The Forest of Whispers is even more dangerous. However, this may be the quicker of the paths," Mhurr informed them

"Well, what's your answer?" the naga asked, tightening her tail around her prisoner. The male dridder groaned in pain as his breathing became more labored.

"All right! I'll do as you command," the female dridder shouted begrudgingly. The naga nodded and smiled darkly.

"Then help the one on her front first," the naga ordered. The female dridder glared cold hatred at the human-loving naga, but did as ordered and moved to Solita. She carefully cut the webbing that was holding Solita down.

As Solita felt the webbing become unstuck, she began moving her wings so she wouldn't fall down once free.

"I can't believe I'm losing two fairies," the dridder grumbled as she worked on freeing Solita's upper body first. "You would have lasted us a month, maybe more."

"Sorry to disappoint," Solita replied snidely. Soon she found her top torso free and she could lift her body off the webbing more and more as the dridder worked downward.

Fakira and Felix gave a breath of relief when Solita was flying once more. She did not wish to chance landing on another branch. Still glaring, the dridder moved to Fakira.

"Start with her head and make sure her wings are still usable," the naga added as Ted poked his head out of Solita's hand to watch. The dridder growled and was about to snap back when she heard her mate groan once more.

Slowly Fakira felt her head being freed from the webbing and lifted it up. The dridder worked on her spanned arms next before moving to the torso, where she was careful to not damage the fairy's wings.

In short time, Fakira was once more freed and held the staff tight in her hands. She glanced uneasily at the naga still holding the boy of her life before staring at the female naga, now glaring at the naga.

"I did as you demanded, now release my mate," she said. The naga said noting but gave a pwerful motion with her tail, throwing the mate to the female dridder. "How are you?" she whispered as she caught her mate on the webs.

"My arms are broken," he answered. The female growled, knowing it would be impossible to catch them all again with him being injured. She helped him in their retreat. Hopefully they would find another catch in some other webs.

"Good riddance," the naga said, sighing before looking down at the fairies. She saw another human with the first fairy freed. She opened her hand and looked at Felix.

"These two, are they your friends?" she asked. Felix moved quickly to the edge of the hand and saw his friends free.

"Yes, they are," Felix said as Fakira came up quickly. She snatched Felix from the hand in a flash and held him close.

"You're safe," Fakira said as she hugged Felix. The naga had a soft smile on her face.

"I'm glad there are others who see humans as people," the naga said, "My name is Fiona."

"I'm Fakira," Fakira said.

"Solita," Solita added, "So how did you come to see humans as equals?"

"It's a long story, but we don't have time to tell it now. Those dridders were pretty pissed and could come back with reinforcements," the naga Fiona said, "Follow me to a safer place." She turned away and began moving across the canopy. She paused for a moment to see neither fairy had moved with her. "I promise you I won't eat your friends," she said.

"I think we can trust her," Felix noted. Fakira looked down in her hand at Felix and nodded.

"Solita?" she asked. Solita glanced at Fakira, then to Ted, who nodded in agreement with Fakira.

"All right," she conceded and the two began following Fiona.

A little under a half an hour later, Fiona stopped at a large tree with an opening in it.

"This is my home," she said, "No dridders come around here at risk of me killing them."

"You do know how to fight, that's for sure," Solita said, staying in the air. She still didn't fully trust this naga. Fiona nodded.

"Yes, but part of me wishes I could use magic like you two. To make such wounds in the trees is truly amazing. You might even be able to fight Crisis or Anna with some training," Fiona commented. Fakira recalled the name from Mhurr's comments on their path. whoever this Crisis was, she sounded like a powerful being.

So, do you know your way through this land?" Fakira asked. Fiona nodded.

"Yes, where are you four headed?" Fiona asked.

"The Fairy Kingdom, to say goodbye to my mother," Fakira answered. Fiona caught the pain in the young fairy's voice and recalled her own pain of leaving her human parents. Part of her wanted to ask why, but realized it was because of her views on humans. No fairy could last long in this world with those views.

"I see," Fiona replied.

"Do you think you could help us reach there?" Felix called from the hands.

1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Fiona winced when she heard the question. Her face then looked down at Felix in Fakira's closed hand with a sincerely apologetic face. "I'm sorry, but I can't take you to the fairy kingdom. Going to a land where I can be shrunk and eaten doesn't sound like a good place to me," Fiona informed him, emphasizing the "I". Fiona was too frightened by a place where she could become the prey. She had been a giant predator all her life and knew what could happen to humans, which was why she sympathized with them so much, as well as the fact that she was raised by humans. This showed how little Fiona knew about fairies, however. Giants were in fact safe around most fairies, because they judged people by their normal size, and if one's normal size was a giant, then they were a person in the eyes of fairies. That is unless they encounter a fairy that viewed everything as prey, they seriously upset a fairy, or they encounter a playful fairy that wants to shrink them. Even though playful fairies could see a shrunken giant person as still a person, they might be tempted to see them as a toy, pet, or prey. So, Fiona was safe around fairies, but then again, she thought herself as a human more than a naga and if a predator ate humans, she felt they were dangerous creatures.

Fiona noticed the disappointed faces and added, "But I think I know someone that would help you."

Most of the travelers' faces lit up upon hearing this information. "You know someone else that might help us, and the 'person' doesn't eat humans?" Solita questioned in a little disbelief.

"He would never eat a human because he is a human," Fiona replied.

"Human? How could he be much help? This is a dangerous task," Fakira said. Fakira didn't want to sound like humans were worthless, but she had to admit that a human guide would be dangerous for the human, even if they could try their best to protect him like they were doing for Felix and Ted.

"He's very skilled, "Fiona defended, "He knows this world like the back of his hand. He's been everywhere in this place and knows about everything. He even created the map of Felarya, well, at least the best map of Felarya. It even has pictures of the top predators and where their territories are. They have red circles around them, and he also has pictures of people with blue circles around them and where they could be found. The blue circles are the human sized people and the giant predators who would help humans and not bring harm to them. There are others like me out there that would help protect humans, such as Jade.

"You seem to have high regard for this human," Fakira noted.

"Yes, he and his family helped me during a dark time. I owe a lot to them," Fiona said, "They even put my picture in a blue circle on their map. I just wish he would allow copies to be sold in every market. Maybe then I would get to met more people and help them. You could probably imagine how lonely it gets here."

"I wish we would have had that map as soon as we came here," Felix stated, "Then we would have searched for you first."

Fiona's cheeks turned red form Felix's words, well, every part of her cheeks except for the brown freckles. Fakira was slightly jealous by Felix's compliment towards Fiona. As she examined Fiona, she noticed that Fiona was much older and had the same kind of body as Solita, age wise, and Fiona was three feet taller than Fakira. Fiona had a cute yet beautiful face like hers. Fiona was also naked, showing off more developed breasts and her vagina. Fakira was slightly used to this, because she remembered that almost all Felaryan predators were naked. This was because most didn't have size changing abilities and couldn't find clothes that fit them. So, they've just accepted their nudity. Even some fairies stayed naked in order to attract the opposite sex of a human sized prey. Only those giant predators that had no size changing abilities that were extremely self conscious of their nudity insisted on trying to find something to use as clothing. Fakira could tell that it was Ted and Felix's first time seeing a nude female, because they kept glancing at Fiona's breasts every so often.

"So, can you take us to this human?" Fakira asked.

"I can so you the way out of the Bulvon Forest, but that's as far as I will go," Fiona told them. Fiona didn't say that she was afraid of leaving the Bulvon Forest, but she didn't have to. The others could see it in her eyes. "I'll lead you to the river and take you to the edge of the Bulvon forest," Fiona continued, "Then, all you'd need to do is follow the river and you'll find his home. I've never been there, but that's the directions he gave me if I ever needed his help."

"Can we start traveling there now?" Fakira asked, ready to get going again.

"How about we have lunch first," Fiona insisted, "Are you four hungry? I know I am."

"I guess that's okay," Fakira hesitantly agreed. Fakira looked down at Felix and asked, "Are you hungry?" Felix nodded.

Fakira looked at Ted and Solita. Ted nodded, but Solita looked at Fiona suspiciously. Solita had always had trust issues, ever since her parents had died. She still didn't trust the Felaryan naga. It's not Solita's fault that she has an untrusting personality. She lived in a different world from Fakira. She lived in a world were she was the small person and there were many large creatures that would like to eat her or harm her. She had to be suspicious to survive this world. Luckily, once a person was deemed trustworthy to Solita, they were forever trustworthy in her eyes. Fiona still hadn't passed the test yet. Solita eventually nodded her head since everyone else had agreed with Fiona.

"Great!" Fiona cheered like a giddy child, "I'll go hunt for some food. Would anyone like to join me?"

"I'll join you," Fakira offered. She then turned to Solita and asked, "You don't mind staying here with Ted and Felix while I hunt, right?"

"I don't mind," Solita replied as Fakira handed Felix to her open hand. Solita was actually glad Fakira would go with Fiona, because if the naga tried something on the hunt, Fakira would be able to shrink her. Plus, if the naga was truly untrustworthy and had some dangerous predator in her home, waiting for them, Solita would keep an eye out for it. She would not let anything happen to Felix and especially Ted.

"We'll be back with fruits and animals," Fiona informed them.

"We might not need as much food as you think, because I can grow food and dead animals much easier than living things," Fakira said.

"That's great!" Fiona exclaimed before heading through the canopy and motioning for Fakira to follow. Solita entered the tree through the hole at canopy level.

They are caught in a downpour.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Fakira flew fast to keep up with Fiona. The way she moved from tree to tree was amazing, not losing any speed at all.

"So what will we hunt?" Fakira asked.

"I usually go after a flock of drashig," Fiona replied, not wanting to add an occasional human. She saw them as people, she knew it was wrong, but sometimes her instincts got the better of her. "It takes about ten to fill me, but if you can grow them, that will help on how many we need."

"How big are they?" Fakira asked, who had never seen one before.

"About seven feet tall. They also spit an acidic venom at you," Fiona replied. Fakira nodded, happy she left Felix with Solita. He would be safe there and not have a chance to spend any close time with Fiona.

"Thanks for the warning," Fakira said when Fiona paused and looked at a branch. Fakira saw her smile and looked to the branch. A Bulvonian snail was passing over the branch, but that was not what was making Fiona smile: Two nekos were on top of it and one was holding a pole with some cabbage on it in front of the snail. Fiona moved to hide and signaled Fakira to follow her. She led Fakira away from the snail and it's riders.

"They were smart," Fiona said, looking at Fakira.

"How so?" Fakira asked.

"Snails avoid dridder webs and slug girl can't track them on the snail's paths," Fiona said. Fakira nodded.

"Do you see people using them often?" Fakira asked.

"Sometimes, but I can't see everywhere," Fiona replied. Her eyes scanned around. "Do you mind if I ask you some questions?" Fakira shook her head, guessing already what she wanted to know.

"Not at all," Fakira replied.

"How did you come to see your friends as people?" Fiona said. Fakira took a breath.

"They saved my life when I owed them nothing," Fakira responded, "They showed me the truth that my mother would never accept. They accepted me and trusted me, depsite knowing where I came from. I have come to care for my friends and will kill any who try to take them from me." She blinked as she saw the worry on Fiona's face, realizing that last part was said much colder than she planned. But she didn't mind. Now Fiona would know to not be so nice with her Felix when they were done.

"Um, I think there's a flock this way," Fiona said breaking the ice that just formed.

"Lead on," Fakira said.

*********

Solita looked carefully around the home. It was a quiet place with a large cushion made from leaves and other things for a bed. But there was nothing dangerous inside. Sighing, she opened her hands.

"Solita, what was that for?" Ted asked, looking up at his girlfirend's beautiful face.

"I don't trust Fiona," Solita said simply enough.

"How come?" Felix asked. Solita's eyes looked at Felix.

"Because I have spent most of my life the small one, so I'm weary of new people," Solita replied, "I don't trust quickly."

"Even if she saved us?" Ted asked.

"Yes," Solita affirmed, sitting on the floor. "I don't want to lose you Ted, and I know Fakira would be devistated if you were lost Felix. So please bear with my actions. We only want for you two to be safe." Ted and Felix said nothing for a moment. They knew what it was like to be alone. In the dark halls of Lord william's castle, finding an ally was rare, finding a friend was even rarer. Solita was just trying to look out for them. Even if it was a bit cold.

"I understand," Ted said, walking down Solita's arm. She kept still as he reached her elbow and hugged the arm. Solita smiled and sighed. It had been a long few days.

***********

"How did you find this flock so far away?" Fakira asked, as they held onto six drashigs.

"I smelled them all the way back from my home. I have a better nose than most anything in this land," Fiona said, "It's how I found you four being caught by the dridders."

"That's some nose," Fakira said, noticing how Fiona suddenly tensed and began taking deep breaths through her nose.

"Oh no," she bemoaned, turning to the way home, she started quickly. Fakira jumped into the air and followed the racing naga.

"What's wrong?" Fakira asked.

"A storm's coming, a big one," Fiona said as distant thunder rumbled over head. "I don't like storms," Fiona added, "I haven't since I was little."

Fakira said nothing in response as they pressed on. She was happy Felix would be safe in Fiona's home. She understood the worry about big storms in Felarya. And a giant wouldn't say "big" unless they meant it.

1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Fiona was relieved that her and Fakira made it to her home in record time and before the storm could get anywhere near them. When Fiona was securely on the branch that led to her home's entrance, she sniffed in the direction of the big storm. It was definitely heading in her direction, but she could possible finish lunch before it reached them. Fiona sighed and whispered, "Good, we made it here before the storm could catch us." Fiona couldn't stop her mind from recalling the memories and the feeling she had experienced the last time she had been caught in a storm. This caused Fiona to shiver as she looked down at the branch she was on.

Fakira landed on the same branch just before Fiona had whispered. She landed right in front of Fiona and had heard what was said. She saw that Fiona was looking down and shivering with her arms hugging herself, her hands were still carrying the three drashigs she was in charge of. Though Fakira was still a bit jealous of how Felix had gawked at Fiona's nudity, Fakira still felt concern of the Felaryan naga. It wasn't the naga's fault that she was naked and Felix had never seen a nude female before. Of course he'd stare at her and Fiona didn't have clothes to fit her. Plus, the friendliness she had given Felix seemed to be the same friendliness she gave to everyone. Fiona just seemed like a very kind and friendly person. Plus, she saw humans as people, and any Felaryan that did so was good in Fakira's book. "Fiona, are you alright?" Fakira asked.

The terrible memories in Fiona's mind suddenly disappeared and she was back in the present. Fiona looked up to see Fakira concerned for her well being. It wasn't the same amount of concern as the two people that had helped Fiona through her dark times, but it was still concern. Fiona might have found four more friends, even if they were leaving Felarya once Fakira's business was settled. Also, the possibility of having two human friends made her even happier because she had so very few human friends. "I'll feel better once we're inside," Fiona told her.

Fakira and Fiona entered the tree home with six drashigs. Solita was sitting against one of the walls with both Felix and Ted in her hands which were close to her stomach. Ted was leaning against the soft skin of Solita's belly. Once Fiona had the two curtains that she had made out of leaves and other material from the forest closed where her entrance and window were, she felt much happier. "Lunch is here!" Fiona called out quite cheerfully.

"Why did you close everything up?" Solita interrogated.

"There's a storm approaching," Fakira informed her. After Fakira set her three drashigs down where Fiona had put hers, Fakira approached Solita and held out her hand once she crouched in front of her. Knowing what Fakira wanted, Solita lifted the hand that Felix was in towards Fakira's waiting hand. "Did you miss me?" Fakira asked.

"Yes, actually I did a bit," Felix answered as he crawled onto the hand of his giant fairy girlfriend. When Felix was seated on her palm, Fakira lifted her hand to her cheek and pressed Felix gently against it. She smiled as his tiny body was against her cheek and as he tried to do his best to hug it back. Fakira began shaking her head slightly so that her cheek continued to rub against Felix's body. Felix felt that he was in a soft and warm heaven.

Fiona smiled upon seeing this. It was clear that the human and the fairy cared for each other deeply and even loved each other. Fiona had thought it was impossible for a Felaryan top predator that had been raised by its own kind could ever actually fall in love with a human, but Fakira and this human proved that it was indeed possible. "Maybe there is still some hope for me," Fiona thought. She had been raised by humans and thought she was a human in a naga body. She wished for a human mate and not a naga mate that would see humans as prey. She wished for a human friend who wouldn't see her as some monster, a human she could stay with and protect from all the other predators out there. Fiona wanted to feel for a human the way Fakira felt for hers. She wanted what Fakira had.

Not wanting to be saddened or jealous of Fakira, Fiona cut off those thoughts as soon as she realized something. "Oh, I'm sorry," Fiona said causing everyone to turn to her, "I didn't catch your names or introduce myself to the two of you." Fiona meant the two humans who were friends with giant fairies. "That was very rude of me not to ask for your names," Fiona said before slithering close to the fairies. She stopped in front of Fakira and looked down at the human in her hand. "My name is Fiona, and what shall I call you?" Fiona asked politely.

"My name is Felix." Fakira had Felix in an open palm, but still held him close to her.

"It's nice to meet you Felix," Fiona said as she brought a fist in front of Felix with only her pointer finger sticking out of the fist. The finger was pointing at Felix and directly in front of him and she held it there. Felix was confused by the action as well as everyone else. Fiona tilted her head and asked, "Don't humans shake hands when meeting?"

Finally realizing what Fiona meant with her action, Felix replied, "Oh. Yes, they do. I just didn't realize..."

"I should have been clearer. I mean, I can't shake humans' hands the same way. I can only offer a finger," Fiona said. Normally, she didn't shake hands when meeting a new person. Fiona was the type of person that was more comfortable hugging people. Heck, she even picked up human sized strangers she just met without a second thought and would hug them against her breast. Maybe that was part of her "clingy" nature. However, these fairies were very protective of their humans and Fiona didn't want to offend them or scare their humans.

After Felix grasped Fiona's finger with both hands and "shook it", Fiona approached Ted who was held even closer to Solita. Solita protectively held Ted in a fist where only his arms, shoulders, and head stuck out. "And what might your name be?" Fiona asked.

"Ted."

"Nice to meet you Ted," Fiona said as she "shook his hands", but as she did this, she looked at Ted deeply and fell into a trance-like state. Being naturally worried, Solita blocked the rest of Ted with her other hand. Fiona shook her head and apologized, "Sorry, it's just that... Never mind. What shall we do for lunch?"

"First, we need to know how many want cooked food. We will cook the drashigs while they're still small, because it will be easier," Fakira stated.

"You can cook them?" Fiona asked with mouth watering, "I haven't had cooked food in a long time. I would like my drashig cooked."

"Okay, that's cooked for Fiona, Ted, and Felix as well as raw for my meal. What about you Solita?" Fakira asked.

"I don't eat raw meat. My species of fairy are like humans. We need food cooked," Solita answered. Solita then turned to Fiona and asked, "You used to eat cooked food? I thought nagas ate their food raw."
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: How Rude of Me

There was a thumping on the doorway,  Fiona has another guest.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
Felix felt his body shake as the thunder ripped over head. His mind flashed back to the spring of the year before Fakira came to the castle. A powerful storm hit the lands and the thunder was unlike anything he had lived through. A stray bolt of lighting actually struck the castle and damaged the tower it hit. It was a storm he wouldn't soon forget. But that horrific storm was nothing more than a mild shower to what he heard hit outside. He felt his body continue to shake and felt like Fakira was pressing him against her chest. Turning around, he saw Fiona hugging onto Fakira, her large breasts pressing against Fakira's hands. She was shaking.

No one said anyhting as Fiona calmed down and quickly pulled herself off of Fakira.

"I'm sorry," Fiona said, "I've hated storms for years." No one said anything for a second.

"Um, you were saying about eating cooked food," Felix prompted. Fiona nodded.

"I was raised by human parents," Fiona responded, "They used to cook my meals."

"You were raised by humans?" Solita asked, not fully believing the statement. Fiona nodded.

"Yes, I was out in the woods when a storm hit and I was lost from my birth parents. I was small, scared and alone," Fiona answered, "But I was found by my human mother and father. They cared for me and loved me dearly." Felix and Fakira could see small tears forming in the corner of her eyes.

"Did they die?" Felix asked. Fiona shook her head.

"No, I was growing too large and the other humans we were living with were becoming worried. So I left and came here," Fiona said, "I didn't want my parents to be thrown out because of me." She took a breath and looked at her company. "So how did you end up together?" looking at Ted and Solita.

"Felix, Fakira and Ted entered my clan's woods and didn't act like normal humans," Solita answered, "They were considerate, wise, and trustworthy." The words echoed strangely in Fiona's ears.

"There's another fairy wood than the Fairy Kingdom?" she asked.

"Not here in Felarya," Solita responded, "I'm not a fairy of this world." She ended it there, not wishing to reveal her true size to this . . . ally. That was an acceptable term for Solita's mind.

"So, why don't we get started on cooking?" Fakira asked, "Do you have some dry wood?" Fiona nodded and moved to one side and pulled out some small dried branches.

"I was going to use these to try and make a table, but when the last storm hit, I broke the branches. Will this work?" Fiona asked, placing the wood on the ground. Fakira knelt down and let Felix off to look at the pile.

"Do you have a stone we can build the fire on, so we don't damage the floor?" Felix asked.

"No, but I don't mind if you leave some marks on the floor," Fiona said. Felix nodded.

"Ted, mind helping?" Felix asked. Ted glanced at his Solita and she placed him down near Felix. "I think something like the roast pits back in the kitchen would work here," Felix said, looking at the dead birds which were taller than either human. Ted nodded.

"Yeah, that should work," Ted replied, "Let's get the wood out in that order."

"Is there anything we can do?" Fakira asked.

"Um, mind cleaning the birds?" Ted asked. Both fairies smiled and picked some of the dead birds and began removing the feathers.

It took about ten minutes to finish cleaning the birds and for the boys to set up the roast pits. With the giant ladies help, a branch was speared through the bird and set up to roast. Felix stood before the wood and concentrated for a moment. He opened his eyes and the wood caught on fire. He moved the fire so the entire pit was ablaze and they began slowly cooking the birds.

Fiona was happy to smell cooking meat once more and her guests were a great distraction from the storm as it was raging outside.

"So, would you mind telling us about this person you're taking us to meet?" Solita asked, glancing at Fiona.

"Well, we shouldn't move until after the storm passes," Fiona replied.

"But you can still tell us about this being," Solita countered. Fiona nodded.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.title: Big Storm

Fiona said nothing. The storm was passed and they could leave.
1451211212121121221122111111122212222112.content:
"I first met him many, many, years ago. I cannot remember how long ago it was, but I think it was at the very least around six years ago," Fiona informed them all, " I had left my parents and by the time I met him, I had been living in the Bulvon Forest for a couple of years. It was a very dark time for me." Fiona's mind recalled those first years in the Bulvon forest. She had been completely alone for that whole duration between then and the time she had left her parents and the human village. They seemed very long and lonely years for her, and it had allowed her naga instincts to kick in more frequently than ever. Those instincts took over at times and caused her to devour humans which only brought her into a deeper depression and filled her with terrible regret and fear for any human that should encounter her.

"Was that a dark time for you because you were lonely?" Felix asked, seeing the expression Fiona had made after she had told them when she had first met the human and while she retreated into a silence and gazed into nothingness.

"Yes, that was one of the reasons," Fiona muttered as she continued to stare into nothingness. Protecting her parents by allowing them to stay in the safe human village wasn't the only motive for running away. She also feared her naga instincts and her naga desires of eating humans. She thought that the village would be much safer with her gone. But being alone in the savage world of the Bulvon Forest only allowed her instincts to strengthen their hold on her and she had given into the evil within herself that she tried to keep at bay by staying as far away from humans as she could. Fiona closed her eyes, but could still see all the faces of the humans she had eaten over the course of her life which brought upon a terrible feeling in the pit of her stomach and a single tear drop form the corner of both her eyes, leaving a tear trail.

Seeing Fiona act this way made Fakira feel sorry for the Felaryan naga, because she was clearly recalling her "dark days" more than the human she was supposed to talk about. Hoping to bring Fiona out of such a recall, Fakira asked, "So what happened when you met this human you wish to bring us to?"

This question did bring Fiona back to the whole reason she was recalling these memories and she cleared the faces that plagued her mind. "When I first came across him, he didn't really trust me all that well. I am a naga after all and there are very few nagas out there that are friends of humans. He was a very powerful mage and was able to bind my down to the ground," Fiona explained. Fiona left out the part that the human's suspicion of her was well deserved, because when she first met him, she tried to eat him. It was his powerful magic binding her to the ground that gave her the time to regain control. "I pleaded to him, and I explained to him that I was raised by humans and didn’t want to eat him. Luckily, he believed my words and stayed two days with me to help me with my loneliness. He was a very kind man and I quickly saw him as a friend. He was a traveler, and though he told me very little about himself, I was fine with that. I got to see him quite regularly, because he traveled the same route at regular intervals. Though I would only see him a few days during his travels, and a few special days he would come see me, it did wonders to wiping away my loneliness. Sometimes while he traveled, his wife, or at least I think it was his wife, would stay with me a few days as well to help me. They told me that if I ever needed them, I could visit their home, and they gave me the directions. Though, I've never traveled there."

"This human has a wife?" Solita asked. She found it odd that Fiona did know whether this other person was a wife or not to the human they were going to see.

"They never told me they were married or not. They discussed very little about themselves, but she told me a few things about her past which helped me in many ways. However, they acted like husband and wife, but I've never hear of a human ever actually marrying a Felaryan Top Predator."

"A Felaryan Predator? What was she?" Fakira asked.

"She's a pantaur. I know pantaurs are a branch from the sphinx family, but she definitely must have had some sphinx blood in her, because even if she looked physically like a pantaur, she had some personality qualities of a sphinx. She had a similar past, because she was raised by a human family as well." Fiona remembered one of the many talks she had with the pantaur. Also being a giant Felaryan that was raised by humans, the pantaur saw humans as people, and she to have some difficulties holding her instincts back. However, the pantaur never let it take hold of her and never gave in to eating humans. The pantaur gave Fiona pointers on how to control those savage instincts, and from then on, Fiona had eaten very few humans. She still at humans from time to time and the instincts got the best of her, but she kept in control for close to 95% of her human encounters opposed to those first years alone.

Solita, who was still a little skeptical about Fiona's story, asked, "And what are their names? I could understand them keeping some secrets from you, but surely they've told you their names."

"The pantaur's name is Aubree and the man's name is Arthur," Fiona answered.

The rest of the group froze and stopped what they were doing once they heard that name. They stared at Fiona with wide eyes of surprised while Fiona grew a little uncomfortable with their stares. Ted, who was no longer focused on the cooking meat, stared up at Fiona and quickly asked, "Are you sure his name was Arthur?"

"Yes, I'm very sure. Why are you all looking at me strangely?"

Ted thought about what Fiona had said about the man she called Arthur. She said he was a traveler and walked through the Bulvon Forest regularly. Did that mean his father walked through this forest to get to the dimensional gate? Plus, Fiona said he was a powerful mage. Ted now knew of the dimensional magic his father must have possessed, but maybe he had more magic. The only thing that didn't make since was the pantaur Fiona thought was his wife. "Did he have two wives? Is that why he traveled back and forth though the two realms? Hell, he might even have wives in other dimensions if this is the case." Ted had to know if the Arthur she talked about was the same Arthur that was his father. "Did he have a scar?"

"Yes, why do you ask such questions?"

"Because, I think the man you speak of could possibly be my father."

Fiona's eyes widened now. Was that why Ted looked familiar to her? "Ted, may I take a closer look at you?"

"Why?", but it wasn't Ted that asked this. Instead, it was Solita who got closer to Ted, ready to protect him from the naga.

Fiona looked up at the suspicious fairy before telling her, "I just want to take a closer look to see if he and Arthur have some resemblances." Fiona looked back down at Ted and asked, "So, may I take a closer look at you?" Fiona placed a hand down on the floor with her palm facing upwards.

Ted looked up at Solita who was staring down at him with worry in her eyes. "It'll be alright," Ted mouthed the words to Solita before walking onto Fiona's palm.

Fiona lifted her hand very carefully; she didn't want Solita to be angered with her any more than she probably already was. Fiona lifted Ted to her face and examined him with her different colored eyes. "I knew you looked a bit familiar," Fiona finally told him, "I can see many resemblances of Arthur in you."

"R-really? Could the Arthur you speak of be my father?" Ted asked.

Fiona nodded.

"When did you see him last?"

Fiona thought carefully. She hadn't realized this before, but she soon realized it had been a very long time since she had seen Arthur. "I think... I think it's been close to three, maybe four years since I've seen him."

"Don't you find it odd that a person that you haven't seen a person you used to see regularly in three to four years?" Solita questioned, "You didn't think about going to try and find out what's happened to him?"

"I... I didn't realize it's been so long until I thought about it now," Fiona explained.

"What if he's dead?"

"I..." Fiona started, but had no idea what to even say.

"We still have to go and see him," Ted turned and informed the rest of the group, "If what Fiona says is true, then we have to see him more than ever, because we now we know where he lives."

Fiona soon set Ted down on the ground and he proceeded to approach Solita and the fire that was cooking the meat. Eventually, the meat was cooked for everyone and Fakira grew the food for Solita, Fiona, and herself, while Felix and Ted shared from Fakira and Solita. They really didn't need all the birds Fakira and Fiona captured, but Solita and Fakira knew a way to preserve the food magically and they could carry it with them. Felix blew out the fire with his wind magic. Fiona noticed this.

Fiona moved to the the doorway and existed. Solita and Fakira carried their guys out and Fiona led them towards the edge of the Bulvon woods.

Lord William glared at the council before him. No decent ideas had come about to breaking into the Fairy Woods once more and Sanya had been firm that she wanted a good plan before trying to break into the forest again. She was the only person he would agree to follow, even if he disagreed with the idea. And now he was feeling tired. But it wasn't a normal fatigue. He knew it well and knew she wished to swim.

"Leave me. If there are no decent ideas for breaking the new barrier, I will be very angry" Lord William barked suddenly, startling those present. They glanced at each other and rose quickly. Once they had left, he rose and went into his bedroom and placed a sign outside it. He moved to his bed and laid down, falling asleep.

When he opened his eyes once more, he found himself in a lush jungle.

"William," came a voice from behind him. He turned and saw Sanya standing in all her beauty.

"What is it?" William asked as she walked towards him.

"I have an idea on how to use the portals here in Feylara to reach you," Sanya answered. His eyes widened in shock.

"But how? The one in the human settlement is guarded and they won't open it for a succubus and the one in the ruins won't let you near it, even in your small form," Willam replied. Sanya's eyes darkened as she recalled the energy blast that damn gate had hit her with.

"Well, it will be because of those escaped slaves. They're here in Feylara," Sanya replied,"And I have an idea on how to use them for my escape." William took a deep breath when he heard mention of those slaves who nearly killed him.

Right before them, was a wide river, and to their left, much smaller and different trees along with very small vegetation along the river.

Humans were safer if they weren't near her.

Though the fairies and humans she now called friends couldn't tell why Fiona was afraid, they could tell that she was affraid of leaving the Bulvon Forest. "Fiona, Arthur and Aubree meant a lot to you, right?" Fakira spoke up.

"And you said these people haven't come to see you in years. Doesn't that worry you?"

"Yes, it does. I hope that they're alright."

"Don't you think you should come with us and check on the people that mean so much to you? Can you really abandon them?"

14512112121211212211221112.content:
As the river carried them through the cave's caverens, Fakira found herself going under the water. However, when Felix and Ted noticed this, they grabbed a hold of her, to keep her head above the surface.

Finally, they saw the sky, and saw the stars. However, the river was still too strong for them to move to the shore, and they were held together by the rope, which had wrapped around them.

Suddenly, another rope was tossed at them, and a voice said, "Grab a hold you three before you reach the falls." At this, they heard the water starting to roar. Fearing for their lives, the three grab a hold of the rope, and found themselves being pulled to safety. When they looked at the person who had saved them, they saw a young man, about twenty years of age. "Well," he said. "Do a bit of night fishing and I catch two lads and a lass. Well, let me get that rope off of yah." With that, he pulled out a knife and deftlly severed the rope that had held the three together. "There," he said. "That must be a lot better, eh?"

"Um, who are you?" Ted asked, with a bit of boldness, "You seem to talk funny."

"Oh, right, let me introduce myself," The man said, as he helped the three up to their collective feet, though Fakira was reluctant to let him touch her. "You may call me Corears, that's Core-Ars mind you. Now, while that isn't my real name, it is the closest thing to it around here."

"So, you're not from here?" Ted asked.

"Not even close," the man, Corears, said. "I'm from another world, much like that fairy with you."

"How do you know that she is a fairy?" Felix asked, wondering what the man would do to them.

"I've been to her world kid," the man said. "Lovely place, lovely people, especially the women, oh man, very lovely indeed. However, I hate it, and I hate the monsters. Nothing more than animals those creatures be, nagas, harpies, mermaids, angles, demons, centaurs, dryads, fairies, all of them." "Hey, I'm not an animal," Fakira said, with anger in her voice, and starting to get her energy ready to shrink the man. "Don't even think about it, fairy," the man said. "I've killed those of your race before, from the inside, in their stomach. Besides, I'm part Falarian fairy myself."

Suddenly, with just a snap of his fingers, Fakira became the size that she had shrank Felix the last few days. Then, just before she could move, she found herself in the man's hand, with a teleportation spell, much like one that could of sent a human into a fairy's stomach. "What are you?" she asked, scared for her life.

"I'm every race there is in existance," he said. "I touch someone of a race that I haven't encountered, I absorb their abilities, and I can change into that race. watch." Suddenly, wings sprouted from his back, several of them. One was of an angle, one was from a demon, one was from a harpy, and one was from a fairy as well. "And that is not all I can do," he said, as scales started to cover his body, and his abdaman became that of a dridder, including eight spider-like legs. "However, I prefer this form." With that, he turned into a human again. Then, he set Fakira down, and snapped his fingers again, turning her back to her previous size.

"Now, you best come with me and spend the night at my place," Corears said. "The woods are dangerous at night for travelers, as there are dangerous animals, bandits, and Lord William's men patroling the area from time to time."

"You know Lord William?" Ted asked, cautiosly.

"Know him, I despise him. If it worn't for the fact that I swore off killing people for non-survival reasons, I'd of killed him years ago," Corears said, with venom in his words. "The way that monster treats others is dispicible. After all, a lord should help the people, and help out the common man, and build better roads for trade and travel, schools to educate the young, and more. Instead, you even think of something different, and you get a knife in-between your shoulder blades. Well, are you three going to come with me or what?"

145121121212112122112211121.content:
The three young people decided to follow the strange man. While he had called Fakira's kind animals, and deffinatly wasn't human at all, he did seem to be trustworthy, and he did say that he despised Lord William, for whatever reason, which made him very trustworthy in their eyes.

"So, Corears, what are you?" Ted asked as he walked beside the strange man, with Fakira and Felix behind them.

"Well, my race really didn't have a name," the man said. "However, other races called us Acquirers."

"What do you mean?" Felix asked from behind the man.

"It was the way that our culture was," Corears said. "The more races that one had met, and had acquired the forms of, the better their standing in society. In fact, before one could even take a mate, of our own race, even for just a short time thing, one had to acquire the forms of five different sentiant races. Once one had done that, then they could be allowed to take a mate, from our kind, even if it was only for a one time thing, and try to carry on one's line. However, aside from me, and any mixed breeds out there, our race is all but finished."

"What are you talking about?" Fakira asked, wondering how such a creature could be the last of its kind.

"There was a war between those who befriended people before they asked if they could touch them and acquire their forms and those who kidnapped people to acqire their forms," Corears said, as a tear rolled down his cheek.

"What was the difference?" Ted asked.

At this, Corears sighed, and said, "For one of my kind to acquire the form of a different race, we'd have to absorb that person, and kill them in the process. Currently, I have over two thousand forms that are from over two thousand different races. That means that I had to kill over two thousand people to acquire those forms. In fact, if you've noticed, I have a special pair of, what you would call them, gloves, on my hands. If I wanted to acquire someone's race, and add it to my being, I'd take one off, and touch them, and I'd absorb that person's being into me, including their memories. Let's say that if I'd absorb someone who had been scared of me, I'd have that memory, but, if I had befriended them, and waited until they were on their deathbed before I absorbed them, then I would have nothing but fond memories that that person had of me."

"How can your kind do that?" Felix asked.

"My kind can live for thousands of years," Corears said. "Waiting several decades for someone to die of old age was no problem for those who took the patient route to acquire a person's form, as it was part of our rules, to not take the form of another unless they were dieing, or they were a threat to your life, or the lives of those you cared for, as there were those who had fallen for the person whose form they wanted to acquire. Also, we can also have children with those of other races, though they tend to be of the race that the other person is.

"However, there was a large group who forsaked that golden rule, and would absorb people of other races left and right, with no regards as to what it meant to our relations with those of the other races. Where once our kind had been welcomed as friends, who respected the lives of others, we were now feared or hated, all because of these monsters, who had no respect for the lives of others. As a result, we went to war with those who had been our kin, sibling against sibling, cousin against cousin, friend against friend, and so on.

"In the end, it came down to me, and one other, who was a Taker, as us Befrienders had called them. Well, I killed him, and absorbed him, as that is the only way for an Acquirer to die, is if another absorbs him. However, the sad thing was, the man had been my brother, and I had tried to pursade him to end his foolishness, before he stopped listening and attacked me, so I had to defend myself. As a result, I swore that I'd never take another person's life to get their form, unless my life was in danger."

With this, the man sighed, and the group walked in silence.

After a while, they came upon a small hut, one that looked like something that a pesant would live in.

"Well, here we are," Corears said, as he opened up a door. "Make yourselves at home."

What does the inside look like?

1451211212121121221122111212.content:
When the trio stepped inside, they were amazed.

"Why, this is no hut!" Ted said, with amazement in his voice. "It's a palace!"

The inside of the hut was not only far larger than the outside, it was also brightly lit, and had white walls with paintings of various peoples and races on them, with starways, and anything that one would think would be in a King's palace.

"How did you make this?" Fakira asked. "I do not know of any magic that could possible do this."

"It's called a pocket dimension," Corears said. "It is not really a part of this world, but it is connected to it. Of course, the only way to enter is to be invited in by the one who made it. A very usefull safety precausion. Not only does it keep people from discovering my location, but, if some one is after you, and I let you in, and shut the door, when they open the door on their end, they will see only a normal hut, with no one in it."

"But what if someone tried to come in?" Felix asked. "What would happen?"

"Depends." Corears said. "If they were just looking for a place to stay the night, they will find some very ordanary rations that they can eat, and a straw bed with a deerskin covering to sleep on. In the morning, I'll be at a table, and offer them breakfast, and tell them that since I came home late, and found them asleep in my bed, I decided to let them stay for the night, and not wake them. However, if they tried to steal something, like say some money that I have on the table next to the food, SNAP! they find themselves to be not only shrunken, but sent to one of my cages in my lab."

"What do you mean by lab?" Ted asked, as the only other person he knew of, that used that word, was Lord William, when he told the guards to send some unfortinate slave, or prisoner, to a dark and horrid place where only the screems of the person were heard.

"It's were I work on my expariments," Corears said. "But, don't worry, I don't do anything to those who are in the cages, well, nothing that would be life threatening at any rate. Instead, I just check them over, and put them under a spell."

"What sort of spell?" Felix asked, wondering what he and the other two had gotten themselves in.

"A transformation spell," Corears said. "I can change one's gender, and, or, race. I can turn a man into a woman, and a human into a fairy, a fairy into a naga, a naga into a neko, a neko into a kitsune, and so on. Of course, the spell lasts, at most, two days, unless I reaply it."

"That might be usefull to have," Ted said. "If only until we get out of Lord William's land."

"Well I wouldn't try that," Corears said. "Lord William is very skilled in the most evil of magics, and can see past any disguises that you have on."

"Do you mean dark magic, like necronamcy?" Ted asked, wondering just how powerful his former master was.

"Actually, that type of magic isn't nesicaraly evil," Corears said. "ALL magic can be used for good and evil.In fact, I know a necromancer who is concidered a hero to his village, because he was able to ask the viliagers who had died in the past to awaken from their slumber and protect their living decendants from a large horde of bandits. Also, I know a man, who practiced what most call Holy magic, who could bring someone back to true life, who would bring people back to life, so that he could kill them again, and again."

"So, what do you mean by evil magic?" Felix asked, worried about his own magical abilities.

"Son, by evil magic, I mean when it is used for selfish gain," Corears said, as he looked the boy over. "If you use your magic to help others, no matter what type it is, then I would concider it to be good magic."

"Do you know what magic I have?" Felix asked. "I haven't used it much."

"To be honest," Corears said. "I don't know. You are unlike any being that I have seen."

"What do you mean?" Fakira asked. "I thought that you said that you have the forms of over two thousand races."

"Young lady, My kind encountered thousands, upon thousands of beings of different races," Corears said, causing the young fairy's eyes to widen, as well as those of the other two. "My kind documented every race that they ever encountered, and every year a new one was discovered. They documented the phsyology, the diet, the cultures that the beings had with each other, their languages, everything. Every year something new was discovered, even those who had already been documented could become different somehow."

"When was my world discovered?" Fakira asked, wondering if the man could take her home.

"HA, your world was discovered three thousand years ago," the man said. "In fact, your world was classifided as Allmal by us. In our language, that means, 'Planet of Evil People who take the Lives of Others for Selfish Reasons.' The explorers documented case upon case of canibalism of the various sentiant beings eating others, for non-survival reasons. Now, while the canibalism itself, if it had been for a reason like the person was starving to death, and all that was avaliable to eat was another sentiant being, would of been understandable. However, there is plenty of non-sentiant animals in the forests, seas, mountians, deaserts, and so forth, that your kind could of eaten. When we found out it was because they liked the taste of those other sentiant beings, we changed the name. We had been thinking of calling it Allbon, Planet of Large Beatiful Women, as the explorers tended to locate large females with large chests for the most part. After we found out what your world was really like, it took a lot of effort to not just send our forces there to take it over to make sure that every race was safe from each other."

"You were thinking about taking my world over?" Fakira asked with shock in her voice.

"Yes," Corears said, as he glared at the young fairy. "In fact, I was in favor of taking it over. Unfortanatly, we had our own problems, from within our own people. Our civil war was the only reason we didn't take it over. Now, since I am the only one left of my kind, I'm launching saomething of a one-man-war against your world."

"Why?" Farika asked, as she looked at the Acquirrer.

"Because your people are savages," Corears said. "And I don't mean by technology levels, as there are advanced cities in your world, but because of how you act towards other beings around you. Depending on how they act towards those around them, I could call those who live in a cave and make stone tools civilized and those whose technology is way beyond this world's own savages."

"In that case," Ted asked. "How would you classify our world?

"It's both," Corears said. "Many people here care for each other to the point that they'd give everything, even their lives, for them. Then there are those that I concider monsters, like Lord William for instance. Him, if I hadn't sworn my outh, I'd kill in two seconds."

"Would you, absorb him?" Felix asked, with a nervous gulp.

14513.content:
The following day Felix woke up early, even after the late night last night what little sleep he had received had refreshed him, he was looking forward to the day, and even a little curious about the girl in the dungeon.

After breakfast, the usual watered down porridge, Felix went about his duties. This morning he was pulling weevils out of the wheat of the last shipment, something that was neglected in the oats eaten by the slaves, it was a simple but tedious job that entailed putting each individual grain into an empty barrel and throwing the black specks that were weevils out onto the grass. Felix settled down to the monotonous job until there was a cry from someone nearby.

Felix looked around and saw another of the children with his hands over his eyes wailing “I've gone blind!” over and over, a few of the other children had got up to comfort him. Felix got up to help and immediately realised that he had been muttering that song under his breath, the one that the girl had been singing when he saw her yesterday. After a few minutes he calmed down and began to regain his sight. People went back to their sorting, though his temporary blindness was certainly the main discussion point. Not five minutes after that people began experiencing mild stomach cramps and again Felix realised that he was muttering the words under his breath the moment his mind began to wander. The morning passed for those surrounding Felix as sudden stomach cramps and blindness and rumours of plagues.

At noon Felix remembered that he had to feed the girl, it was so hard to think of her as a monster no matter what he was told, so he went to the kitchens and luckily evaded the chef this time. With another packet of meat over his back Felix made his way down the corridors to the dungeon where the girl was chained.

This time there were three guards, one now wore a bandage across his eyes and when Felix spoke to the one with the keys to get him to open the door the guard didn't seem to hear at all, he turned to the third man who flashed several hand signals to the second man and the second man turned and opened the door. It struck Felix that they must be blind, deaf and mute. Had the day been better Felix would have laughed at the reference to a children's story, but having all his friends sporadically going blind and doubling up from stomach cramps did not leave Felix in a laughing mood. He had learned however that slaves who let emotions affect their actions were punished quickly and painfully.

Felix entered the door and stepped in. When saw the girl again a flash of anger washed over him. “What did you do to me!” Careful to stay out of range of the chain bolted to the floor he took a step forward. “What!” The girl backed into the corner and cowered there. Felix had found an outlet for the past five years. He was going to tame her. All he could remember Lord William had been the closest thing to a father, poor excuse though he was and so Felix knew little of kindness or even disobedience. Just fear and a simmering withdrawn hatred. And now a way to release it.

Felix began to chant “Ethna Hepalu Calum” Concentrating on the girl, curiosity replaced by the rush of releasing pent up anger. The girl was doubling up and crying out, chains clinking as she rocked forward onto the ground. Felix felt something else too, as he chanted he felt as if thousands of tiny lines of energy were suddenly bursting to life throughout his body, he could almost see the line that traveled to the girl from him, and others that fanned out from his body, he concentrated and more of them moved to the girl, causing her to let out another shriek of pain. Felix stopped and said “Eat” and threw a piece of meat at her. Tipping the remainder on the floor just in reach, if she stretched. Felix turned to go. Before he left the door he said one thing to the girl, “Tomorrow you will tell me” Leaving and shutting the door behind him.
That night Felix lay on his bed, those lines of energy still pulsing, but not as much as when he had been chanting. He was sure he wasn't doing it without thinking this time though, it was just there. Eventually though he drifted off to sleep.

He had a new dream that night, one he would remember for the rest of his life. In the dream it was night time and he was younger, maybe four. He was standing on the ramparts of some castle, hiding in a corner near a tower. There were troops on the tower, and also a man and a woman hand in hand, the troops were busy preparing but the man and the woman turned to each other, wrapped their arms around each other and Felix could hear them crying, could feel himself crying too. Then they turned and faced outward and Felix looked beyond the ramparts and saw an army, men in red and black armour, both absolutes either red or black no combinations of the two. There were siege weapons in a row behind the front, mostly ladders or towers, no mangonels or trebuchets at all. Two battering rams that Felix could see. But most fearsome was the creature that stood behind the army, over the hight of the walls he was blood red and covered with enormous scales, leathery wings folded behind his back and teeth that reached almost beyond what his gaping maw could contain. It was the eyes however that terrified Felix, they burned with crimson fire. A horn sounded and the Demon roared and the army advanced, the ladder troops proceeding at a run while the towers rumbled forward with men sheltering behind them. The man and the woman began glowing, thousands of lines covered their bodies and pulsed with extraordinary power, thunder clapped and the bolt of lightning struck one of the towers which began burning and collapsed almost instantly, another bolt of lightning struck and another tower collapsed, the man and woman began to lift off the ground, stopping about three feet above the stone, still clasping the others hand, they extended the other hand and lightning began arcing between them, increasing to form a ball of crackling energy that flew at the giant and exploded on it's chest forcing it back a pace, for a hundred foot monster a pace is quite significant. The Demon responded with a ball of fire that streaked toward the wall and struck something invisible that curved inwards, it struck Felix that though the fire itself was burning brightly nothing else lit up, as if the fire shed no real light.

The firewall continued to bend inwards until it touched the man and the woman and they were consumed. Then it vanished and the demon stepped back, it's impossibly deep and terrible voice carrying all the way to the wall. “I have played my part, now you play yours.” He then vanished in a burst of fire. The rest was a chaotic blur as the soldiers reached the walls and began killing the men defending the walls, not without their share of losses but numbers won out in the end. At one point a man had advanced on Felix with his sword dripping in someone else's blood. Felix felt those lines of energy again pulsing in his arms and legs, in his head and in time with the beating of his heart. And the thought that existed so powerfully in his head. Felix screamed “Get Away from me” at the man and the lines converged and he flew backwards off the wall. Three more men met the same fate before Felix was bound and gagged and blindfolded.

Some time later he was grabbed and carried somewhere and dumped on soft wet earth, and heard a man reporting “Sir we found something you might like, lost four good men getting him, anyone who came near him got thrown off the wall, didn't see what did it though. Mayhap he's like the Archmages and can do magic” that sounded like a joke in the mans voice but Felix realised it must be true, at least about the magic, he didn't know what an Archmage was, maybe they were that man and that woman.

Another voice replied “We'll take him back to the lost plane, the Lord William likes pets and maybe in a decade he will be ours anyway. Especially if we give him a human mage as a pet. He'd like that almost as much as an angel.”

A third voice said “I'll take him, I'm supposed to be getting close and this might earn me a generalship from him.” That sounded like an irony. Confirmed by the others simultaneous replies of “As you say Grandmaster.” The dream ended there but in it's dying moments Felix recognized that voice. It was General Ethan.

Felix woke up and cried into his blanket, the moment he woke up he had realised what he had seen. He knew what the man and the woman were.

They were his parents. Felix thought of the girl in the dungeon.

“What have I done?”

1453.content:
Chilotaurs- Chilotaurs resemble a cross between an human and a giant centipede. They vary in size but average between 40-120 feet in length. Their human halves have deeply tanned skin, pointed ears, and two long antennae protruding from their foreheads that are always in motion. Their function is to alert the chilotaur to any threat or food source nearby. They are very sensitive to movement to a range of about 60 feet. They are longer for males to help them locate mates.

Their centipede bodies are various shades of colour ranging from a very light tan to deep black or red. The number of legs varies but most have around 40 pairs. The first pair of legs are actually a delivery system for a very nasty venom which is why most predators leave chilotaurs alone. Effects are paralysis followed by difficulty in breathing and death in a matter of minutes for human sized victims. Larger predators may escape with severe pain and nausea.

However chilotaurs do have their weaknesses. They can’t stand bright light of any kind and prefer to avoid travelling in daylight if they can help it. They prefer dark, moist environments and are usually found on the forest floor among the leaf litter or in caves or in ruined buildings.

Chilotaurs aren’t fussy about their diet. If its slow enough to catch and small enough to be swallowed, its lunch! Favourite food items include small mammals, flightless birds, reptiles of all descriptions and various fruits and vegetables. They are particularly fond of small arboreal frogs and doesn’t seem to mind the skin secretions at all from the poisonous varieties. Although rare, it has been known for greater specimens to turn man-eater. These individuals can be a real hazard for adventurers exploring cave systems.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------

Nagas- Nagas are half human, half snake people. Their size varies a lot, ranging from 6 feet "head to ground", to about "120 feet head to ground", with very different body lengths. (The creature is goint to be a giant naga, though.) Giant nagas are very dangerous and pose an enormous threat to adventurers on Felarya. They are fast and agile predators, surprisingly silent for their size and possess huge appetites. They love to ambush convoys and small groups of humans. A typical giant naga eats about 5 humans a day to stay healthy, and many more in order to feel satiated. They eat animals if the hunt is going poorly, and some have even included fruits and vegetables in their diet. Nagas have very strong stomachs. Not only it can digest just about everything, but it's very resistant to damage as well. Once an unfortunate adventurer finds himself trapped inside one, there is really only one thing that can happen.

In battle, nagas mostly use their tail, along with their bare fists and sometimes a weapon. A naga's tail is tremendously strong, and can do great damage when swung, crushing their foes between the ground and their tough scales. In spite of their physical powers nagas are usually peaceful towards other creatures and are not really a war-like race. The major exception is when dealing with dridders, who have been their natural enemies since time immemorial.

14532.content:
Lord William stared down at Felix and smiled due to Felix's obvious fear. "The creature that General Ethan has captured for me is the most dangerous creature in all of Felarya," Lord William replied.

Felix quickly became confused. "Felarya?" Felix questioned.

Lord William's wicked smile disappeared when he saw Felix's fear turn into confusing. Lord William's expression turned into annoyance since he would have to explain what Felarya was. Normally Lord William didn't bother with explaining things to his slaves, they were slaves after all and didn't need to know anything, but Lord William loved torturing and bringing fear into the hearts of his slaves. In explaining Felarya and the creature Ethan had captured, Lord William knew that he would put fear in the slave boy and the boy would more likely be more efficient and cautious in his work, or the boy would be too scared and do a terrible job so that Lord William will have the pleasure of putting him to death or punishing him.

Therefore, Lord William explained, "Felarya is the most dangerous place for humans to go to. It is another world like our own, but its wilder and mostly untamed. Nearly every creature there are larger than humans and eat humans. Even some bugs are be enough to eat humans."

Felix gulped and Lord William could see the slave boy's fear which caused Lord William's wicked smile to reappear. "There is no regard for humans that live in Felarya. Even the large sentient creatures of Felarya eat humans," Lord William continued.

"But, if their sentient, then their intelligent. Why would they eat a human? It would be murder," Felix argued.

"Felaryan don't see things the way humans do here. Felaryan consider beings of their own size people and things smaller than them as food and not a person," Lord William explained, "Since humans are smaller than them, they don't see us as humans. Only as small creatures that could be swallowed whole and can fill their stomachs. They feel that creatures that are that small can't be anything else other than food. They have no regrets eating humans."

Felix was completely horrified by this statement. "How could a sentient being eat another? Even if a sentient being was smaller than me, I'd never eat it. It's murder. How can Felaryans be so cruel and heartless," Felix wondered. For the first time in his life, he had realized there was a place far worse than Lord William's castle and Felix didn't want to leave the safety of the castle and end up in Felarya.

Felix looked at the wooden crate being pushed in the cell by strong men and Felix started to wonder what terrible and cruel monster was in the crate. The men pushed it through the large gates of the cell, about the same size as the main gate to the outer wall, and closed them again. Felix knew the men were opening the crate and fighting off the creature to get it in the chains.

Lord William followed Felix's gaze and said, "The creature Ethan captured is the most dangerous sentient being in Felarya. I will tame it though, and it will be my slave and devour my enemies."

"What is it?" Felix questioned.

"A giant naga," Lord William informed Felix, "But it's different from our giant nagas. These nagas love the taste of humans and once one eats one, they have can't help themselves and have to eat more. Some eat up to five humans a day. Nagas from Felarya are always hungry."

"They also look more human than our nagas," Lord William continued, "Their upper body is fully human as opposed to our nagas that have human structure for an upper body but have snake skin and a snake head. Felaryan nagas have fully human upper halves and a long tail."

"Has this naga eaten a human yet?" Felix questioned. He was worried that the naga was going to try everything in its power to eat him.

"It's too young. It's not large enough to eat a human," Lord William explained, "So it doesn't have the craving, because it hasn't eaten a human, yet. The naga is about five years of age and only about ten feet tall from the head to the ground when upright, but the tail behind it is at least twice as long as its height. Though, the naga will grow quickly. When a Felaryan naga becomes five years of age, they have sudden growth spurts till they grow the proper size for a five year old."

"How large is that?" Felix questioned.

"About seventy feet from ground to head," Lord William stated, "It will be that large within a month and will have random growth spurts till it reaches that height."

The men exited out of the human sized door of the cell and Lord William said, "It's time for you to feed it and bring it water."

Felix noticed the food and water on a cart near the door and Felix gulped. If a five year old naga's true height was seventy feet, how large was its adult size? Felix took the car and pushed it in.

Felix's eyes adjusted to the low light and looked around the dungeon. The room was tall, well over 100 feet tall. There were some skeletons still hanging from chains on the walls. He gulped and remembered why he was there. He expected to be attacked quickly, but there was no attack.

He didn't need to look very far to find the naga. Even if he couldn't see it, he would have been able to hear it. The naga itself stood just as how Lord William described it. Ten feet tall from the head to the ground when upright, and the tail behind it was at least twice as long as its height, though he had to guess as the naga was coiled up in a corner, crying. That was when he found out it's gender. It was a girl naga. Kinda hard to miss it with her crying. For a moment, Felix was astounded by how she looked. Her scales were a mixture of dark gray and yellow that formed a pattern, her hair was down to her shoulders, and was blueish green hue. Then she shifted and looked right at him with one of her eyes. It's eye held a serpentine pupil, with the iris being golden in color.

In reaction to seeing him, the naga girl just coiled in on herself, trying to become as small as possible. Felix bit the inside of his cheek and wondered what he should do. Should he just push the cart towards her and be done with it? Or should he try to talk with the giant naga girl? After all, she had to be scared to death, and if she was anything like he was, then she would probably need a friend to get through this. Plus, if he convinced her not to eat humans, then there might be hope yet! He...just hoped that she wouldn't just fool him into dropping his guard and then eat him.
