Cillia had been crying ever since she had been captured, especially when the tiny people started hitting her with bits of steel and other things, forcing her into her current state right now. Ever since, she had been sobbing, waiting for the next bad thing to happen. When she heard the doors open, she didn't bother to look, as she as certain it was more tiny people trying to hurt her. When she heard something being pushed in, she stopped her crying long enough to look. It was just one tiny person, this one being smaller than the rest of them, and it was pushing something towards her. When it got close enough to her, she saw that it was food and water. She was starting to get hungry, but she had been ignoring that because of her current situation. She wondered why this tiny person was feeding her, while the others were hurting her. Should she ask it? Or would it be better not to talk. She had to think quickly, otherwise she was certain that it would leave as well.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

Felix thought it best to not talk to the naga girl...at least not right now. He had other duties to tend to, but he knew that he would be back tonight, after all, it was now apart of his duties to care for the naga girl. He turned around to go, but he heard movement behind him, and before he knew it, the naga girl had grabbed him. Felix's mind started to go haywire, with almost a million bad things going through his head.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

Cillia had been just about to say something when she saw that the tiny person was leaving. She made her decision in a split second and decided to grab him before he left. She had just reached him in time too, as she could feel the chains that were around her almost yank her back. She looked at the tiny person in her hands and noticed that he was starting to panic. She looked at him with her eyes filled with sadness and fear of her own, and opened her mouth to speak.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

Felix saw that she was opening her mouth, and instantly shut his own eyes, fearing that he was going to be eaten. He was too scared to remember that Lord William had told him that the naga was still too young to eat humans. Instead of being eaten, Felix heard a soft, young, feminine voice plead, "Please...tell me what's going on!"

Felix opened his eyes in shock. "D-did...she just...talk to me?" Felix thought and he searched his brain for any other explanation for what he heard. When Felix looked back up at her face with a shockeed expression, she repeated her question. "C-can you put me down first...please?" Felix asked her, obviously frightened at where he was currently.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

Cillia noticed that her actions were scaring the tiny person, but she didn't want him to run away. She didn't think she'd be able to catch him this time if he did. "Only if you promise not to run..." Cillia said, trying to hold back the tears that were still coming from earlier. Unless he said he would, she wasn't going to put him down.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

Felix knew that if he said yes, and then ran away, he could kiss trying to be friends with her out the window. "I have to go and do other things, but I'll be back later. If I don't leave now, I'll be punished. I promise that I will talk to you then." Felix said, hopefully she would understand and let him down. He saw her eyes shifting to the sides, like she was thinking on it.
145321.title: Beauty and the Slave

choices: As Felix does his other duties, he thinks about what had happened.
Later when Felix comes back to the cell with dinner...
1453212.content:
The female naga that was holding Felix may have been a Felaryan and one of the most dangerous species in Felarya, but she was still very young and only ten feet tall when upright. She was taught that tiny people that could be swallowed whole weren't people at all and just a snack. She was told by her mother that tiny people were of no other use to her other than a food source since they were too small, too small to be considered people. Her mother even described the pleasurable sensations that came when swallowing a human whole: how they'd try to fight back her tongue when it was too powerful, how they'd squirm around and try to escape even when they slide down her throat, and especially the sensation of their tiny fists pounding the inside of her stomach without any chance of escape. The way Cillia's mother had described the experience of her first eaten human made Cillia feel as though she couldn't wait to be gigantic like her mother.

However, Cillia was still too small to swallow something human-sized in one bite, and since she was five years old and just starting her growth spurts, she wouldn't be big enough to do so till those growth spurts finished by the end of the month. Not only was Cillia unable to eat a human-sized creature, but her mother never caught her any tinies, creatures on Felarya that were humanoid but had the average height of about three inches. So, Cillia would just have to wait till she grew large enough, though she wanted to experience it badly.

Despite Cillia being a dangerous Felaryan naga and still larger than the average human, she was still not big enough to swallow them and that made them people in her eyes, because they weren't too small just yet. Even though Felix was doll-sized to her, he was still a person, and an older boy at that.

Normally, Cillia would respect her elders and do as they say, even if that older person was still a kid like herself. However, her young and desperate mind wasn't listening to Felix's argument. She was very scared, because she was suddenly brought to an unfamiliar place and captured by humans for seemingly no reason at all. She was now in a terrifying place, chained up, and her clothes stripped from her. She wanted answers, and when a five year old was desperate for answers, they were going to try and get it by any means necessary. She couldn't be told no, or in this case "I'll tell you later", especially not from someone the size of a doll. "I'm not putting you down till you tell me what's happening," Cillia demanded.

Felix was worried that this would happen. The naga was young and still ten feet tall. "What was I thinking? Did I honestly believe something so young and large would see me as a person when I'm so little? Why would something so large listen to me," Felix thought to himself as he was held in the air by two large hands positioned under his arms. Felix looked up fearfully at the large youthful fast of the giant naga. There was anger in it and Felix feared what the naga would do to him if he didn't tell her what was happening to her. It was his first day feeding the naga and it seemed as though he was in a life or death situation already.

Cillia noticed the human's fear. It was completely frightened of her. "Please, tell me what's happening. I promise to put you down," Cillia told Felix.

After this statement, Felix realized that the naga was desperate for answers. This naga seemed to be five years old. He remembered some of the guests that had entered Lord William's castle. Some had kids of that age. He remembered one that really wanted something and did whatever he could to convince her father to give it to her. "The naga's not angry. It just really wants something like the kid. This is still potentially dangerous since she'll do whatever it takes to convince me, but there's still hope that I might be able to befriend this creature. Looks like I have no other choice except to answer her questions. I hope she doesn't have too much. I really have to go," Felix realized.

Felix sighed, "What do you want to know?"

"Where am I? Why am I here? What's...?" Cillia asked quickly.

"Please, one question at a time!" Felix yelled over the naga's voice. There was some silence before Felix calmly answered, "You're in Lord William's dungeons in his castle."

"Who... Who's Lord William?" Cillia asked.

"He's a human, but he's a monster. He's a terrible ruthless man who doesn't care who he hurts or kills to get what he wants," Felix answered.

Cillia shivered when she heard the word monster. She began to worry why a monster wanted her. Forgetting that Felix had told her that Lord William was technically human, she asked, "Does the monster want to eat me?"

"No," Felix replied, "He wants to keep you here and make you his slave and weapon."

"Slave? What's that?" Cillia was confused by the word, but she didn't like the sound of it when it was said with the word weapon.

"I'm a slave. Lord William owns me as if I'm property. I have to do whatever he wants me to do, no matter how much I dislike it," Felix informed the naga.

"If you don't like doing something, why don't you just don't do it?" Cillia asked.

"If I disobey, he hurts me badly. I have no choice but to do what he asks," Felix told her.

"He wants me to be his slave? I don't want to be a slave," Cillia cried out.

"Unless you can find a way to escape, you may not have much of a choice," Felix sadly informed her.

"But, why me?" Cillia questioned with tears in her eyes.

"You're a giant naga. He wants to use you as a weapon to kill people and eat them," Felix said.

"I... I don't want to kill people. Please, don't let the monster make me his slave," Cillia pleaded to the human in her hands.

Felix couldn't believe what he was witnessing. This large, yet young, creature was pleading to him for his help. He never thought something so large would do that to him. Not know what else to say, Felix said, "I'll do what I can."

"You promise?" Cillia questioned.

Felix nodded and said, "Now, I really have to get going."

"Will you promise to come back?" Cillia asked.

"Yes, I'm the one that has to feed you. I'll come back this evening, and we'll see each other everyday, I promise," Felix told the giant naga.

Cillia bent down and reluctantly put the human down on his feet and removed her hands. She looked down at the human with sad eyes and he looked back at her. "I'll be back later with dinner and we can talk much longer," Felix assured the giant naga.

Felix turned and began to push the empty cart away, but Cillia ordered, "Wait! What's you name?"

"Felix," Felix answered, "What's yours?"

"Cillia," Cillia replied.

"Well, Cillia, I'll see you again at dinner," Felix said before he pushed the cart again and left the cell.
1453212.title: She Needs Answers, NOW!

choices: It was Felix.
(reader's choice)
14532121.content:
After Felix had left Cillia's cell and left to go clean Lord William's library, he thought back to what had just transpired. Contrary to what Lord William thought, the giant naga that he had was only a child, an infant. She still saw humans as people, and not food...for now. He wondered, was it possible to have Cillia keep him in that view?

During his cleaning, he stole a book away from one of the shelves that lined the wall. While Felix only had basic reading skills, the book had plenty of detailed pictures to make up for that. It showed various giant nagas in many different poses. Almost all of them had a human or some such small sentient being held over an open mouth. However, there was one that had a giant naga lying on their back, apparently taking a nap, with a human with them as well. That gave him hope. What he didn't, or rather couldn't read, was that the chances of befriending a giant naga were very low. The trick was to make sure that the giant naga kept thinking you as a friend, but once they thought that of you, you were safe.

Felix quickly put the book back where he got it from and continued to dust and clean, making it look like he had never even cracked the book open. He had a busy day ahead of him, several of the jobs were quite tiring indeed. But he had to keep his promise to Cillia. Not because he had to, but because he made a vow to never break a promise. After living a life of a slave, Felix had learned many things about humans, more so than any others could. He learned that there were all types of humans, and the majority of the ones that he knew, they were deceivers, liers, thieves, slavers and murderers. Those were the kind of people that Lord William dealt with. He went to any lengths to make sure that his power was absolute. Felix hated him and the ones he dealt with behind the curtains. Just because he was a slave didn't mean he couldn't hear what was going on. It was because of this that he had made the vow to never break a promise, He did not want to be anything like Lord William or the ones he dealt with.

However, no matter how many times Felix thought of a way to escape, he could never do it by himself, and the other slaves were already broken. He could tell just by looking at their eyes. They had already lost their will to fight a long time ago. Most even wondered how Felix could stay as hopeful as he had been in this hell on earth. However, with some help with Cillia, Felix just knew that they would be able to get out of there, someway...somehow. But for any of his escape plans to work, that he was now reformulating, he would need to know if Cillia would think of him as a friend from then on...and not food when she grew bigger.

Cillia, for her part, was terribly lonely. While she may have been an only child, that much may have been true, but she almost always had at least one person or thing to keep her company until she woke up in a strange place. It was mainly because of this that she had snatched the human all of a sudden, she didn't want to be left alone. She had been comforted by his assurance that he was going to come back, everyday, but that didn't stop her from being lonely.

As such, it really wasn't a surprise that she was curled up in the furthest corner that the chains would allow her to curl up in and waited, staring at the door. As she was a giant naga, she had a sort of sixth sense for where living things were at, so she got ready to move when she felt one start to approach the door. She wasn't adapt at sensing who the living creature was, not yet. She had heard tales of another giant naga who was so good at sensing the location of living creatures that she could not only tell how far away they were, but their general size too, even when she was asleep! She hoped that she would be as good as that naga someday, that way her current predicament would never happen again.
14532121.title: As Felix Does his Other Duties...

choices: They talk about possible ways of escaping.
They just talk to try and get to know each other better.
145321211.content:
The iron bared human sized door squeaked open and the familiar cart of meat and water came rolling out. Cillia rose from er curled position. Her tail was still curled on the ground, but she was straightening her upper body upwards while holding herself up with her arms and hands. She waited, hoping that it was Felix coming through that door. Sure enough, pushing that cart was the small human she had met and talked with earlier.

Cillia was excited and relieved upon seeing him due to her loneliness of being in the cell. Cillia shot up and slithered towards the front of the cell, completely forgetting about the chains around her wrists, midsection, and neck. She was just too glad to finally see someone that she could talk to and no longer be by herself. Cillia quickly slithered towards Felix which scared Felix a bit seeing a ten foot tall naga child charging towards him. "Fel..." was all that Cillia could say before the chains stopped her voice by choking her. The chains pulled her back and she fell backwards. The chains had hurt Cillia, especially her neck. Cillia clutched the chain cuff around her neck and began to cry. She was five years old after all.

Once Felix saw Cillia start to cry, he quickly got over his fear of her when he had seen her charging. Cillia had been going full force and it looked painful just to watch the chains stop her and force her back. Plus, Felix was a very kindhearted person and he couldn't just stand there and watch Cillia cry. He felt that he needed to comfort her. Felix quickly pushed the cart forward and stopped pushing it once it was in her reach. Felix then hurried to Cillia. It was a very odd thing to see something as large as Cillia crying, but Felix wasn't thinking about her shear size. She was a young child, and it was natural for a child to cry when they were hurt. She was a child, was all that Felix thought about in his mind, and he just couldn't let her cry.

Cillia was curled up with her back turned to Felix, crying uncontrollably. Felix knelt down, even though her back and side were large and vast being ten feet tall. Felix placed his hand on her bare shoulder and began rubbing it. Cillia's cries called slightly due to the fact she knew someone was there trying to give her comfort. Amidst her cries, Cillia turned her head to look at the small hand on her shoulder. Suddenly with lightning fast speed, Cillia turned around and grabbed Felix. While she was now lying on her other side, she pulled Felix against her torso and hugged him firmly as she continued to cry. It looked a lot like a child hugging a teddy bear where Cillia was the child and Felix was the teddy bear.

Felix was in a state of shock for a few moments since he had been on his knees and then before he could blink, he was in the arms of the naga being pressed against her body's soft skin. However, Felix was able to escape his state of shock quicker than usual because he could still hear the cries of the naga child. Felix began patting whatever his hands could reach while in the naga's embrace.

"What's wrong?" Felix found his voice and tried to sound as calm and caring as he could, "Did those chains hurt you?"

"Yes," Cillia replied.

"Can I see?" Felix asked.

Cillia stayed lying on her side, but she lifted her arms closer to her chest so that Felix would be pushed upwards and be able to look at her neck. Felix touched the cuff around her neck and peeked between the metal and Cillia's neck. The skin was a little red, but it didn't look like there was much permanent damage. "Does it still hurt?" Felix asked.

"A... a little," Cillia answered.

Felix was able to fit his hand in between the cuff and Cillia's neck. The reason for the space was so that Cillia would grow into it and that they might not have to change the chain cuffs too quickly due to the growth spurts she'd experience. Felix rubbed the slightly red neck and Cillia twitched a little. "Does it still hurt?" Felix asked while continuing to rub it.

"No, it... it kind of tickles," Cillia replied with a little laugh.

"Well then, does this tickle?" Felix asked as he intentionally began to tickle her neck.

"Yes!" Cillia said as she began to laugh uncontrollably. Cillia began to roll and squirm from the tickling on her throat. She never rolled onto her belly though and never squeezed Felix too hard. Despite being very ticklish, she seemed to be conscious of Felix on her. Eventually, she put her hands under Felix's arms and lifted him up as she was on her back. "Stop tickling me," Cillia giggled.

"Are you all better now?" Felix questioned.

Cillia thought about it, and she didn't feel any pain anymore. "I feel good now," Cillia told and it was all thanks to Felix distracting her from the pain. Cillia pulled Felix into a hug again and whispered, "Thank you, Felix."

"You're welcome, Cillia," Felix replied as he laid his body against Cillia's skin and hugged whatever his arms could wrap around. It was an odd experience for the both of them, but they enjoyed it. Cillia found it odd that she was befriending a human so quickly. She had thought that she would see her first human when she was large enough to eat it and be able to hunt with her parents. However, she was introduced to humans quite early due to her being captured and put in a strange place. All of them had been mean to her except for Felix. Due to her situation of being alone with Felix being the only kind person around and her being too small to view humans as food, it seems quite natural for Cillia to befriend Felix. In fact, Cillia began feeling as though Felix was like a big brother to her.

Felix also found it odd to become friends to a giant naga. A few months ago, he would have never believed it was possible to have a giant naga as his first friend ever. Especially after what Lord William had said about Felaryan nagas. Yet, here he was befriending a giant naga. He just hoped that Cillia would continue to see him as a friend and that he would be like the human in the picture he had seen with the girl lying on the naga's stomach causally without fear of being eaten.

Cillia stopped hugging Felix which aloud him to sit up and st cross legged on her. Cillia turned her head and saw the cart. She stretched out her arm and pulled it to her. She sat up at an angle letting her forearms and elbows keep her up and she grabbed some meat and started eating. "So, what do you want to talk about?" Cillia asked.
145321211.title: Little Big Brother

choices: Felix finally knows enough about Cillia to start planning an escape.
Felix continues getting to know Cillia first.
1453212112.content:
For a little while, Felix and Cillia just discussed various things that they hoped the other would know about. However, there were problems...for instance, Cillia had asked where were Felix's parents. Felix had to carefully explain that he didn't know where his parents were, or what they even looked like. It had been so long ago when his parents had either sold him off to slavery, as what Lord William had told him the one time he had asked, back before he knew better than to talk to someone like him. The other thing that was more of a possibility was the fact that he may have been kidnapped, as he had seen some slave traders kidnap children from farmers and the like in order to make sure that they always had a good supply for any potential 'customers', like Lord William. However, whatever had happened, they either couldn't do anything about it, or they just didn't care. Felix didn't want to know the answer to that question. He didn't even know if his parents were still alive.

When Felix asked about Cillia's parents, he was surprised to find out that her mother, who was a pure blooded Giant Naga, had actually taken a sorcerer as her mate. But then he thought back to the book he had read. Somehow, Cillia's father must have somehow convinced her mother not to eat him, and as they got to know each other, they must have eventually fallen in love. However, Cillia didn't know where her father was at anymore. Her mother wouldn't talk about the subject. Felix thought to himself that for a seemingly innocent child, Cillia had a very good memory if she was able to remember stuff that had happened when she could probably barely open her eyes.

Felix always kept an ear out for the tell tale sign that he was about to hit his time limit for being in here. Not that the guards minded, it was just that it was always less of a pain to make sure that the slave was dead, and know about it, than the other way around. That way they would know to order a new slave to take the place of the one that had been...disposed of. Felix thought to himself grimly that there was always that way out of Lord Williams grasp, but he wasn't going to kill himself. Not now anyways. He may have thought about doing that before he had met Cillia a few times, but now that he knew someone else in this hell hole, and vice versa, he wasn't going to leave the other person he knew, the person in this case being Cillia, alone in a place like this. Especially not someone as young as Cillia. For someone like her, being alone in a place like this would most likely have made her into the monster that Lord William was thought she was. Felix had made it his job from then on to make sure that Cillia would know what was right, and what was wrong from then on. In a way, he wondered if this was what an older brother would do with a younger sibling. Of course, most older brother's younger siblings didn't dwarf them at only five years of age.
1453212112.title: Know thyself

choices: Cillia quickly remembers the past few weeks with Felix. She resists eating Felix
She has troubles resisting and Felix has to convince her not to eat him!
14532121121.content:
As Felix pushed the cart from the kitchen to the dungeons, he thought about Cillia. Despite her being a giant naga, she acted like any normal five year old child would. Sure she had some personalities of a Felaryan naga, but all and all, her mind was quite human like, at least human enough for Felix to understand and relate to it. A few weeks had past and thanks to Felix having to go feed her three times a day; they had gotten to know each other very well.

Often times, Cillia talked about her mother and as well as Cillia's life in Felarya. She had described her mother as a beautiful and caring mother. However, Felix knew her mother wouldn't be as caring to him as she was with her daughter. Felix was human, after all, and could easily be part of Cillia's mother's diet. It was clear that Cillia missed her mother dearly and she'd cry sometimes when she mentioned her. Felix chivalrously was there to comfort Cillia when this happened.

She also described her home and its beauty. Felix couldn't remember anything past the walls of the castle and loved to here about the environment and imaging its beauty, even if it was a land full of dangerous predators that wouldn't hesitate to eat a human. Cillia even told him how her mother taught her to hunt and told her how she would have to hunt when she was bigger. Cillia still wasn't as good as he mother, but she was decent enough to catch smaller creatures. Felix knew that Cillia would be very useful in hunting if they ever found a way to escape together.

In the weeks they were together, Cillia began to truly see Felix as a big brother, despite the fact she could pick him up quite easily. She looked to him for guidance and respected him as a brother. Felix began seeing Cillia as a little sister as well. He didn't remember ever having a family and he felt relieved to finally call someone part of his family, even if they weren't related by blood and even if the person was a giant naga.

During those weeks, Cillia was having growth spurts. Her body was having them so that she would become the height of a five year old giant naga. She was one of the more gigantic species of nagas that averaged to be about 120 feet tall from head to ground. So, when the growth spurts stopped, she would become about 50 feet tall and then continue to grow normally. Cillia had been growing to about that height. Cillia hadn't reached that height just yet and didn't have problems seeing Felix as a person, because not only was he not prey because of their friendship, but also because he wasn't small enough to swallow whole. However, when she would reach that fifty foot Felix would seem like he would be less than six inches compared to her. Oddly, as she grew, the cuffs around her neck, waist, and wrists never broke. They seemed to grow with her body, as if magically enhanced.

Felix was getting closer to approaching Cillia's cell. He knew Cillia would be waiting for her dinner and be waiting to be able to talk with him since he could stay with her longer at nights. He trusted Cillia and he knew that it was finally time to try and figure out an escape plan with her. He knew that he could trust her and be able to escape with her and still be safe with her. However, he still had to figure out a plan. Maybe Cillia could have some insight on the matter. She was a very bright child for being only five years of age.

Felix reached the cell and the guard opened the door for him. Felix pushed the cart through and the guard closed the door behind him. Cillia was as close to him as her chains would allow her. She was lying down on her stomach with her tail coiled up, forming a bed for her upper body to rest upon. She had heard the door and was slowly waking from her nap. Sometimes, Cillia napped. She needed to rest at time, especially the days Lord William's men tried to tame her. "Hi, Felix," Cillia greeted as she yawned.

"Good evening, Cillia," Felix replied as he started pushing the cart towards her. He noticed that Cillia must have had a growth spurt, because she was bigger than she was the last time he had met her. He didn't know that it was her last growth spurt and she was fifty feet tall from the ground up!

When Felix was close enough, Cilla reached her hand out to him. She wrapped her fingers around him and picked him up to her face as her chin continued to rest on her coils. Felix had gotten used to Cillia picking him up. She did it quite often and now it was easy enough and she was big enough to pick him up in one hand. Cillia stood her upper body upright and hugged Felix by gently pressing his body against her stomach.

In the middle of her hug, her stomach growled and Cillia giggled, "I'm really hungry. You always come just in time."

Cillia placed her palm upwards so that Felix could sit on it. Cillia reached down to the cart and ate all the food and drink all the water from it. When she was finished, she noticed how small Felix looked in her palm. He was small, small enough to swallow whole, well for a naga anyway.

Suddenly, she remembered her mother's words and her detailed descriptions of swallowing humans whole. The way her mother had described it made it sound so wonderful and good. Humans were supposed to be the second most delicious creatures, elves being number one. She was now big enough to swallow a human whole and there was a human in her hand. She was increasingly becoming tempted to eat Felix, especially since she was still a little hungry.

She must have been giving Felix a strange look, because Felix looked worried and nervously questioned, "Cillia, what's wrong?"
14532121121.title: The Urge

choices: He did figure out.
He was trying to think of a good escape plan.
145321211211.content:
Before anything else happened, Cillia remembered when she had seen Felix for the second time since coming here. She had hurt herself from trying to get to him, and he had made her feel better. He had also been there for her whenever she needed him most, and continued to look after her, even though there was such a huge size difference between the two of them. Felix was her big brother, not food!

Her human side of her quickly pushed away her naga instinct because of that, and gently shook her head. "Nothing, I was just thinking of how cute you look being that small." Cillia said, spinning a good lie. Like all nagas, she had an uncanny ability with lying, even though she always regretted doing it to Felix. But she was thinking that at the same time, so it wasn't a complete lie, plus it was an old subject that the two of them always had fun arguing over. But this time Felix wasn't arguing with her, something that struck her as odd. He seemed different today...so she decided to ask him.

"Felix...what's wrong?" Cillia asked her big brother, but he didn't seem to hear her. "Brother...?" Cillia asked quietly. Her mind raced, was he able to see through her lie? After spending so much time with her, had Felix begun to know when she was lying and when she was telling the truth? That thought scared her, she never willingly wanted to lie to Felix, she just knew that if she had told him what had just happened, he might not see her in the same way.

But then, her mind countered, if he was her brother, he would know that she had seen him as her brother, and there for not food. Wouldn't he congratulate her for fighting off that urge? But there was also something else about him, it seemed as if he was trying to think of something else as well...sometimes she couldn't tell what it was that Felix was thinking about, but she always knew a lie when she heard one, not that Felix ever lied to her. Which made it all the harder for herself to lie to him from time to time. She just hoped that he was trying to think of something, and hadn't of figured out that she had lied to him, even if it was only a little.
145321211211.title: Resisting the urge

choices: Felix forgives Cillia and comforts her.
Felix can't bring himself to forgive her.
1453212112111.content:
Felix looked up at Cillia suspiciously as he asked, "Cillia, why were you looking at me like that?"

"What do you mean?" Cillia asked trying to keep her composure. "He knows! He knows!" Cillia panicked in her mind.

"It didn't seem like you were looking at me like that because I was cute. You've given me that face often, and that look was nothing like that," Felix told her. Felix examined her expression. She seemed to be getting more worried and nervous. It was as if she was trying to hide something, but was getting closer to find out the truth. "Is there something you don't want to tell me?" Felix asked.

"N-no," Cillia lied even though she knew he would see through such a lie. She was becoming more and more obvious that she was hiding something.

Felix thought about the look she had given him after she finished her dinner. He had seen that look before, but he couldn't remember where or when she did it. Felix thought very carefully, and as the silence continued, he noticed Cillia becoming more uncomfortable. She fidgeted and bit her bottom lip. Then Felix remembered. Cillia had never given him that look before, but she had given that look towards the animals he feed her. She had been looking at him with a hungry expression as if she wanted to eat him.

Felix looked up at Cillia with shock clear in his face. "Were you thinking of eating me, Cillia?" Felix questioned.

"No, I wasn't," Cillia answered quickly as she shook her head. Her beautiful, big eyes were forming tears.

"You were thinking about eating me," Felix gasped in realization. Felix tried to back away, but quickly realized he was in the palm of her hand and he had no where to go.

"Felix, I..." Cillia tried to think of a lie to say, but another lie would just make the situation worse.

"Tell me the truth, Cillia. Did you really think about eating me?" Felix asked.

Cillia knew she had to tell Felix the truth now. She had no idea how he would react to the truth, but she had to tell him. "Yes," Cillia answered with teary eyes, "I did think about eating you, but it was only for a second."

"Why would you even think that?" Felix replied in horror.

"My mother told me that when something is swallowable, it is prey and I can eat it, even if it is sentient. It's not a person," Cillia explained, tears still falling, "You're small enough for me to swallow now. Mother told me what it was like to eat a human. She described how good it was had have tasty and pleasurable swallowing a human whole could be. I really badly want to try it. You were in my hand as I thought about this."

"You could have eaten me, despite everything I've done for you, despite the fact I treat you like a sister?" Felix said, clearly upset.

"But I didn't eat you," Cillia argued, "I can't possibly eat you, Felix. I thought about everything you've done for me. I thought about that day I hurt myself with the chains and you were there for me. You're always there for me when I need you. I will never hurt you. I resisted the urge, because you're my brother."

Felix looked away to think about what had just happened. Cillia continued to stare down at Felix, waiting for his judgment with watery eyes. "What if he's mad at me forever, now? What if he hates me for thinking about eating him? I don't want to lose him. Felix is my brother. If he thinks I'm some terrible monster, then I don't know what I'd do," Cillia thought to herself. She was worried Felix would hate her and see her as a monster. She was worried that he wouldn't want to be her brother anymore and leave her. Then she would be alone again.

"Please, brother," Cillia pleaded as she cried, "Don't hate me. I don't want to lose you. I promise that I'll never think about eating you ever again. You're still safe with me, I promise. Please, stay my brother."

Felix looked back up at Cillia. It was clear from her crying that she was truly sorry for what she had done, and if she was truly sorry, then Felix would be safe with her. She wouldn't ever think of eating him ever again because she'll know how mad he would get and would worry that he would leave her. Besides, even though she had the urge to eat him, she stopped herself because she remembered everything he had done for her. She truly sees Felix as a brother.

What should he do?

14532121121111.content:
As Felix stared at Cillia, he knew that he couldn't stay mad at her. After all, she had said so herself, and, for better or worse, Felix still had that small trust in her. As such, he looked down at the 'ground' that was Cillia's palm and walked forward from the edge. He signaled for Cillia to raise him up closer towards her face. She did so, wondering what he was going to do. As he got closer, he suddenly reached out and hugged her around her neck, as much as possible.

"I can't stay mad at you Cillia. If you say you can control yourself...then I trust you with my life." For better or worse, he had just given Cillia control of his life pretty much.

The only thing she did, however, was press him up against herself a bit more. Now, there were tears of joy from the fact that her brother was not leaving her alone. "Thank you..." She whispered to Felix.

Felix patted her neck and brought himself out of the hold. "Now, I have something else to tell you." That caught Cillia off guard, and surprised her. Sure, he did have things to talk about, but usually, Felix didn't look as serious as he was right now.
14532121121111.title: Felix forgives Cillia and comforts her.

145321211211111.content:
"I think that I may have finally found a way out of here...but it might be a bit tricky." Felix said as he sat back down onto Cillia's palm. "Okay, maybe more than just a bit. As I've told you before, I have tried to think up of a great many ways of getting out of here. However, there has always been one thing that has stopped me. I am the only slave that hasn't lost their spirit, the rest of the others...they are more like the living dead. Their spirits died out long ago. Now, however, I have you, and with the two of us together, I'm sure we can get out. It's just a matter of when." Felix continued to say, getting back up and starting to pace along Cillia's palm. "I have noticed that there are times when the guards are less in numbers than usual. From the gossip that I overhear at the tables, they say it is because General Ethan is trying to find Lord William another being such as yourself. Some say it's because he is getting tired from the lack of progress from your...ah...taming." Felix said, the last part carefully.

"You mean...he's trying to find another Felaryan creature?" Cillia said, surprised. She started to think then. She didn't know any of the other nagas, except for the ones that were like legends. She knew from her mother that all dridders needed to be destroyed. The two species were mortal enemies since...a very long time ago, so it would be horrible if they caught one of them and they placed it in her cell. She would be surprised if they ever managed to catch a dryad. Besides nagas and, though she hated to admit it, dridders, dryads were among the more deadlier races, if not because of their size, then because of their ability to conceal themselves. Mer-folk were just as hard to catch, as they rarely came out of the waters that they called home. Fairies would be able to fly out of their reach, and they had an innate sense of magic as well. Something she had yet to see a human use. A list of many other races that her mother taught her about ran through her, each less likely to be caught than the last. "I don't think he's going to succeed." Cillia said flatly.

"I'll trust your words. Anyways, it's always a certain day of the week. That's when he gathers up all of the experienced guards to go out and hunt." Felix said, after he waited for Cillia to get done thinking. He could always tell when she was thinking. Her eyes had a habit of wandering. "That will leave the less experienced ones. That is when we will have to try our luck. Hopefully, before this week is over, we both will be free from Lord William's clutches." Felix said, and started to pace again. Now came the hard part. They knew that there was a time window that they could use to get out, now he needed to think of a path, and the means to escape.
145321211211111.title: Surprising plans

choices: Felix had found weakness in the chains and anchors.
Felix will need the keys to free Cillia.
1453212112111111.content:
"So, we know the time that's best to escape, but how do we escape?" Cillia asked mainly to try and help both their thought processes.

Felix stopped pacing for a while. Pacing normally would have helped him think, but even though Cillia's hand was large enough for him to stand on and even lie on, pacing back and forth with that little distance to pace was making him a little dizzy, even with her cupping two hands together now to give him more room. The last thing Felix needed was to accidentally fall off the hands of his... sister... and hit the stone floor from such a height. Felix looked at the chain cuff around Cillia's wrists and the one around her neck. He knew that she had another around her waist, but he didn't look down at that one. "We should figure it out one step at a time. Starting with how to get those chains and metal cuffs off you," Felix finally said.

"But how do we do that?" Cillia asked, "I don't suppose you know where the keys are."

Felix looked up at Cillia's giant child face. There was doubt in her voice about Felix knowing where the keys that would free her from the chains binding her to the cell were or that Felix would even be able to obtain them. However, her eyes were filled with hopefulness. Felix stared deep into those eyes. Felix knew that she trusted him and believed in him. Despite her size, he was still her big brother and she looked up to him for guidance, security, and assurance. It was a very strange thing to be looked up to by a giant naga that could easily carry him in one hand, but Felix was getting used to it, and Cillia already seemed to have no problems looking up to him already even when she thought he was cute at his small size from time to time. Felix sighed and looked down while shaking his head. "Sorry, but I'm not sure where the keys would be."

"Oh," was all Cillia said as she looked further down beneath where he hands were raised with Felix atop them.

Felix felt as though he had let her down by the sound of that single "Oh". Wishing to cheer Cillia up, Felix quickly said, "But, maybe we won't need the keys. Maybe there is another way out of them. And even if there isn't, I will do my best to find out where those keys might be, I promise."

Cillia looked back up at Felix in her hands and raised those hands up to her face. "I knew I could count on you, brother." Cillia turned her head, and Felix knew what she wanted to do. Felix positioned himself so that he was only on one of her palms. With the other hand, Cillia lifted it vertically and placed it behind Felix. Cillia then brought her cheek down against Felix while his tiny body was between it and her other hand. Cillia rubbed her cheek against her big brother's tiny body. They might not have been able to show the same sort of affection that normal siblings of similar sizes would, but Cillia still found many different ways to show that affection.

When Cillia was finished, she lowered her hands back down to about neck level and Felix sat down in her cupped hands. Cillia smiled happily down at him with new found hope and said, "So, about these chains and cuffs."

"Well, I think we can count out waiting for you to grow out of them, because they've seemed to grow with you, at least the cuffs have."

"Yes, they have," Cillia replied with some sadness.

"But what about the chains? Maybe you could pull them apart or..."

"Felix, these chains have kept me here no matter how much I've pulled. If I could have broken free from them, do you think I'd be here?" Cillia asked. This time, a slight annoyance and frustration was in her voice, but Felix knew those emotions weren't directed towards him.

"Can you take me to the anchors that hold them in the wall?" Felix requested.

Cillia didn't know what Felix would possibly gain by doing this, but Cillia agreed to carry her brother to them anyway. As Cillia approached the wall at the other end of the cell, Felix instructed her to go a little slower. Cillia didn't realize it, but Felix was examining the chains on the floor as well. The chains, though very thick by human standards and big enough to hold a very large beast, never grew with Cillia and were their original size. One chain link was probably at least a four of Felix's size, but there might be a chance of Cillia to break free, or at least that's what Felix thought. Cillia was much stronger and bigger now. Felix hoped to find signs of weakness in the chains or the anchors. When Cillia reached the anchors in the wall, she lifted Felix to each on and let him examine them. While he did this, he didn't give any hints of his plan or why he was doing this.

Cillia was left in suspense the entire time. She wanted badly to ask Felix what was going on, but Felix seemed so focused on what he was doing and she didn't want to disturb him so that he might find a way out of this place. When Felix was finished, Cillia couldn't take the silence any longer and she asked, "So?"

At least every single one of the chains holding her had, at one point or another, a rusted link somewhere. The anchors in the wall also looked like, while they could have held the Cillia of the past, they weren't meant to handle how big Cillia had gotten. "So...we won't be needing the keys." Felix said. He watched as Cillia's head cocked to the side on confusement.

"But I already told you I tried to break free before." Cillia told Felix, wondering what it was that he was getting at. Since she had tried those few times, she had given up on trying it again. What had Felix seen that would have made him think otherwise? She couldn't understand the way Felix thought sometimes...which was understandable, even giving how close the two of them had gotten in such a short time, that didn't excuse the fact that even though that may be the case, they haven't really had enough TIME to really get to know each other. Not that Cillia cared. After she broke out of here with her brother, she was going to find a way back home. She wanted to see her mother again. However, Cillia then realized something. Even though Cillia saw Felix as a person and not prey, what would her mother think of him? However, Cillia's thoughts were drawn away from that thought when Felix started to talk. However, even though her attention was given to Felix, the thought that her mother may eat Felix was still unbearable, and wouldn't go away.

I don't think Lord William or any of the other soldiers know about it, but we shouldn't take the chance and wait. Luck must finally be on our side for once..." Felix said as he explained why. Felix was attending to his last duty of polishing armour when he overheard two guards just outside begin to talk and Felix couldnt help but listen in on their conversation.

"I'm telling you this idea is foolish" One grumbled as Felix eged over closer to the door "It was hard enough to find that first beast and now we need to find another!"

"Quit your complaining" A more deep gruff voice shot back "We get paid on the bucket load just to wander around a forest and if you cant handle doing that you shouldnt of taken this job"

"Look all i'm saying is that if an older one sneaks up on us and these creatures are as powerful as they say i dont think sword and bows are going to keep us from becoming dinner" The gaurd said nervously.

"HAH!" The deep voiced gaurd laughed "Well you have until monday to pass of the pay day of a lifetime and you saw that 'naga' feleryans are just spinless or we would have run into one by now"

Felix's attention fell away from the talk of the gaurdsmen and his task as his eyes widened at what they had said. "Monday..." Felix muttered "That means we have seven days until the hunt it might be enought time to deal with the little problem". The 'little problem' he was mentioning was the fact that when Cillia did manage to free herself from the chains she had grown over the size of the actual EXIT of the dungeon. He had refrained from telling Cillia this however not wanting to crush her hopes of freedom. However after living a slave as long as he could remember Felix knew this castle better than anyone after being constantly asigned new jobs due the deaths of many slaves who had defied Lord William and had ended up as one of the many skeletons that now litter the dungeon. Felix stopped polishing as he remebered the looks of shock, anger and fear as one by one rebelious slaves had been dragged off and the sight of this had only mad his own confidence drop over the years.

He shook away these thoughts and continued planning in his mind. The only thing that they could use to escape is the sewage lines that led from the castle all the way into the old forest two miles West from the castle. It was linked to the sewage system in the dungeons and the only thing standing between the duo and freedom was a few layers of concrete. Felix only had to figure out how to break through it. Of course Cillia could possibly break through the floor given the right amount of time but that was not an option and the remaing guards would realize something was amiss and though less of them remained there were enough to stop the escape with time to mobolize. He had to think of a way to break through the floor fast and ensure their escape.

After another hour Thte guards inspected the gear and decided it was acceptable then let Felix fetch Cillia dinner (but only after giving a large fist to the ribs for taking so long). Felix however was not demoralized by this as if the fates were in his favour soon he would breathe fresh air of freedom and never look back at this place again.

Felix had got the food for Cillia and was now making his way back to the dungeon. He had made it right up to the door when the guard that seemed to be posted there most the time stopped him abruptly as he blocked the door with his spear. Felix was taken back by the guard sudden hostility but regained himself and said "I'm here with the naga's food sir please allow me in" Felix said with a degree of nervousness in his voice for worry of the guards intent eyes analysing him as if he were choosing wether a pig was yet worthy of slaughter.

After a long pause the guard lent toward Felix and said "I am not a fool boy and i know what you and that naga have been up to" After these words came out of his mouth Feix was stunned. He had been discovered? His fate was sealed! The guard would take him to William amd his life would end at a hangsmens noose! The thought of his body lying there limp and Cillia being left alone at the hands of that monster was too much to bare. Felix was considering options when the guard lauged. But this was not a luagh of creulty as the guard so often used but a laugh of joy as if Felix was a God send he had been waiting for.

"Wha- why are you laughing" Felix aked lowering his guard.

"Is it not obvious boy!" The guard belowed inbetween laughter "Its good to see i'm not the only one in this hell hole who wants to strike back at that foul pice of work William!" Felix was amazed! This man was not an enemy but a possible ally.

The guard stoped laughing suddenly aware that people may hear him. He reached for his left glove and took it off and upon it was a large black hand inorinted in his skin that Felix gasped as he saw. The guard chuckled "You know this symbol lad?" The guard asked "I am a member of the black hand the group sworn to end the opression of our 'lord' once and for all. I have been spying on this fort for two years and i have a favour to ask of you."

"Good on ya lad" He said while smiling "I realize that you plan to spring that naga and what better way to distract the lord is that. I know the sewers is the only way to get that colossus out of here and with the right... tools... we can make entry easy" As he said this he produced a large ball and a match from his puch. The guard explained that the black hand needed to weaken the defences and the trust of Lord William's forces for a final attack and this was the perfect opertunity to begin the uprising. All Felix had to do was blow the floor under the dngeon and escape leaving the castle in chaos for the black hand to send the message to Lord William. Felix was at amiss with his luck and was about to take the agent up on his offer but he realized this all seemed very suspicious.

"Why are you so egar to help us?" Felix asked and the guards face became very serious.

"Maybe becuase i've seen you suffer for two years, maybe because I see that girl no matter how big or monstrous she may be in pain and it hurts me as much or possibley becuase its my duty" The spy muttered then looked directly at Felix and said "Just know that at the end of that unnel you'll be within arms width of out of William's kingdom and freedom will be yours." With that he handed the explosived to Felix and began to open the door.

As the guard pushed Felix in the slave couldnt help but turn around and ask for the guard name. 14532121121112.content:
Felix said nothing. Cillia grew more worried with each passing second of his silence. Felix gestured her to lower her hand to the ground. Cilia did not want to, but she did. Once her hand was close enough to the ground, Felix jumped off of it. He grabbed the cart and walked away. Cillia's worsefear came true. She reached out for him, but her hand caught onto the cuff around her wrist. "Please brother!" she shouted. "Don't leave me!" Tears were flowing out of Cillia's eyes like rivers. She didnt want to lose her brother, Felix was the only light in her dark world. Felixstopped but did not turn around.

"I'm not your brother, and I'm not your sister..." Cillia gasped in horror as tears began to gush out. "If there is no trust, we shouldn't even be friends..." Felix continued walking towards the gate. He ignored every cry and plea Cillia made between the limit line and the entrance. The guards opened the cage and Felix left; without even saying goodbye. Cillia was left in the cage, her heart broken. She now lost the only thing she could care about at this moment in her life.

The next few weeks were possibly the saddest for Cillia. Felix came three times a day, giving Cillia her meals. But she only placed them just behind the limit line for her reach. He said nothing else and left. Day by day, piece by piece, Cillia's heart and will were fading. The Lord was having an easier time controlling her. Cillia tried to fight it, but she lacked the will to do it. Felix was unfathed by her reactions. She wanted to eat him, after everything he has done for her. Cillia's heart was broken into pieces, but so was Felix's faith and trust. By the end of the month...
14532121121112.title: Broken into Pieces

145321211211121.content:
By the end of the month Felix had become loyal to Lord William again. Without the help of knowing he had a friend or anyone to trust, Felix had lost himself to Lord William completely this time. Each passing day, Cillia could see the life of Felix leave him more and more, each day. She didn’t know what was more painful, the fact that she lost her one and only friend in this horrid place or the fact that she could see that same person hollow out each and each every day. As for Felix his mind has numbed as well as his body, he was becoming more and more like ever slave. No more hope, no more love, or anything. When Felix’s mind became numb, so did his body. Whenever a guard hit him, sure fell to the ground from the hit, but he felt no pain.

As Felix returned day like every other day to feed Cillia, Lord William was walking out of the east cell. “You slave,” Lord William called, “why isn’t the beast eating or drinking?! Don’t you know what happens if it doesn’t eat?!” Lord William slapped Felix to the ground, but again, he felt no pain.

Felix looked up at Lord William and asked, “What do you want me to do?”

“Force it to eat. If it won’t eat the food willingly then you’ll force it to eat.” When Lord William said this, something in Felix’s mind flashed, was he suppose to act afraid of her? Sure to keep their friendship secret but now, why should he?

“But Lord, won’t it eat me?” Felix asked. Why was he doing this? Sure he had no emotions when he asked but still why? He even knows that Lord William doesn’t care about losing a slave, to master Cil… a monster.

“Because to lose to lose a slave is better than losing a guard, didn’t I already tell you this?” and like that Lord William left. Felix walked the cart in like he does every day, but today he was surprised. Cillia’s last few meals were just laying there in front of her. Her water was untouched. When Felix looked at Cillia, he was mortified. She looked like she hasn’t eaten in days. She didn’t look like she had any strength at all. And with her growing, her body would be too weak to move. But she was just laying there sleeping.

Felix looked at her in fear, but unlike the time they meet, Felix feared for her to life. Sure Felix may have numbed after all this time and still upset about what she did, but the shock of seeing someone as strong as Cillia to just lay there and look so weak made him realize he needed to help her.

Felix pushed the cart right in front of Cillia and grabbed the deer He tried to pick it up but Felix was too weak to get pick it up. So Felix dragged it in front of Cillia and tried to wake her up. “Cillia wake up.” Felix said, he would have yelled it if the guards weren’t on the other side of the door. Come on Cillia wake up.”

Cillia started to move around, but she didn’t didn’t wake up. She did however mutter, “Felix?” He voice sounded so weak and dry that it hurt Felix to see her like this.

Felix looked at her and said, “Yes Cillia, it’s me.” Felix was kind of worried he wasn’t sure if Cillia would forgive him for leaving her alone in a place like this.
145321211211121.title: Who's Heartless Now?

1453212112111211.content:
Cillia's eyes began to open very slowly. She was too weak to even open her eyes. However they managed to open completely, giving Felix some relief. Cilia's tired eyes landed on Felix. The memory of his ignorant behavior flashed through her mind. She no longer wanted to see Felix like that. She began to roll her body, but it was hard for her. But she wanted not to see Felix in his current state.

"Cilla wait!" shouted Felix. Cillia stopped at the sound of his voice. Did he...did he just speak to me...? Is there concern in his voice? she thought. Cillia turned back over to see Felix standing in the same position. Something was different about him. His eyes did not seem lifeless or drained anymore. They were filled with sadness and concern. A spark of hope and happiness lit inside of Cillia's heart. "Felix...?" she asked. "Cillia, you need to eat..." he said. Even more concern, Cillia was overjoyed. "Lord William will punish me if you don't eat..."

The spark extinguished as quickly as it ignited. Felix only wanted to prevent his punishment, not to help Cillia. Cillia's eyes soon filled with sadness and she tried to turn away from Felix once again. Tears began to form and drip down her cheek. But, she felt something else on her cheek. Out of the corner of her eye, she saw Felix hugging what he could of Cillia's cheek. Cillia stopped moving and focused what she could on Felix. He was really hugging her. She recieved more of a response in five minutes than what she lacked for over a month. "Please Cillia...." said Felix, "I don't want to lose you again. I was too worried for my own life that I forgot yours. I never should have left you, I will never forgive myself. I'm not just your light in this dark world, your my light. I don't want you to die. Your my sister...and I'm your brother!" Felix was now in tears. Cillia cried, but they were tears of joy. With what strength she had, Cillia grabbed Felix and placed him near her chest. She embraced him in a massive hug, "I missed you so much brother..."
1453212112111211.title: Brother Sister Reunited
