1453312.content:
Felix took in the sight of the sphinx's back, colored a light sandy yellow. As he watched, the sphinx seemed to notice him, and slowly stood up. He watched as it stood taller and taller, until it looked like it was about fifty feet tall by his guess. The sphinx turned around so it faced Felix, and he could see its full body as it turned. He saw the powerful lion part, with big paws lacking any claws and a long fur-tipped tail that swished back and forth lazily. He followed the lion part from that tail to where the lion's head should be, but there, the fur ended and was replaced by skin. The sphinx's body turned into that of a human, apparently a young girl due to her lack of certain feminine features on her chest. He could tell the sphinx was female mainly due to her face. She had ragged tan hair and freckles, and glowing green eyes, with a single fang jutting from the top of her mouth. Instead of human ears, she had feline, lion ears covered in fur, and a wilted flower held behind one.

The sphinx looked down at Felix as he stared at her with a sort of awe. He'd never seen such a huge creature, and although he hated to admit it, she actually looked a bit pretty to him. But he noticed that her eyes were very sad, and her arms were crossed in front of her stomach; she was shivering, and looked on the verge of tears. Felix couldn't help but feel sad for her, but stopped himself from walking up to her. The guards were still watching, and wouldn't let him do anything but feed the beast and leave.

The sphinx pleaded at him with her eyes, and Felix felt overwhelmingly sad for her. He started stumbling forward, in a trance, and the guards shouted for him to stop. But he wasn't able to hear them, and was lost in the sphinx's green eyes....

Suddenly, the eyes turned red, and the sphinx bared her teeth (which meant little considering they were all human-like except for her two longer fangs). Felix stood still, unable to move, as the sphinx's left hand reached down towards him. He had walked well into her arms' range, and she was easily able to reach him. Her fingers wrapped around him, and he couldn't resist as she lifted him from the ground without any effort, bringing him close to her stomach.

Now that he wasn't looking at her eyes, he suddenly felt able to move. He started struggling, shouting for help and kicking the sphinx in her stomach. She didn't react, though, and simply brought her other hand to start stroking his head. He was stunned with surprise, and stopped struggling for a bit. He was being held facing away from her, and he could see a group of guards coming into the cell. The sphinx stopped petting him and squeezed him tighter. He decided not to squirm, and see what happened. After all, the sphinx had him, and the guards were his only chance to get away....

145331212.content:
"Long version, or short version?" the boy asked the sphinx.

The sphinx thought for a second, then replied, "Short. I get bored easily." Saying that, she rolled her lioness half onto its side, her human half still upright and propped up with the hand not holding Felix. Her tail swished slowly as she look at him expectantly.

"Well, we're in a castle, under the control of a man named Lord William," Felix said. "I'm a slave, which means he makes me do things without paying me or anything. And you're here because you're big and powerful, and he wants to train you so he can use you to get more power. I guess that's as simple as I can put it."

The sphinx listened to Felix's explanation with a sad expression. "So... You're like me? You're stuck here?"

Felix nodded, but then hung his head low. "Yeah. I've always wanted to escape, but I've never been able to myself."

The sphinx smiled slightly. "Well, maybe we could help each other with that."

Felix looked up with a somewhat surprised expression. "Wait, do you know how to get out of here?" he asked her.

The sphinx began to look nervous, and said, "Actually, no. But maybe we could help each other find a way to escape."

Felix looked up at the grate covered hole in the ceiling, and remembered something. "I thought Lord William said you have wings?"

As soon as he said that, the sphinx looked away. "Well, sphinxes are supposed to have wings..."

"You're telling me you don't?" he asked, slightly annoyed and worried.

The sphinx moved her hand a bit, letting Felix take a better look at her lioness half. He saw two small nubs behind her front legs' shoulders, and realized what it likely meant.

"I was born like that," she explained. "My wings never grew in. So, we can't fly out of here, even if we could break the chains they have on me."

Felix sighed, running a hand through his hair. "Okay, we'll have to think of something else. But, I think I should get going now. The guards might come back and attack you again, and that wouldn't be good."

The sphinx nodded, setting Felix down gently on the ground. He began walking away, but stopped and turned around, looking way up at her youthful face.

"One more thing," he began. "Do you have a name?"

"Yeah," she said. "Zahra."

"Huh. Neat name," he said.

"It means flower," she explained. "But, shouldn't you get going?"

Felix nodded and, with a wave, ran back to the door, hoping to make a plan the next time they met.

1453312122.content:
When Felix left the cell, he surprised everyone. They thought he was dead by the sphinx's hand, and having found he was not, they took to calling him "the sphinx tamer". He liked the attention, but knew he should probably keep secret how he and Zahra were actually starting to be friends.

Lord William knew something was up, though. The sphinx and Felix had something between them. The beast was deadly, as he intended it to be, and so it must have befriended the slave. Such an alliance could only lead to rebellion, with the slave using the beast, and he couldn't allow that. He was interested in how such an alliance was created, though, and hoped he could create something similar between himself and the sphinx, as it would help him reach his goal. He thought he might ask the slave at any point about this, though, so he could act now with breaking their alliance so he might forge one for himself.

He decided to test their alliance by sending in a group of guards and a wizard, with the task of wounding the sphinx severely. He would then have the wizard use his spells to spy on them, and see how the slave reacted to the sphinx's injuries. Perhaps copying the slave's reaction to the sphinx's pain would help lord William form a bond with the sphinx, and help him control it easier.

And so, when Felix came to feed Zahra again, he entered her cell to find her crying, lying on the ground. He checked to see that the door was closed, and rushed over to her, leaving the cart behind. He sat down next to her face, which was almost as big as he was, and asked what was wrong.

Zahra wiped her eyes and glanced over at Felix, her red eyes turned even more so with tears. "They.., hurt me... With magic," she stuttered. "Hurt so much!"

Felix stood up and awkwardly tried hugging her face. She smiled slightly and pushed herself off the ground with her hands, leaning over Felix. She pushed more, until she was sitting with her lioness half lying down and her human hald upright, and held out a hand to Felix, her palm facing him. He knew what she wanted, and walked into her hand, raising his arms so the would stay free to move. She wrapped her fingers around him and lifted him to her face, wiping more tears from her eyes with her other hand.

"Felix..." she started. "We need... To get out..."

"Yeah," he said, patting her wrist, one of the only things he could easily reach in the position he was in. "Is this the first time they hurt you like this?"

She nodded, crying still. "Yeah, it... It hurt... He used magic, and... And it hurt a lot..."

Felix just hung there, held in her gentle hand and surprised that such a big creature could be so hurt. He also got angry at lord William and his men for hurting Zahra, realizing in that moment how protective he was of her. She was many times his size, and was easily able to overpower him, and was even holding him in her hand right now as an example of her power over him... But even so, he saw she was still weak, and he felt like he was what she needed for protection.

"Listen, I've lived here my whole life," Felix said.

"In this cell?" Zahra asked, cocking her head.

"No, of course not!" Felix said, laughing. Zahra giggled, wiping tears from her eyes. She seemed to be recovering a bit.

"I've lived in this castle my whole life, and I know some secret ways in and out. Ways lord William doesn't know about, and if he did, would wish I didn't know about. I can explain two ways to you, and maybe we could work out a way to escape...."

Succubi- Succubi are women with demonic features such as horns, fangs, bat-like wings, etc.

There is no single definitive depiction of them, as their appearance varies widely from one species to another. However, there is one fact about succubi that is universally agreed upon: they are extraordinary beautiful. Their features are perfect and their alluring body is made to make mortals, both males and females, fall under their charms.

A lesser known fact about succubi are their true size. When they appear in peoples dreams to lure and tempt them, they usually show themselves human-sized. However, most succubi are actually about 80 feet tall on average! This lesser known fact remains so because few people come back alive to report the succubi's true height.

Succubi are very dangerous and deadly beings. Their alluring bodies hide their martial skills; they are good warriors and excellent spell casters. Even an average succubus is a master of her element and knows the basics of dimensional magic. Succubi are also extremely voracious, and their large magic-proof stomachs can digest just about everything.

Like all demons, succubi show no mercy to their enemies or to their prey. They are deceptive, prone to anger and they have a temperament that can only be described as chaotic. But contrary to Heaven's propaganda, not all succubi are innately evil, nor are all demons. Indeed, it is easy to find some friendly and amiable succubi. It's very difficult to fully earn a succubus's trust, but once you do, they usually makes excellent friends, loyal to the death.

Felix rolled his eyes after the Lord made a comment. Felix hated it when the Lord constently talked about getting more power. That is all he ever cared about, power. Lord William led Felix to a cart with a large amount of meat and water.

"You are here slave to feed the Succubus" said Lord William.

145332222.content:
Chlaenas- A giant chimeric race that resembles a tauric cross between a human and an octopus. They can be found in many of the seas of Felarya, especially in the abyssal depths of the Topazial sea and in their underwater city Ryzelm’oire. However, roaming chlaenas have been known to go closer to the surface and even onto land. A chlaena’s body is made up entirely of muscle and soft tissue; they have nearly no bones or other rigid internal structure, which means that they have unparalleled flexibility and contortion abilities. They are capable of greatly compressing themselves into tight spaces, or expanding their body to swallow a creature nearly their own size. While this helps a lot when it comes to large prey, a chlaena’s compressibility can also work against them, and relatively smaller predators might be able to stuff a chlaena down their throat and swallow them!

While a chlaena must stay wet to survive, as long as they have ready access to water, they are able to traverse land much more ably than one might expect. A mermaid who climbs up onto shore for safety from aquatic predators is often rudely surprised when a chlaena merely follows her, dragging themselves onto land with their tentacles.

Terrestrial beings often find chlaenas disturbing, for reasons they just can't put their finger on. Maybe it’s the eight tentacles extending from their octopus-like lower body, or their large, staring eyes. Or maybe it’s the fact that they seem to be unnaturally cheerful, all the time... and the way that their boneless, ‘unnatural’ way of moving (particularly on land) tends to make intelligent vertebrates shudder. A chlaena is capable of turning their head nearly 360 degrees around, so if they want to look at you, they will typically not turn fully around to do so... which can be somewhat unnerving.

Chlaenas, like the other cephaloid races, have odd mindsets; they simply do not think the way the “normal” races do. Their logic is pretty much the only kind they are really capable of following, and their behavior can often be frustrating or frightening to those incapable of understanding their motivations. However, one thing you can rely on is for a Chlaena to be cheerful and honest, even when obviously inappropriate.

Chlaenas are capable of squeezing into very tight spaces, by compressing their flexible body and shifting their organs around inside their body. This allows them to pass through an opening only 10-15% the size of their entire body. Most chlaenas possess a mild paralytic venom, which can help take some of the fight out of large prey. In all but a few subspecies, this venom is non-lethal, as it affects only the voluntary muscles.

Due to millions of specialized cells in their skin called chromatophores, chlaenas are able to rapidly change the color of their entire body, or select parts of it. They use it either to match their surroundings, or for communication and to display their mood. Nearly all chlaenas have ink glands located somewhere in their bodies, which they can use to squirt a pressurized spray of ink into the water, quickly creating an underwater ‘smokescreen’ to cover their escape or give them the advantage in an attack. Some chlaenas can even mix their venom into the ink, creating a cloud that dulls the senses of predator or prey.

After a short while of traversing the curving stairs, they finally reached the door to the beast's cell. "Alright, this is as far as I go. Feed it the fish and toss the watercress into the water. It'll know what to do with it. And good luck." The man pushed the cart closer to the boy before leaving, trekking back upstairs.

Gathering up his few traces of bravery, Felix opened the door to the chlaena's chambers and pushed the cart in.

Unknown to Felix, two beautiful red eyes sensed the movement through the vibrations.
1453322221.title: The Underwater Beast

choices: Nothing happened, and he left the room safely
The chlaena appeared!
14533222211.content:
Felix pushed the cart into the room. It was huge and rock-walled, like a cavern, which was likely what it originally was before being integrated into the dungeons. There was a bit of land past the door, and a small wooden dock starting at the edge of the land and the pool and sticking out over the water. The boy pushed the cart closer to the dock before pausing. He felt like he was being watched, but the room was too dimly lit to really make out much of anything.

Shaking slightly in fear, he continued pushing the cart, reaching the dock and continuing along it until the end. There, he reached around and opened up the hatch on the side opposite him, and carefully tilted the cart to dump out its contents into the water. Some of the food floated, while some sank, but he couldn't see the chlaena come up to take any.

He didn't want to stay around to find out if it would, though. He began to pull the cart and turned around, heading for the door again. As he walked...
14533222211.title: Hurry up and leave

choices: Trust the chlaena
Take his chances and swim to shore
145332222112.content:
Suddenly, Felix heard a loud crash, and turned to see a large spray of water to his left. He covered himself with his arms to try to block the water flying at him, but it didn't help much. Soaking wet, he wiped his eyes to see better, and immediately wished he hadn't.

Lying on the dock, just feet in front of him, lay a thick tentacle, emerging from the pool to the left and sinking back in on the right. It was about the width of the boy's torso form waist to chest, and blocked hi way completely unless he wanted to try climbing over it. He had no intention of doing that, though, remembering how powerful a chlaena's tentacles were according to the small amount of information he'd been told about them. Unfortunately, that also meant he was stuck on the dock, surrounded by water on three sides and a chlaena's tentacle on the fourth. There was nowhere to go.

The boy began to shiver even more, partly from being drenched in cold water, but mainly from fear. He was trapped. He screamed for help, but there was no response. He stood there for a few moments, trying to figure out what to do, but quickly realized that he'd been ignoring something. Namely, the fact that he wasn't dead. The chlaena's tentacle was feet away, but it wasn't coiling and crushing him. If the chlaena was hostile, it would have done so by now, but it hadn't, so... maybe it wasn't hostile?

A thought crossed Felix's mind, one that he immediately thought was crazy. What if the chlaena really wasn't hostile, and was actually friendly? What if it revealed a tentacle as an invitation for Felix to approach it, and allow himself to be picked up by the chlaena? But the what? Would it turn hostile then?

Felix knew he had to choose something fast, in any case. He could trust the chlaena and approach the tentacle, or try to avoid it, perhaps by jumping into the water and quickly swimming to the shore. It could be risky, but it could work.

In the end, he decided to...
145332222112.title: Blocked by a tentacle

choices: Raise the tentacle and let him pass
Let him walk into the tentacle
1453322221121.content:
Felix gulped. He didn't like it, but he knew he couldn't make it to shore if he jumped into the pool. The chlaena would tell, and definitely grab him before he could make it. Besides, if it hadn't attacked him by now, it probably wasn't hostile. The boy, still shivering, called out.

"Hey... I know you're there... chlaena," he said, voice shaking. "I'm... I'm going to walk towards your... your tentacle... Please, just move it out of the way and let me leave! But if you don't... if you're planning to... grab me... well, just be gentle, okay? Please?"

There was no response. He didn't expect any, but he felt better knowing he'd asked the chlaena to not hurt him. Perhaps that would make a difference, he thought as he slowly walked forward.

----------
----------

Underwater, the creature heard the boy clearly, and understood. Clearly, the boy was terrified, and it made the creature sad. It began to worry that it had been too sudden in its appearance, but it wanted to ensure the boy trusted it completely, even enough to willingly walk into its deadly grasp, so it needed to reveal itself in this way. Even so, the chlaena wondered if it would be better to let him go and later reveal itself less abruptly, and thought as the boy approached its tentacle...
1453322221121.title: Trust the chlaena

choices: Male
Female
14533222211212.content:
The tentacle didn't move as Felix approached it, shivering, and hoping the chlaena wouldn't kill him instantly. It was time to find out, though, since he had reached the tentacle. He raised his arms high so they'd be free of the giant creature's grip, and walked into the limb. The chlaena's suction cups, each very small for a creature of its size, stuck to the boy, and let the chlaena know that the boy had indeed walking into its grip. Felix watched as the tentacle moved, its tapered end emerging from the right side of the dock and curling around towards him. He began to grow scared as he watched, and tried to back away, but the suction cups held him in place, so he could only watch as the chlaena went to work wrapping him up.

The tentacle coiled around, making a few circles around the boy's body, and surrounding him from ankle to chest in wet sliminess. He continued to shiver, since the tentacle was quite cold, but he realized that the coiling was very gentle, and not at all crushing him. It wasn't entirely comfortable, but it wasn't painful, so he did his best to remain calm and still. Eventually, the tentacle finished wrapping around him, leaving a short distance towards the end to hang free, and then the boy felt it all tighten. He suddenly panicked, squirming in the tentacle's grip, but it did nothing. The grip continued to tighten, but before it could get painful at all, the boy felt his feet leave the ground, and realized that the chlaena had finally picked him up, and had just been getting a tighter grip so he wouldn't slip at all.

He watched as he was raised up many feet off the ground, then slowly brought over the pool. He was quite scared now, as he could easily be dropped into the pool from this position, where he'd be at the chlaena's mercy. However, the chlaena seemed to be very merciful, and the boy simply allowed it to move him, refusing to struggle at all.

After a short time, the tentacle stopped moving, and the boy glanced down as he heard noise coming from the pool. The tentacle blocked a portion of his view downwards, but he could still see enough to tell that something very big was rising out of the water. As he watched, there was a second explosion of water, covering his face and blinding him for a few moments. When he recovered, he gasped as he finally saw the upper body of the chlaena for the first time. Staring at the giant form in awe, he quickly realized that the creature was...
14533222211212.title: In the chlaena's grasp

choices: Guards returned to check on the boy and saw the chlaena holding him!
The boy and the chlaena holding him continued talking
145332222112122.content:
The chlaena was a female, Felix could tell, though it seemed too young for any definitive signs of its sex to appear. Nonetheless, something about it seemed feminine to Felix. The chlaena had long golden hair covering its chest and reaching almost down to its waist, where the humanoid part ended and the octopus part began. The hair was messy despite being wet, and a few strands seemed to always stick up from the top. The chlaena had large, bright blue eyes and light freckles, and seemed to have tribal marking on her. There was a red stripe running over her nose from cheek to cheek, and other red stripes and abstract markings on her torso and arms. The chlaena's arms were held in front of it, hands clasped together right in front of her chest, and she stared at the boy intently while he stared back, filled now with surprise and awe more than anything else. He'd never seen a living thing so huge before, and especially not something that looked like a human for the most part. The human part of the body wasn't absurdly large, though, and though he couldn't estimate its size very accurately, she seemed big enough to hold him in a single hand, as if he were a doll.

Felix was startled from his thoughts when the chlaena suddenly spoke. Her sex was pretty much confirmed when she spoke, as she had the voice of a young girl, no older than Felix.

"You... trusted me," the chlaena said. "I am... surprised... and happy." With that, she smiled gently, although doing so revealed a large fang in the left side of her mouth, making Felix slightly worried for his safety again. Nonetheless, the chlaena continued, without making any hostile moves.

"You... your name?"

The boy paused for a moment, still stunned at the whole situation he was in, but was able to stammer his name.

The chlaena continued to smile. "Ah... F-Felix... Hello, Felix. My name is..."

The chlaena proceeded to make a few noises that were clearly not form any human language. Felix stared, and the chlaena blushed slightly.

"Oh... sorry... is of my... own language... much... easier to... to understand than... than yours, but I can... speak some of yours too. Have heard people call me... Chlegigrasni. Do not understand... but is easier humans to... to say."

The boy nodded. "Hello... Chlegigangr... Chlesniga... Chlegasnigra... What's your name again?"

The chlaena giggled, brinign up a hand to cover her mouth, and the boy smiled too, laughing a bit as well. He never would have guessed that this situation would lead to him and a giant half-girl-half-octopus laughing together. In the end, though, it certainly was a good way for it to go, considering all the other bad ways it could have gone.

The chlaena repeated her name, and the boy said it a few more times to memorize it. After that...
145332222112122.title: Chlegigrasni the Chlaena

choices: Long raven hair of a female
Short red hair of a male
14533222212.content:
Pushing the cart in, Felix was treated with a rather strange sight. The Lord had flooded both stories of the dungeons to provide the cell for the creature. Extending out over the water was a boardwalk so he throw the fish and grass out to the chlaena.

The boy looked around, checking to see if the cellmate was around. Satisfied that it wasn't around, he slowly pushed the cart onto the path. The wheels trudged over the pathway, causing small ripples to spread on the water. Deep below the waves, something was watching him. To the eyes underwater, it was a strange sight to it also.

The slave threw in all the fish onto the wider areas. He was afraid that the creature might come up and destroy the boardwalk he stood on. Turning his attention to the watercress, he touched it before retracting his hand. Watercress was very slimy and slippery like soap but tough like rubber. Picking up a bushel, he threw them onto the water. As he did, he noticed that none of the fish were gone yet. Stopping his task, Felix slowly tiptoed out to the edge and peeked over the surface. A pinwheel of large green lights slowly twirled in a tornado-like fashion as the creature slowly came closer. Stepping back, he slowly shuffled back before running to the entrance. He didn't want to still be on the boardwalk when it surfaced.

Just as he reached for the door ring, he stopped and listened. It felt as though a little girl was whispering into his ear.

"....lease....ait. on't......go. Plea..."

The boy took his hand away from the large ring and looked back. Now the lights were a deep blue and close to breaking the surface. Walking back to the end, he kneeled. "Are you talking...to me?" He felt a little foolish asking it but he had no reason to as the chlaena replied. "Yes I ...as. ...ank..ou...for coming...ack." The neons underwater turned a bright yellow as she spoke.

Felix understood most of what it said but it was still a pain to decipher. "You're welcome, I guess. Why are you speaking that way, though?"

He received what sounded like a sigh. "Well, the water acts as a constant disruptor and messes up some of my words. I could surface so we could talk face-to-face but...would you run away from me again?"

"I'll try not to. But if I do, it may be from just being nervous. After all, I don't know what you are."

Bubbles rose to the surface as the chlaena came at a sluggish pace. The first thing that Felix saw was....
14533222212.title: The First Encounter

choices: They continue to conversate, Felix infroming her about her surroundings.
The same white knight from before comes in and escorts Felix away.
145332222121.content:
At first, Felix thought what was rising was merely a black hill albeit a tiny margin larger but with closer examination, he saw that was the chlaena's hair. As the waterfall of crisp dark blue rose, he wonder if it would stop soon. Finally, as it towered at least 18ft, it stopped growing.

The chlaena was clearly a young girl, approximately the age of a 9-year-old. Her complexion was very pale, as though she was constantly sick, but in reality, she was very healthy. The cascade of raven hair effectively hid most of her body from view. A ghostly hand reached up and removed the hair from her face to reveal her beautiful crimson eyes. One of the main points of her body were the various orange tribal markings across her body. Especially the one that looked oddly like a sun around her right eye.

Felix tried to pry his mouth open to say something but he was too busy wallowing in shock and bewilderment.

============================================================================ ===========

Do I scare him? Maybe I should speak first? Hmm... The chlaena ran through a number of options before choosing one. Just say hello.

============================================================================ =================================

The girl slowly moved her hand in a wave. "Hi..."

Hearing her speak first, Felix snapped out of his thoughts as well. "Oh, hello." An awkward silence took over the air for a few seconds. Both of them were looking at each other carefully; examining one another.

The boy decided to speak first. "My name is Felix. Nice to meet you." He offered his hand to the chlaena, who was almost taken aback by such a gesture.

Using extreme caution, she took his tiny hand into her pointer and thumb and proceeded to shake it very gently while introducing herself. "Greetings. My name is Sun. The pleasure is all mine...somewhat." She giggled. Felix was amazed that she could smile, dare say laugh. It was such a harsh environment to live in and yet she still could smile.

"Sun? If you don't mind what I say, then doesn't your appearance somewhat contradict your name?" Felix spoke in a soft tone, as not to show he was poking fun.

"My name isn't based on appearance, silly! Where I came from, they were named on personality. My mother always said I had a sunny, bright smile. And she said I'm outgoing, cheerful..." Sun went on to list hundreds more adjectives that seemed to describe her rather well.
145332222121.title: Cheerful Prisoner

choices: Sun soon comes up with a plan but she needs materials.
Felix recieves a helper on his feeding habits, thus jeopardizing the escape plan
1453322221211.content:
Finally, Sun had reached the end of her listings. Felix tried hard to pay attention to his newfound friend during the adjective-naming, but he found it difficult. The chlaena looked around at her rather poor home. "Where are we, though?"

The boy bit his lip as these words left her mouth. He wasn't so sure if she would still be so cheerful after the explanation. "Well, you see, we are now property of a mean king. He's called Lord William but his servants, including me, have to call him Lord or Sir. Usually, if we don't obey his directions or rules, he whips us or beats us. It's very painful. Awful."

For the first time since her arrival, Sun didn't look as cheerful. "Well, why don't you leave? If a person is that mean to you, you shouldn't stay near him. Let alone obey his orders! It's like you want his punishment, then!"

Felix let his head drop as he sat at the edge of the boardwalk. "That's the thing. I can't leave. I'm not allowed. If I do try to leave, he'll probably..." He took a deep gulp of air as he let the next words from his mouth. "Kill me."

Felix would find Sun's face close up to his as she slammed both her hands on the boardwalk behind him, almost destroying it. The boy fell back in surprised shock. Was her anger also like the sun? "Why?! That's not fair! It's cruel and mean and! And! It's not fair!!"

Her powerful underwater octopus tentacles slammed into two of the support beams, causing a section of it to be destroyed. Also propelling Felix into the dark water as though he were a ragdoll. Sun realized her mistake and swam over to Felix as she scooped him up in her hands. "Felix! I'm sorry! Are you OK? It was an accident! I didn't mean it, I swear!" Thankfully, one of her drifting tentacles had cushioned his fall, being more beneficial that the octopus half had nearly no bones.

The boy inhaled and exhaled rapidly as he lay resting in her large palms. Such power! Just like Lord William said! Sitting up slowly, he began to feel himself. He recalled falling on something slick and slippery. Holding a hand to his head, Felix recovered from his dizziness. "It's OK. It's OK, Sun. I'm not dead or injured. Just slightly dizzy. But what was that?"

Sun sighed relief as she drifted through the water. "My other half. The octopus half. Where I came from, it was somewhat natural to have strength like this. But regardless, I shouldn't have lost myself. But it just makes so mad that your species would treat each other so harshly!" Large tears began to flow down her pale cheeks as she spoke. Spreading her tentacles out so her lower half was like a parachute , she set Felix down upon it before bursting out in tears.

After a few more minutes of crying, she regained her posture. "Alright, I'm better. I'm going to make you a promise, Felix. I'm gonna spend every second of my days here trying to find a way out. For both of us."

Felix looked up at the vermilion eyes of Sun. Her eyes burned with determination and strong-will as her lower body turned a deep shade of crimson. "If you could do that....that'd be nice, Sun." Thinking of a resolution of his own, he stood up to say it only to slip on the slick surface of the slippery body-made platform. "And I promise to bring you food to boost your brain power."

The chlaena clapped her hands together in joy. "Deal!! Once we get out of here, we can go back to my world! And you can meet my family! And maybe......you'd like to join my family. You would be my big brother. And you'd have a big sister. Literally big." Felix fantasized about what she said. A family. He'd forgotten what it was like to have a family. "Umm, Sun? I need to get back to my chores. I'll see you at lunch soon, OK?"

Drifting over to the partial boardwalk, she deposited her passenger onto it before watching her new friend leave. Once Felix left, Sun slowly sank back into the murky depths, thinking of one thing. Freedom with Felix.
1453322221211.title: They continue to conversate, Felix infroming he...

choices: For way to help her grow faster
For materials for a spell to destroy the grate
14533222212111.content:
As the young slave left the flooded dungeons, more hopeful than he had been in years, his newfound friend sank down into the depths, wondering a way to escape. Sun set about exploring her prison. It appeared that the dungeon had indeed been two levels before its flooding, and diving down, Sun passed by submerged cells, ancinet bones littering the floor, and in some cases whole skeletons shackled to walls.She felt her anger flare. She would not be stuck here, would not let Felix suffer it either. The chaelana continued on, arriving at what seemed to be an old stair case. Curisoity piqued, she swam down it,

The second floor of dungeons was similar to the first, save that it had a large chamber at the end of its hall, full of strange and grisly looking devices. She didn't know what they were for, but small as they were to her, they still carried an air of menace. She gave an involuntary shiver. She'd ask Felix what the cruel looking devices were for next time he came. Sun was about to leave and return she felt an odd current in the water. Pausing, she followed the flow until she came to a section of the wall, stone and mortar filled with cracks. Here, it was definetly coming from here. Water was flowing through the wall, and into something behind it!

WIthout a second thought, the chaelana began to pull at the stones and soaked mortar, latching tentacles onto loose stones with their suckers and pulling with all her strength. At last, one of the stones fell from its place, sending a cloud of dust up in the water. The current only grew stronger. Emboldened by this success, Sun wormed several of her tentacles in through the newly made hole in the wall's center, latched them on to the other side of the wall, and pulled once again. This time, nearly the entire section of the wall came down, throwing up more dust, but it was quickly sucked away by the now fast moving current.Swimming through the hole,Sun found herself in a small cavern, and found the currents source.

A massive iron grate ad been laid over a hole in the floor, beneath which water rushed by. Sun smiled. It was an underground river. And with Lord William's castle so close to the shore, it could only lead to the sea. This was her and Felix's way out. Grinning, she wrapepd tentacles around the grate, and pulled. It didn't budge. Somewhat flustered, but far from discouraged, Sun pondered way to get around it.She recalled bits of magic she had learned back home. Dangerous stuff, and mostly forbidden, she cast such thoughts aside. This was a situation that warranted the danger. Then again, she was sure that if she were bigger and stronger, it would be a imple matter to rip of the grate. Finally, she decided to ask Felix......
14533222212111.title: A Discovery and a Decision

choices: Fine, he'll help
Unsure. He's a lil uncomfortable with Sun at this size, let alone any bigger
145332222121111.content:
Sun pondered her dilemma. "Well," she thought, "those spells can be dangerous. I should only try ones I'm sure about. I'm positive that I can do one to let Felix breathe under here, but stuff to get the grate off could backfire pretty bad. Guess I'll just have to get bigger," she concluded with a slight grin. "No one will be able to push me around any more back home, and I can take care of my new brother better." Her thoughts then invariably turned to Felix. "I hope he comes back here soon, we've got a lot to talk about."

***********************

Felix hurried through the rest of his day's tasks, eager to return and see his newfound friend, but her was careful to mask his optimism around the castle staff. Sadistic guards took pleasure in crushing anything that brought the slaves joy, and the boy feared what would happen if they discovered the source of his hope. So he kept it hidden, keeping his head down whenever one of the armored thugs stomped by. Soon enough though, it was time for dinner, and the slave hurried down to the kitchens to retrieve the cart, once more filled with fish and aquatic plants, before descending down into the dungeons.

The cart wobbled slightly as he rolled it out over the rickety wooden platform, and as he reached the end of the pier, Felix stepped aside and looked down at the water.

"Sun!" he called, "It's me, Felix. I'm here with dinner!"

Abruptly, the water began to bubble and ripple slightly as a large shadow formed beneath its surface, and Sun slowly surfaced, smiling widely.

"Hey buddy, I got some news!"

Felix smiled weakly.

"That's great Sun. Why don't you have dinner first, you look pretty hungry."

His giant friend smiled sheepishly.

"Well I am a little bit. I was doing some exploring and," she lowered her voice, eyes glancing around for any unwanted listeners, "I think I've fond us a way out of here.

Felix's mouth fell into a large O.

"Wh-What? How? Where?"

Sun's grin persisted.

"Below us, in one the one flooded floor. There was a weak wal, and behind that, there's an underwater river that can take us straight through to the ocean. I know a spell that'll let you breathe underwater for the trip, but, uh there's one slight problem."

Felix frowned.

'What is it?"

"Well, you see, to get to the underground river, there's a metal grate in the way. To ger past that, I'm going to have to get stronger, and bigger. Will you help me?"

How does Felix feel about this?
145332222121111.title: Sun's Request

choices: The chef is a tough cookie but finally crumbles, thanks to some help.
The chef refuses to give more food to the chlaena.
1453322221211111.content:
Felix brought his hand to his chin and adopted a thinking pose as Sun devoured her repast ravenously. Sun has been a wonderful person ever since she's came. She's proven Lord William wrong so far, aside from the boardwalk. But she's in total control of her actions and she's not reckless. I don't see why I shouldn't help her. Helping her helps myself....Guess we'll do it.

"Sun." The cheerful chlaena chewed, her cheeks full of trout, before swallowing them down and returning to attention. "Yes?" Felix took a deep breath before continuing. "I've decided. I'll find a way to bring more food. So that way, you can become bigger and stronger. And then, we'll be able to escape, right? After all, we're friends, right?"

"Mmmm, wrong!" The boy gazed up at the wide smile and closed eyes of his friend. "What?" Sun waved her finger and tsked as though she were reproaching some naughty babe, keeping the warm grin on her face. "We're not friends. Never were." Felix felt an aching pain in his heart grow and expand. So this was all a trick, huh? Figures about proving Lord William wrong... "Then......Then what are we?"

"We're family. From the minute we met, I was your younger sister and you my older brother. And family sticks together, through thick and thin. Am I right, brother? After all, for now, we've all we've got."

The young boy looked into Sun's crimson eyes and saw plains of unending kindness. Tears began to gather in his eyes and fall down his cheeks. The chlaena instantly stooped down to his level. "Fel? Please don't cry. Don't be sad. Please." Felix began to wipe his eyes with the ragged cloth of his shirt. "I'm not sad. It's just...been so long since I remember having a family." With those words, he began to let loose a new onslaught of tears. Gently using her pinkie, she began to stroke her brother's spine.

After a short while of releasing tears, Felix regain his posture. "Thank you, Sun. Those were kind words to say. Anyway, I'll find a way to persuade the chef to give me more food." The chlaena smiled and picked up the boy in her hand before giving him a peck on the cheek. "Don't overexert yourself, brother. I'll see you in the morning, yes?" Cheeks aflame with blush, Felix nodded. "Yes, but I'll try convince him tonight. Anyway, I must be gone now, Su-, I mean, sister." Sun allowed the tips of her tentacles to splash the water. It was her sign of showing happiness. "Alright, good night, brother. Curling her tentacle on the boardwalk, she slid Felix back onto the wooden platform. With a look back, he saw the melancholy of beautiful lights sinking into the depths of dungeon, swirling and twisting. "Good night, sis." With those words, he exited the room, inside full of hope.
1453322221211111.title: We're Friends, Right?

choices: "Do you know what's going on between me and the beast?"
"Why are you helping me so much?"
14533222212111111.content:
The brilliant sun rose the next morning in the slave quarters, treating Felix to a faceful of sunshine. Rousing himself from his bed, the young slave smiled while looking at the rays of yellow flowing through the window. Sun, I made you a promise, didn't I? Stretching his limbs, Felix began to prepare for his daily chores. He'd have to be careful not to suffer any wounds for fear of angering his little/bigger sister becoming angry. "Well, sister, wish me luck."

The morning and afternoon passed by quickly, the numerous slaves rushing to take care of the various jobs and tasks assigned to them with the guards watching their every move with avarice-filled eyes. Felix was finally done polishing the royal armors of past kings and queens before looking at the stained glass window of the throne room. The sun had fallen quite low into the green land, announcing the arrival of evening. Evening meant it was time for him to feed Sun. But today, it also meant it was time to persuade the chef to give more food up to his sister. Drying his hands on his ragged shirt, Felix took a deep breath before heading down to the kitchen.

Upon reaching his destination, the young boy would find his target slicing apart pieces of healthy meat into thin slabs. Looking hungrily, Felix licked his lips before remembering what he came to do. Walking into the room, Felix spoke in a soft voice. "Mister, I'm here for the beast's food..." Wedging his blade into the wooden chopping board, the bulk of a man turned around, treating Felix to a resolve-abandoning sight. Being a butcher as well as a chef, the meat he chopped up often ended up on his apron he wore, leaving no wonder to what the red stuff on it was. Not only that but he was also ridiculously burly. "Already, huh? Fine, then." Loading up the cart with the meat and watercress, the chef was about to go back to his business until Felix spoke up. "Sir, it'll need a little more than this."

A vein of anger appeared on the butcher's head as he turned around. "A little more, huh? Listen here, you mangy boy. There ain't enough food to go around for everybody in this here castle. Certainly not enough for a boy and his little pet. Or maybe..." Grabbing the frightened Felix by his wrist, he dragged him closer. "You're trying to get more food for you and ya friends. Well, how about I serve you to them?!" Raising his knife above, a deadly glint in his eyes.....

"Chef, stop this instant! If you kill him, I will have to report you."

Turning to the doorway, Felix saw the same white knight waiting. "Lord William's orders. The creature is to receive more food to speed it's growth. Here's the paper if you need it." Taking the outstretched parchment from the knight, the burly butcher read the paper, slowly letting go of the slave's arm. Mumbling to himself, he loaded more fish and cress onto the cart before leaving to continue cutting up his meat. Taking the cart in his hands, the white knight beckoned Felix to follow as he began to lead the way.

"You have a question. I can sense it. What is it you want to ask?" Gathering his courage, Felix said,..
14533222212111111.title: The White Knight Strikes...

choices: She was bigger than before!
She was talking in her sleep!?
145332222121111111.content:
Making sure that there was no one around to overhear them, the white knight answered Felix's question.

"The creature in that cage that is being transferred into the cell is a neko," Lord William stated, "You've heard of them, right slave."

Felix gave a sigh of relief when he heard what his master said. Felix had grown worried when he was told he had to care for a monster, because he was worried that it was a dragon or something monstrous in the cage, not a neko. Nekos weren't monsters, they were intelligent like humans. Felix was relieved that there wouldn't be in danger like he thought there would be. His master had just been trying to scare him.

"Yes, there have been nekos that have visited the castle before. They look like humans except they have cat ears, tails, sometimes whiskers, and some other cat like features. But, they're sentient and just like humans," Felix answered.

"You seem relieved to know you will be taking care of a neko," Lord William observed.

"I was worried I'd be taking care of a monster, not a neko," Felix replied.

"Did you know that there are more savage nekos out there? There are some that live in the wild, and although they still have intelligence, their feline instincts are stronger. You have only seen the civilized ones that are ruled by their intellect and not their instincts. There are even some that look entirely like a cat, but walk like humans. You've heard the term anthro, right?" Lord William asked.

Felix shook his head and asked, "Is this a wild neko?"

Lord William smiled upon seeing Felix's fear return once again. "This is far worse than a wild neko. This is a Felaryan giant neko," Lord William stated.

"G-giant neko?" Felix questioned.

"They are very rare, even in the realm of Felarya which is full of giant creatures. However, they are still possible and they gain the same twisted moral system of the other top predators of Felarya," Lord William explained.

"What do you mean, master?" Felix questioned.

"Felarya is a beautiful place, and the women there are all breathtakingly beautiful as well. However, it is the most twisted and cruel realm to go to. In Felarya, the large eat the small without hesitation. No mater how sentient the giant predator is, they will not hesitate to eat a human if they should cross paths. Hell, there are species that have a giant version and a regular version where the giant versions eat the smaller version despite being of the same species. In Felarya, the word person is defined by how small you are. If you're smaller than the giant creature, than that creature wouldn't see you as a person and wouldn't feel any guilt for eating you," Lord William said.

"So, this neko thinks like the other monsters in Felarya. It will eat people despite it being intelligent?" Felix gasped, "But how cruel can it be to eat a person only because they're smaller?"

"To a Felaryan, it doesn't seem cruel at all. In their realm and in the giant predators' cultures, it is morally permissible to eat a smaller being. Most find it impossible to find any other use for a being of human size and feel they're too small of anything but a snack. A top predator in Felarya might be the kindest creature ever when it comes to creatures of their own size, but it would still eat smaller people just because they're too small to defend themselves," Lord William informed the slave.

"So, I have to feed this giant neko, and make sure it is taken care of?" Felix asked.

"Yes. The soldiers are probably chaining it up in the cell as we speak. As long as you keep out of the creature's range, you will be fine. You will have to watch your own safety. No guard will save you. If you die, I'll just replace you with another slave, understood?" Lord William asked.

"Yes, master," Felix replied.

"You wouldn't want to be caught by a giant neko. Not only will this creature eat you, but it will play with you and torture you a bit first. You know how a cat plays with its food, right? All nekos still have that feline instinct. Do you remember that neko that caught the mouse and played with it before devouring it?" Lord William asked. Felix just nodded. "That mouse will be you if the giant neko captures you. Felaryan giant nekos love catching smaller prey and play with them first. No matter what species the prey is or what level of intelligence, the nekos will be overwhelmed by its instinct to capture and eat smaller creatures. They would even do this to human sized nekos."

Guards exited the cell and began pushing the cage away. "Looks like the neko has been dealt with. It's time for you to feed it, slave," Lord William stated, "The food you are to give it is right behind you on that cart." With that, Lord William left and Felix approached the cart. The guards who stayed already had the gate open for Felix to enter. Felix took in a deep breath and pushed in the cart full of food. The gate clanged shut behind him.

After dark, Felix came back to the neko's cell with another cart, full of food. The catgirl sat with her back to him again, and didn't turn to look when he entered. Felix stood still for a bit, watching her and taking in the sight. He knew the neko was dangerous, but he still couldn't help but feel a bit awed by her. She must have been ten times his size, maybe even more. He hadn't taken as good a look at her before as he was now, but it only made him a bit more scared. Even so, he walked forward, making sure to keep out of of her arms' range, and shoved the cart closer towards her.

The neko turned her head, staring at Felix. She seemed confused, but then she noticed the cart. Reaching out, she grabbed a chunk of meat from the cart and looked it over, sniffing it. She began eating, but spat out the food after the first bite.

"This tastes bad," she complained, looking down at Felix as if it was his fault.

"Hey, my food's not much better," he told her. "I wish we could eat better, but we can't unless we get out of this place."

The neko kept looking at him, as if she was trying to decide whether or not to believe him. She sighed and tried to eat another piece of meat, choking slightly as it went down.

"I've never eaten food this old before," she said. "Back in Felarya, we usually ate food fresh. Most of the creatures there could swallow their prey whole.

She looked at Felix, who had sat down on the ground facing her, and noticed he looked scared.

"Did you do that, too?" he asked her, worried about what her answer would be.

A grin passed over her face, revealing her fangs. "No, I was too young," she said. "I still am, I think. Besides, I never really liked the idea of swallowing live prey. Wouldn't they kick and struggle a lot? Seems like that'd hurt your throat or something...."

She kept eating her food, staring off at nothing. Felix watched her, slightly worried she might decide to try and eat him next. But he knew that if he stayed far enough away, he should be safe. Besides, the fact that she was talking with him like this probably meant she was getting a bit nicer, for some reason. Maybe she liked his company? Or maybe she just wanted to eat him too?

The neko just kept eating, reaching down for a bucket of water and drinking it in one gulp. She coughed, and complained again about how bad it tasted.

"Pretty sure that's not clean at all," Felix said, sadly. "But like I said, it's what I drink too."

The neko looked down at the boy, with a different look in her eyes. She felt different, like she realized this boy was in the same position as she was, trapped in this bad place. She suddenly felt like she wanted to help him, so that they could both escape.

Before she could say anything, they both heard the door to the cell open. A guard stepped inside, and asked why Felix hadn't come back yet.

Felix got up, stumbling back in surprise. He'd almost forgotten that he was on a time limit with feeding the prisoner. But as he went towards the door, he heard scraping behind him, and the sound of metal snapping. He looked back in surprise, and saw that the neko had managed to free her left arm, ripping the chain from the wall. He shouted, and the guard grabbed his axe and shouted for help. Felix started to run away, but the neko swung her tail around, tripping him so he landed on his face. He looked over his shoulder, too hurt to stand up, and saw her hand reaching towards him.

He couldn't do anything as her hands reached him, her fingers closing around his torso. Her hand could barely wrap around him, but she was able to pick him up off the ground and bring him closer to her. By now, she had moved around so she was facing the door, sitting with her legs curled up under her and her tail wrapped around her privates, her other arm supporting her. She held Felix close to her stomach, and he looked up in fear, too scared to even squirm.. He saw she wasn't paying attention to him, and was just staring at the guard by the door.

The guard stepped back, frightened. "I'm not going in there," he said. "Not with that thing i there with you. Sorry slave. I'll tell the boss about this. Maybe he'll care."

The guard ran off, slamming the door behind him. Felix kept watching the neko, and she raised him up to her face. She looked him over with her bright yellow eyes, glowing in the dark like a cat's, and he was worried she might try to eat him....

145332222212212.content:
Felix pulled another cart's worth of food to go and feed his new neko friend. The cart itself may have weighed the same weight as him, seeing that it carried the amount of food needed for a creature of her size, albeit being borderline to enough. The guards watched him struggle to pull it, and laughed at him.

"You've worked here long enough, boy. Aren't you strong enough by this point?" one of them retorted. Felix shrugged it off, and they laughed again. He used his back to open the door, and when he did, the guards pushed the cart in with him and shut the door. He could vaguely hear them laughing a third time as he turned to look at the neko. She had just woken up from the slam of the door, and she was a tad groggy.

"Five... more minutes..." she said, eyes closed and half-asleep.

"It's me, Felix." Felix replied, and her eyes snapped open.

"You... came!" she said, smiling, then quickly wiped the emotion away.

"I have your food and water." he replied, pushing the cart just within her range. She snatched it and gobbled it up quickly, setting the cart back down where it was before.

"Was there anything you wanted to say before I go?" he told her. The neko looked shocked.

Argh! I forgot my questions... Great. Maybe I should tell him my name before I go...

"Just my name. You can call me-"

She was cut off when she saw that he wasn't paying attention to her; rather, he had his ear to the door.

"Hey! Why aren't you paying attention to me?" she asked, annoyed.

"Shh! The guards are talking..." he returned. Outside, the guards were talking about a new arrival to the fortress.
-----
"Hey, did you hear? Lord William had decided to run a recruitment drive because of the search for the big cat thing."

"Oh yeah, that. Didn't they say that only one person applied?"

"Definitely. Do you think he was accepted?"

"Obviously so, he was the only one who bothered to sign up. We lost so many men on that Felaryan expedition, we really had no choice."

"I've heard some people say he's a special person... rumor has it he's gone to Felarya and back just on his own!"

"Are you serious?"

"Only one way to find out."
-----
"A new guard?" Felix said aloud.

"Another one? Aren't there enough of them already?" the neko complained.

"I willing to bet he's a stuck-up jerk like the rest..."

Felix shook his head. He didn't want to think about that.

"So, what was it you wanted to say?" he asked.

"...I forgot," she started, knowing that wasn't true, "so can we just... talk for a while?"

"...I might be able to stay in here for a little while. At least, until I have to go sleep."

"Would you be allowed to... sleep here?" she asked, trying to hide any emotion showing.

Felix detected it, but said nothing. "Unfortunately, Lord William will beat me to an inch of my life. Let's just talk, then."

Unfortunately, the guards came in at that moment.

"What's taking you, boy? It doesn't take this long to deliver food." one of them retorted.

"I was about to-"

Felix was cut off as they grabbed him and lifted him into the air. The neko hissed and clawed at them, and they quickly ran out with him. When they left the room and barred the door, they threw him in the other direction.

"Go to bed or something, boy." they commanded. Felix sighed, and walked away.
-----
The neko sighed.

"I wish I had told him my name... I want him to call me by it so I can feel less lonely... but I can't. I just... why can't I just think of him as a friend? That's all he wants of me.. the same that I want from him."

Shaking her head, the neko held her head.

"No... that's what they want. He's working with them, I know he is... I can't tell him my name unless he helps me escape. I refuse to give my trust to some random tiny!"
-----
Felix lay his head to rest on his arm; the pillow he had may as well be stone.

"I wonder what that new guard will be like..."

He closed his eyes and tried to fall asleep.

Mermaids are half women, half fish. They can be found in the rivers, lakes and seas all across Felarya. They breath freely in or out of the water and can even move on land, albeit very clumsily. They are often extraordinarily beautiful with alluring voices. The average Felaryan mermaid tends to be around 130 feet in length, with the sea species being even longer.

Felaryan mermaids are naughty, voracious, and represent the main danger for swimmers and adventurers sailing the rivers or seas of Felarya. They use their sweet voices and some illusion spells to charm and attract their prey. If they are in a hurry, they can use their powerful tail to sink a ship and then devour the crew falling in water. Some Felaryan mermaids also possess a very long and sticky tongue they can extend to catch a prey, much like a frog.

Mermaids and merfolks in general can live both in salty or fresh water. They are extroverted beings, but speak surprisingly little of their life underwater. They are said to have a few large underwater cities in Topazial sea and they regulary go there to mate or simply spend time with their kind.

1512.content:
"The beast we caught is a roc," Lord William said. "It's, quite simply, a giant bird of prey. This particular one is very young, and female. We believe it should be easy to rear, as the males are more short tempered."

Felix gulped, but there was nothing he could do but agree to feed the giant bird. Soon, he was walking through the door to its cell, which was dimly lit through a grate covered hole in the ceiling. In e back of the cell, chains wrapped around its legs and neck, stood the roc. The bird was at least twenty feet tall, maybe even more like thirty at most. Felix noted the two large catlike ears on the sides of its head, and the light brown feathers covering its body. Its wings were pale white, and he noticed its talons we're tipped with very sharp black claws. The roc had bright yellow eyes, and was staring at Felix with a look of interest. Longer feathers coming out from around the eye looked like long eyelashes, actually giving the female roc a feminine appearance.

Felix walked forward until the guards told him to stop, and pushed the cart towards the roc. The giant bird didn't react, still watching Felix. The boy looked back at the guards, and they told him to stay for a bit. He just sat down, feeling a bit safer knowing the roc was restrained, and waited for her to move.

Meanwhile, the roc was staring down at the tiny creature that had entered her cell. Ever since she was captured during a flight one day, she had been sulking, hoping to find someone to help her get away. Though a child in her kind's years, she was mature beyond her age for human standards, and she realized the boy might be different, and able to help her.

She looked at the cart full of food and the bucket of water hanging from it, and reached out with a talon. She dragged them closer to her, but atill didn't eat from them. Felix looked worried, and the guards shouted that they needed the cart if it was possible to get it back. Felix told them the roc had it, and it was over the line of its range, but the guards didn't care.

"Hey, if you die, there are others to take your job," one said,

"Nothing personal,though, honest," the other said.

Felix sighed and got up. He really didn't want to get hurt, or worse, but he had no choice. He didn't know why the guards cared about keeping the cart from the beast, but he assumed they actually just wanted to see him try and avoid the roc.

He moved towards the cart. The roc watched him carefully, and Felix noticed her talons twitch slightly....

15122.content:
The boy watches where he steps, stopping just before the line marking the roc's reach. The Roc is staring down at him, waiting for him to take the next step. But Felix just stood there, not wanting to get into the range of this giant monster.

"Hurry up!" a guard shouts from behind. The boy turns around, and the roc takes her chance.

With a screech, she lunges forward, her beak open and head tilted sideways. In an instant, the two halves of her beak are on either side of the human's body. Before he has a chance to react, the roc bites down, gently, and lifts the boy off the ground easily!

Felix doesn't even scream as the roc grabs him. He's too shocked at what just happened. Apparently, the roc's reach was longer than the line! The roc straightens her head so that Felix is now held parallel to the ground. The boy looks towards the door, and sees the two guards standing there, weapons ready.

"It grabbed him!" one shouts. "Let's get in there and stop it!"

The roc suddenly drops the boy from her beak, and he lands on the ground painfully. He's only lain there a moment, though, before the roc lifts up a talon and slams it down onto his body, making him shout in pain. The giant bird slowly curls her claws around his body, lifting him off the ground and holding him close to her body. The roc then opens her mouth and roars loudly at the guards, making them run away and slam the door shut.

With the guards gone, the roc still doesn't release her grip on the boy. She instead raises her leg towards her face, angling her talon so she can see the boy's face clearly. The small human gazes up at her, his eyes wide with fear....

152.content:
"An amarok," Lord William spoke proudly, "You've never heard of one, have you?"

Felix simply shook his head, "Well... no."

Lord William smiled grimly. "Well, allow me to educate you then," he began, "An amarok is a monstrous wolf that can plow through castle walls, has skin as thick as armor, and is nearly impossible to kill." Felix's blood went cold. "You needn't worry though, it's still an infant," the Lord laughed a bit then continued, "You shall care for it until it reaches maturity. You will also have to teach it who the master is and if it dies... you die."

Felix was speechless. Was he serious? A ten year old slave was to care for such a monster! Surly he jest! "But Lord..."

"And to make sure of that, I brought you a little gift." Suddenly, a guard form behind snapped something to the back of Felix's neck. Felix fell to the ground from a new found pain that now coursed in his body.

"The amarok has one of those collars on as well, they bind your soul to its. If one of you dies, the other dies as well. So, don't slack off! Also, you can't remove the collar, so don't try!" he grined, "Don't worry, you'll be taken well taken care of IF you do your part that is." Felix looked up at the vile lord, "Now, I'll leave you to get acquainted with with your better half. Take care."

He and guard left him there lying in the dark with the beast, as the two reached the the top of the stairs, the guard looked back and muttered, "Poor kid," before shutting the door. In the dark, Felix looked up into the cage to see the amarok...
152.title: The Amarok and the Collar

1521.content:
Felix stared at the large cage that resembled a large wooden crate with a large door at on end and a barred window on that door. The door was only meant to open by unlatching it and it would fall to the ground. The cage was still in the hallway close to the cell the amarok was supposed to go into. The cell had two doors leading into it, a human sized door made of iron bars to look through them, and a large door like the gates of the outside wall that could be opened and easily fit the amarok through them.

The amarok had apparently been asleep during the trip to the cell, but now Felix could hear movement in the cage. The amarok was awake which made Felix nervous. "If this creature is an infant like Lord William said it is, maybe it can't break out of the cage," Felix tried to assure himself. However, when Lord William had told Felix of the creature's abilities, Felix couldn't forget the image of a giant wolf bursting through a stone wall with ease and devouring the village outside the castle hungrily.

Felix wanted to get out of there badly, yet the cage was near the stairs and exit of the dungeons. Felix was frightened to go that way. He was also frightened of what Lord William might do to him if he should leave.

Suddenly, Felix heard whimpering from within the cage. Felix was surprised by this and stood very still at first. The whimpering was very sad like an injured puppy, a big injured puppy, because the whimpering might have been high pitched to an amarok, but the size difference between a human and an amarok made the whimpering sound a little deeper than it should have. Felix stood up on his feet slowly. The whimpering made him very curious. It almost sounded familiar to him for some reason. However, he didn't know why it would be familiar when he had never seen a monster before, let alone even hear of an amarok.

Felix found himself walking towards the door of the cage to look through the barred opening that was slightly past eye level with him. The amarok must have heard Felix's approach, because Felix heard it move around in the cage and the cage even rocked a bit as it moved around. Felix approached the opening and brought himself on top of the tips of his toes and looked in. It was true! the armarok was just an infant!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------

"So, how did you capture the monster again and where did you find it?" Lord William questioned General Ethan.

General Ethan replied, "We were in the vicinity of the small village called Littown. A villager found our campsite and explained that an amarok was attacking the village. We followed him to the village, but the monster had already destroyed most of the village and eaten many terrified people. We were going to kill it, but Alex noticed this creature was an infant. I remembered you, my Lord and thought that if we captured it, you would be able to control the infant easily and it would be very useful to you."

"Something that could already use such aggression would be a useful weapon once I could wield it. Very good. Get your men and get the creature in the cell by any means necessary, without killing it, of course," Lord William ordered General Ethan and Alex. Lord William turned to a servant and said, "Get the meat and water and bring it to the boy. The amarok is probably very hungry."

The servant hurried away and Lord William walked away as well. General Ethan turned to Alex and saw a bit of anger in Alex's eyes. "You're still not mad about the amarok, are you?" General Ethan questioned.

"You know as well as I that the amarok was not attacking the village. We found traces of dead amaroks in the forest near the village. The creatures parents must have died by hunters and it wandered around not knowing what had happened," Alex informed General Ethan, "It must have accidentally came upon the village. You know how it acted when it arrived. It wasn't harming anyone. It had accidentally crushed a few huts, but it wasn't harming the villagers. It looked like it was looking for help."

"Yet, the story of it attacking would please Lord William much more, which is why we told him this," General Ethan explained.

"If only you didn't have to make that order to make the story believable," Alex commented.

"You will speak nothing of that event. No one needs to know how the villagers truly died," General Ethan whispered while grabbing Alex and pinning him to the wall, "If you or anyone else gets the idea of telling..."

"I won't tell," Alex interrupted General Ethan. Alex hated having to keep such a terrible secret. He never even taken part of the mass killing. He tried to convince the others to stop, but he promised not to tell so that he could live. Something Alex still dreaded.

"Now, let's think of a way to get that creature in the cell and in its chains," General Ethan replied.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------

Felix was still astounded by what he saw. The amarok was the size of an elephant, yet it look exactly like a puppy, with the large head, short legs (relative to its body), little ears, the short muzzle, and little tail. The amarok had to have been born a few days ago!

It also surprised Felix that the amarok was whimpering and cowering in the corner of the cage, afraid of Felix. "This is the monster Lord William was talking about? How could this be a monster? It looks scared and defenseless, despite being the size of an elephant." Felix thought to himself.

Felix remembered that he could be able to tell the gender of a wolf by the color of its fur, if it was like the gray wolves. Gray wolf females had gray fur and males had black fur. What fur did the amarok have?
1521.title: Just an Infant!

15213.content:
The amarok's fur was white, Felix wouldn't be able to tell it's gender by fur color. Felix became very curious of this creature, never having seen one in his life and now there was an infant amarok before him, cowering in fear. It was quite a paradox that such a massive creature was scared of a small boy such as Felix, who now found himself lifting the latch of the door. Once the latch was gone the door was drawn to fall to the floor, but Felix tried to ease the door down, as not to scare the amarok more than it already was.

It was very difficult for someone as small as Felix to open such a large door by himself. He struggled under the weight, but he managed to slowly lower the door to the ground. Nothing stood between him and the amarok now, but it was still scared, not moving from the corner.

Felix wanted to assure the infant that he meant no harm, but as he moved closer, the amarok tried to move further away. It's back pressed against the wall as it realized that there was no escape and began to whimper uncontrollably. Felix quickly lowered himself to the ground, hoping to calm the amarok down. He figured that if he made himself look smaller the amarok wouldn't be as frightened.

The amarok stopped whimpering when it didn't hear the sounds of the human moving around, but it could still smell him. It slowly removed it's paws from it's eyes to see the little human in a submissive pose. The amarok was only an infant, but it understood what these beings were capable of, it had seen it's entire pack die and one of their own villages slaughtered. Then it was brought here. It was scared and vulnerable, but it now looked on in confusion as this one human had submitted.

It seemed like hours had passed to Felix. He lied still on the floor, looking down the whole time. Felix suddenly became scared again. He didn't know how the amarok would react to it's new surroundings once it became bolder. It might even become angry and attack anything in sight.

Suddenly, Felix felt something move above his body. The amarok had quietly moved towards the boy, very curious. It was a new experience to the infant to be so close to a human, but something about this one seemed familiar. Felix felt the air move above him and the sounds of the amarok smelling him. He looked up to see the amarok towering above, it's puppy eyes staring at him. The amarok must have overcome it's fears, but Felix stood slowly, cautious not to scare it again.

The amarok's head slowly reared back as it extended it's tongue. Felix was knocked back down as the mass of wet flesh collided with his body. The amarok was probably not aware of how fragile he was. Felix got up and wiped the saliva from his face, he remembered the collar about his neck. They were bound to each other by their souls, or so said Lord William. But he wasn't a man of humor, he most surely meant what he said.

Felix looked up at the amarok covered in white fur, kneeling above him, now with a friendly expression, but Felix could only guess. There was still much he didn't know about this creature, the amarok also had curiosity in it's eyes.

"What is Lord William planning?" His mind wandered back to the collar, now he saw the same collar attached to the amarok's neck, only larger in scale.

"Why he want me to be bound to this..." Felix realized how lonely the amarok must be. If it was just an infant, it must have been taken away from it's family. Now it was in this dark dungeon. It really needed a friend down here. It also needed a name.
15213.title: We Are Gonna Be Friends

1523.content:
Felix looked at the large cage before him. It was made of some very strong and powerful wood, but had small holes so whatever was in their could breathe. It was also very big, huge even, almost as tall and wide as the hall he was in, and the dungeon halls were very wide and tall.

He looked through the holes, it was very dark and hard to see. He saw what he thought was the amarok, but it was too big, to oddly shaped, to be a mere infant which is what Lord William claimed. It must be a fixture to the wall or something, but Felix couldn't find the amarok cub.

Felix wondered if he should go into the cage and check if the monster was even in their. But if the creature really was in the cage, and wasn't chained, it could attack Felix and kill him. "Maybe this is some sick joke," Felix thought to himself hopefully, " Maybe right now my horrible master is laughing that the gullibility of his slave." Embarrassing, but at least he wouldn't have to tend to a monster.

Felix approached the cage door. The door was latched to the cage in a way that it could be unlatched and it was simply fall to the ground. If he unlatched the door, there would be no way for him along to lift it up and latch it again. "It must have been designed like that so they could just push the cage in the cell through the giant doors, unlatch it and then quickly escape before the amarok could get out of the cage," Felix thought. It seemed too well planed for it to be a joke and though Lord William loved to torment his slaves, he had never seen Lord William play a joke on them.

Felix saw that the large door had a square hole with bars running down through the hole. Felix had to get on his tip toes to peek through the hole. Felix grabbed the bars to keep him up as he looked through the hole. Everything was black inside and he couldn't see anything. He saw no movement and nothing that seemed like the outline of a creature. "Hey, anything in there?" Felix shouted out, but there was no reply and no movement. It truly looked like all of this was some sick joke.

Felix knew their was only one way to know for sure. Fighting his fear, he walked up to the latch, and unlatched the latches. The heavy door began to fall due to the gravity and Felix caught it. The door was very heavy for the ten year old slave and he had troubles setting it down gently. It didn't work at well though because his hands slipped halfway and it dropped to the ground hard. Felix wouldn't be able to close it again. There was no turning back now.

As his eyes adjusted to the dim light in the cage, he looked everywhere, and just when his eyes were fully adjusted, his heart stopped cold. The huge shape he saw earlier was the amarok, and to his horror it was slowly getting to it's feet. The creature must have been sleeping and the large door hitting the ground woke it up. The massive, jet black furred (which was probably why Felix couldn't see it well) looked... strangely confused, like someone who was jumped, beat up, then stuffed in a huge dark a cage, which was probably what happened in the first place. Felix stayed completely still as the amarok scanned the cage still looking very confused.

Eventually, the eyes aimed toward the light coming from the hallway outside the cage and unfortunately, its eyes fell upon the poor ten year old slave that was Felix. Felix held his breath when the amarok started to walk forward. Felix tried to back away slowly as the humongous dog-like creature approached, but he fell backwards and fell on his butt. The Amarok had gained too much ground now, since it was so large, and Felix realized there was no point in running. Felix could now easily tell the amarok was a cub, but it was still at least twenty-five feet tall which did not comfort Felix as the creature looked him up and down, sniffing at him. Then.....
